Answer_4: affect main motor speed if done in conjunction with higher  generator engine speeds

Question_Title: Electric propulsion coupling excitation is reduced at slow speeds to __________.
An electric tachometer receives the engine speed signal from a __________.
Answer_1: small generator mounted on the engine
Answer_4: vibrating reed meter generating a voltage proportionate to  engine speed

Question_Title: A three-phase alternator is operating at 450 volts with the switchboard ammeter indicating 300 amps.  The kw meter  currently indicates 163.6 KW, with a power factor of 0.7. If the power factor increases to 0.8, the KW meter reading  would increase by __________.
A semiconductor that decreases in resistance with an increase in temperature is known as a __________.
The shunt used in an ammeter should be connected in __________.
Answer_1: series with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
Answer_2: parallel with the load and in series with the meter movement
Answer_3: parallel with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
Answer_4: series with the load and in series with the meter movement

Question_Title: Brushless generators are designed to operate without the use of __________.
An operating characteristic appearing on the name plates of shipboard AC motors is __________.
Low horsepower, polyphase, induction motors can be started  with full voltage by means of __________.
Which of the listed devices may be installed on a large turbo-electric alternating current propulsion generator?
Answer_1: Temperature detector coils inserted in the stator slots for measuring stator temperature.
Answer_3: Electric space heaters to prevent condensation of moisture.

Question_Title: Moisture damage, as a result of condensation occurring inside of the cargo winch master switches, can be reduced by __________.
Answer_1: installing a light bulb in the pedestal stand
Answer_2: coating the switch box internals with epoxy sealer
Answer_4: using strip heaters inside the switch box

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions will occur if the solenoid coil burns out on a cargo winch with an electrical brake?
Answer_1: The brake will be set by spring force.
Answer_2: The motor will overspeed and burn up.
Answer_3: The load suspended from the cargo boom will fall.

Question_Title: Which of the listed battery charging circuits is used to maintain a wet-cell, lead-acid, storage battery in a fully  charged state during long periods of disuse?

Answer_2: permit shunts with larger resistances to be utilized
Answer_3: prevent damage to the meter movement from heat generated by the shunt

Question_Title: The output voltage of a 440 volt, 60 hertz, AC generator is controlled by the __________.
Any electric motor can be constructed to be __________.
Which of the following statements represents the main difference between a relay and a contactor?
Answer_1: Contactors control current and relays control voltage.
Answer_2: A relay is series connected and a contactor is parallel connected.
Answer_3: Contactors can handle heavier loads than relays.
Answer_4: Contactors are made from silver and relays are made from copper.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning a polyphase synchronous propulsion motor?
Answer_1: The motor is started as an induction motor.
Answer_2: Resistance is gradually added to the rotor circuit.
Answer_3: The starting current is held below the rated current.
Answer_4: The field winding is energized for starting purposes only.

Question_Title: Where a thermal-acting breaker is required to be used in an area of unusually high, low, or constantly fluctuating temperatures, an ambient compensating element must be used.  This element consists of a __________.

Answer_2: conical spring on the contact arm

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents an application of a silicon controlled rectifier?
Answer_1: To provide DC power for a main propulsion motor.
Answer_2: For use as a voltage reference diode.
Answer_3: For sensing flame in an automated burner.

Question_Title: The electrolyte used in a nickel-cadmium battery is distilled water and __________.
What damage may occur to the components of a winch master control switch, if the cover gasket becomes deteriorated?
Answer_3: Sparking at the winch motor brushes.

Question_Title: An accidental path of low resistance, allowing passage of abnormal amount of current is known as a/an __________.

Answer_1: both meters in series with the resistance
Answer_2: both meters in parallel with the resistance
Answer_3: the ammeter in series and the voltmeter in parallel with the resistance
Answer_4: the ammeter in parallel and the voltmeter in series with the resistance

Question_Title: In general, polyphase induction motors can be started on full line voltage by means of __________.
Which of the following statements concerning the maintenance of solid-silver contacts in relays and auxiliary control circuits is correct?
Answer_1: When necessary, they should always be dressed with a wire wheel.
Answer_2: They should be filed with a fine-cut file when projections  extend beyond the contact surface.
Answer_3: When black silver oxide is present, it should always be removed from the contact surface with coarse sandpaper.
Answer_4: If necessary, they should be held together with moderate pressure while emery paper is drawn between the contacts.

Question_Title: While starting a main propulsion synchronous motor, the ammeter pegs out at maximum and then returns to the proper  value after synchronization.  This indicates the __________.

Answer_1: high speed clearance of low impedance short circuits in the branch
Answer_2: continuity of service on main bus under short circuit conditions in a branch
Answer_3: isolation of short circuits by selective tripping of branch circuit breakers

Question_Title: Which of the following electric motors would be the safest and most reliable to use on the main deck of a vessel in foul weather conditions?

Answer_1: de-energize the circuit to allow connection of the  instrument in series
Answer_2: hook the jaws of the instrument around the insulated conductor
Answer_3: connect the voltage test leads to the appropriate terminals
Answer_4: short the test leads and calibrate the instrument to zero

Question_Title: The use of four diodes, in a full-wave bridge rectifier circuit, will __________.
Answer_1: provide unidirectional current to the load
Answer_2: allow a very high leakage current from the load
Answer_3: convert direct current to alternating current
Answer_4: offer high opposition to current in two directions

Question_Title: Autotransformer starters or compensators are sometimes used with polyphase induction motors to __________.
Answer_1: reduce the voltage applied to the motor during the starting period
Answer_3: provide a backup means of voltage regulation for emergency starting
Answer_4: allow the voltage to be either stepped up or down, depending on the application, to ensure full torque

Question_Title: In an AC synchronous motor electric propulsion plant, propeller speed is controlled by varying the __________.
Answer_3: number of energized main motor poles

Question_Title: A molded-case breaker provides protection against short circuits by using a/an __________.

Answer_1: to prevent excess current flow through the meter that would damage it
Answer_2: for AC measurements only and a low resistance meter for DC measurements
Answer_3: whenever a low impedance meter is not available, regardless of the components being tested
Answer_4: so as not to load down the circuit and obtain erroneous voltage readings

Question_Title: Which of the listed devices is used to measure pressure and convert it to an electrical signal?
Grounds occurring in electrical machinery as a result of insulation failure may result from __________.
The amount of voltage induced in the windings of an AC generator depends on __________.
Answer_1: the number of conductors in series per winding
Answer_2: the speed at which the magnetic field passes across the winding
Answer_3: the strength of the magnetic field

Question_Title: A motor using a rheostat in the motor circuit to vary the speed is called a __________.
Which of the following precautions should you take when securing propulsion generators and motors for an extended period of time?
Answer_1: Disconnect the brush pigtails from their contacts and circulate air through the units.
Answer_2: Disconnect the brush pigtails from their contacts and discharge carbon dioxide into the units to keep them dry.
Answer_3: Lift the brushes from commutator collector rings and use the built-in heater to prevent moisture accumulation.
Answer_4: Lift the brushes from commutator collector rings and circulate cool dry air through the units.

Question_Title: When reading electrical motor controller diagrams, it helps to know that __________.
Answer_1: current paths in the control circuit are drawn as heavy lines and in the power circuit as lighter lines
Answer_2: current paths in the power circuit are drawn as heavy lines and in control circuit as lighter lines
Answer_3: circuits subject to 500 volts or greater are drawn as heavy lines and below 500 volts as lighter lines
Answer_4: circuits subject to 500 volts or greater are drawn as light lines and below 500 volts as heavy lines

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be taken when troubleshooting various power circuits using a common solenoid-type mechanical voltage tester (wiggins)?
Answer_1: Never use this tester on circuits greater than 60 Hz, as the coil's resultant high impedance lowers current and magnetic pull.  The tester may not register dangerous voltages.
Answer_2: Always remember that the unit is polarity sensitive and if  used on DC circuits reversing the leads may result in high  temperatures within the tester.
Answer_3: Never connect the device to circuits where potentials greater than 120 volts may be present, as the coil's extremely fine wire cannot withstand more than a few amps.
Answer_4: Always pre-set the meter to the next higher range than the  amount of voltage expected in the circuit in order to prevent damage from an off-scale reading.

Question_Title: The device that most commonly utilizes the principle of electromagnetic induction is the __________.
A tubular fuse should always be removed from a fuse panel with __________.
Answer_2: a pair of insulated metal pliers

Question_Title: One factor that determines the frequency of an alternator  is the __________.
Answer_1: number of turns of wire in the armature coil

Question_Title: The variable resistance placed in the rotor circuit of a wound-rotor induction motor provides for __________.

Answer_1: The variables in digital systems are fixed quantities, and the variables in analog systems are continuous quantities.
Answer_2: There are no basic differences between the two systems.
Answer_3: Analog devices are superior in accuracy compared to digital devices.
Answer_4: Operations in a digital device are performed simultaneously.

Question_Title: The number of cells in a 12 volt lead-acid battery is __________.

Answer_2: absorption of moisture in the insulation

Question_Title: The frequency output of an operating alternator is  controlled by the __________.
Answer_1: relative speed of the rotor poles
Answer_2: number of turns of wire in the armature coil

Question_Title: Which of the following physical characteristics does a wound-rotor induction motor possess that a squirrel cage motor does not?

Answer_1: reduces magnetic pull on the plunger and requires more current to trip the relay
Answer_2: reduces magnetic pull on the plunger and requires less current to trip the relay
Answer_3: increases magnetic pull on the plunger and requires more current to trip the relay
Answer_4: increases magnetic pull on the plunger and requires less current to trip the relay

Question_Title: Protection against sustained overloads occurring in molded-case circuit breakers is provided by a/an __________.

Answer_1: average temperature at any given latitude

Answer_3: average temperature rise due to resistance at 10% overload
Answer_4: permissible difference in the ambient temperature of the motor due to existing weather conditions

Question_Title: Which of the following represents the accepted method of cleaning dust and foreign particles from electrical equipment while limiting damage to electric components?

Answer_3: inductive reaction of the rotating stator field

Question_Title: An electrical device which prevents an action from occurring until all other required conditions are met is called a/an __________.

Question_Title: The electrolyte in a lead-acid storage battery consists of  distilled water and __________.

Answer_2: changing the number of phases to the motor

Answer_4: inserting resistance into the rotor circuit

Answer_2: is enclosed in a tube of insulating material with metal ferrules at each end

Question_Title: The alarm system for an engine order telegraph uses small  selsyn motors attached to the indicators.  The alarm sounds when the rotors are __________.

Answer_2: in synchronous position, no current is flowing, and the relays are closed

Answer_4: not synchronized, current is flowing, and the relays are closed

Answer_2: test all fuses and measure the line voltage

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the significance of ambient temperature in relation to the service life of electronic components?
Answer_1: Ambient temperature should be as high as possible to drive  off moisture.
Answer_2: Increased ambient temperature decreases the service life of electronic components.

Answer_1: collect all available data on a casualty

Answer_1: conductor resistance is not a factor

Answer_3: fluctuating voltmeter reading, while the other coil readings are steady

Question_Title: A delayed-action fuse is most frequently used in which of the listed circuits?

Answer_1: Fill the motor housing with CO2 to inert the space.

Answer_2: keep the components at their design ambient temperature

Answer_1: the recommended current and voltage rating

Answer_4: lower current and higher voltage rating

Answer_1: higher than in a discharged battery

Question_Title: The heating of conductors as a result of resistance in a distribution circuit causes a power loss expressed as __________.

Question_Title: The output voltage of a three-phase alternator is regulated by the __________.

Answer_1: reduce vibration and noise in the contactor
Answer_2: prevent flux buildup in the operating coil
Answer_3: eliminate arcing when the contacts close

Question_Title: In a cartridge-type fuse, the metal element is contained in a __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning all three-phase alternators?

Answer_2: Each has one armature winding acted on by three identical but separate systems of rotating magnets.

Question_Title: A low-voltage protection circuit is used in electric motor  starting equipment to __________.
Answer_1: trip circuit contactors when the motor overspeeds due to low voltage

Answer_2: Cotton cloth coated with insulating varnish.

Answer_4: Paper impregnated with mineral oil, specially wrapped with  nonmetallic tape, and coated with varnish.

Answer_2: DC current applied to the rotor coils causes the rotor magnets to lock in with the rotating flux of the stator

Question_Title: What is the maximum allowable primary current of a 2 KVA step-down transformer with a four to one turns ratio if connected across a 440 volt line?

Answer_4: zinc or an alloy of tin and lead

Question_Title: The cross-sectional area of shipboard electrical cable is expressed in __________.

Question_Title: A common source of field excitation for synchronous motors is a/an __________.

Answer_3: The emitter separates the base and collector.

Answer_2: conduct electric current to an outside circuit
Answer_3: convert DC current to AC current
Answer_4: provide excitation to a DC generator

Question_Title: The most common source of excitation for synchronous motors is a/an __________.

Question_Title: A damper winding is designed as part of a synchronous motor to __________.

Question_Title: Alternating current circuits develop resistance, inductance and capacitance.  The inductance of a coil is expressed in  __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the important factor that must be considered when replacing a faulty diode in the exciter rectifier assembly?

Question_Title: The opposition to the establishment of magnetic lines of force in a magnetic circuit is called the circuit's __________.

Question_Title: The purpose of an impressed current cathodic protection system aboard ship is to __________.

Answer_2: insulation may be covered with moisture

Answer_4: larger machines may acquire a charge of static electricity  during operation

Question_Title: A variable shunt, connected across the series field coils of a DC compound wound generator, to permit adjustment of the  degree of compounding, is called a __________.

Answer_1: increase in resistance with increased temperature

Upon checking the records of that motor, you  find the readings have consistently been at that level for  the last six years.  You should, therefore, recommend that  the __________.

If the pointer fails to return to zero when a megger is disconnected, the __________.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions describes the effect on intrinsic semiconductor operation as a result of a  temperature increase?

Question_Title: The multiple prefix 'mega' (M) means __________.

Question_Title: On a switchboard, if all three ground detection lamps remain burning at half intensity when the test button is depressed, which of the listed conditions is indicated?

Question_Title: A replacement wire having twice the length and one-half the cross-sectional area of the original wire will have a resistance that is __________.

Question_Title: Aboard ship, a grounded field coil in an AC motor can be determined by using a __________.

Answer_4: is indicated by the ground detecting lamps on the main switchboard

Question_Title: The third color band on a resistor is used to indicate the __________.

Question_Title: Why is it a poor practice to use a high wattage soldering iron when soldering or desoldering components on a printed  circuit board?

Answer_2: the sum of the powers used in each load

Answer_4: never more than the power used in largest load

Question_Title: The total resistance of a parallel circuit is always __________.

Answer_4: equal to the sum of the individual branch resistances divided by the number  of branches

Answer_3: the residual magnetism of the contact faces

Answer_2: continue to operate at the same speed

Question_Title: Which of the processes listed occurs during the charging of a lead-acid storage battery?

Answer_2: Positive plates change to lead peroxide.
Answer_3: Both plates change to lead peroxide.
Answer_4: Both plates change to lead sulfate.

Question_Title: The primary function of an electric motor is to __________.

Answer_2: power factor will change in the leading direction
Answer_3: kilowatt load will be greatly increased
Answer_4: ampere load will be greatly decreased

Question_Title: In a series wound motor, the current passing through the field windings is also passing through the __________.

Answer_1: Temperature detector coils inserted in the stator slots for measuring stator temperature.
Answer_3: Electric space heaters to prevent condensation of moisture.

Question_Title: The total power consumed in a parallel circuit is __________.
Answer_1: the sum of the powers used in each load (resistor) divided  by the number of loads
Answer_2: always less than the power used in the smallest load
Answer_3: the sum of the powers used in each individual load
Answer_4: never more than the power used in the largest load

Question_Title: The resistance of electric wire will decrease as its __________.
Which of the instruments listed should always be connected  in series with a circuit?
The power factor of an AC generator operating singularly is determined by the __________.

Answer_1: varying the voltage applied to the motor
Answer_2: the weight of the load on the cargo boom
Answer_3: overcurrent protection devices in the motor

Answer_1: designing the contacts to open slowly
Answer_2: directing the arc into an arc chute
Answer_3: an inverse timed thermal trip for short circuit currents
Answer_4: instantaneous magnetic trip for overload currents

Question_Title: When a lead-acid battery begins gassing freely while receiving a normal charge, the charging current should __________.

Answer_1: increases by the square of the original value

Question_Title: An ammeter should be used to measure __________.
Answer_1: the voltage between two points in a circuit

Question_Title: Why is it desirable to operate paralleled AC generators at  the same power factor?
Answer_1: Circulating currents are kept to a minimum.
Answer_2: Field excitation losses are kept to a minimum.
Answer_3: Generator rotors will have a lesser tendency to hunt.
Answer_4: Because a power factor increase will decrease kilowatt output.

Question_Title: The charge of a lead-acid battery is checked with a __________.
When the voltage remains constant, and the resistance increases in a series circuit, current flow __________.
A DC ammeter is always connected __________.

Answer_1: changing the sensitivity of the prime mover to large changes in voltage

Question_Title: In a compound-wound motor, a portion of the line current flows through the __________.

Answer_3: 18 volts, positive on the 24 volt battery
Answer_4: 30 volts, negative on the 24 volt battery

Question_Title: You can determine if a circuit breaker has tripped by __________.
Answer_1: examining the position of the handle
Answer_2: checking for which of the breakers is warm

Question_Title: An operational amplifier, as used in today's consoles, may  have a calculated gain of 5.  This means that as the input  changes by __________.
Under which of the following conditions will a lead-acid battery be given a 'test discharge'?
Answer_2: Whenever a cell cannot be brought within 10 points of full  charge specific gravity.
Answer_3: When one or more cells is found to have less than normal voltage after an equalizing charge.

Question_Title: Which of the formulas listed is correct for determining power?
Which of the listed meters uses a shunt connected in series with the load, but parallel with the meter movement?
Which of the following statements describes what will happen when both the polarity of the field poles, and the direction of current to the brushes of a DC motor are reversed?
Answer_2: The direction of rotation of the armature will be reversed.
Answer_3: The direction of rotation of the armature will remain the same.
Answer_4: The field pole windings will become overheated.

Question_Title: A slow continual loss of electrolyte level from one cell of a storage battery could be due to __________.
Answer_3: the specific gravity being higher than normal

Question_Title: Nickel-cadmium batteries are superior to lead-acid batteries at high discharge rates because they __________.
Answer_1: deliver a large amount of power and can be recharged in a shorter time
Answer_2: need fewer cells in connected series and less mounting space
Answer_3: have higher output voltages and require no maintenance

Question_Title: When the operating handle of a molded-case circuit breaker  is in the mid-position, the circuit breaker is indicated as being __________.

Answer_1: the new lamp may be of a higher wattage and cause heat damage to the lens
Answer_2: removing a faulty lamp usually causes an alarm to sound on  the bridge
Answer_3: attention should be paid only to engine orders
Answer_4: a socket/wiring fault may cause a ground or short circuit to shut down a vital function

Question_Title: The rate at which heat is produced in a direct current circuit is equal to __________.
Answer_4: I times R divided by T

Question_Title: The basic meter movement responds to the flow of current through its coil. Therefore, this meter movement may be used as a/an __________.
Answer_1: voltmeter by placing a resistance in parallel with the coil
Answer_2: ohmmeter by placing another meter movement in parallel with the coil
Answer_3: wattmeter by placing a battery in parallel with the coil
Answer_4: ammeter by placing a low resistance in parallel with the coil

Question_Title: When power is restored after a complete power failure, a steering gear pump motor will __________.

Answer_1: Accidental contact between one line and ground does not cause an outage.
Answer_2: Double ground faults on different phases will not cause an  outage.
Answer_4: Accidental contact between one line and ground will always  cause an outage.

Question_Title: What is the approximate voltage per cell produced by the nickel-iron (Edison) battery?
One horsepower is equal to __________.
An ammeter reads slightly above 'zero' when its leads are disconnected, this is a result of __________.
Answer_1: mechanical misalignment of the meter pointer
Answer_2: a poor ground for the meter case
Answer_4: resistors inside the meter storing charges

Question_Title: When an alternator is to remain idle for even a few days __________.
Answer_1: lift the brushes and disconnect the pigtails
Answer_2: insulate the collector rings with strips of cardboard
Answer_4: open the equalizing bus disconnect switch

Question_Title: Proper storage battery maintenance includes __________.
Answer_1: keeping connections tight and casing surfaces clean
Answer_2: making sure electrolyte level is below the separator plates
Answer_3: insulating the terminals with naval jelly
Answer_4: maintaining a high charging rate at all times

Question_Title: Part of the insulation of practically all electrical machinery is in the form of organic compounds which contain some amount of __________.
When the current in a power transmission line is increased, the power loss  __________.
Answer_1: increases as the square of the current
Answer_2: decreases as the square root of the current
Answer_3: remains the same, as it is independent of current flow
Answer_4: increases in direct proportion as the current

Question_Title: Modern handheld digital tachometers operate by counting light pulses returned to the unit by __________.
Answer_3: a small bulb attached to the shaft

Question_Title: To determine the state of charge of a nickel-cadmium battery, you would use a/an __________.
The true power indicated by the pointer movement of a wattmeter depends on the current flow through the load, the magnitude of the potential across the load, and the __________.
The shunt of a DC ammeter should be connected in __________.
Answer_1: series with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
Answer_2: parallel with the load and in series with the meter movement
Answer_3: parallel with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
Answer_4: series with the load and in series with the meter movement

Question_Title: The standard method of controlling the output voltage of a  440 volt, 60 Hz, AC generator is accomplished by adjusting  the __________.
The air gap provided in induction motors should be checked  periodically with a feeler gage to detect an unequal air gap and __________.
When troubleshooting a lead-acid storage battery, a weak or dead cell is best detected by __________.
Answer_1: measuring and comparing all cells' specific gravity
Answer_2: taking an open circuit voltage test of individual cells
Answer_3: visually inspecting the electrolyte levels of each cell
Answer_4: taking each cell's temperature with a calibrated mercury thermometer

Question_Title: Common nickel-cadmium and nickel-iron storage batteries utilize __________.
Due to the operating characteristics of the system, time lag fuses (or dual-element fuses) are necessary for use in __________.
Loss of or weak residual magnetism in an alternator or generator can be corrected for by __________.
Answer_1: running the rotor in the opposite direction for 5 minutes
Answer_2: allowing the generator to run at 10% of normal speed for 5  minutes
Answer_3: running the generator at normal speed with the field rheostat fully counterclockwise
Answer_4: using a storage battery or battery charger to 'flash' the field

Question_Title: An accidental path of low resistance which passes an abnormal amount of current is known as a/an __________.
A milliammeter, with a full scale deflection reading of 100 milliamps, is known to have an accuracy of + or - 2%.  A meter reading of 10 milliamps would indicate a line current of between __________.
The amount of voltage induced in the windings of an AC generator depends mainly on __________.
Answer_1: the number of field poles energized
Answer_2: the speed at which the stator windings rotate through the magnetic field
Answer_3: the strength of the magnetic field

Question_Title: Which of the following materials is a good electrical insulator?
Cleaning of electrical insulation should be __________.
Answer_3: determined by need and not the calendar
Answer_4: performed whenever the electrician is not otherwise busy

Question_Title: The plates of a NiCad storage battery are made of __________.
Answer_1: potassium hydroxide with a small amount of sulfuric acid
Answer_4: combinations of nickel powder and nickel & cadmium salts

Question_Title: An instantaneous-trip-type fuse will __________.
Answer_1: open as soon as the load current exceeds its set point
Answer_2: allow a preset delay between overcurrent and melting
Answer_3: open a circuit by using a time delay element with a magnetic trip
Answer_4: reset itself when the overcurrent is corrected

Question_Title: Basic electrical motor action depends on __________.
Answer_1: a conductor rotated within a magnetic field
Answer_2: a current carrying conductor placed in a magnetic field
Answer_3: the relative force of the commutator and commutating poles
Answer_4: the relative force of the armature and interpoles

Question_Title: When mixing electrolyte, which of the following precautions should always be observed?
Answer_1: Add the acid to the water.
Answer_2: Use a heavy duty aluminum pail.
Answer_3: Add the water to the acid.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements about copper wire sized by the AWG rating is correct?
Answer_1: Number 12 AWG wire has a higher current rating than number  10 AWG wire.
Answer_2: Number 10 AWG wire has a higher dielectric strength than number 12 AWG wire.
Answer_3: Number 12 AWG wire is larger than Number 10 AWG wire.
Answer_4: Number 12 AWG wire at 25C has more resistance per 1000 feet than No. 10 AWG wire at 25C.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the correct method of connecting the shunt of an ammeter prior to taking a reading?
Answer_1: In series with the load and in series with the meter movement.
Answer_2: In series with the load and in parallel with the meter movement.
Answer_3: In parallel with the load and in series with the meter movement.
Answer_4: In parallel with the load and in parallel with the meter movement.

Question_Title: Relative to the direction of rotation, a D.C. motor commutating pole has the same polarity as the __________.

Answer_1: supply alternate logic levels at the input(s) and test for  change of state conditions at the output
Answer_2: ground all inputs and test for a logic "1" at the output
Answer_3: open all inputs and test for a logic '0' at the output
Answer_4: vary each input smoothly from 0-10 volts and test for similar variance at the output

Question_Title: Upon failure of the normal power supply, the emergency generator is placed on the line by the __________.

Answer_1: changing the pedestal bearing insulation yearly
Answer_2: megger testing of all rectifying diodes
Answer_4: periodic cleaning of the air filters or screens

Question_Title: Nickel-cadmium storage batteries are superior to lead-acid  batteries because they __________.
Answer_1: put out higher voltages and require no maintenance
Answer_2: can remain idle and keep a full charge for a long time
Answer_3: need fewer cells in series and use less mounting space

Question_Title: The force that causes free electrons to move in a conductor as electric current flow is called a/an __________.
Which of the following meters uses a shunt connected in series with the load, but parallel with the meter movement?
Electrical machinery insulation will break down more rapidly due to __________.
Answer_1: low loading of motors and generators

Question_Title: The speed of a multi-speed, squirrel-cage, induction motor  operating in a fixed frequency system can be changed by __________.
Answer_1: reconnecting stator windings for different numbers of poles
Answer_2: changing the RPM of the rotor flux
Answer_3: changing the phase sequence of the applied voltage
Answer_4: reconnecting the stator so that no poles have the same polarity

Question_Title: In the construction of D.C. motors, parts of both the series and shunt fields are wound on the __________.

Answer_1: aimed directly at the rotating shaft
Answer_2: partially aimed at a 60 Hz. fluorescent light
Answer_3: positioned 5-10 inches from the rotating shaft

Question_Title: Which of the listed sections of an emergency switchboard is used to supply power for alarm signals under emergency conditions?
Answer_1: The generator and bus transfer section

Question_Title: Which of the listed ranges represents specific gravity corrected for temperature for the electrolyte of a fully charged portable lead-acid battery?
The operator of electrical motors should keep a constant check on the loads they carry because __________.
Answer_1: low loads necessitate frequent insulation cleaning
Answer_2: exceeding nameplate values shortens useful life
Answer_3: energy is wasted if full loading is not utilized
Answer_4: power factor correction methods are load dependent

Question_Title: Inductance is the property of an electric circuit that __________.
Answer_1: opposes any change in the applied voltage
Answer_2: opposes any change in the current flow through the circuit
Answer_3: aids any changes in the applied voltage
Answer_4: aids any changes in the current through the circuit

Question_Title: An important factor in reducing D.C. motor commutator wear  is __________.
Answer_1: keeping the ambient humidity as low as possible
Answer_2: ensuring a very low brush current density
Answer_3: establishing the copper oxide surface film

Question_Title: When removing ball or roller bearings from the shaft of a motor, you should use a __________.

Answer_1: interchanging any two of the three line leads to the stator
Answer_2: disconnecting one of the three line leads to the stator
Answer_3: switching the shunt field coil leads
Answer_4: permanently disconnecting any two of the three line leads to the stator

Question_Title: When troubleshooting a console circuit card which is suspected of being faulty, the first step would be to __________.
Answer_1: pull the card and measure the value of all resistors
Answer_2: check for the correct value and polarity of all power connections to the card
Answer_3: de-energize and pull the card to visually inspect for burned components
Answer_4: check for continuity of circuit board traces and then the gain of each transistor

Question_Title: The amount of mechanical force or torque produced by an electric motor depends on the __________.
Answer_3: length of conductor in the field

Question_Title: Capacitance is the property of an electric circuit opposing a change in the __________.
A megohmmeter is connected to each end of an individual motor winding. A low ohm reading indicates __________.
The frequency of an AC generator is controlled by the __________.
The 24 volt DC bus on the emergency switchboard is used to  supply power to the __________.
The life expectancy of electrical insulation, is approximately halved for an increased operating temperature of __________.
Under normal conditions, storage batteries used for starting the emergency diesel generator are maintained in a charged  state by which of the following methods?
At high discharge rates, nickel-cadmium storage batteries are superior to lead-acid batteries because they __________.
Answer_1: require fewer cells for the same voltage and less mounting  space
Answer_2: are able to produce higher voltages and do not have to be charged as often
Answer_3: can be charged and discharged many times without much damage
Answer_4: have no individual cells to replace at the end of useful life

Question_Title: A megohmmeter can be used to test for __________.
The frequency of an alternator is controlled from the main  switchboard by adjusting the __________.
The reversal of an AC, three-phase, induction motor is accomplished by __________.
Answer_2: reversing the position of the slip rings
Answer_3: interchanging any two of the three motor leads

Question_Title: When troubleshooting a console circuit card suspected of being faulty, first check for proper voltages to the card and then __________.
Answer_1: test transistors or integrated circuits for gain and compare with manufacturer's specifications
Answer_2: blow any accumulated dust from the card with at least 30 psi air from the ship's service air system
Answer_3: pull the card, clean the sliding connections with a pencil  eraser, and remove accumulated dust
Answer_4: de-energize the card and check the printed circuit traces for continuity with an ohmmeter

Question_Title: A useful instrument for checking A.C. motor performance by  measuring possible unbalanced currents is the __________.
In an AC circuit, the inductive reactance of a coil varies  with the __________.
Complete maintenance of electrical motors should include periodic checks for machine __________.
In order to take a current reading with a 'clamp-on' ammeter, the instrument's jaws __________.
Answer_4: will act as a transformer primary

Question_Title: The number of cycles per second occurring in AC voltage is  known as the __________.
What is the approximate discharge voltage produced by one cell of a nickel-cadmium battery?
You are using a mechanical voltage tester to check the fuses in a three-phase circuit supplying an electric motor.  For  which of the following reasons must the motor be stopped during the test?
Answer_1: Testing an energized circuit presents a hazard to the testing personnel.
Answer_2: A faulty fuse could go undetected with the motor energized.
Answer_3: Reversed polarity of the circuit would be indicated by the  voltage tester with the circuit energized.

Question_Title: Sparking of D.C. motor brushes can be caused by __________.
Answer_2: many mechanical, electrical or operating faults

Question_Title: A hydrometer is used to measure the __________.
Answer_1: specific gravity of a battery electrolyte
Answer_2: water pressure in a deck pipeline
Answer_3: amount of potable water a vessel is taking on
Answer_4: power developed by a salt water service pump

Question_Title: When troubleshooting an alkaline storage battery, a weak or  dead cell is best located by __________.
Answer_1: checking the specific gravity of each cell
Answer_2: visually inspecting each cell's electrolyte level
Answer_3: load testing each cell with a voltmeter
Answer_4: measuring the electrolyte temperature with an accurate mercury thermometer

Question_Title: When a megohmmeter is used to test the dielectric strength  of wire insulation, the initial dip of the pointer toward 'zero' is caused by __________.
Answer_2: the leakage of current along the surface of dirty insulation
Answer_4: the dielectric absorption effect of the insulation

Question_Title: The voltage of an operating AC turbogenerator is raised or  lowered by adjusting the __________.
To properly seat the brushes on slip rings, you should use  __________.
Electrical insulation is classed by the __________.
Answer_2: approximate operating voltage and current expected
Answer_4: temperature stability of the manufacturing material(s)

Question_Title: In D.C. motor construction, commutating windings are wound on __________.
Which of the following statements concerning AC circuits is correct?
Answer_1: The power factor of a resistive circuit is always zero.
Answer_2: True power in an inductive circuit always equals apparent power.
Answer_3: Inductive reactance varies directly with the frequency and  the inductance.
Answer_4: Total opposition to the flow of alternating current depends upon the amount of reactive power.

Question_Title: When troubleshooting motor controllers, a shorted relay or  contactor coil is often indicated by __________.
Answer_1: a resistance reading of 'infinity' on an ohmmeter
Answer_2: charred insulation and/or a blown control fuse
Answer_3: a reading of 'zero' on a megger from one of the coil's leads to ground
Answer_4: a higher-than-normal voltage reading across the winding

Question_Title: When a battery-charging panel is being used, the batteries  will discharge if __________.
Routine A.C. motor maintenance should include periodic __________.
Answer_1: temperature readings at normal loads to detect abnormal temperature rises
Answer_2: inspection of the motor's internals for loose rotor bars or field poles
Answer_3: verifying RPM if a sychronous motor

Question_Title: Electric current is the flow of electrons through a conductor. The rate of this flow is measured as __________.
If the pointer on a megger fails to return to 'zero' when not being used, the __________.
Answer_4: pointer probably stuck in that position

Question_Title: If the driving torque, such as that produced by a diesel engine, creates pulsations when coupled with a synchronous generator operating in parallel; the generator rotor may be periodically pulled ahead or behind its normal position as it rotates.  This hunting condition is sometimes reduced by __________.
Which of the following statements represents the FIRST step in seating new brushes on slip rings?
Answer_1: Wrap sandpaper around the slip rings and slide it back and  forth between the brushes and the slip rings.
Answer_2: Press the brushes against the slip ring with a wood block.
Answer_3: Increase brush pressure and run at no load for 3 to 4 hours.
Answer_4: Apply seating compound under the brushes and run at no load for 2 hours.

Question_Title: When replacing fuses, always make sure __________.
Answer_1: to stand on a rubber mat and use rubber gloves
Answer_2: to use insulated pliers or screwdriver
Answer_3: the fuse clips are straight, tight, and in good contact
Answer_4: to increase the fuse rating 10% to guard against 'nuisance  blowing'

Question_Title: Periodic testing of circuit breakers is necessary to assure that a correctly rated and properly installed unit  __________.
Answer_1: can trip faster as it increases in age
Answer_2: will continue to provide the original degree of protection
Answer_3: does not exceed its interrupting capacity
Answer_4: be able to withstand at least 125% of applied voltage

Question_Title: Voltage will always lead current in a/an __________.
The need for insulation cleaning may be determined by __________.
Answer_4: the time period since the last cleaning

Question_Title: Motor name plate data includes " C rise ".  This indicates the __________.
Answer_1: actual running temperature of the winding from no load to full load
Answer_2: permissible temperature rise of the windings above the designed ambient temperature
Answer_3: maximum allowable temperature rise above normal full load operating temperature
Answer_4: maximum allowable temperature rise for continuous no load service

Question_Title: When using a megohmmeter to test the dielectric strength of wire insulation, a continuous series of slight downscale kicks by the pointer is result of __________.
Answer_2: the leakage of current along the surface of dirty insulation
Answer_4: the dielectric-absorption effect of the insulation

Question_Title: You are attempting to parallel two AC generators and the synchroscope pointer is revolving in the slow direction. This indicates that the frequency of the incoming machine is __________.
Answer_3: the same as the bus frequency but out of phase with it
Answer_4: the same as the bus frequency, and the circuit breaker may  be closed at any pointer position

Question_Title: Periodic testing by a shoreside support technician using a special camera which can detect potentially dangerous loose or corroded bus bar and controller connections is termed __________.
When troubleshooting a console circuit card suspected of being faulty, first check operating voltages, clean the card and then __________.
Answer_1: make sure wired connections and push-on connectors are tight
Answer_2: test each resistor and capacitor on the card with an ohmmeter
Answer_3: check the continuity of all printed circuit traces with an  ohmmeter
Answer_4: measure the gain of each transistor or integrated circuit

Question_Title: Four lamps are connected in parallel in a single circuit. If one of the lamp burns out, the others will __________.
A commutator's protective oxide film can be destroyed by __________.
When the electrolyte level of a lead-acid storage battery has decreased due to normal evaporation, the level should be reestablished by adding __________.
Answer_3: a weak solution of sulfuric acid and distilled water
Answer_4: a strong solution of sulfuric acid and distilled water

Question_Title: When troubleshooting a motor controller, all indications are that a relay coil should be energized.  If there were no magnetic pull, with rated voltage measured across the coil, the most probable cause would be that the __________.
Answer_3: auxiliary contact in series with the coil is defective

Question_Title: Materials that retain a large part of their magnetization,  after the magnetizing force is removed, are said to have __________.
Discharge switches are often located on hand-driven meggers. The purpose of these switches is to discharge capacitive charges stored in the __________.
You are attempting to parallel two AC generators and the synchroscope pointer stops at a position other than 0 prior to closing the circuit breaker.  This indicates __________.
Answer_1: the frequency of the incoming machine is the same as the bus frequency
Answer_2: the incoming machine is in phase with the bus, but the frequency is not the same
Answer_3: the circuit breaker may be closed after breaker has been reset
Answer_4: there is an existing cross current between generators

Question_Title: When shipboard electrical distribution circuits are connected in parallel, additional parallel circuits will cause the total circuit resistance to __________.
Answer_1: increase, causing a drop in the line current
Answer_2: increase, causing a decrease in the line voltage
Answer_3: decrease, causing an increase in the line voltage
Answer_4: decrease, causing an increase in the line current

Question_Title: Which of the listed classes of electrical insulation is suited for the highest operating temperature?
Which of the following procedures represents the best method to prevent the freezing of batteries continuously exposed to low temperatures?
Answer_1: The battery caps should be removed.
Answer_2: The battery cap vents should be sealed.
Answer_3: The battery should be kept in a fully charged condition.
Answer_4: The battery should be disconnected from its charging source.

Question_Title: Ambient temperature is the __________.
Answer_1: amount of temperature rise of an electric motor with no load
Answer_2: temperature of the compartment where the motor is located
Answer_3: normal electric motor operating temperature, less the room temperature
Answer_4: actual temperature developed by an operating motor

Question_Title: A ohmmeter can be used to test for __________.
You are attempting to parallel two AC generators and the synchroscope pointer is revolving slowly in the fast direction.  You should __________.
Answer_1: use the governor control switch to adjust the incoming voltage so it is equal to the bus voltage
Answer_2: use the governor control switch to increase the speed of the machine on the line only

Answer_2: reading of 1.0 on the power factor meter

Question_Title: A DC generator which is used to supply direct current in order to maintain an AC generator field is commonly known as a/an __________.
A volt-ohm-millimeter can be used to check for __________.
When paralleling two AC generators, the frequency (cycles)  of the incoming generator, just prior to closing the circuit breaker, should be __________.
Answer_1: slightly less than the frequency of the generator on the line
Answer_2: the same as the frequency of the generator on the line
Answer_3: slightly more than the frequency of the generator on the line

Question_Title: A split-phase induction squirrel-cage motor will not come up to speed, even though the rated voltage, rated frequency, and rated load are applied.  The suspected trouble could be due to __________.
A ground is indicated by the ground-detecting system on the main electrical switchboard.  The FIRST step in locating the actual ground is to __________.
Answer_1: close all circuit breakers in the distribution panel until  the ground detector indicates normal
Answer_2: open the individual circuit breakers, one by one until the  ground detection system indicates normal
Answer_4: check each circuit with a megohmmeter

Question_Title: Fuses are usually rated in __________.
When used for taking resistance measurements, a volt-ohm-milliammeter is normally powered by __________.
Answer_3: the current in the circuit being tested

Question_Title: When paralleled, AC generators must have the same __________.
Discoloration of the rotor bars in a squirrel-cage motor is typical evidence of __________.
Multiple grounds have developed and were initialy indicated by the ground-detecting system as one ground.  The FIRST step in locating the grounds is to __________.
Answer_1: examine the main bus bars for signs of overheating
Answer_2: eliminate the individual circuits one by one until the ground detecting system no longer indicates any grounds
Answer_4: check each circuit with a megohmmeter

Question_Title: To protect the rotor of a motor disassembled for maintenance or overhaul, it should be __________.
Answer_1: suspended by wire slings in one corner of the shop
Answer_2: wrapped in several layers of heavy paper or cardboard
Answer_3: supported by flat wood blocks on the workbench
Answer_4: returned to the frame as soon as the bearings are removed

Question_Title: Which of the following materials is a good insulator?
Electrical power is expressed in __________.

A voltmeter located on a control panel has been operating correctly for six months, suddenly burns out.  After removing it, it is found that neither side of the meter has been grounded.  When installing the new meter it should be  __________.
Answer_2: connected to a large resistor between the positive side and the ground
Answer_3: installed exactly as the old installation

Question_Title: Which of the following should be the FIRST step in removing a generator from parallel operation?
Answer_1: Trip the generator off the switchboard.
Answer_3: Decrease the governor setting on the 'off going' generator.
Answer_4: Decrease the cycles of the generator staying on the line.

Question_Title: An overload in which of the listed motors will result in the illumination of an indicating light at the propulsion  control station alarm panel?
A current-carrying conductor makes accidental contact with a wiring conduit.  This will be indicated by a __________.
An electrical connection between the wiring of an electric  motor and its metal frame is known as a/an __________.
Prior to closing the breaker when paralleling two AC generators, the recommended practice is to have the frequency of the incoming machine __________.
Answer_1: slightly less than the line frequency
Answer_2: the same as the line frequency
Answer_3: slightly greater than the line frequency

Question_Title: If a synchronous motor begins to vibrate severely and pull  out of synchronism, the cause may be __________.
Answer_2: an open in the field coils

Question_Title: Accidental grounds in a shipboard electrical system must be repaired as soon as possible as they will __________.
Answer_3: appear on the ground detection system
Answer_4: damage insulation and may cause outages

Question_Title: The standard measuring unit of wire by its cross-sectional  area, as used in American wire tables is the __________.
A change in field excitation of an alternator operating in  parallel will cause a change in its __________.
The effect of carrying field excitation excessively high on a synchronous motor will result in a __________.
Answer_1: tendency for the motor to fall out of step
Answer_2: tendency for the motor to overspeed
Answer_3: tendency for the motor to overheat

Question_Title: In addition to short circuits and sustained overloads, fuses are likely to blow due to __________.
The greatest single cause of electrical failures is __________.
A device used in an electrical circuit to change alternating current to direct current, is known as a __________.

Two AC generators of the same capacity are operating in parallel.  One with a zero speed droop setting and the other with a 5% speed droop.  If its capacity is not exceeded, the unit whose governor has the zero speed droop setting will __________.
Answer_1: assume the smaller share of the load
Answer_2: maintain the frequency of the system

Question_Title: A fuse will "blow" if __________.
Answer_1: an electric motor is stopped suddenly by opening a switch
Answer_2: the flow of current to the protection device is reversed
Answer_3: the electrical current exceeds the rated value of the fuse
Answer_4: unequal resistors are connected in parallel

Question_Title: The inductance of a coil is measured in __________.

Answer_1: connect the motor and then use the 'jog' button to determine the direction of rotation
Answer_2: connect the phase indicator to the motor leads, rotate the  motor by hand and then connect to the supply voltage
Answer_3: connect the phase indicator to the supply voltage then connect the motor
Answer_4: check the supply line phase sequence and motor rotation with appropriate indicators, then connect correspondingly marked leads

Question_Title: Current flowing in only one direction is called __________.

If a three-phase induction motor is operated under a light load and it develops an open in one of its supply lines, the motor will __________.
Answer_1: continue to run, but will vibrate and have reduced torque

Answer_3: run cooler due to reduced current flow

Question_Title: When a fluorescent lamp fails to light, the trouble can be  in the __________.

Why is it a good practice to have the frequency of the incoming alternator adjusted slightly higher than that of the loaded alternator when paralleling two alternators?
Answer_1: This allows the oncoming machine to accept load immediately.
Answer_2: This prevents the machine from floating on the line.
Answer_3: The reverse power relay is prevented from activating.

Question_Title: In an alternating current electrical system, a low system power factor is a direct sign of __________.
Answer_3: a short in the exciter field windings
Answer_4: an excessive number of minor system grounds

Question_Title: Battery capacities are given in __________.
When a low input voltage is imparted to a device which then delivers a high output voltage, the device is known as a __________.
Which of the following conditions can lead to the failure of a resistor?

Two paralleled alternators are operating near rated load. If one trips out mechanically, which of the listed actions  should be taken FIRST?
Answer_2: Strip the board of all non-vital circuits.
Answer_4: Transfer all vital loads to the emergency bus.

Question_Title: Routine maintenance of dry-type transformers should include __________.
Answer_1: preventing the entrance of water from broken pipe lines  steam lines
Answer_2: keeping protective surfaces and insulating bushings free of dirt and conductive debris
Answer_3: periodic testing of insulation resistance with a megger

Question_Title: The twisting force developed by a motor and applied to a shaft is called __________.

Answer_1: supply excessive current to the bus
Answer_2: operate at the same load, but with reduced voltage
Answer_3: lose its load and tend to overspeed

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed will indicate the need to clean the insulation on the windings of an electric motor?
Which of the listed devices may be used as a digital device?
If all of the ground detection lamps burn with equal brilliance, whether the test button is depressed or released, then __________.

Answer_1: calibrated using a capactance wheatstone bridge
Answer_2: replaced and the reason for the overheating found
Answer_3: cooled with a spray can of refrigerant approved for this purpose
Answer_4: resoldered with care taken to insure that the origional cold solder joint is repaired

Question_Title: The unit of electrical power is the __________.

Answer_1: continue to operate at no load
Answer_3: begin to motorize and then trip out
Answer_4: slow down and operate at reduced load

Question_Title: Which of the listed procedures is the best way to tell if a motor has become overloaded?
Answer_1: Measure the current flow and compare it with the motor full load current flow as shown on the nameplate.
Answer_2: Feel the motor and judge by the temperature.
Answer_3: Watch for telltale signs of smoke coming from the motor.
Answer_4: Periodic opening of the O/L relay coil

Question_Title: If a small electric motor is imersed in salt water it should be __________.; ;  I.  washed in fresh water ;  II. dried in an oven

Some large A.C. motors are equipped with with heaters. These could be __________.; ;  I.  resistance heaters bolted directly to the frame ;  II. low voltage windings embedded in the motor windings
The unit of electrical resistance is the __________.
On some electrical generating equipment one outboard bearing pedestal is insulated from the bedplate.  To check this insulation with the machine assembled you should use a____________.
Answer_2: millivolt meter and a jumper with the machine running
Answer_3: megohm meter with the machine running
Answer_4: voltmeter and ampmeter with the machine running

Question_Title: When an AC or a DC motor fails to start, the FIRST step in  troubleshooting should be to check the __________.

Answer_1: determine the amount of varnish that can be applied to correct insulation problems
Answer_2: determine the condition of the bearings
Answer_3: provide for the correct proper tightening of the field coil bolts and correct lateral adjustment of the field coils

Question_Title: On some electrical generating equipment one outboard bearing pedestal is insulated from the bedplate.  This should be checked with a millivolt meter and a jumper. With the millivolt meter connectd between the shaft and the bedplate how should the jumper be used?
Answer_1: It should be placed from one end of the shaft to the other to eliminate shaft currents.
Answer_2: It is used to short the + and - in a D.C. generator or Phase A and Phase C in an alternator to eleminate the effects of CEMF.
Answer_3: It should be placed across the insulating block to increase the shaft current to a point where it can be measured with the millivolt meter.
Answer_4: It should be placed from the shaft to the pedestal while one reading is taken, then removed to take a second reading.  This eliminates the insulating effect of the bearing.

Question_Title: A current-carrying conductor making electrical contact with a wiring conduit will be indicated by a __________.
Answer_2: totally dark switchboard ground detecting light

Question_Title: Maintenance of alkaline batteries should include __________.
Answer_1: checking the electrolyte weekly using a hydrometer
Answer_4: replacment when the volts per cell drops below 1.8 VDC

Question_Title: If deck machinery is expected to be idle for an extended period of time you should____________.
Answer_1: have electrical safety gloves available in case of electrical shock before running
Answer_2: perform a 'high pot' test to determine the condition of the insulation
Answer_3: water wash the motor and controller to remove any salt that may interfere with smooth operation
Answer_4: check run at regular intervals to insure correct operation and to renew the internal coating of lubrication

Question_Title: Ambient temperature is the __________.
Answer_1: amount of temperature rise with no load
Answer_2: amount of temperature developed by an operating motor
Answer_3: temperature of the compartment where the motor is located
Answer_4: normal operating temperature, less the room temperature

Question_Title: After closing the circuit breaker to place two similar alternators in parallel, the NEXT step is to balance the __________.

Answer_1: failure to clean the bearing before repacking
Answer_3: excess lubrication forcing the bearing full of grease and eliminating all areas of expansion

Question_Title: If air gap readings for an electical generating machine have changed significantly from the last reading, you should check  __________.
Answer_4: the field coil bolts for the proper torque values

Question_Title: In the event of a power failure during cargo loading operations, the movement of an electric powered cargo winch will be stopped by __________.
Answer_2: the weight of the load on the boom

Question_Title: A switchboard ammeter indicates a reading slightly above 'zero' when the leads are disconnected, this is caused by __________.
Answer_1: mechanical misalignment of the meter pointer
Answer_2: a poor ground for the meter case
Answer_4: capacitors inside the meter storing charges

Question_Title: Air gap readings should be periodicly taken for electrical generation equipment.  The best tool to use to take these measurements is a __________.

Answer_3: The synchronizing lamps will burn out.

Question_Title: Brush sparking in a DC generator during commutation may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: eddy currents in the armature core

Answer_3: induced current opposite to coil inductance
Answer_4: coil inductance discharge occurring at commutation

Question_Title: Air gap readings for electrical generating equipment should be taken periodicly.  This is to __________.; ;  I.  determine the condition of the bearings  ; II. prevent damage to the rotor and stator

A three-phase alternator is operating at 450 volts with the switchboard ammeter indicating 300 amps.  The kw meter  currently indicates 163.6 KW, with a power factor of 0.7. If the power factor increases to 0.8, the KW meter would then read __________.

Which of the following statements is true concerning stepdown transformer operation?
Answer_1: The resistance on the primary side is lower than the  secondary side.
Answer_2: The voltage to the primary side is the same as the voltage  from the secondary side.
Answer_3: The current to the primary side is the same as the current  from the secondary side.
Answer_4: The voltage to the primary side is greater than the voltage from the secondary side.

Question_Title: To remove an alternator operating in parallel with another  unit from the main electrical bus, you must FIRST __________.
Answer_1: adjust the power factor on both units

Answer_3: open the circuit breaker on the outgoing alternator
Answer_4: remove the load from the outgoing alternator

Question_Title: The following air gap readings were obtained from a horizontally mounted, bilge pump, induction motor, equipped with sleeve bearings: ;                      FWD END            AFT END ; Top                  .045               .049; Right Side           .045               .047; Left Side            .045               .047 ; Bottom               .045               .041;  ; Which of the following statements is true?
Answer_1: The aft bearing should be replaced.
Answer_2: Shims should be removed from the aft bearing.
Answer_3: The forward bearing should be lowered.
Answer_4: The aft bearing should be lowered.

Question_Title: A ground on a particular phase of a three-phase low voltage distribution system would be indicated by a __________.
Answer_3: dark or dim switchboard ground detecting light

Question_Title: If the bearings of an electrical generator are failing more frequently than expected and the lubricating oil is sludging then you should __________.
Answer_1: check the connections to the output leads

Answer_4: replace the thrust bearing of the prime mover

Question_Title: On electrical generators one of the bearings is isolated from the bedplate.  This insulating block should not be painted and must be kept clean to __________.
Answer_2: create an isolated ground for the instrumentation
Answer_3: allow for the expansion of the generator away from the prime mover as it warms up
Answer_4: eliminate shaft currents to prevent damaging the bearings

Question_Title: Maintenance of alkaline batteries should include __________.
Answer_1: checking the electrolyte weekly using a hydrometer
Answer_3: top off with sulfuric acid as needed
Answer_4: making certain connections are tight and clean

Question_Title: One item listed on the name plate of a cargo pump motor is  'degrees centigrade rise.'  This number is based on __________.
Answer_1: normal temperature change from cold to hot
Answer_3: minimum heat rise from no load to full load
Answer_4: maximum degrees centigrade rise from absolute zero

Question_Title: As part of a routine maintenance program for deck machinery, you should __________.
Answer_1: inspect electrical wiring and pushbutton switches for evidence of corrosion or burned insulation
Answer_2: disassemble pushbutton switches and drain water each week
Answer_3: remove motor covers and ventilate as weather permits
Answer_4: Check drum switch contact pressure every three months

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions will occur if the polarity of the field poles and the direction of current to the brushes of a DC motor were both reversed?
Answer_2: The direction of rotation of the armature would be reversed.
Answer_3: The direction of rotation of the armature would be  unchanged.
Answer_4: The field pole windings would become overheated.

Question_Title: A single-phase induction motor will only start if you spin the rotor rapidly with the line switch closed.  After starting, its speed fluctuates between very slow and half-speed.  The problem probably lies in the __________.

Answer_3: apply the voltage tester across the bottoms of the line fuses
Answer_4: ensure the circuit is de-energized, and then use a  continuity tester

Question_Title: If your multimeter gives a reading in ohms when testing each end of each conductor of a three-conductor cable, this indicates __________.
Answer_3: the presence of a partial ground
Answer_4: that the conductor is not short circuited

Answer_1: manually, by adjusting the governor controls
Answer_3: manually, adjusting the output of current transformers
Answer_4: automatically, by the designed action of the governors

Question_Title: A short circuit in the armature of a DC motor will cause the motor to __________.

Answer_1: there is a ground on the line with the dark lamp
Answer_2: the dark lamp must be replaced
Answer_3: there are grounds on the lines with the bright lamps

Question_Title: Which of the methods listed is used to start a AC generator turning?
Answer_1: Residual magnetism remaining in the field poles.
Answer_2: Residual magnetism remaining in the field coils.
Answer_3: Residual magnetism remaining in the armature.
Answer_4: Rotation by a mechanical prime mover.

Question_Title: When a megohmmeter is being used on a alternating current machine, the meter pointer will dip toward 'zero' and then gradually rise to the true resistance value if the motor insulation is __________.
What current is required to light two 75 watt lamps and one 40 watt lamp when connected in series to a 120 volt power source?

Answer_1: an open in the run winding

Question_Title: DC generator voltage is decreased by cutting __________.

Answer_1: there is a slight ground on all three phases
Answer_4: the light bulbs are of improper voltage

Question_Title: A three-phase alternator is developing 300 amps, with a 0.8 power factor, at 450 volts.  The true indicated power on the kilowatt meter, located on the main switchboard, will be __________.
Which of the listed conditions will occur if dirt and grease are allowed to accumulate between the commutator segments of a motor?
'Corrosion-resistant material' and 'noncorrodible material' will include which of the following __________.

Answer_1: the dark lamp must be replaced
Answer_2: there is a ground in the line with the dark lamp
Answer_3: there are grounds in two of the three phases
Answer_4: the voltage to the dark lamp is less than that of the system

Question_Title: The power supplied to a motor is six kilowatts at 120 volts. What is the impedance of the motor?

Answer_3: sounding each bar with a light weight hammer
Answer_4: checking with a calibrated torque wrench

Question_Title: The distance between a generator and its load is 100 feet.  What would be the approximate total voltage drop across a two wire supply cable if the current were 5.5 amperes and the resistance of the wire were 2.525 ohms per 1,000 feet?
An open armature connection in a DC propulsion motor could be caused by __________.

Answer_1: suspended by wire slings in one corner of the shop
Answer_3: supported by two "V" notched wood blocks
Answer_4: returned to the frame as soon as the bearings are removed

Question_Title: Ships requiring rapid maneuvering response with a high degree of main propeller shaft control are most often _______ .

Answer_2: no resistance accompanied by stray inductance

Question_Title: Main propeller shaft rotation of a DC diesel-electric ship is normally reversed by __________.
Answer_1: reversing the field in the AC generator
Answer_2: reversing the field in the DC motor

Question_Title: While standing an "at sea watch" onboard a DC diesel-elecric drive ship, you notice sparking of the brushes on the DC drive motor.  You should first __________.

Answer_3: trip the circuit breaker for that motor

Question_Title: SCR power converters are used on DC diesel-electric drive ships to __________.
Answer_1: convert high voltage AC to DC

Question_Title: A four-pole induction motor, operating on three-phase 60 cycle current will operate at approximately __________.

Upon relieving an "at sea watch" you notice that the starboard motor has reduced voltage and zero current compared to normal voltage and current indicated on the port motor.  The problem with the starboard motor could be __________.

Answer_1: increase the speed of the generator with the largest kvar while decreasing the other generator speed

Answer_4: decrease the voltage of the generator with the largest kvar while increasing the other generator voltage

Question_Title: A conductor with a cross-sectional area of one circular mil would have a diameter of __________.

Answer_1: de-energize and lock out thermal heater circuits and any other auxiliary circuits located inside the motor housing
Answer_2: tag and lock out the motors main circuit breaker
Answer_3: engage shaft brake to prevent rotor from turning

Question_Title: An equalizing connection between two compound-wound DC generators when paralleled, serves to __________.
Answer_1: reverse the polarity of the incoming generator as the series field weakens
Answer_3: reverse the direction of current in the series field of the incoming generator
Answer_4: parallel the series fields of the generators

Question_Title: If a D.C. motor hums, but does not run when energized, which of the listed conditions could exist?
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Thermal strip heaters are provided in DC main propulsion motors to __________.
Answer_2: maintain a relatively constant temperature in the motor enclosure

Question_Title: An AC diesel-electric propulsion system requires less maintenance than a DC diesel-electric system for which one of the following components?

Answer_1: varying the input frequency of the voltage to the motor

Question_Title: On electric propulsion drive ships, Silicon-Controlled Rectifiers can be used to control which of the following?; ; I.  DC propulsion motors; II.  AC propulsion motors

Answer_1: power converter cooling fan not energized

Answer_3: lubricating oil pressure to the main propulsion drive system is insufficient

Question_Title: What precautions should you take when required to run "split bus" on a main power distribution bus on a diesel-electric drive ship?

Answer_2: Establish generator phase sychronization before closing bus ties.

Question_Title: One major advantage of a diesel electric propulsion plant is __________.

Question_Title: If a small electric motor is imersed in salt water it should be __________.; ;  I.  washed in fresh water ;  II. thoroughly dried

Answer_1: The flux may not spread evenly.

Question_Title: When troubleshooting an amplifier, you measure an output of 30 volts.  If the gain of the amplifier is 2, what must  the input voltage be for the amplifier to work properly?

Answer_1: decrease the average current in the circuit
Answer_2: not have any affect on the the average current value

Answer_4: not have any affect on the capacitve reactance

Question_Title: Decreasing the power source frequency in a capacitive circuit will __________.
Answer_1: decrease the average current in the circuit
Answer_2: not have any affect on the the average current value
Answer_3: increase the average current in the circuit
Answer_4: not have any affect on the capacitve reactance

Question_Title: Which of the following represents the corrected specific gravity of a lead acid battery, with a temperature of 90F, and a hydrometer reading of 1160?
