Answer_1: Never use this tester on circuits greater than 60 Hz as the  tester may not register voltages over 60 Hz.
Answer_2: Always remember that the unit is polarity sensitive and if  used on DC circuits reversing the leads may result in high  temperatures within the tester.
Answer_3: Never connect the device to circuits where potentials greater than 120 volts may be present, as the coil's extremely fine wire cannot withstand more than a few amps.
Answer_4: Always pre-set the meter to the next higher range than the  amount of voltage expected in the circuit in order to prevent damage from an off-scale reading.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning nickel-cadmium batteries is true?
Answer_1: Nickel-cadmium batteries are less susceptible to local action than lead-acid batteries.
Answer_2: Nickel-cadmium batteries should only be discharged 50% before recharging.
Answer_3: The electrolyte of an idle nickel-cadmium battery must be replaced monthly to maintain battery condition.
Answer_4: When mixing electrolyte always add acid to the water.

Question_Title: A battery is connected to a circuit containing three resistors in parallel.  The values of the three resistors are 2 ohms, 3 ohms, and 6 ohms.  What is the voltage of the battery if the total circuit current is 12 amps?
When two generators are on the line and are sharing the load equally, they are said to be operating in __________.
If a DC motor runs faster than designed, with all other conditions being normal, the possible cause could be a/an __________.
What is the rotor speed of a six pole, 60 cycle, induction motor operating at full load with 3% slip?
For practical purposes, in a simple series circuit employing two resistors, a drop of one half the source voltage will occur across one resistor if it has __________.
Answer_1: a resistance equal to the other
Answer_2: half the resistance value of the other resistor
Answer_3: at least ten times the resistance of the other

Question_Title: The formula for computing impedance in a series circuit containing resistance, capacitance, and inductance is __________. [ NOTE: the symbol  *  stands for 'multiplied by' ]
Answer_3: Z * Z = R * R + (XL - XC) * (XL - XC)

Question_Title: For practical purposes, in a simple series circuit employing two resistors, the largest voltage drop will occur across the resistor which has  __________.
Answer_3: a resistance equal to the other
Answer_4: less resistance than the other resistor

Question_Title: A short in the shunt field of a DC motor is best located by __________.
Answer_2: applying AC voltage to each field coil and measuring the voltage drop across each field coil
Answer_3: using a growler and hacksaw blade
Answer_4: isolating each coil from the others and using a megohmmeter

Question_Title: In a three-wire, 230/115 volt DC system, the potential between neutral and negative is __________.
The main difference between a motor control circuit containing low voltage protection and low voltage release is that the latter contains __________.
If a DC motor runs hot, the cause may be __________.
Answer_4: an open in the shunt field

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be taken when troubleshooting various power circuits using an electronic voltage tester?
Answer_1: Never use this tester on circuits of 60 Hz, as the tester may not register the voltage.
Answer_2: Always remember that the unit is polarity sensitive and if  used on DC circuits reversing the leads may result in high  temperatures within the tester.
Answer_3: Never connect the device to circuits where potentials are greater than 120 volts.
Answer_4: Always check a known power source of the same type and voltage before using it to troubleshoot electrical equipment.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning Nickel-Cadmium batteries is true?
Answer_1: When mixing Ni-Cad electrolyte always add acid to the water.
Answer_2: When mixing Ni-Cad electrolyte always add water to the acid.
Answer_3: Nickel-Cadmium batteries can be stored for a long period of time while still keeping a full charge.
Answer_4: The electrolyte of an idle Nickel-Cadmium battery must be replaced monthly to maintain battery condition.

Question_Title: An electrical component is connected across a 120 volt 60 hertz AC supply.  What is the current drawn by the component if the impedance is 200 ohms?
Which of the methods listed is used to maintain the division of load between two compound-wound, DC generators operating in parallel?
Answer_2: The shunt field rheostats are interconnected.
Answer_3: The series fields of both generators are connected in series.
Answer_4: The equalizer connection parallels the series fields of all machines.

Question_Title: A lamp has a source voltage of 110 volts and a current of 0.9 amps.  What is the resistance of the lamp?
Which of the listed conditions might contribute to very rapid wearing of a DC machine's commutator bars?
Answer_2: Using improper grade of carbon brushes
Answer_3: Aligning the front and rear mica V-rings improperly
Answer_4: An open circuit in the armature

Question_Title: A coil is wound with 200 feet of No. 16 tinned copper wire  and connected to a 12 volt battery.  What is the current if the resistance per 1000 feet of No. 16 tinned copper wire is 4.26 ohms?
The prime mover of an AC two pole main propulsion generator drives the generator at 3600 RPM.  If the main propulsion motor has 80 poles, what will be the propeller speed?
A coil is wound with 400 feet of No. 16 tinned copper wire  and connected to a 12 volt battery.  What is the current if the resistance per 1000 feet of No. 16 tinned copper wire is 4.26 ohms?
Sparking at the brushes of a running motor could be an indication of __________.
While standing an "at sea watch" onboard a DC diesel-electric drive ship you notice the transformer core temperature slowly rising.  You should first __________.
Answer_1: check the transformer ventilation fans for proper operation
Answer_2: notify the bridge that you need to slow down
Answer_3: send the oiler to look for fires in the transformer
Answer_4: reduce load by tripping lighting circuits

Question_Title: A three-phase alternator operates at 450 volts with a 0.8 power factor.  If the ammeter indicates 250 amperes, what  should be the KW meter reading?
Electrical failures in motors are caused by the breakdown of insulation, which may be caused by __________.
An operational amplifier, as used in today's consoles, has a calculated gain of 5.  This means that when the input changes __________.
Damp armature windings in a D.C. motor may lead to  __________.

If the synchronous speed of a 12 pole, polyphase, induction motor operating at 60 Hz were 600 RPM, how many poles will  be required in a similar motor operating at the same frequency but having a synchronous speed of 900 RPM?
If a single-phase induction motor fails to start, the problem may be __________.
Answer_1: an open in the main winding

Question_Title: A four-pole, 60 cycle, squirrel-cage motor has a full load  speed of 1725 RPM.  What will be the percent of slip at full load?
A single-phase induction motor starts, comes up to about 75% rated speed, slows down to a lower speed, and accelerates again.  The problem is most likely in the __________.

Electric motors intended for use outside the engine room and boiler room are frequently rated to run at a designed  ambient temperature of 40C.  What is the equivalent temperature in degrees Fahrenheit?
A four-pole 60-hertz induction motor has a synchronous speed of 1800 RPM and a slip of 4 percent at full load.  What will be its full load speed?
The speed of a squirrel-cage, multi-speed, induction motor, as used aboard ship, is varied by changing the __________.
Answer_1: number of connected poles in the stator

Question_Title: When the length and cross sectional area of a wire are both tripled, the resistance __________.
Universal motors will operate on AC or DC current, and are  generally found in __________.
A motor enclosure which protects against falling liquids is classified as  __________.
A bus bar is 3 inches wide and 0.375 inches thick. What size of round conductor (in circular mils) is necessary to carry the same current as the bus bar?

As a result of a mechanical malfunction in one of the ship's service generators operating in parallel, you must secure that generator.  In order to prevent a possible overload to the remaining generator, which of the following sequential  courses of action should be taken?
Answer_1: Trip the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker and prime mover throttle trip.
Answer_2: Trip all nonvital distribution feeder circuit breakers, the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker, and the prime mover throttle trip.
Answer_3: Trip the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker and distribution feeder circuit breakers.
Answer_4: Trip all nonvital distribution feeder circuit breakers, the malfunctioning prime mover turbine throttle trip, and the generator circuit breaker.

Question_Title: What is the main function in the use of a capacitor for starting a single phase motor?
Answer_2: Split the phase to establish a rotating magnetic field
Answer_4: Prolong the life of the starting contacts

Question_Title: A circuit breaker for a 300 KW alternator is rated at 470 amperes of full continuous load.  The amount of overcurrent allowed is 125%.  Which of the following conditions will trip the breaker?
Answer_2: Sustained current flow of 500 amperes for 10 minutes.

Question_Title: The most practical method of controlling the RPM of a step-speed AC motor is to __________.
A diesel driven emergency generator is prevented from being paralleled with the ship's service generators by __________.
The energy consumed by an AC motor, as strictly reactive power, is __________.
Answer_2: used to establish the magnetic field of the motor
Answer_3: lost as heat generated by the windings
Answer_4: lost in doing work to turn the motor itself

Question_Title: A turbogenerator has a rated output of 1200 KW at 60 Hertz, with a no load frequency of 61.5 Hertz.  What is its speed  droop?
If an alternator is to be inactive for a considerable period of time, which of the following actions should be taken?
Answer_1: It should be disconnected from the prime mover and raised off its bearing supports.
Answer_2: Insulation resistance readings should be taken weekly to ensure resistance is not deteriorating.
Answer_3: The brushes should be lifted off the slip rings to prevent  pitting of the metal by electrolytic action.
Answer_4: The windings and collector rings should be protected with a thin coat of grease or oil.

Question_Title: Which of the following is a characteristic of fractional  horsepower repulsion start motors?
Answer_1: They start with a rotating stator field.
Answer_2: The short circuiting ring is removed from the commutator while starting.
Answer_3: The brushes are removed from the commutator while starting.
Answer_4: They have a low starting torque.

Question_Title: A vessel is equipped with two ship's service generators. Generator #1 is rated at 900 kw and generator #2 is rated at 600 kw.  During parallel operation, with a hotel load of 1,000 kw, what should be the kw load on generator #2?
Which of the listed motors will operate at the highest RPM, assuming that each operates at the same frequency?
Answer_1: A four-pole synchronous motor under normal load.
Answer_2: A four-pole induction motor under no load.
Answer_3: A six-pole synchronous motor under normal load.
Answer_4: A six-pole induction motor under full load.

Question_Title: A three-phase alternator is operating at 450 volts, 250 amps at 0.6 power factor.  If the power factor increases to 0.8, the kw load potential will increase by __________.
On large generators, space heaters are used to __________.
Answer_1: keep the machine at ambient tmperature of the machinery space
Answer_2: maintain rotor and stator winding temperatures above the dew point to prevent the formation of condensation
Answer_3: prevent condensation in the lube oil
Answer_4: prevent electrolysis due to condensation in the bearings

Question_Title: Which of the following materials is recommended for finishing the slip rings after grinding or turning?
A megger is being used to test the insulation of an AC generator.  The resistance value of a dry, clean winding will __________.
Answer_1: continue to rise as test potential is maintained, becoming  fairly steady as the dielectric-absorption effect of insulation stabilizes
Answer_2: remain constant as the temperature of the windings increases
Answer_3: continue to drop as test potential is maintained, becoming  fairly steady after 5-7 minutes
Answer_4: stabilize after approximately 2-4 minutes of fluctuation

Question_Title: Which statement is true concerning a split-phase induction motor?
Answer_1: Motor rotation can be reversed without changing the windings or leads.
Answer_2: Motor speed can be readily adjusted from zero to full speed.
Answer_3: The motor will run as a generator with the proper wiring.
Answer_4: Motor rotation can be reversed by reversing the leads on the starting winding.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements, concerning the general maintenance of a brushless generator, is correct?
Answer_1: Paint should be applied to insulating surfaces on an annual basis.
Answer_2: Alcohol should be used to remove dust and grime from windings.
Answer_3: High pressure air should be used to blow out carbon dust.
Answer_4: Accessible generator parts should be wiped with a clean dry rag on a periodic basis.

Question_Title: Which of the listed colors properly describes a DC motor commutator when correct commutation is taking place?
An AC generator produces 60 Hz at 1800 RPM.  If the generator speed is increased to 1830 RPM, the cycles will __________.
Brushes in a generator must be positioned in the neutral plane to avoid sparking between the brushes and the __________.
If the connections for the field and the armature on a DC motor are reversed, __________.
Answer_1: the motor will run as a generator
Answer_3: the direction of rotation will be the same
Answer_4: the direction of rotation will be reversed

Question_Title: A lead-acid battery can deliver 20 amperes continuously for 10 hours with an ampere-hour rating of __________.
An advantage of DC motors over AC motors is that they __________.
A twelve volt lead-acid battery is constructed of __________.

Moisture accumulating in electric motors and generator windings having a cold insulation resistance greater than 50,000 ohms may be baked out with internal heat.  This heat can be developed by __________.
Answer_1: feeding current into the windings at low voltage
Answer_2: short circuiting the armature and field windings
Answer_3: short circuiting the field windings and passing current through the armature
Answer_4: obtaining current from a DC source such as an electric welder and feeding it into the armature while running the motor at full speed

Question_Title: A series wound DC motor has its armature and field connected in series with a resistor.  When the motor is disconnected  from its power supply, this motor will exemplify __________.
Answer_1: the proper connections for across the line starting
Answer_2: the proper connections for an automatic strip heater

Question_Title: An electric heating element supplied with 120 volts draws 15 amps.  How much power will be consumed?
Uneven wear of the commutator surface on a direct current propulsion motor can be caused by __________.
An increase in the amount of current flow through the armature of a shunt motor is the final result of a/an __________.
Answer_1: increase in the load on the motor
Answer_2: decrease in the load on the motor

Question_Title: The torque produced by a DC motor armature is the product of the force acting at the armature surface multiplied by   __________.
Answer_1: work done by the armature in one revolution
Answer_2: effective armature diameter at which the force acts
Answer_3: maximum moment arm at the center of rotation of the armature
Answer_4: perpendicular distance to its center of rotation

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true if a 100 watt lamp and a 75 watt lamp are connected in parallel across a 100 volt power supply?
Answer_1: The 75 watt lamp will draw as much current as the 100 watt  lamp.
Answer_2: The 100 watt lamp will have a greater resistance.
Answer_3: Current flow will be the same across each lamp.
Answer_4: The 75 watt lamp will have a higher resistance.

Question_Title: Two 100 watt light bulbs are connected in parallel across a 100 volt power supply. The total power developed in the circuit is __________.
Answer_4: equal to the product of the amperes times the voltage in each branch

Question_Title: In order to safely carry out repairs to a generator circuit breaker, it must be isolated from the bus.  This is accomplished by opening the __________.
If the voltage supplied to the lighting circuit is 110 volts, how much current is used by a 100 watt light bulb?
Three 12 volt, lead-acid, batteries connected in series will develop __________.
Unnecessary and frequent applications of varnish to the generator windings to repair defective insulation will result in __________.
Answer_1: heavy coatings of varnish interfering with heat dissipation
Answer_2: deficient air gap clearance and eventual damage to the casing
Answer_4: a built-up of varnish without changing generator operation

Question_Title: What is the wattage of a heating element drawing a current  of 30 amperes, at 120 volts?
The insulation of electric generators during short idle periods should be __________.
Answer_1: allowed to cool slowly to ambient temperatures
Answer_2: flashed with direct current to remove any residual magnetism
Answer_3: kept warm by using strip or space heaters
Answer_4: relieved of all capacitive charge by grounding the  conductors

Question_Title: A four pole, 60 Hz, three-phase synchronous motor comes up  to 1760 RPM when started as an induction motor.  What is the percent slip after the rotor field is energized?
In preparing to take insulation resistance readings on a main generator, the windings should be grounded for about 15 minutes prior to the test to __________.
Answer_1: allow accurate zeroing of the meter
Answer_2: help the windings to cool to ambient temperature
Answer_3: release any residual capacitive charge from the windings
Answer_4: help the windings to cool to the same temperature as the ground test connection

Question_Title: The removal of paint from electrical equipment, such as generators, should be cautiously undertaken because __________.
Answer_1: the mechanical shock of paint removal lessens the dielectric strength of the insulation
Answer_2: the paint dust is composed of abrasive and semi-conducting  materials which impair insulation
Answer_3: paint dust buildup has a tendency to cause corrosion
Answer_4: phase windings frequently become isolated from each other due to dust interference at the terminals

Question_Title: What will be the frequency of a three-phase, six pole, AC generator operating at 1800 revolutions per minute?
An alternator will fail to produce line voltage as a result of __________.
A lamp is provided with 110 volts and draws a current of 0.8 amps.  What is the resistance of the lamp?
If a circuit has resistances of 5, 10, and 20 ohms connected in parallel, what is the combined resistance of the circuit?
What power is consumed by a heating element using a current of 20 amperes at 120 volts?
If an AC generator experiences voltage failure, the cause may be __________.
Answer_1: an open in the field circuit
Answer_2: the brushes shifting out of the neutral plane

Question_Title: How many volts are necessary to provide a current of 10 amperes to a motor with an in-line resistance of 11 ohms?

A wire is being used as a replacement having twice the length and one-half the cross-sectional area of the original wire.  The resistance of this new wire, when compared to that of the original wire, is __________.
Answer_3: the same as the original resistance

Question_Title: Chattering of the collector ring brushes on a generator may be remedied by __________.
When the current flow in a power transmission line is halved, the power loss __________.
An alternator operating in parallel begins to vibrate severely and eventually trips out on the reverse power relay.  The cause of the vibration was a result of  __________.
Answer_1: the dropping of load by that alternator
Answer_3: the alternator was operating out of synchronism
Answer_4: flashover at the alternator collector rings

Question_Title: An AC circuit has a capacitive reactance of 30 ohms in addition to an inductive reactance of 40 ohms connected in series.  What is the reactance of the circuit?
Severe vibration, accompanied by flashover at the collector rings of an alternator operating in parallel, is a symptom  of __________.
A common-emitter circuit has an input voltage of 0.1 volt,  an output voltage of 2.0 volts, an input current of 0.5 milliamps, and an output current of 10 milliamps.  What is  the power gain?
An open occurring within the field rheostat of an AC generator can be detected by short circuiting its terminals and observing a __________.
Answer_1: negative deflection of the wattmeter pointer
Answer_2: positive deflection of the wattmeter pointer

Question_Title: A four pole turbogenerator is used in conjunction with a 160 pole propulsion motor.  If the generator is turning at  3,200 RPM, what is the current speed of the propeller?
If three AC generators are operating in parallel, and one of them were to "pull out" of synchronism with the other two generators, the __________.
Answer_1: normally operating AC generators will vibrate severely
Answer_2: AC generator pulling out of synchronism will vibrate severely
Answer_3: normally operating AC generators will overspeed and unload
Answer_4: AC generator pulling out of synchronism will become motorized

Question_Title: If the excitation of an alternator operating in parallel is decreased below normal, its __________.
Answer_1: power factor will change in the lagging direction
Answer_2: power factor will change in the leading direction
Answer_3: ampere load will be greatly increased
Answer_4: kilowatt load will be greatly decreased

Question_Title: Motorization of an alternator is undesirable because __________.
Answer_2: it puts an additional load on the bus
Answer_3: high voltage pulses are induced in the bus

Question_Title: Which of the following problems will occur if the circuit breaker of the incoming alternator is closed and it is 180 out of phase with the loaded alternator when paralleling?
Answer_1: The rotor of the loaded alternator will hunt.
Answer_2: Severe cross currents will occur which could cause damage.
Answer_3: The rotor of the incoming alternator will stop.
Answer_4: Both alternators will parallel 180 out of phase.

Question_Title: Voltage failure of an AC generator may be caused by __________.
Answer_3: high mica segments on the stator bus bar

Question_Title: A loss of field excitation to an AC generator while operating in parallel will cause it to __________.
Answer_1: absorb more and more load due to decreased armature reaction
Answer_2: lose its load due to the inherent speed droop built into the governor
Answer_3: smoke and overload due to field flashover as residual field flux changes polarity
Answer_4: lose its load, begin to motorize, trip out on reverse power relay, and possibly overspeed

Question_Title: An AC generator operating in parallel loses its excitation without tripping the circuit breaker.  This will __________.
Answer_1: not affect the faulty generator due to the compensation of  the other generators
Answer_2: cause the slip rings to melt
Answer_3: cause a low voltage differential to develop between the armature and the bus
Answer_4: cause high currents to be induced in the field windings

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the operation of two alternators in parallel?
Answer_1: The cycles per second of each alternator are the same.
Answer_2: Both alternator governors must be set with the same amount  of speed droop.
Answer_3: The number of field poles must be the same on each  alternator.
Answer_4: The load must always be divided equally between alternators.

Question_Title: An alternator switchboard has a synchroscope and synchronizing lamps.  If the synchroscope is broken, which  of the steps listed is the most essential before an alternator can be paralleled with the bus?
Answer_1: The breaker should be closed when one synchronizing lamp is dark and the other is bright.
Answer_2: The breaker should be closed when both synchronizing lamps  are bright.
Answer_3: The frequency meter should be used to determine that the incoming alternator frequency is slightly higher than the bus.
Answer_4: A portable phase sequence indicator must be used to verify  the information from the lamps.

Question_Title: Hysteresis in a direct current generator is indicated by __________.
Etched or burned bands on the contact faces of the brushes  in a direct current generator can be caused by __________.
If only one brush on a commutator is sparking excessively,  you should look for __________.
Sparking at the brushes of a DC propulsion motor can be the result of __________.
When using a megohmmeter to determine which shunt field coil is grounded in a DC machine, you must __________.
Answer_1: insulate the field frame from the ship's hull
Answer_2: disconnect each shunt field coil before testing
Answer_3: use a motor driven high capacity megohmmeter
Answer_4: remove all main line lead connections before testing

Question_Title: The most practical method used for resurfacing a ship's service motor commutator is to __________.
Answer_1: turn it down in the ship's lathe

Question_Title: An open shunt field in a direct current machine may be located by connecting the field circuit to an external power source, equal to the rated field voltage or less, and tested with a voltmeter from __________.
Answer_1: one line terminal to each coil lead in succession
Answer_2: one field coil to each adjacent field coil in turn
Answer_3: any suitable ground to any available line lead
Answer_4: any field pole to each field coil lead

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the effects of  ambient temperature on local action within lead-acid storage batteries?
Answer_1: Increasing ambient temperature increases local action.
Answer_2: Increasing ambient temperature decreases local action.
Answer_3: Ambient temperature has no effect on local action.
Answer_4: At 90F all local action virtually ceases.

Question_Title: Diesel generators #1 and #2 are operating in parallel at near full load capacity.  Diesel generator #1 suddenly trips out mechanically due to low lube oil pressure.  The reverse power relay functions properly and trips generator #1 electrically off the board.  Which of the following actions should you carry out FIRST?
Answer_2: Ascertain cause of the low lube oil pressure.
Answer_3: Strip the board of all nonvital circuits.
Answer_4: Secure alarms, reset reverse power relay, and restart #1 engine.

Question_Title: In a 60 Hz AC system, the current will pass through one complete cycle in __________.
Three factors responsible for the change in voltage as load is applied to an AC generator are: 1) the drop in resistance in the armature circuit, 2) the change in flux, and 3) the  __________.
The division of the reactive KVA load between paralleled AC generators is initiated by the __________.
Which of the following losses is/are present in every direct current generator armature?
Upon failure of the normal power supply, the emergency generator is placed on the line by the __________.
The most common type of AC service generator found aboard ship is the stationary __________.
The load sharing characteristics of two diesel alternators  operating in parallel are directly related to the setting of their governors' __________.
Which of the following statements about a three-phase wye connection is correct?
Answer_1: The line current is 1.73 times the phase current.
Answer_2: The phase current is 1.73 times the line current.
Answer_3: The line voltage is 1.73 times the phase voltage.
Answer_4: The phase voltage is 1.73 times the line voltage.

Question_Title: Proper storage battery maintenance includes __________.
Answer_1: maintaining a high charging rate at all times
Answer_2: replacing the electrolyte once a year
Answer_3: insuring electrolyte level is below the separator plates
Answer_4: applying petroleum jelly to connections to minimize corrosion

Question_Title: Ambient temperature is the __________.
Answer_2: amount of temperature developed by an operating motor
Answer_3: normal operating temperature, less the room temperature

Question_Title: Which of the spaces listed is defined as a 'location requiring an exceptional degree of protection' when considering the installation of shipboard electrical equipment?
The source of emergency lighting and power at loss of normal ship's power on a cargo vessel should be obtained from the  __________.
Answer_1: emergency generator supply to the emergency switchboard
Answer_2: emergency generator supply to the main switchboard
Answer_3: battery supply to the main switchboard
Answer_4: turbogenerator supply to the emergency switchboard

Question_Title: The emergency electrical power source on tank vessels over  500 GT on an international voyage, should be capable of continuous operation under emergency load for __________.
Which of the following statements represents the FIRST precaution to be taken prior to working on any installed electrical component?
Answer_3: Ground the case of the machine before beginning any repairs.
Answer_4: Open the supply circuits and tag the switches.

Question_Title: Which of the listed safety features should be provided in small rooms or lockers where batteries are stored?
Answer_1: Installation of a fixed CO2 system.
Answer_2: An exhaust duct is to be provided and led from within three inches of the deck.
Answer_3: Power ventilation is to be provided if trickle charging is  utilized.
Answer_4: An exhaust duct is to be provided and led from the top of the locker to the open air.

Question_Title: The shipboard general alarm system must receive its main source of power from __________.
All electric cables passing through watertight bulkheads must be __________.
Answer_2: grounded on both sides of the bulkhead
Answer_3: fitted with unions on each side of the bulkhead
Answer_4: welded on both sides of the bulkhead

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning electrical cables is correct?
Answer_1: Where they pass through watertight bulkheads, they should be fitted with watertight stuffing boxes.
Answer_2: Electric cable coverings should never be grounded.
Answer_3: Electrical cables must be rigidly held in place by welding  of armored cable, or glued in place where nonmetallic insulation is used.

Question_Title: From the standpoint of safety, you should never allow salt  water to enter a lead-acid storage battery or come in contact with sulfuric acid because __________.
Answer_1: the resulting gas is extremely flammable
Answer_2: the resulting gas is a respiratory irritant that can be fatal
Answer_3: the primary constituent, sodium, reacts lethally with lead  peroxide
Answer_4: combining salt water with lead-acid creates an invisible gas resulting in severe corrosion

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be taken when a blown fuse, rated at 10 amperes, is replaced?
Answer_1: Short out the fuse before removing it from the circuit.
Answer_2: Use needle-nose pliers to remove fuse from the circuit.
Answer_3: Replace blown fuse with one of equal voltage and ampere capacity.
Answer_4: Fuses of 10 ampere rating and less are virtually harmless when energized and may be handled freely.

Question_Title: Before any work on electrical or electronic equipment is performed, which of the following precautions should be carried out?
Answer_3: Secure and tag the supply circuit breaker in the open position.
Answer_4: Station a man at the circuit supply switch.

Question_Title: When maintenance personnel are working on electrical equipment, all supply switches should be secured in the open position and tagged specifically by the __________.
When changing fuses, you should always __________.
If overloading a DC machine becomes necessary in an emergency, you should __________.
Answer_1: cool the machine with portable blowers and fans
Answer_2: hold thermal overload relays open with blocks of wood
Answer_3: inject small amounts of CO2 into the windings for cooling
Answer_4: increase the residual magnetism value of windings to reduce eddy currents

Question_Title: According to 46 CFR, which of the following statements is true regarding  electric receptacle outlets?
Answer_1: There must be a sufficient number of receptacle outlets in the crew accommodations for an adequate level of habitability.
Answer_2: Each receptacle outelt must be compatible with the voltage and current of the circuit in which it is installed.
Answer_3: A receptacle outlet must not have any exposed live parts with the plug opening uncovered.

Question_Title: Electrical wire in general, when used aboard vessels must meet minimum requirements.  Which of the following statements is/are correct?
Answer_1: Each wire must be 14 AWG or larger, regardless of locations and use.
Answer_3: The only wire that does not have to be in a suitable enclosure or cover is the ground wire used with portable tools and lights.

Question_Title: Which of the following is/are true concerning electric power operated watertight door systems?
Answer_1: Each motor driven door must use the main bus as its source  of power.
Answer_2: Each distribution panel for the system must be on the lowest level where berthing quarters are located.
Answer_3: Distribution panels must not be provided with a means of locking in order to permit quick activation of the system.
Answer_4: Each system must have a separate branch circuit.

Question_Title: Unless it can be shown that a 45C ambient temperature will not be exceeded, motors within a machinery space must be designed for an ambient temperature of __________.
Which of the following statements is/are true regarding requirements for receptacle outlets aboard vessels?

Question_Title: Which of the following safeguards can be built into the control circuit of a remotely operated fire pump to ensure  that the pump is not started with the suction valve closed?
Answer_1: The fire pump starting circuit is completed by a limit switch when the suction valve opens.
Answer_2: A normally closed contact opens in the suction valve starter circuit, and the pump starts immediately upon the pushing of the pump start button.
Answer_3: A normally open contact closes in the fire pump suction valve starter circuit, and the pump starts immediately upon the pushing of the pump start button.
Answer_4: A time delay relay is de-energized when the 'ON' button is  pushed, and the pump starts after a predetermined time delay.

Question_Title: The deck plating on a MODU is supported primarily by deck longitudinals and deck __________.
How long must the records of tests and inspections of fire  fighting equipment for a MODU be retained on board?
Answer_4: Until the next inspection for certification

Question_Title: A reciprocating air compressor is running roughly and vibrating excessively, indicating that the __________.
Increasing the moisture content of conditioned air is known as __________.
The master or person in charge of a MODU is required to log __________.
Answer_1: the date and hour of each fire drill
Answer_2: the names of all persons on board
Answer_3: only casualties which occur while underway

Question_Title: In a radial piston pump, reversal and control of fluid flow are accomplished by moving the __________.
What must be entered in the unofficial logbook by the master or person in charge of a mobile offshore drilling unit after conducting a fire drill?
Answer_1: The condition of all fire fighting equipment, watertight door mechanisms, and valves used during each drill.
Answer_2: The location of the unit at the time each drill is  conducted.
Answer_3: The name of each crew member who participated in the drill  and their responsibilities.

Question_Title: After conducting a boat drill, the master or person in charge of MODU shall log __________.
Answer_1: the names of crew members who participated in the drill
Answer_2: the length of time that each motor propelled lifeboat was operated in the drill
Answer_3: the length of time the lifeboat was in the water
Answer_4: the time it took to lower the boat

Question_Title: The deck loads on a MODU are distributed through the deck beams to the __________.
One cause of leaky valves in a low pressure air compressor  may be attributed to __________.
Answer_1: running with an air filter element different from that required by the original manufacturer's specifications
Answer_2: excessive operating hours without carrying out preventive maintenance

Question_Title: To maintain design discharge pressure from a centrifugal pump, the design clearance must be maintained between the __________.
Which of the following statements represents the difference between a four-jaw independent chuck and a three-jaw universal chuck?
Answer_1: The jaws on the three-jaw chuck can be individually adjusted.
Answer_2: The jaws on the four-jaw chuck can be individually adjusted.
Answer_3: The three-jaw chuck will hold square, round, and irregular  shapes in either a concentric or an eccentric position.
Answer_4: Since the three-jaw universal chuck is automatically self-centering, it is always more accurate than the four-jaw independent chuck.

Question_Title: Enlarging one tube end so the end of another tube of the same size will fit inside is termed __________.
Stern tube and strut bearings lined with hardwood or rubber composition materials are lubricated with __________.
The purpose of annealing any metal is to make the metal __________.
When the longitudinal strength members of a MODU are continuous and closely spaced, the vessel is __________.
Lifeboat winches on a MODU are required to be inspected and an entry made in the logbook.  What should this entry include?
Answer_1: The time required to lower a lifeboat.
Answer_2: The time required to raise a lifeboat.
Answer_3: The date of inspection and condition of the winch.

Question_Title: A fluctuating and unsteady vacuum in an evaporator may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: wet steam entering the air ejector nozzle
Answer_2: pinhole leaks in the evaporator tube nests
Answer_3: rapid scaling on the evaporator tube nests
Answer_4: high water levels in the last effect

Question_Title: If a radial piston hydraulic pump fails to deliver rated fluid volume, the cause can be __________.
Pipe threads are cut with a taper to __________.
When the tilting box of a variable stroke axial-piston pump is perpendicular to the pump shaft, which of the following  conditions will exist?
Which of the refrigerants listed is considered safe and ideal for most marine applications?
Which of the following statements is used to describe the term 'base' in reference to greases?
Answer_1: Texture of the grease under load.
Answer_2: Temperature at which the grease softens or melts.
Answer_3: Type of soap used in its production.
Answer_4: Temperature below which the grease will be ineffective as a lubricant.

Question_Title: Closed impellers differ from open impellers in that closed  impellers __________.
Answer_1: allow liquid to enter the eye from one direction only
Answer_2: have side walls which extend from the eye to the outer edge of the vane tips
Answer_4: are not vented above the impeller eye

Question_Title: The floating end of a shell-and-tube type cooler utilizes a packing ring to __________.
Answer_1: prevent leakage past the floating end tube sheet
Answer_3: baffle cooling water so it can be directed on a multiple pass
Answer_4: modify to a mixer type cooler

Question_Title: A MODU having continuous closely spaced transverse strength members is __________.
With respect to centrifugal pump design, which of the following descriptions best represents a pump utilizing two impellers?
Which of the listed pipe sizes is not commonly used?
When using a sling psychrometer to determine relative humidity, the indicated difference between the dry bulb and the wet bulb reading is the __________.
The static positive suction head of a pump is the __________.
Answer_1: distance of the suction liquid level above the center line  of the pump
Answer_2: distance the suction liquid level is below the center line  of the pump
Answer_3: force necessary to overcome frictional losses in the pump and piping
Answer_4: amount in inches of mercury the total suction head is below atmospheric pressure

Question_Title: A grease lubricated ball bearing or roller bearing will run cooler if the grease __________.
Answer_1: fills only 10% of all void spaces within the bearing
Answer_2: has a high grease penetration number (is hard)
Answer_3: is thinned with a suitable lubricating oil
Answer_4: is heated prior to packing the bearing

Question_Title: The ash content of a fuel oil is significant to the operating engineer because it __________.
Answer_1: is an indication of the amount of noncombustible material present in the oil
Answer_2: indicates the quantity of energy released by burning a unit amount of the fuel
Answer_3: is useful for determining proper atomization temperatures
Answer_4: reflects the overall thermal efficiency of the fuel oil service system

Question_Title: What is the diameter of a cylinder whose cross-sectional area is 706.86 square inches?
On a MODU, the deck stringer is the outboard most deck __________.
Which pipe listed has the largest outside diameter?
Answer_1: A 3/4" pipe with a standard wall thickness.
Answer_2: A 3/4" pipe with an extra strong wall thickness.
Answer_3: A 3/4" pipe with a double extra strong wall thickness.
Answer_4: All have the same outside diameter.

Question_Title: The sum of the sensible heat and the latent heat of any substance is known as __________.
Expansion of the tube bundle in a shell-and-tube type cooler may be provided for by the __________.
The pressure produced within the oil wedge of a rotating journal is __________.
Answer_1: the same as the pressure in the lubricating system
Answer_2: less than the pressure in the lubricating system
Answer_3: greater than the pressure in the lubricating system
Answer_4: highest at the oil groove location

Question_Title: Which combination of the main shaft segments listed below,  that are located furthest from the main engine, are connected by the inboard stern tube shaft coupling?
Compared to internal structural plating, the exterior hull  plating on a MODU is usually __________.
The gasket and the broken studs have been replaced on a tank manhole cover.  Which of the following methods is satisfactory for testing the repair?
Answer_1: Pressurize the tank with 10 psig air, soap the repaired area, watch for visible signs of leakage or bubbles.
Answer_2: Fill the tank with water via the ballast pump until the innage reading corresponds to the maximum depth of the tank.
Answer_3: Hose test the repaired area with a minimum of 100 psig water pressure.
Answer_4: Fill the tank via the ballast pump until water flows from the vent line opening on deck.

Question_Title: Piping cross-sections over 12 inches in diameter are sized  by the __________.
The static suction lift of a pump is the difference in elevation between the __________.
Answer_1: centerline of the pump and the level of the liquid in the suction well when the source of liquid is below the pump
Answer_2: centerline of the pump and the suction liquid level when the source of liquid is above the pump
Answer_3: centerline of the pump and the level of the discharge liquid
Answer_4: liquid levels of the suction and discharge

Question_Title: The heat identified by only a change in temperature is known as __________.
The usual number of single-acting pistons used in a variable stroke axial-piston pump is __________.
Piping cross-sections ranging from 1/8 inch to 12 inches in diameter, are sized by __________.
An axial piston pump differs from a radial piston pump as the pistons of an axial piston pump are positioned  __________.
Answer_2: parallel to each other and to the shaft
Answer_3: parallel to each other but at a right angle to the shaft
Answer_4: at an angle to each other and to the shaft

Question_Title: In reference to air conditioning, when air attains the maximum amount of moisture it can hold at a specific temperature, it is said to be __________.
Positive displacement, helical gear pumps are well suited for pumping oil because __________.
Answer_1: stuffing boxes eliminate the leakage problems usually associated with other gear pumps
Answer_2: it is not necessary to closely maintain design clearances with this pump
Answer_3: they are essentially self-priming and produce a high suction lift
Answer_4: these pumps are designed with extreme tooth angles

Question_Title: The conical steel or composition cone installed on a propeller, known as a fairwater cone, provides which of the following benefits?
The exposed portion of the outboard propeller shaft is protected against seawater corrosion by __________.
Answer_2: a covering of plastic, rubber, or shrunk-on composition sleeve
Answer_4: a layer of oxidation formed when the metal of the shaft is  exposed to seawater

Question_Title: Why are removable sleeves installed on centrifugal pump shafts?
Answer_1: They make it easier to replace the pump shaft packing.
Answer_2: They can be economically replaced as they wear out.
Answer_3: They can be removed when it is necessary to lighten the weight of the pump.
Answer_4: They increase the strength of the shaft.

Question_Title: If a reciprocating air compressor has a knock occurring in  frequency with its operating RPM, the cause is probably __________.
Piping is sized by its nominal __________.
Answer_1: inside diameter regardless of other parameters
Answer_2: outside diameter regardless of other parameters
Answer_3: inside diameter from 1/8 inch to 12 inches, and over 12 inches by its outside diameter
Answer_4: inside diameter from 1/8 inch to 24 inches, and over 24 inches by its outside diameter

Question_Title: A good quality oil used in main propulsion engine lubrication systems should be __________.
When air at a given temperature, contains the maximum amount of moisture for that temperature, the air is said to be __________.
Which of the listed types of pumps is NOT likely to be installed in a main drainage or evacuation system?
In a compression type grease cup, the lubricant is forced into the bearing by __________.
The term referring to the number of teeth per inch on a hacksaw blade is known as the __________.
Which of the following statements represents the advantage  of rotary pumps as compared to reciprocating pumps?
Answer_1: The high discharge pressure of the rotary pumps permits a larger volume of fluid per unit time than the reciprocating pump.
Answer_2: Rotary pumps are capable of pumping more fluid than reciprocating pumps of the same weight.
Answer_3: Rotary pumps occupy only one-half the space of reciprocating pumps.
Answer_4: Rotary pumps eliminate discharge slippage of the pumped liquid, while this does not hold true for a reciprocating pump.

Question_Title: Which of the following factors will have the greatest effect on the heating load within a conditioned space?
Which of the following terms represents the form of heat removed from the refrigerant in the condenser of a  refrigeration system?
Which of the devices listed should be used to reshape a grinding wheel?
Water leaking through the stern tube stuffing box is used to accomplish which of the following actions?
Water hammer in a steam heating system can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: filling the auxiliary boiler with cold water
Answer_2: steam admitted to a cold pipe
Answer_3: filling the auxiliary boiler with hot water
Answer_4: draining a soot blower line before cracking the steam supply valve

Question_Title: Main propulsion engine lube oil sumps should be constructed __________.
Answer_1: so as to never be integral with the main engine foundation
Answer_4: with drain/return lines terminating just above or at the designed normal level

Question_Title: A major controlling factor in the location of the condensate return piping from a heating system is/are __________.
Answer_1: the requirement for a gravity return
Answer_2: the requirement for short laterals run
Answer_3: the requirement to minimize conflict with headroom and other services

Question_Title: If the existing vapor pressure is subtracted from the indicated pressure at the pump suction, the remainder is the __________.
A first stage unloader installed in a low pressure air compressor is unable to completely retract. This will result in __________.
Answer_2: loss of moisture in the air charge in the receiver
Answer_3: frequent lifting of the intercooler relief valve

Question_Title: The heat removed from the refrigerant in the condenser of a refrigeration plant is the __________.
When conducting a hydrostatic test on the distillate cooler shell of a flash type evaporator, liquid appears well inside one of the tubes.  In order to correct this, you should __________.
Answer_4: all of the above would be considered satisfactory as a temporary repair until permanent repairs may be conducted

Question_Title: Excessive leakage and premature failure of valve packing is a result of __________.
Answer_2: jamming a valve in the closed position
Answer_3: low pressure fluid flow through the pipeline

Question_Title: Which of the following problems may be encountered by using an oil having a viscosity higher than that specified for an operating hydraulic system?
Water leaking from a pump packing gland is kept away from the bearing housing by the use of __________.
An inadequate reciprocating bilge pump discharge is most often caused by __________.
Which of the listed problems could produce a high absolute  pressure within a flash type evaporator?
Answer_3: a leak in the first stage demister
Answer_4: a cracked distillate pump vent line

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions should be used to support the need to change the lube oil when there has been an increase in the neutralization number?
Answer_1: A decrease in the viscosity of the oil
Answer_2: An increase in the viscosity of the oil
Answer_3: A change in the cloud point
Answer_4: A change in the floc point

Question_Title: The dew point of air is reached when the wet bulb temperature is __________.
Answer_4: equal to the dry bulb temperature

Question_Title: The purpose of bilge keels is to __________.
Answer_1: lower the center of gravity of the ship

Question_Title: A casing drain is provided for axial piston and bent axis variable stroke pumps to __________.
Answer_1: vent off any accumulated air from the system
Answer_2: drain off any accumulated water from the pump casing prior  to its being started
Answer_3: assist the complete removal of hydraulic oil from the system prior to opening for major or minor repairs
Answer_4: prevent damage due to agitation and overheating of oil accumulated in the casing as a result of minor internal leakage

Question_Title: Before the longitudinal carriage feed of a lathe is engaged, you must be certain the __________.
Increasing the speed of a rotary pump above its rated speed will result in which of the following conditions to occur?
The function of lubricating oil is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain even distribution of bearing wear
Answer_3: maintain a pressurized fluid film between moving surfaces

Question_Title: The tendency for lubricating oil to thin out at high temperatures and thicken at low temperatures will be characterized by a __________.
After packing is added to the stern tube stuffing box, which of the following procedures should be observed to insure even tightening of the gland?
Answer_1: Listen for a smooth, regular sound.
Answer_2: Measure the distance between the gland and the stuffing box with a rule.
Answer_3: Judge by feeling the gland for an increase in heat as it is being tightened up.
Answer_4: Open the drain connection to allow seawater to flow in and make the distance even.

Question_Title: The temperature at which water vapor in the atmosphere begins to condense is called the __________.
One function of the air receiver in a compressed air system is to __________.
Answer_1: dry the air discharged from the intercooler
Answer_3: receive exhaust air from pneumatic accessories
Answer_4: remove all traces of oil from the air

Question_Title: If a drill press is used to completely bore through a metal plate, feed pressure on the drill bit should be eased as the bit breaks through the bottom of the hole to prevent __________.
Answer_1: the drill bit from jamming and spinning the workpiece

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the purpose of  the split inflatable seal installed aft of the primary seal assembly for the propeller shaft?
Answer_1: To serve as a seal when adding packing to the stuffing box.
Answer_2: To allow repair or replacement of the primary seal elements when the ship is waterborne.
Answer_3: To eliminate leakage via the propeller shaft when the shaft is not rotating.
Answer_4: To provide a ready means for the entry of cooling water.

Question_Title: Why should a person performing maintenance on an air compressor wire and tag the system valves closed?
Answer_3: To protect the operator performing the maintenance.
Answer_4: Each of the above is correct.

Question_Title: With regard to the opening and closing of watertight appliances not fitted with a remote operating control or alarm system, which of the following is the master or person in charge of a MODU required to enter in the logbook?
Answer_1: The time required to close the appliances.
Answer_2: The reason for opening or closing each appliance.
Answer_3: The name of the person performing the opening and closing of such appliances.
Answer_4: The fact that the hull indicators functioned or not.

Question_Title: One of the main differences between the various types of screw pumps is in the __________.
Answer_2: direction of rotation of the screws

Question_Title: The FIRST thing to do to ensure that a refrigeration unit will not start while undergoing repairs, is to __________.
Answer_1: secure and tag the electrical circuit
Answer_2: place a crow bar in the flywheel of the unit
Answer_3: inform all persons in the area not to start the unit

Question_Title: Propeller pumps are used primarily where there is a need to move a large volume of liquid.  However, their use is limited by a maximum total head of __________.
Which of the components listed is used to connect several sections of line shafting?
Answer_2: Bolts fitted through flange type couplings forged integral  with the shaft sections.

Question_Title: At which of the following locations would a duplex pressure gage most likely be located?
Answer_1: Fuel oil service pump discharge flange

Question_Title: Why is the discharge pressure of a herringbone gear pump steadier than the discharge pressure of a simple spur gear  pump?
Answer_1: Clearance between the gear teeth and casing is smaller.
Answer_2: The gear teeth are smaller than those of the simple spur gear pump.
Answer_3: One discharge phase begins before the previous discharge phase has been completed.
Answer_4: The herringbone gear pump has four spur gears instead of two.

Question_Title: Which of the following actions, pertaining to saltwater lubricated stern tube stuffing boxes, is usually observed when the ship is expected to be in port for an extended period?
Answer_1: The stuffing box is continually flushed.
Answer_2: The drain connection is left opened.
Answer_3: The stuffing box gland is tightened.
Answer_4: The packing is adjusted for greater cooling or replaced.

Question_Title: A bourdon tube-type steam pressure gage is fitted with a siphon loop to prevent damage from __________.
In a refrigeration system, the refrigerant absorbs the latent heat of vaporization in the __________.
Oil emulsification in engine lubricating oils will tend to  __________.
Answer_1: decrease sludge formation in lubricating oil
Answer_2: cause water to separate from the oil
Answer_4: displace lubricating oil required in areas of friction

Question_Title: The conical steel or composition cone installed on a propeller, known as a fairwater cone, provides which of the following benefits?
An aligning punch is used to __________.
Answer_1: line up corresponding holes in adjacent parts
Answer_3: mark centers and lines in layout work
Answer_4: make a starting mark for a drill

Question_Title: Which of the gasket materials and/or types listed is typically used on high pressure steam flange joints?
The taper produced by a lathe taper attachment is determined by setting the __________.
The only means of removing the latent heat of condensation  from a refrigerant in the normal refrigeration cycle is by  __________.
Answer_1: passing it through the expansion valve
Answer_2: condensing refrigerant in the system condenser
Answer_3: passing the gaseous  refrigerant through the heat interchanger on the suction side of the compressor
Answer_4: maintaining a high pressure on the system's receiver

Question_Title: One characteristic of a lubricating oil adversely affecting the results of centrifuging is __________.
Which of the listed devices is used to control the admission of steam to the steam cylinder of a reciprocating pump?
Which of the devices listed prevents water from entering a  ship's hull via the propulsion shaft?
Answer_1: Stern tube packing or mechanical shaft seal

Question_Title: With reference to a vessel's structural integrity, the most significant characteristic of a cryogenic liquid is its __________.
Answer_2: highly corrosive action on mild steel
Answer_3: vapor cloud which reacts violently with saltwater

Question_Title: A boiler forced draft pressure gage indicates 6 inches of water.  This corresponds to a pressure of __________.
To obtain a 1/2 inch per foot taper on an 18 inch workpiece, the tailstock of the lathe must be setover __________.
The heat required to change a substance from a solid to a liquid while at its freezing temperature, is known as the latent heat of __________.
A wrench that completely surrounds a nut, or bolt head is a/an __________.
Which of the following problems occurring in a hydraulic system can be caused by the use of an oil having a viscosity lower than specified?
The degree to which the viscosity of an oil will change with a change in temperature is indicated by the __________.
Which of the listed reciprocating pump parts control the position of the pilot slide valve?
Answer_4: Movement of the main piston through the steam cylinder

Question_Title: Which of the processes listed consumes the greatest amount  of power while producing the greatest amount of heat?
Which of the following guidelines is considered to reflect  good design practices of shipboard steam heating systems?
Answer_1: Provide constant steam service for equipment operating throughout the year.
Answer_2: Provide either a common or individual reducing station for  each group of units requiring the same operating pressure.
Answer_3: Run all piping so it may be drained by gravity.

Question_Title: The heat required to change a substance from a liquid to a  gas without experiencing a temperature change, is defined as the latent heat of __________.
The average density of brine discharged from the last stage of an evaporator should not exceed  __________.
A distinguishing feature of an eductor, when compared to other pumps, is the __________.
Answer_1: discharge end being smaller than the suction end
Answer_4: ease at which the wearing rings may be changed

Question_Title: When securing a flash-type evaporator for an extended period of time, you should __________.
Answer_2: fill the unit with descaling compound
Answer_4: tightly seal the unit to exclude air

Question_Title: The portion of a hydraulic hose that determines its overall strength, is the __________.
Which features of a centrifugal pump reduce the need for renewing worn impellers and pump casings?
Answer_1: Close radial clearance between impeller hub and casing
Answer_4: Replaceable impeller and casing wearing rings

Question_Title: A centrifugal pump may fail to deliver water when first started if the __________.
A weight of 1,000 kips is equivalent to __________.
Which of the devices listed is common to all types of pumps?
Answer_1: A power end and fluid end

Question_Title: Heat which brings about a change in the physical state of a substance without a change in temperature, is called __________.
The hulls of most modern towing vessels constructed today are fabricated from __________.
A roller bearing should normally be filled to what fraction of its space cavity?
Which of the listed parts is used in a lobe-type rotary pump to allow for wear on the lobe edges?
A boiler forced draft pressure gage indicates 8 inches of water.  This corresponds to a pressure of __________.
The size of flexible hose used in a hydraulic system is indicated by __________.
Answer_1: the inside diameter of the tube
Answer_2: the numerical designation found on the 'skin' of the hose
Answer_3: a color code on the armor
Answer_4: the thickness of the tube wall

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump vibrates and is noisy when operating, the cause could be __________.
Which of the wrenches listed is least likely to slip off a  bolthead or nut?
Expansion tanks when used in a ships hot water heating system, may be of the open or closed type.  In a closed type system, what would be the normal temperature range of the water?
Latent heat can be defined as the heat which must be added  to a substance in order to change it from a __________.
The designation 'schedule 80 extra strong ' refers to __________.
Tapping threads into a blind hole should be finished by using a __________.
Distilled water from an evaporator may be discharged into a potable water tank __________.
Answer_2: after passing through an activated charcoal filter
Answer_3: after chemical analysis shows it is fit for consumption
Answer_4: through a solenoid operated three-way valve

Question_Title: The factors that determine the service life of packing in a pump will include which of the following conditions?
If the capacity of a centrifugal pump decreases gradually over a long period of time, you should replace the  __________.
To absorb the wear resulting from impeller rotation and abrasives in the liquid, a centrifugal pump is usually fitted with __________.
Personnel working with refrigeration systems, and subject to the exposure of refgerants should wear __________.
The ability of a metal to be hammered, or rolled out is called its __________.
A pressure reading of 00.0 psig is theoretically equal to __________.
If the foundation bolts of a reciprocating air compressor are loose, which of the conditions below will occur?

Answer_2: unusual high demand on the system
Answer_3: increase capacity during times of peak demand
Answer_4: increase steam and water contact for better efficiency

Question_Title: Gate valves should not be used for throttling as __________.
Answer_1: the pressure drop will be excessive
Answer_3: the installation of an equalizing line will be necessary
Answer_4: wire drawing of the disc will result

Question_Title: To finish tapping a blind hole, it is best to use a __________.
The purpose of an air compressor unloading device is to __________.
Answer_1: drain water from the air receiver
Answer_3: delay the compression process until the motor is up to speed

Question_Title: The amount of moisture in a given sample of air, when compared with the amount of moisture the air could hold if  totally saturated at the existing temperature of the sample, is called __________.
Which of the copper alloys listed is commonly used in heat exchangers and possesses a high resistance to  corrosion?
Antifriction bearings can be removed undamaged from a shaft by using an arbor press, or wheel puller with a________.
Which of the following statements is correct relative to distillation plant operation?
Answer_1: Distillation is the process of boiling seawater to produce  vapor which is condensed into fresh water.
Answer_2: Evaporation is the second part of the distillation process  where brine is removed.
Answer_3: Brine is the result of condensed sea water vapor.
Answer_4: Distillate is the product resulting from the evaporation of fresh water vapor.

Question_Title: A leaking steam trap located in the return lines from a heating system is indicated by excessive __________.
If a centrifugal pump is driven by a constant speed electric motor and produces a discharge pressure less than  designed, the cause is probably __________.
At high pressures, an O-ring has a tendency to extrude into the clearance space between the mating parts of a hydraulic actuator.  Which of the listed components is used to prevent extrusion?
The ratio of the weight of moisture contained in a given volume of air, to the weight of moisture that the same sample would hold if saturated, is called the __________.
Which of the listed chemicals can be routinely used to maintain the hygienic quality of potable water?
Which of the following statements concerning antifriction bearings installed on pumps is true?
Answer_1: The inner race should be free to turn on the shaft.
Answer_2: The outer race should be free to turn its housing.
Answer_3: Alignment is not a critical factor in their installation.
Answer_4: They are usually pressed on to their shafts.

Question_Title: The steam coils in a high pressure evaporator used for saltwater service should be descaled with __________.
The packing installed in the pump stuffing box is lubricated by __________.
If you were operating a centrifugal water service pump with worn wearing rings, the __________.
Which of the listed materials have been used to manufacture piping available in standard weight, extra strong, and double extra strong wall thickness?
A lathe dog, fitted with a headless set screw, is known as a __________.
The moisture sensitive element of a humidistat can be made of __________.
Which of the following statements is correct regarding an oil with a high viscosity index?
Answer_1: A large change of viscosity occurs with a minor change in temperature.
Answer_2: No change in viscosity occurs with any change in temperature.
Answer_3: Very little change in viscosity occurs with a significant change in temperature.
Answer_4: The viscosity of the oil increases with an increase in temperature.

Question_Title: An organic solid lubricant, such as graphite, is suitable as an oil additive when used in __________.
Answer_1: machinery bearings subjected to high temperatures
Answer_2: antifriction bearings on general service pumps

Question_Title: Ferrous metals are metals containing __________.
Which of the following clearance readings should be taken and recorded in drydock?
Answer_1: The clearances between the propeller blade tips and the hull.
Answer_2: The clearances between the propeller hub and the fair water cone.
Answer_4: The clearances between the stern tube packing gland and the retaining ring.

Question_Title: Brine density in a distilling plant is measured with a/an __________.

For the various sizes of tubing and wall thickness used in a hydraulic system, the inside diameter can be determined if  it is remembered that the inside diameter equals the outside diameter less __________.
Which of the following statements is correct regarding grades of pipe?
Answer_1: Stainless steel pipe is manufactured in four general grades.
Answer_2: Brass pipe is manufactured in three common grades.
Answer_3: Copper pipe is manufactured in two common grades.
Answer_4: The term 'extra strong' is normally associated with schedule 160 steel pipe.

Question_Title: Which of the following definitions accurately describes 'tool feed' when referring to lathe work?
Answer_1: The distance the tool advances with each revolution of the  work.
Answer_2: The distance from the bottom of the cut to the uncut surface of the workpiece.
Answer_3: The distance the workpiece circumference moves past the cutting tool point in one minute.
Answer_4: The chip length that will be removed from the work in one minute.

Question_Title: When handling contaminated oil from a hermetically sealed refrigeration compressor unit that has burned out its motor, you should __________.
Answer_1: store the oil in a clean refrigerant drum
Answer_3: circulate the oil through a filter drier
Answer_4: remove the oil with a portable charging cylinder

Question_Title: The greatest difference between absorbent and adsorbent filters is that absorbent filters __________.
Answer_1: will remove additives from the lube oil
Answer_2: soak up liquid contaminants directly into the filter media
Answer_3: do not create pressure drops in the lube oil system
Answer_4: attract or have liquid contaminants stick to the surface of the filter media

Question_Title: The graphite in a bearing lubricant compound of graphite grease, acts as a __________.
Which of the following statements describes the function of an alarm annunciator on an engine room alarm panel?
Answer_1: An alarm condition causes a light and siren to come on which remain on until the machinery is secured.
Answer_2: An alarm condition causes a flashing light to illuminate indicating the malfunction, followed by an audible alarm.  When the alarm acknowledge button is depressed, the audible alarm is silenced and the light stops flashing but remains illuminated.
Answer_3: An alarm condition gives an audible and visual alarm signal, both of which are secured when the alarm acknowledge button is depressed.
Answer_4: An alarm condition causes a flashing light to come on, followed by an audible alarm.  When the alarm acknowledge button is depressed, the warning light is extinguished.

Question_Title: When replacing ball bearings on an electric motor shaft, you should __________.

Answer_2: apply even pressure to the outer race
Answer_3: apply even force to the inner race

Answer_2: Replace with larger cross-sectional turns of packing.

Question_Title: Why would a flash type distilling unit be more efficient when operated in cooler seawater temperatures?

Answer_3: A single-stage impeller with curved vanes.
Answer_4: A two-stage pump with an operating speed 100 RPM less than  specified.

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be observed concerning the introduction of a fire resistant fluid into a hydraulic system?

Answer_4: Only chemically active filters may be used.

Question_Title: The aft, starboard bilge-well can not be pumped out, and back flushing has not been successful.  The next practical  solution will be to carry out which of the following actions?

Question_Title: A vertical shaft having a rudder attached to its lower end  and having a yoke, quadrant, or tiller fitted to its upper  portion by which it may be turned, is the __________.

Question_Title: A temporary Certificate of Inspection, Form CG-854, may be  issued to a self propelled cargo vessel __________.

Answer_1: two or more impellers housed together in one casing and mounted on a single shaft
Answer_2: a single stepped impeller mounted in a progressively staged casing
Answer_3: a large radial clearance between the impeller and casing to prevent overheating due to friction
Answer_4: an increase in the discharge velocity of the liquid with a  corresponding decrease in pressure through the stages

Question_Title: The major difference between the discharge and suction valves installed in most low pressure, reciprocating air compressors is that __________.

Answer_2: the reed valves used on the discharge are made substantially thicker and heavier than the suction valves
Answer_3: the suction valve springs exert a greater tension than the  discharge valve springs
Answer_4: the discharge valve springs exert a greater tension than the suction valve springs

Question_Title: If you attempt to tighten a leaking hydraulic fitting with  pressure on the system, you will __________.
Answer_2: find that the pressure will prevent the components from being tightened
Answer_4: dislodge any scale in the tubing, and it will damage the system

Question_Title: The annual reinspection of a tank vessel, holding a two year Certificate of Inspection endorsed, 'Inspected and Approved for the Carriage of Flammable or Combustible Liquids of Grade A', must __________.
Answer_1: where possible, be made between the tenth and fourteenth month of the period for which the certificate is valid
Answer_2: be preceded by written application by the master, owner, or agent of the vessel
Answer_3: be undertaken only when all cargo tanks are empty, gas free, and made accessible for internal examination

Question_Title: Propeller pitch speed minus ship speed divided by the propeller pitch speed is termed __________.

Answer_2: provide a means of supplying sealing fluid for the impeller shaft stuffing box
Answer_3: enable the pump and its suction line to remain primed prior to starting the pump
Answer_4: afford the pumping system protection against water hammer and surging

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed, when used on an electro-hydraulic steering gear, keeps the movement of the  rudder closely in step with the steering wheel?

Answer_1: Reassemble the pump and provide more water leak off for lubrication.
Answer_2: Check for parallel alignment of the sleeve radial face to the sleeve bore.
Answer_3: Reassemble the pump and set the governor to obtain a slower speed.
Answer_4: Correct the cause of scoring and install a new shaft sleeve.

Question_Title: The designation '1/4-20' describes __________.
Answer_4: machine bolt size and threads per inch

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the path of air flow passing through a typical two stage, low pressure, reciprocating, air compressor?

Answer_2: L.P. cylinder, air cleaner, intercooler, and H.P. cylinder
Answer_3: Air cleaner, L.P. cylinder, H.P. cylinder, and intercooler
Answer_4: Air cleaner, L.P. cylinder, intercooler, and H.P. cylinder

Question_Title: A flare-type tubing connector is used in the hydraulic hatch-cover system and has developed a slight leak.  To stop the leak you should __________.

Answer_2: a means of unloading during start-up

Answer_4: a variable compression ratio enabling the output to be varied to suit any load condition

Answer_3: completely charge the accumulators to prevent system energy loss

Answer_3: Failure of the high pressure cutout

Answer_4: prevent any salinity in the distillate produced

Question_Title: If an air compressor is used to supply compressed air to outlets throughout the engine room and on deck of a vessel, the system is known as the __________.

Answer_2: oil contamination in the compressed air

Answer_3: pulsations in the air distribution system

Question_Title: Which of the listed valve types is typically used as inlet  and discharge valves on modern low pressure air compressors?

Answer_2: decreasing the absolute pressure of each stage

Answer_4: increasing the pressure at the spray pipe

Question_Title: Open end wrenches are __________.

Answer_2: relieving the intercooler pressure to the atmosphere

Answer_3: They have a greater tolerance for high speed applications.

Question_Title: With regards to fluid flow control, an advantage of pneumatic control systems over electrical control systems is __________.
Answer_1: practically no limit to the power available for a given system

Answer_1: tend to twist about its long axis

Answer_3: contract in length and expand in diameter
Answer_4: flex at right angles to the applied pressure

Answer_1: Both are higher than normal burning temperatures.

Answer_3: The ignition temperature is always higher.

Question_Title: The wrench size for a 3/4 inch American National bolt is __________.

Question_Title: Double cut files are most effective when used for __________.

Answer_3: blown fuse in the motor circuit

Question_Title: Clearances between the impeller hub and casing of a centrifugal pump are checked with the use of __________.

Answer_2: adjust the high pressure cutout to maintain the desired pressure

Question_Title: The names plug, bottom, and taper refer to __________.

Answer_3: by the thermal input to the system's fluid

Question_Title: Differential pressures can be measured with the use of a __________.

Answer_2: filled with grease to 95% of the total open spaces within the bearing

Question_Title: Which of the following definitions can be used to define the term 'offset' as a characteristic of controller action?

Question_Title: A salinity indicator is used to determine the __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following definitions best describes sensitivity as a characteristic of controller action?

Question_Title: If the relief valve on the discharge side of a hydraulic pump lifts, the cause could be __________.
