Answer_2: permits a resilient material to return to its almost original shape
Answer_3: allows a resiliant material to resist permanent deformation
Answer_4: is directly related to a material's elastic limit

Question_Title: In an automated control system, which of the following statements would apply to any type of closed loop system?
Answer_1: The manipulated variables are adjusted only from the input demand signals without monitoring the outlet  conditions or variables.
Answer_2: Another term commonly used in conjunction with this type of system is 'feed forward.'
Answer_3: The controlled variable must always deviate from its set point before any corrective action is initiated by the controller.
Answer_4: In order for a system to fall under the category of closed loop control, there should be no adjustments required to be made manually by the operator.

Question_Title: A knocking sound emitted from an unloaded air compressor is probably caused by __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning any evaporator?
Answer_1: High conductivity of the distillate indicates distillate salinity is excessive.
Answer_2: Increasing the absolute pressure of the shell will increase the distiller's capacity.
Answer_3: Mesh separators are used in evaporators to filter the distillate.
Answer_4: Reducing the brine density will reduce the heat lost overboard.

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump operating with a positive suction head vibrates, or becomes noisy, the cause could be __________.
A piece missing from one blade of a four-bladed propeller  could result in __________.
The sensing line for the low pressure cutout switch to a refrigeration system is located __________.
Answer_3: on the suction side of the compressor
Answer_4: on the discharge side of the compressor

Question_Title: A taper tap is correctly used for __________.
Answer_2: producing tapered threads in a hole
Answer_3: deepening the extent of existing threads in a hole
Answer_4: finishing the threading operation in a blind hole

Question_Title: Which type of screwdriver listed would have a 'Keystone' type vertical cross-sectional tip?
When the ship's bulkheads are reinforced against bending and bulging, the bulkheads are provided with __________.
In the production of freshwater from seawater through a process of heating and cooling, the cooling phase of production is usually called __________.
Which of the listed metals can usually be drilled without lubrication?

Answer_1: under a vacuum and air will tend to leak into the pump
Answer_2: sealed by the fluid being pumped and no leakage will occur
Answer_3: under pressure and fluid will tend to leak into the pump
Answer_4: sealed by the seal cage or pump lantern ring

Question_Title: All straight shanked twist drills must be mounted or held in a __________.

Excessive propeller vibration may occur as a result of __________.
Answer_2: high water pressure under the hull

Question_Title: Small passenger vessel of less than 100 gross tons shall be drydocked or hauled out at intervals not to exceed 36 months if it is operated in saltwater a total of___________.
Answer_1: more than 9 months in the last 18 month period
Answer_2: less than 9 months in each of the last 12 months
Answer_3: 30 months in the last 36 months since drydocking or haul out
Answer_4: 6 months or less in each 12 month period since it was last  drydocked or hauled out

Question_Title: Information from a data-logger can be helpful in determining the long term probability of machinery failure if you __________.
Answer_1: evaluate only the latest logged data as this is the best indication of plant status
Answer_2: evaluate a series of readings to obtain operating trends
Answer_3: monitor off limit conditions only when announced by an audible and visual signal
Answer_4: secure the machine under relatively steady state conditions

Question_Title: The process of boiling seawater in order to separate it into freshwater vapor and brine is usually defined as __________.
If the cutting edges of a drill are ground at different angles, the __________.
The purpose of the low pressure cutout switch is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain liquid refrigerant at the suction of the compressor
Answer_2: maintain a preset suction pressure to the compressor
Answer_3: start and stop the compressor at preset operating pressures

Question_Title: Partially clogged or scored nozzles in a two stage air ejector unit of a flash distilling plant could result in a  __________.
Answer_1: fluctuating vacuum in the flash chamber
Answer_3: high water level in the air ejector after condenser
Answer_4: malfunctioning check valve in the air ejector discharge

Question_Title: In modern ship construction, high tensile steel (HTS) may be permitted in __________.

Answer_1: prevent chemical breakdown of hydraulic fluid
Answer_2: remove condensation from the fluid reservoir
Answer_3: prevent the anchor from seizing in the hawsepipe
Answer_4: renew the internal coating of lubrication

Question_Title: If two centrifugal pumps, driven by two independent electric motors, operating at unequal speeds are discharging an inflammable liquid through a common discharge line, the higher speed pump may cause the slower pump to __________.
The dimension of the thinnest hydrodynamic film developed within a full journal bearing, when all other factors remain constant, depends upon the __________.
The purpose of the refrigeration system low pressure cutout switch is to __________.
Answer_1: protect the compressor from liquid flood back
Answer_2: protect the compressor from low discharge pressure
Answer_3: start and stop the compressor upon system demand
Answer_4: start the compressor after a drop in the evaporator pressure

Question_Title: Mechanical shaft seals used on water service pumps require  lubrication of the seal faces to minimize deposits of foreign matter on those surfaces.  Which of the following pressures and lubricants are required?
Which of the following conditions can develop if a valve with a badly scored valve stem is repacked?
Answer_2: Leaking and premature failure of the packing.
Answer_3: The valve disk will become eroded.
Answer_4: The valve seat will sustain damage due to fretting.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements best describes a  'Keystone' shaped tip on a standard screwdriver?
Answer_1: A straight shank that does not widen at the top of the blade.
Answer_2: A fourway tip cut at right angles.
Answer_3: A blade whose width is approximately that of the shank diameter with flattened tapered sides.

Question_Title: Overheating of a hydraulic system may be a result of __________.
Answer_1: changing pump discharge pressure in response to normal load variations
Answer_4: continued slow recirculation of the oil

Question_Title: Condensate must be drained periodically from the air compressor receivers to prevent __________.

Answer_1: compressor discharge valve and the condenser

Question_Title: Which of the following types of nuts would be best suited to use when it is important that a nut not work itself loose due to vibration?
In pressure measurement, absolute pressure is defined as the difference in pressure between __________.
Answer_1: any two pressures measured with respect to a common reference
Answer_2: atmospheric pressure and barometric pressure at a given point
Answer_3: gage pressure and ambient atmospheric pressure
Answer_4: a perfect vacuum and the total pressure at a given point

Question_Title: The nameplate of a reciprocating pump lists the following dimensions: "7 X 6 X 4".  The diameter of the liquid cylinder is __________.

Answer_3: what type of acid contaminants are present in a measured sample
Answer_4: how much sulfuric acid the oil has absorbed during  operations

Question_Title: An oil separator is a device used to remove oil from the __________.

Answer_1: The neutralization number has decreased below minimum levels.
Answer_2: The sole use of the increase in the neutralization number need only be the basis for this decision.
Answer_3: In addition to the increase in the neutralization number, the viscosity of oil has also increased.

Answer_1: adding small amounts of oil to the system

Answer_4: the system has been idle for a long period of time

Answer_2: The impeller is located at the upper end of the shaft.

Question_Title: Joiner bulkheads on a MODU provide __________.

Answer_3: The stern tube should be tested for cracks with dye penetrant.

Question_Title: When adding packing to a seal involving motion, you must be careful to prevent __________.
Answer_3: deterioration of the packing due to excessive tightening

Question_Title: Oil separators installed in refrigeration systems serve to  __________.
Answer_1: remove excess oil from the system
Answer_2: remove oil entrained in high pressure liquid lines
Answer_3: return oil entrained in refrigerant vapor back to the compressor crankcase

Question_Title: The brine density in a submerged tube evaporator should be  maintained at __________.
Answer_1: 1.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_2: 1.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_3: 2.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_4: 3.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water

Question_Title: A screwdriver should never be used as a __________.

Answer_1: Leaks developed in the suction piping.
Answer_2: Friction losses as a result of improperly sized pipe.
Answer_3: Gases or vapors released in the liquid as a result of greater than normal pressure drops.

Question_Title: Structural bulkheads on a MODU are usually __________.
Plug valves installed in hydraulic systems are most suitable for use as __________.

Answer_1: the purifier driving gears are lubricated by the reclaimed  oil as it leaves the bowl
Answer_2: all dirt and sludge are automatically discharged with the cooling water
Answer_3: sealing water must never be supplied until after oil is fed to the unit
Answer_4: deterioration of the bowl ring gasket will cause the purifier to lose its water seal

Question_Title: Properties of a good refrigeration oil include __________.
Pushing the file endways (or with the axis), under pressure, against the work, is called __________.
Medium temperature hot water systems have been used in place of small auxiliary boilers producing 100 psig steam with __________.
The lignum vitae in a stern tube bearing is normally lubricated with __________.

Answer_1: Provide orifice-type bypasses for all traps and automatic valves.
Answer_2: Provide a dirt pocket and strainer ahead of the steam trap  on a unit heater return.
Answer_3: Provide all units with a dirt trap and gate valve in the supply and a check valve on the return.
Answer_4: Wherever possible install vertical runs for condensate piping.

Question_Title: To anneal a copper gasket, you should heat the gasket __________.
Answer_2: and let cool slowly in the air
Answer_3: cherry red and quench in water

Question_Title: Reinforcing frames attached to a bulkhead on a MODU are called __________.

Answer_1: allow an alternate main pump to start in the fully loaded condition thus developing immediate full torque
Answer_2: prevent either main pump from being hydraulically motored when idle by cross pressure flow
Answer_3: prevent both units from operating simultaneously which could result in doubling the flow of oil and pressure leading to  over pressurization of the system

Question_Title: Ball peen hammers are sized according to their __________.

Answer_1: assist in flushing out all packing strips when renewing packing underway

Answer_4: serve as the only source of supply of water for the stern tube bearing

Answer_2: treating sewage in an approved system

Answer_1: They may be used in lieu of conventional packing glands for any service other than saltwater.

Question_Title: The number "8" in the notation of an '8-32' tap, indicates  the __________.

Answer_2: distance between the face and the edge of the file
Answer_3: distance between the point and the heel of the file

Question_Title: Which of the following is the most common type of valving element used in hydraulic system directional control valves?

Answer_1: 1/4 inch in diameter with a pitch of 20 threads per inch
Answer_2: 1/2 inch long having a total of 20 threads
Answer_3: a total of 20 threads with a pitch of 1/4 inch
Answer_4: 1/20 of an inch long and 1/4 inch in diameter

Question_Title: A one ton air conditioning system has which of the listed operating characteristics?
Answer_1: It forces 2,000 lbs. of refrigerant through the evaporator per day.
Answer_2: It forces 2,000 lbs. of air per hour across the evaporator coils.
Answer_3: Its cooling power equals that of melting 2,000 lbs. of ice per day.

Question_Title: Which of the materials listed is used as the dynamic seal material on mechanical seals installed on most centrifugal  pumps used in water service?

Answer_1: Contamination of the lube oil by emulsification will result.
Answer_2: The lube oil will not be subjected to the proper centrifugal force.
Answer_3: The lube oil will overheat and flash.
Answer_4: Oil will discharge from the heavy phase discharge port and  be wasted.

Question_Title: Feedwater supplied to a flash type distilling plant will flash to vapor in the first-stage due to __________.
Answer_1: flash chamber pressure pressure being lower than the saturation pressure corresponding to the feedwater temperature
Answer_2: temperature being higher than the evaporation temperature of the supplied feedwater
Answer_3: heat exchange surfaces being directly in the path of the entering feedwater
Answer_4: orifices finely atomizing the heated feedwater entering the flash chamber

Question_Title: Stanchions prevent the entire deck load on a MODU from being carried by the __________.
The Phillips screwdriver has a blunt end and flukes with an angle of __________.
When using a handheld hacksaw, you should apply pressure only on the forward stroke __________.
Answer_1: only when cutting thin wall tubing

Question_Title: An important consideration in selecting a lubricating oil for use in a refrigeration compressor is for the oil to __________.

Answer_1: a defective pressure switch or pilot valve
Answer_2: a leak in the intercooler piping
Answer_3: leakage through the low pressure unloader control diaphragm

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the main difference between a stuffing box gland and a mechanical seal for sealing the shaft of a centrifugal pump?
Answer_1: Packed stuffing box glands are subject to wear, but mechanical seals are not.
Answer_2: Packed stuffing box glands must be cooled by the liquid being pumped, but mechanical seals do not require cooling.
Answer_3: If packing fails, the pump can be kept running temporarily  by tightening the gland, but if a mechanical seal fails it  must be totally renewed to stop the leakage.
Answer_4: The sealing surface of a mechanical seal is parallel to the shaft, but the sealing surface of a packed gland is perpendicular to the shaft.

Question_Title: In a shell-and-tube type hydraulic fluid cooler, the amount of heat transferred from the hydraulic fluid to the cooling water depends upon __________.
Answer_1: the temperature of the hydraulic fluid
Answer_2: the flow rate of both the cooling water and the hydraulic fluid
Answer_3: the temperature of the cooling water

Question_Title: Support of MODU side plating is provided primarily by transverse __________.

Answer_1: angle formed by adjacent flanks of a thread
Answer_2: number of threads divided by the length of the threaded portion of the screw
Answer_3: distance between corresponding points on adjacent threads
Answer_4: angle of taper formed by the centerline of the screw and the crests of the thread

Question_Title: The presence of scale and dirt on the saltwater side of a lube oil cooler is usually indicated by __________.
Answer_2: seawater leaking into the lube oil system

Question_Title: One refrigeration ton is equal to __________.

The tool used to remove a ball bearing from the shaft of a  motor is called a __________.
Fabric type packing, such as flax or hemp, is best suited for __________.
Answer_4: packing valves with badly grooved stems

Question_Title: Which of the listed problems is occurring if a coil type high pressure evaporator constantly requires an increase in the coil steam pressure in order to maintain capacity?
Answer_2: Heat transfer surfaces are being layered with scale.
Answer_4: Shell vapor pressure is constantly decreasing.

Question_Title: Lighter longitudinal stiffening frames on the MODU side plating are called __________.

Answer_2: takes the pump off stroke when the desired rudder angle is  attained.
Answer_3: allows for rudder movement faster than the movement of the  ship's wheel.
Answer_4: returns the rudder to amidships when the wheel is released.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning a radiator type heat exchanger?
Answer_1: Raw water is the cooling medium.
Answer_2: Water cooled exhaust elbows remove the heat.
Answer_3: The surge tank must be located a minimum of 4 feet above the highest finned tube.
Answer_4: Air flow provided by a fan is used as the cooling medium.

Question_Title: How much heat can a 5 ton refrigeration unit remove from a  refrigerated space?
Leaking valves in an air compressor can be a result of __________.

Answer_2: loosened until the gland clears the stuffing box
Answer_3: tightened an additional 10% to compress the packing
Answer_4: loosened, and then retightened until they are only finger tight

Question_Title: Aftercoolers are used with air compressors to __________.
Answer_1: reduce the temperature of compressed air
Answer_2: decrease the density of compressed air
Answer_3: dampen pressure pulses in the discharge air
Answer_4: ensure complete expansion of the compressed air

Question_Title: In the last effect of a multi-effect submerged tube distilling plant rapid fluctuations of the absolute pressure tend to cause __________.
Answer_1: scale formation with increased heat transfer
Answer_2: priming with increased salinity of distillate
Answer_3: slight foaming at the distillate feed pump
Answer_4: improved operating conditions at the brine pump

Question_Title: The heavier outboard strake of deck plating on a MODU is called the deck __________.
In which of the following types of evaporators is the control of brine density least important?
Heat exchanger tubes can be protected against erosion and abrasion by the use of __________.
Answer_1: metallic packing on the inlet end

Question_Title: What is the equivalent tonnage of a refrigeration system rated at 48,000 BTU per hour?
Leaking valves in a low pressure, reciprocating, air compressor can result from __________.
Answer_2: operating the compressor at excessive speed
Answer_3: uneven piston stroke in the compressor

Question_Title: Rudder motion is prevented from exceeding the movement of the steering wheel by the __________.
An air compressor is equipped with an intercooler and an aftercooler to __________.
Answer_1: inject water vapor into the compressed air
Answer_2: prevent overheating of first stage valves
Answer_4: reduce the compressed air charge density

Question_Title: Return lines in a non-pressurized hydraulic system  reservoir should enter the tank well below the fluid surface level to __________.

Answer_4: a brine overflow weir set too low

Question_Title: Where is thicker plating usually found in the construction  of integral tanks on a MODU?
Answer_1: On the outside of the tank.
Answer_2: At the bottom of the tank.
Answer_3: At the top of the tank.
Answer_4: At the center of the tank.

Question_Title: When renewing the shaft packing on a centrifugal pump equipped with an external liquid sealing supply, you should __________.
Answer_1: always turn down the shaft in a lathe to ensure a snug fit
Answer_2: ensure that the lantern ring is aligned with the sealing supply opening
Answer_3: check the stuffing box for irregularities with a dial indicator
Answer_4: make sure the seal cage is always positioned at the base of the stuffing box

Question_Title: If an air conditioning system were rated at 24,000 BTU, the equivalent tonnage of the unit would be __________.

Answer_1: compressor would stop abruptly when power was secured
Answer_3: air receiver indicated pressure would be excessively low
Answer_4: compressor would require more than the normal amount of lubrication

Question_Title: On an electro-hydraulic steering gear, which of the listed  devices will keep the rudder from overtraveling the bridge  signal?

Answer_2: tubes of the saltwater feed heater are flooded internally

Question_Title: The Reed and Prince screwdriver has a sharp pointed end with flukes that have an angle of __________.

Answer_1: Close the pressure gage isolation valves.
Answer_2: Secure the casing vapor vent line.
Answer_3: Secure the stuffing box sealing water line.
Answer_4: Trip the three way dump valve.

Question_Title: On tankers with manually operated tank valves, the type of  valve most commonly used is the __________.

Answer_1: eliminate scaling problems on the saltwater side

Answer_3: ease the load on the saltwater service pump

Question_Title: Which of the following is the probable cause for a motor driven, low pressure, reciprocating air compressor to repeatedly trip the circuit breaker upon starting?

Answer_2: relieve excess whip pressure from the hydraulic oil system
Answer_3: protect the piping assembly from external rudder shock

Question_Title: Steam supply piping to deck machinery is insulated in order to __________.
Answer_1: maintain good turbulent free steam flow through the pipe
Answer_3: reduce heat loss from the system

Question_Title: A piece of tapered round stock 36 inches long, 4 inches in  diameter at the large end and 2 1/2 inches in diameter at the small end.  What tailstock setover was used to machine  the taper?
When a heat exchanger is used as a cooler, excessive cooling water flow should be avoided to prevent __________.

Answer_1: dynamically balance the shaft and impeller
Answer_2: check the shaft and impeller assembly on centers to see if  the ring surfaces are true
Answer_3: visually inspect the rings after about an hour of service

Question_Title: If a refrigeration system extracted 48,000 BTU per hour, the equivalent tonnage of the unit would be __________.
If a ship service air compressor failed to unload the __________.
Answer_2: air receiver pressure would be excessively low

Question_Title: In an electro-hydraulic steering system, rudder shock is limited by __________.
Which of the following statements is true regarding a positive displacement rotary pump?
Answer_1: Theoretically, there is no limit to shut off head pressure.
Answer_3: The discharge side should be protected against excessive pressure build up via a relief valve.

Question_Title: Rapid fluctuation of the last effect shell vacuum in a submerged tube evaporator can cause __________.
Answer_2: air leaks in the tube nest

Answer_1: compensate for major leaks in the system
Answer_3: allow for changes in pressure and temperature within the system

Question_Title: An air conditioning system, required to remove from 33,000  to 35,000 BTU per hour, should have a minimum capacity of __________.

Answer_2: a pressure drop through the loop seal

Question_Title: If a ship service air compressor failed to unload, the __________.

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump develops insufficient discharge pressure as a result of worn wearing rings, which of the following corrective actions is required?
Answer_2: Throttle in on the discharge valve.
Answer_3: Always replace the wearing rings and the impeller as a set.
Answer_4: Throttle in on the suction valve.

Question_Title: Accidental flooding of the engine room bilges through the bilge system is prevented by __________.
Answer_1: stop-check valves installed in the bilge suction manifolds
Answer_2: using a positive displacement reciprocating bilge pump
Answer_3: installing eductors in all bilge rose boxes
Answer_4: installing a swing check before each bilge valve

Question_Title: When the compressed air reservoir is placed in line with an air compressor and is used as an aftercooler, the reservoir must be __________.
Answer_3: fitted with a moisture trap at the inlet

Question_Title: Priming in a submerged tube evaporator can be caused by high water level and __________.

Answer_1: allow free movement of hydraulic fluid in both directions
Answer_2: allow fluid flow in one direction only
Answer_3: allow throttled fluid flow in one direction only
Answer_4: restrict hydraulic fluid flow in both directions

Question_Title: The receiver used in a refrigeration system __________.

Answer_1: not be made without the knowledge and approval of the OCMI
Answer_2: be permissable without the knowledge and approval of the Officer in Charge of Marine Inspection
Answer_3: be made at anytime convenient to the vessel operator without prior approval
Answer_4: be made only when Coast Guard Administrative Form 2892 is submitted

Question_Title: In a double-effect submerged tube evaporator, the brine density should be prevented from falling below 1.5/32nds to minimize __________.
Answer_1: scale formation on the tube nests

Question_Title: If there is a sudden drop in the capacity of a reciprocating air compressor, you should check for __________.
Answer_2: worn piston rings or cylinder liners
Answer_4: a defective pressure switch or pilot valve

Question_Title: Which of the equipment listed is most effective in  processing bilge slops for overboard discharge?
Answer_2: Assembling the lube oil purifier as a separator and aligning it to the bilge overboard.

Question_Title: When a reciprocating pump is operating at maximum speed, the cushioning valves should be __________.

Answer_1: prevent oil backflow to the actuators
Answer_2: prevent the hydraulic pump from overheating
Answer_3: control the speed of the hatch cover movement while closing
Answer_4: restrict the oil supply to the hatch covers not in use

Question_Title: During the inspection for certification of small passenger  vessel of less than 100 gross tons, a hydrostatic test of 1-1/4 times the maximum allowable working pressure shall be made to __________.

Answer_3: increased vacuum in the first effect

Question_Title: The static suction head of a horizontal centrifugal pump, is the difference in elevation between the __________.
Answer_1: discharge liquid level and the suction liquid level
Answer_2: discharge liquid level and the pump centerline
Answer_3: suction liquid level and the pump centerline
Answer_4: suction submergence level and the pump discharge

Question_Title: A drilled hole is accurately finished to size with a __________.
In a refrigeration plant, one purpose of the receiver is to __________.
Emergency lighting on small passenger vessels of less than  100 gross tons for lounge areas below the main deck shall be __________.
Answer_1: illuminated at all times while vessel is underway
Answer_2: illuminated automatically and actuated upon failure of the  main lighting system
Answer_3: portable battery operated and have sufficient capacity for 8 hours of continuous operations

Question_Title: When air compressors are arranged for automatic operation,  the cylinders can be unloaded during starting and stopping  by __________.
Answer_2: fitting depressors which hold the suction valve plates on their seats
Answer_3: step unloading the cylinders in a multi-cylinder machine

Question_Title: If a higher than normal water level is observed through the inspection port of a flash evaporator, you should suspect __________.
Answer_1: a leak in the feedwater heater

Question_Title: A Reed and Prince screwdriver should be used only on a Reed and Prince screw, and a Phillips screwdriver should only be used on a Phillips screws in order to avoid damaging the __________. * I.tool * II. Screwhead
Reciprocating air compressor bearing failure may result from __________.
In a fixed displacement axial piston hydraulic motor, the speed is varied by __________.
Answer_1: regulating the ratio between torque and speed via the torque limiter at the motor
Answer_2: directing the motor output flow through a bypass line
Answer_3: maintaining a constant flow and pressure input

Question_Title: When checking zinc plates, or pencils in the refrigerating  system condenser, you should __________.
Answer_1: paint and insulate the plates to prevent corrosion
Answer_2: renew the plates at each inspection
Answer_3: replace the zincs if deteriorated by 50%
Answer_4: file the plates to change the negative value

Question_Title: For drilling or machining cast iron, which of the cutting lubricants is it necessary to use?
One of the main differences between a propeller pump and a  centrifugal pump is the absence of a __________.
Answer_1: volute in the centrifugal type pump
Answer_2: volute in the propeller type pump
Answer_3: velocity nozzle in the centrifugal type pump
Answer_4: reciprocating piston in the centrifugal type pump

Question_Title: In a flash evaporator, scale as a result of higher than normal temperatures is most likely to occur in the __________.
Which of the listed types of seals is used effectively for pumps handling toxic or highly flammable liquids that cannot be permitted to escape into the atmosphere?
No two drills from differing drill sets are of the exact same size, with the exception of the drills measured as 0.25 inch.  These two drills are the 1/4 inch and the __________.
In MODU construction, a large number of watertight bulkheads results in __________.
Answer_1: increased capacity to set flooding boundaries
Answer_2: decreased capacity to set flooding boundaries

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the advantage of the mechanical shaft sealing system over the stuffing box and packing method of shaft sealing for propulsion shafting?
Answer_1: It eliminates the repairing or renewing of the shaft sleeve.
Answer_2: It is fully automatic in operation.
Answer_3: It allows for the removal and reinstallation of all parts without dismantling the shafts.
Answer_4: Each of the above is correct.

Question_Title: Zinc rods are installed in the refrigeration system __________.

A single-acting simplex pump makes 100 single strokes per minute.  The diameter of the water cylinder is 6 inches and the stroke is 10 inches.  If the efficiency of the pump is  90%, what is the capacity of the pump?
Deck rails on passenger decks of vessels engaged in a ferry or excursion type operation shall be at least __________.
Each vessel designed to carry more than 49 passengers must  have __________.
Answer_3: at least one watertight bulkhead to prevent fire advancement for 2 hours
Answer_4: a minumum of four watertight bulkheads

Question_Title: A squealing sound generated by an operating reciprocating air compressor would indicate __________.
When shifting suction from one fresh water tank to another, if the fresh water pump loses suction you should___________.
Indicated high salinity of the distillate discharged from a flash-type distilling plant will be a result of __________.
Answer_1: maintaining the proper distilling plant heat balance
Answer_2: carrying the brine level below normal
Answer_4: venting of the saltwater heater drain pump

Question_Title: Allowances may be made for the expansion and contraction in piping by the use of expansion joints or __________.
Answer_4: bends or loops in the line

Question_Title: For any given volume of compressed air produced by a multistage air compressor, interstage cooling will __________.
Answer_1: increase the power required for compression
Answer_2: decrease the power required for compression
Answer_3: allow isothermal compression of the air charge
Answer_4: allow the compressed air volume to remain constant

Question_Title: The zinc plates are located in the __________.
Solid contaminants are prevented from entering the main lube oil system by way of the main engine sump,  through the use of __________.
Answer_1: fine mesh screening placed around the pump suction line in  the sump
Answer_2: baffles installed without limber or lightening holes to trap the particles
Answer_3: a suction inlet located approximately 10 inches (254 mm) above the sump bottom
Answer_4: a 10 inch (254 mm) dome installed just below the suction inlet and provided with a pipe-opening within one inch of the dome

Question_Title: When the steering wheel is turned, oil is directed to the steering gear rams by __________.
Answer_1: modulating the oil flow with the six-way valve
Answer_2: moving the automatic pressure differential valve
Answer_3: moving the receiving telemotor which regulates the two-way  valve
Answer_4: varying the eccentricity of a floating ring or angle of a tilting box

Question_Title: Penetrations and openings in watertight bulkheads in a vessel of less than 100 gross tons must __________.
Answer_1: only be placed in transverse watertight bulkheads that extend to the bulwark deck
Answer_2: be provided with non-packed slip joints for expansion to permit passage of piping or electric cable
Answer_4: be kept as high and as far inboard as practicable

Question_Title: Operating a reciprocating air compressor without an air filter will cause __________.
Answer_1: carbon deposits on valves and pistons
Answer_2: excessive wear on valves and cylinder liners

Question_Title: Which of the flange types listed identifies the construction of a pipe joint where a flange is slipped over a length of  pipe, the pipe end is heated, then setup (flanged) in a special machine, and then the end of the pipe is machined to form the actual face of the joint?
Which of the following statements is correct concerning antifriction bearings installed on pumps?
Answer_1: The inner race should be free to turn on the shaft.
Answer_2: The outer race should be free to turn in its housing.
Answer_3: Alignment is not a critical factor in their installation.
Answer_4: They are usually pressed onto their shafts.

Question_Title: A water regulating valve controls the refrigeration condenser cooling water flow in response to condenser __________.
Which of the screwdrivers listed has a tip surrounded by parallel fluted ridges resembling the ridges of a splined socket wrench?
Proper internal lubrication of a hydraulic anchor windlass  left idle for extended periods can be accomplished by __________.
Answer_1: performing a check run on the unit at regular intervals
Answer_2: testing the hydraulic fluid for proper pH
Answer_3: checking the reservoir for proper level

Question_Title: If the flow rate to a linear actuator is reduced by half of the original amount, the __________.
Answer_1: pump discharge pressure will be reduced by a proportional amount
Answer_2: speed of the actuator will be reduced
Answer_3: speed of the actuator will be increased

Question_Title: Irregular feeding or surging of the feedwater supply to a flash evaporator may be attributed to  __________.
Answer_1: erratic water flow through the air eductor
Answer_2: a clogged vent line from the air eductor condenser
Answer_3: excessive pressure in the seawater feed heater
Answer_4: a dirty strainer in the saltwater feed pump suction line

Question_Title: Operating a reciprocating air compressor without an air intake filter can result in a/an __________.
Answer_4: deposit of carbon on the valves

Question_Title: Machinery with ball bearings designed to be filled with grease should have the relief plug temporarily removed while grease is being added.  This plug should remain out until the machinery has been operated and sufficiently warmed up  to ensure that __________.
Answer_1: a path of expansion is provided for the grease
Answer_2: all air pockets are vented from the grease
Answer_3: dirt and grit are flushed from the bearing housing
Answer_4: the grease is properly distributed within the bearing

Question_Title: The nameplate of a reciprocating pump lists the following numerals as indicated 7" X 6" X 4".  The diameter of the steam cylinder is __________.
Which of the screwdrivers listed is designed to protect small screws from being over tightened?
Answer_3: Variable speed screwdriver with a jacobs chuck
Answer_4: Constant rpm screwdriver with a jacobs chuck

Question_Title: An arrow stamped on the valve body of a water regulating valve indicates the __________.
Which of the following frequent maintenance procedures is required of compressed air receivers?
Answer_1: A close watch on the temperature.
Answer_2: Constant cleaning to remove oil and dirt.
Answer_3: Constant testing of the relief valves.

Question_Title: The main difference between a common lathe dog and a safety lathe dog is that the latter __________.
The penetration of watertight bulkheads and watertight decks by rigid nonmetallic piping is prohibited except when __________.
Answer_1: using an acceptable metallic fitting, welded or otherwise is attached to the bulkhead or deck by an acceptable method
Answer_2: the rigid nonmetallic plastic pipe is at least of schedule  160 and a metallic shut off valve is provided adjacent to the through deck or bulkhead fitting
Answer_3: metallic shut off valves are welded to nonmetallic hull materials
Answer_4: two non-remotely operated metallic valves are installed on  either side of the deck or bulkhead regardless of accessability

Question_Title: The brake horsepower of a centrifugal pump will vary directly as the __________.
Answer_2: square of the diameter of the impeller
Answer_3: cube of the diameter of the impeller
Answer_4: impeller efficiency for large changes in the size of the impeller

Question_Title: Which type of Marine Sanitation Device (MSD) is used solely for the storage of sewage and flushwater at ambient air pressure and temperature?
Any unusual, or new vibration in the hull or propeller shafting can be an indication of __________.
A reheater in an air conditioning system functions to __________.
Answer_4: restore conditioned air temperature to a comfortable level

Question_Title: Oiling a file as a rust preventative may cause __________.
For cutting cast iron or soft steel, the proper hacksaw blade should have __________.
An air tank rusts out, explodes and causes $(USA) 24,000 damage to the engine room.  By law, this accident is required to be reported to __________.
'Respiratory heat' is a term applied primarily to which of  the following cargoes?
To prevent the unnecessary loading of an air conditioning system while maintaining the designed dry bulb temperature  and relative humidity in an air conditioning system, you should __________.
Answer_1: admit only enough fresh outside air to provide proper ventilation
Answer_2: reduce the air reheating system load
Answer_4: operate the purge recovery unit continuously

Question_Title: Which of the files listed will have coarsely spaced teeth?
Screwdrivers designed for electrical use should have __________.
Which of the files listed is produced with two safe edges?
Which of the listed statements describes specific heat?
Answer_1: The amount of heat required to change the temperature of one pound of a material, one degree F.
Answer_2: The amount of heat required to change the temperature of one pound of ice, one degree F.
Answer_3: The amount of heat required to change the temperature of one pound of butter, one degree F.

Question_Title: To add refrigerant to the low side of an air conditioning system, the refrigerant should be introduced through the __________.
Answer_1: suction service valve as a vapor
Answer_2: suction service valve as a liquid
Answer_3: discharge service valve as a vapor

Question_Title: Which of the following devices is not considered to be a pressure vessel?  (46 CFR)
Which of the files listed is commonly referred to as a 'rattail' file?
Which of the screwdrivers listed is fastest and most convienent when tightening many screws?
Which of the screwdrivers listed is designed for the precision assembly of small parts?
You discover an air leak at the manhole cover shortly after pressurizing a P-tank.  You must __________.
Answer_1: reduce the P-tank pressure to 25-30 psi to complete the dry material transfer
Answer_2: increase the P-tank pressure to the unloading valve setting to force the manhole cover to seat itself
Answer_3: complete the dry material discharge before attempting any repairs
Answer_4: depressurize the tank, replace the gasket, then tighten the bolts securing the hatch cover

Question_Title: Unusual hull, or propeller shaft vibrations can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: excessive engine speed in shallow water
Answer_3: slight overheating of the line shaft spring bearings
Answer_4: high engine speed in deep water

Question_Title: If a refrigeration compressor in a multi-box system runs continuously, the cause might be a __________.
Answer_1: high pressure switch stuck in the closed position

Question_Title: According to regulations (46 CFR), a boiler combustion control system may be tested at __________.
Answer_1: a pressure not less than 1.25 times the maximum allowable working pressure
Answer_2: a pressure not less than 1.5 times the maximum allowable working pressure
Answer_3: the maximum allowable working pressure of the system
Answer_4: the normal operating pressure of the system provided full loading is accomplished

Question_Title: The terms rough, coarse, bastard, second cut, smooth, and dead smooth refer to the __________.
Answer_1: distance between the parallel cuts of a file
Answer_4: both A and C are correct

Question_Title: By which of the listed methods may heat be transferred from one body to another?
Which of the screwdrivers listed is designed with the shaft made from double coil wire or tightly coiled steel?
A file coated with oil and stowed away will __________.
Answer_2: cause the file to slide across the work and prevent fast, clean cutting
Answer_3: cause dust and metal particles to collect in the teeth
Answer_4: both B and C are correct

Question_Title: The length of a file is always measured exclusive of the __________.
Which of the saw blades listed, when mounted in a hand held hacksaw frame, can be used to cut an intricate shape with precision?
The surging that occurs in a centrifugal air conditioning compressor is a result of __________.
Answer_2: the existing load on the evaporator producing a thermodynamic head exceeding the normal maximum of the compressor
Answer_3: low pressure in the condenser at low load
Answer_4: high pressure in the evaporator at high load

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the accepted method for testing a thermostatic expansion valve?
Answer_1: Heat the bulb by using a halide torch or similar device and observe the valve stem movement.
Answer_2: Remove the power head from the unit, heat the bulb with a torch while using a scale to measure the distance the diaphragm has moved.
Answer_3: Chill the bulb in ice water while observing the compressor  for an increase in suction pressure.
Answer_4: Place the sensing bulb in ice water and then warm by hand.  Observe flood-through and temperature change at the suction line.

Question_Title: Which of the files listed is tapered on three sides and is  used to file acute internal angles?
Which of the screwdrivers listed is produced with a tip to  fit screws with a fourway or cross slot?
To cut drill rod, light angle iron, or tool steel with a hand hacksaw, it is best to use a blade with __________.
What is the lowest permissible flashpoint of the oil used in a hydraulic valve actuating system that operates at 145 psi (1000kPa)? (46 CFR)
Which of the saw blades listed, when mounted in a hand held hacksaw frame, will cut on both the forward and reverse strokes?
Any air mixture whose dew point remains constant will also  have an unchanging __________.
A fluid power system shall be so designed __________.
Answer_1: that proper functioning of any unit shall not be affected by the back pressure in the system
Answer_2: to maintain a back pressure throughout the power cylinders  operating range
Answer_3: such that the operation of any unit in the system will provide for sufficient back pressure
Answer_4: none of the above are correct

Question_Title: A hacksaw blade with 14 teeth per inch should be used to cut __________.
Which of the files listed will have medium spaced teeth and is used for general work?
Which of the files listed is tapered on all sides and used  to enlarge rectangular-shaped holes and slots?

A refrigerated container filled with 10,000 lbs. of strawberries has been loaded on your ship.  The set point of the box is 35F and the interior box temperature is 90F, and after 7 hrs. 37 minutes the box is lowered to 60F. Based on the following information, which of the listed steps should be taken? Specific heat of cargo is 0.94 BTU/LB/F, heat gain by container equals 4,000 BTU/hr., and refrigeration system capacity equals 3.42 tons.
Answer_1: Do nothing as the system is operating correctly.
Answer_2: The compressor is worn out and should be replaced.
Answer_4: Add freon to the unit to increase the refrigeration effect.

Question_Title: The dew point is reached when the wet bulb temperature is __________.
Answer_1: equal to the dry bulb temperature
Answer_3: 100F less than the dry bulb temperature

Question_Title: If the superheat value of a thermostatic expansion valve is set too low, the __________.
Answer_1: the suction line will be abnormally cold and liquid may slug back to the compressor
Answer_2: the suction line will be hot due to a reduced amount of refrigerant returning to the compressor
Answer_3: the temperature of the refrigerant within the condenser will remain the same
Answer_4: the temperature of the refrigerant passing through the subcooler will decrease

Question_Title: Using a file without a handle may result in __________.
A new file should be broken in carefully by filing a piece  of __________.
Answer_4: stainless steel stock using light pressure

Question_Title: The edge of a file not having any teeth is known as a __________.
A saw blade produced of bonded tungsten-carbide particles and mounted in a hacksaw frame is known as a __________.
If a thermostatic expansion valve is adjusted for too high a superheat value __________.
Answer_1: all of the system liquid will flow to the evaporator coil
Answer_2: an insufficient amount of liquid will be fed to the evaporator
Answer_3: an excessive amount of liquid will be fed to the evaporator
Answer_4: only the required amount of refrigerant will enter the evaporator regardless of the required superheat value

Question_Title: Pinning is often caused by __________.
Answer_4: bearing too hard on the file

Question_Title: It is not necessary to 'chalk' a file when the metal being  filed is __________.
Which of the saws listed would be more suitable for cutting metal in tight quarters or flush to a surface where a hand  held hacksaw frame could not be used?
The function of a heat interchanger used in a refrigeration system is to __________.
Answer_1: lower the temperature of liquid refrigerant before entering the expansion valve
Answer_2: reduce the possibility of liquid refrigerant from flooding  back to the compressor
Answer_3: minimize sweating of the suction line

Question_Title: According to regulations (46 CFR), who may grant an extension of the tailshaft examination interval?
Answer_1: Officer in Charge, Marine Inspection office
Answer_3: Authorized Representative of the American Bureau of Shipping
Answer_4: Official Representative of the Naval Pollution Control Office

Question_Title: It is necessary to 'chalk' a file when the metal you are filing is __________.

What is the theoretical time necessary to reduce the temperature of 40,000 pounds of onions (placed in a refrigerated container) from 75F to a set point temperature of 46F?  The specific heat of onions is 0.90 BTU/LB/F. The trailer heat gain is 6,500 BTU/hr, with a properly operating refrigeration cooling capacity of 45,500 BTU/hr.
When cutting sheet metal too thin to be held in your hand while using a hand held hacksaw, the sheet metal should be  placed between two __________.
When opening or closing compressor service and line valves  on a typical refrigeration system, you __________.
Answer_1: should turn valves slowly to avoid thermal stresses due to  low temperatures
Answer_2: must first remove the seal cap
Answer_3: should examine the gasket frequently to ensure that it is flat
Answer_4: should never tighten the packing gland

Question_Title: When any vessel is drydocked, examination shall be made of  the propeller, __________. (46 CFR)
Answer_1: fairwater cone and hull anodes by the Chief Engineer assigned to the vessel
Answer_2: propeller coupling and flange fasteners by the authorized inspector of the repair facility
Answer_3: keel and stabilizing fins by a registered marine engineer
Answer_4: stern bushing, sea connection and fastenings if deemed necessary by the marine inspector

Question_Title: While filing, you can prevent pinning by keeping the file clean and rubbing the teeth of the file with __________.
An obstructed expansion valve may be indicated by an incompletely cooled evaporator and __________.
Answer_1: a higher than normal discharge pressure
Answer_3: a decrease in the amount of frosting across the drier
Answer_4: frosting at the suction side of the compressor

Question_Title: Mill files are always __________.
Which term applies to a hacksaw blade having short sections of teeth bent in opposite directions?
If a liquid drying agent is used in a refrigeration system  already equipped with a solid drying agent, the liquid drying agent will __________.
Answer_1: release the moisture already trapped in the solid drying agent
Answer_2: react violently with the solid drying agent
Answer_3: cause toxic gases to from in the refrigerated space
Answer_4: solidify the refrigerant oil in the compressor crankcase

Question_Title: One of the determining factors regulating the time interval for drawing a vessel's tailshaft depends upon the design to reduce stress concentrations.  Which of the following factors, in part, would be considered to meet this design criteria?
Answer_2: Stress relief grooves at the forward end of the propeller and aft end of the liner.
Answer_3: Keyway is to be cut so as to give a sharp rise from the bottom of the keyway to the shaft surface.

Question_Title: Double cut files are used for __________.
Which of the files listed will have closely spaced teeth for finishing to a smooth surface?

Your vessel has received a refrigeration container of 16 long tons of cabbage, loaded at 1700 hours on Friday, with a beginning temperature of 80F.  At what time on Saturday will the box theoretically reach its set point temperature  of 50F, assuming the system is operating correctly? The specific heat of cabbage is 0.94 BTU/LB/F.  The container has a heat gain of 6,000 BTU/hr, and the  refrigeration system's capacity is 40,000 BTU/hr.
If an expansion valve is adjusted for too low a superheat value __________.
Answer_1: the efficiency of the unit will be increased
Answer_2: too much liquid will be passed back to the compressor
Answer_3: the box temperature will increase causing an expansion of the volume of air
Answer_4: the refrigeration effect will increase contributing to uncontrolled box temperatures

Question_Title: Reduced capacity, accompanied by vibration and noise at the suction of a centrifugal pump, results from cavitation in the fluid being pumped.  Cavitation describes the formation of  __________.
Overcharging an air-cooled refrigeration system will cause  the __________.
Answer_3: system to automatically change over to the hot gas defrost  cycle

Question_Title: Which of the problems listed could happen if you attempted  to force open a valve 'frozen' in position by using a wrench on the handwheel?
Archimedes' principle states that the resultant pressure acting on a body immersed in a fluid __________.
Answer_1: acts vertically upward through the center of gravity of the displaced fluid and is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced
Answer_2: will cause the body to have a reduction in mass equal in magnitude to the effective mass of the structure located above the line of floatation
Answer_3: is proportional in magnitude and direction, regardless of the direction originally developed when the object was submerged
Answer_4: is applied equal and in all directions throughout the vessel in which it is contained

Question_Title: When mounted in a hand held hacksaw frame, which of the blades listed could cut smoothly through a metal file?
Which of the statements listed accurately applies to controllable pitch propeller systems?
Answer_1: A pitch indicator is to be fitted on the navigation bridge  for vessels 400 gross tons and above.
Answer_2: Independent remote control of pitch is to be provided at or near the oil distribution box.  Tests of its operation are to be performed in the presence of the Surveyor.
Answer_3: After installation in the vessel, the complete piping system is to be subjected to a hydrostatic test equal to 1.25 times the design pressure.
Answer_4: The arrangement of piping is to be such that a single failure in one part of the piping or pump unit will not impair the integrity of the remaining parts of the system.

Question_Title: A fine wire bristled brush used for cleaning files is called a __________.
The type of tooth set on a hacksaw blade where the teeth are continuously staggered with one to the left and one to the right is known as __________.
Relative humidity can be determined by using a psychrometric chart and a/an __________.
A small obstruction at the thermostatic expansion valve inlet will result in which of the following conditions?
Answer_2: Hunting as indicated by fluctuations of the discharge pressure.
Answer_3: Expansion valves are designed to pass small foreign particles so no adverse condition will occur.
Answer_4: Ice is the sole cause of this and will soon melt due to superheat; no adverse condition will occur.

Question_Title: The material, design, construction and workmanship of main  and auxiliary machinery shall __________. (46 CFR)
Answer_1: determine the necessity of duplication and application of redundant systems
Answer_2: be examined and approved by the Officer in Charge, Marine Inspection of the port in which the vessel is being constructed
Answer_3: be at least equivalent to the standards established by the  American Bureau of Shipping or other recognized classification society
Answer_4: prevent the possibility of operator injury due to inefficient construction practices and inappropriate material testing procedures

Question_Title: The term referring to the amount or degree the teeth of a hacksaw blade are pushed out or canted from the blade center is known as __________.
A lower thermostatic temperature setting will provide a desired degree of comfort in a room where __________.
Answer_2: triple banded squirrel cage fans are used

Question_Title: The teeth of a file may 'clog up' with metal filings and scratch your work.  This condition is known as __________.
If the superheat value of the thermostatic expansion valve  is adjusted too high the __________.
Answer_2: rate at which condensation occurs on the evaporator coils will increase
Answer_3: suction line of the compressor will be abnormally warm
Answer_4: rate at which condensation occurs within the coils will increase

Question_Title: Sawing faster than a rate of 40 to 50 strokes per minute while using a hand held hacksaw will generally __________.
Answer_2: cause the blade to cut faster
Answer_4: not change how the blade cuts

Question_Title: In an air conditioning system, moisture is removed from the air by __________.
What maintenance may be carried out on a thermostatic expansion valve?
Answer_1: The thermal bulb may be recharged.
Answer_2: The rate action may be increased.
Answer_3: The proportional action may be varied.
Answer_4: The inlet screen may be cleaned.

Question_Title: Which statement about calibrating a newly installed thermostatic expansion valve is correct?
Answer_1: The procedure requires a refrigeration wrench and a digital thermometer to measure box temperature.
Answer_2: No special tools are required as long as the solid state circuit control panels are functioning properly.
Answer_3: This procedure is done at the factory with tools not available to a mariner.
Answer_4: An accurate thermometer and suction pressure gage are essential to this process.

Question_Title: Which of the files listed can be used for sharpening a tool?
Answer_4: Only a double bastard cut file.

Question_Title: When using a hand held hacksaw the correct maximum rate of  speed for cutting should be __________.
Routine maintenance on a Central Control Room hermetically  sealed air conditioning unit should include __________.
When a thermostatic expansion valve is installed in a container refrigeration system, the sensing bulb may not require insulation if the bulb is installed __________.
Answer_1: outside of the cooled air stream
Answer_3: on the tail end of the condenser outlet pipe
Answer_4: at the mid-horizontal level of a vertically run tail coil

Question_Title: The type of tooth set on a hacksaw blade where every third tooth remains straight, while the other two are alternately set is known as __________.
Which of the following alarms and instrumentation is not required for a vessel incorporating a controllable pitch propeller in its main propulsion system?
Each pressure vessel containing refrigerants, which may be  isolated, shall be __________. (46 CFR)
Answer_1: subject to annual hyrdrostatic tests to be performed in the presence of a marine inspector
Answer_2: protected by a relief valve set to relieve at a pressure not exceeding 110 percent of the maximum allowable working pressure of the vessel
Answer_3: stored in an upright position in addition to being secured  so as to prevent accidental release of the refrigerant within a confined space
Answer_4: protected by a relief valve set to relieve at a pressure not exceeding the maximum allowable working pressure of the vessel

Question_Title: The type of tooth set on a hacksaw blade where two adjoining teeth are staggered to the right, then  two to the left, and continue to alternate in this manner is known as __________.
Expansion valve maintenance should include which of the following procedures?
Answer_2: Ensuring that the thermal bulb is  in good contact with the suction line.
Answer_3: Checking that the thermal bulb is in the proper location.

Question_Title: In an air conditioning system, low head pressure associated with a reciprocating compressor can be the result of __________.
Which of the installation steps listed is necessary for the proper operation of the thermostatic expansion valve?
Answer_1: Clean outlet pipe and secure bulb tangential to the flow of refrigerant.
Answer_2: Clean off oxidation from the surface of the suction line and sensing bulb with fine abrasive cloth.
Answer_3: Remove excess lengths of the sensing bulb capillary tube from the device to increase sensitivity.
Answer_4: Heat shrink insulating material around the device once the  bulb has been properly secured.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning requirements for propellers?
Answer_1: A propeller may not be changed with one of a different pitch unless stress evaluations are supplied and permission is granted by a Marine Surveyor.
Answer_2: When steel propellers are used, zinc anodes are to be fitted on the aftermost strut bearing housing and on the forward most section of the rudder assembly.
Answer_3: The exposed steel of the shaft is to be protected from the  action of the water by filling all spaces between the cap,  hub and shaft with a suitable material.
Answer_4: Ultrasonic examinations of the propeller may be performed in lieu of required drydocking periods, provided certified copies are distributed to the proper regulatory bodies.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the regulations (46 CFR) regarding internal combustion engine exhausts, boiler and galley uptakes, and similar sources of ignition?
Answer_1: They shall be kept clear of and suitably insulated from any woodwork or other combustible matter.
Answer_2: All exhausts and uptakes shall run as close as possible to  the horizontal and shall exit the machinery space at a point above the highest load line.
Answer_3: The general construction of the vessel shall be such as to  minimize noise hazards in the upper machinery spaces.
Answer_4: This protection shall be such as to be capable of preventing an excessive temperature rise in the upper machinery spaces.

Question_Title: The latent heat of water vapor in air is dependent upon the __________.
When replacing a thermostatic expansion valve sensing bulb, it is necessary to __________.
Answer_1: apply a light film of oil to increase heat transfer
Answer_2: apply a light film of oil to prevent oxidation
Answer_3: apply a heavy coating of grease to function as a heat sink
Answer_4: carefully coat the device with silicone sealant to reduce the effects of convective cooling

Question_Title: A hacksaw blade will break if __________.
Answer_1: the rate of cutting is too great
Answer_2: the blade becomes loose in the frame
Answer_3: too much pressure is applied to the blade

Question_Title: Hydraulic hose assemblies are permitted by 46 CFR to be installed between two points of relative motion __________.
Answer_1: provided proper releasing mechanisms are available to enable quick disconnect capabilities
Answer_2: but shall not be subjected to torsional deflection under any conditions of operation
Answer_3: provided the entire length of the device is visible to the  operator at all times
Answer_4: to prevent the formation of loading stresses

Question_Title: If you know that a refrigeration system is leaking  refrigerant, you would first___________.

Question_Title: Why do OSV's with a liquid mud system generally have more than two tanks?

Question_Title: It is important to circulate the liquid mud on an OSV at regular intervals to___________.

Question_Title: It is important to circulate liquid mud on an OSV to_______.

Answer_4: reduce corrosion damage due to the acidic nature of zinc bromide

Question_Title: Unless told otherwise by the mud dock representative, the recomended circulation time and rate for most new water based liquid mud for each tank is___________.

Answer_3: one day circulating, three days off with a small electric mud pump
Answer_4: fifteen minutes every six hours with a small pump, or diesel pump at half throttle

Question_Title: The intentional venting of class I and II refrigerants to the atmosphere within the territorial limits of the United  States became unlawful on __________.

Question_Title: A particular space is air conditioned by a 25 ton water cooled system.  While troubleshooting, the space is found to be too warm, and the compressor is not operating. Question_Title: Solenoid valves used in refrigeration systems may be classified as __________.

Question_Title: The air compressor for a P-tank unit should be operated for several minutes with its discharge valves open to the atmosphere to __________.

Answer_2: dry out fixed discharge piping and hoses

Question_Title: In a chilled water air conditioning unit using a reciprocating compressor, the refrigerating effect of the primary refrigerant can be increased by __________.

Answer_3: subcooling the refrigerant in the condenser
Answer_4: superheating the refrigerant in the compressor

Question_Title: In a refrigeration system, which of the following statements describes the actions occurring when a solenoid valve, used in conjunction with an unloader head, is energized?
Answer_1: The solenoid valve directs high pressure gas to the valve lifting device raising the suction valve off its seat and causing one specific cylinder to become unloaded.
Answer_2: The solenoid valve directs high pressure gas to the underside of the unloading piston, causing it to rise and allowing the recirculating ports to be opened.
Answer_3: When the solenoid valve becomes energized, the valve ports  become closed, allowing discharge pressure to build up above the piston, shifting it and causing it to unload.
Answer_4: The solenoid valve allows the refrigerant to pass from the  suction chamber to the top of the unloader piston, causing  the piston to lift and unload the cylinder.

Answer_2: Because the tank receives high pressure drains.
Answer_3: Because the tank receives large amounts of water.
Answer_4: Because the tank receives small amounts of water.

Question_Title: Which of the components listed prevents water from flowing  back into the auxiliary exhaust line if the deaerating feed tank becomes flooded?
Air removed from the main condenser is vented to the atmosphere through the __________.
Which of the pumps listed operates at constant speed and delivers water to the deaerating feed tank at a nearly constant pressure?
Which of the following characteristics determines the temperature to which fuel oil must be heated for proper atomization?

Answer_1: protect the service pump from high discharge pressure
Answer_4: supply constant pressure to the burner combustion control valves

Question_Title: Condensate pumps have distinctly noticeable characteristics and are recognized by their __________.
Answer_2: large suction chambers and impeller eyes
Answer_3: multiple impellers and pump shaft positions

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is used to keep overheated condensate from flowing to the deaerating feed tank?
Answer_3: Recirculating line to the main condenser
Answer_4: Recirculating line to the main feed pump

Question_Title: The purpose of the reaction turbine dummy piston is to __________.
Answer_1: counteract axial thrust toward the turbine low pressure end
Answer_2: act in conjunction with gland seal steam to balance turbine thrust
Answer_4: eliminate axial thrust caused by velocity increases in moving blades

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the purpose of boiler sliding feet?
Answer_1: To ensure an airtight seal between the boiler inner and outer casings.
Answer_2: To accommodate the changing length of the water drum as it  expands or contracts with temperature changes.
Answer_3: To compensate for deflection of the hull in way of the boiler supports.
Answer_4: To allow for unequal expansion between the wrapper and tube sheets.

Question_Title: By which of the methods listed is the automatic recirculating valve in the main condenser recirculating line designed to be controlled?

To combat galvanic corrosion, condensers utilizing  copper-nickel waterboxes are usually fitted with __________.
Modern fuel oil temperature control devices are regulated to obtain a desired viscosity rather than a specific fuel oil  temperature because __________.
Answer_1: residual fuel oils have the same viscosity characteristics  regardless of where they are refined
Answer_2: the temperature of the fuel oil varies with the flow rate through the heater
Answer_3: the relationship between temperature and viscosity varies with different fuels
Answer_4: viscosity regulation eliminates the need for close control  of the fuel/air ratio

Question_Title: A test of boiler water for chloride content indicates the amount of __________.

In a multistage reaction turbine, the dummy piston and cylinder function to __________.
Answer_2: dynamic balance of the rotating rotor
Answer_3: eliminate the pressure drop across the blades
Answer_4: provide a means of measuring axial clearances

Question_Title: A common type of air heater used in sectional header marine boilers is the __________.

Answer_1: Direct admission of 35 psi (241.3 kPa) auxiliary steam

Question_Title: In a closed feed and condensate system, the drain from the  second stage air ejector returns directly to the __________.

Answer_3: methyl orange that should be added

Question_Title: If the entire pneumatic control to a multi-element feedwater regulator fails, the feedwater valve is controlled by __________.
One stage in an impulse turbine consists of a set of nozzles in which __________.
Answer_1: a single pressure drop occurs followed by one or more rows  of moving blades
Answer_2: a single velocity drop occurs followed by one row of moving blades
Answer_3: steam expands and impinges on the row of reversing blades
Answer_4: velocity decreases and pressure increases followed by a row of moving blades

Question_Title: One advantage of installing water wall tubes in a boiler furnace is to __________.

Answer_1: The recovery of feedwater for reuse.
Answer_2: Cooling of the exhaust steam from the auxiliary exhaust system before it enters the deaerating feed tank.
Answer_3: Storage of feedwater for immediate use in the boilers.
Answer_4: Condensing of the exhaust steam from the main feed turbine pumps.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions aids in directing gland leakoff steam from the low pressure propulsion turbine to pass through the gland exhaust condenser?
Answer_1: Steam pressure from the low pressure turbine.
Answer_2: Steam pressure from the high pressure turbine.
Answer_3: Compressed air in the air pilot.
Answer_4: The use of a gland exhauster fan.

Answer_4: Counterflow of seawater over the surface of the tubes with  the flow of exhaust steam in the tubes

Question_Title: The primary objective of the auxiliary exhaust system is to supply steam to the __________.

Answer_1: remove any sediment from the glass
Answer_2: maintain the proper water level in the steam drum
Answer_3: provide water samples for the second assistant

Question_Title: Fine adjustments to a boiler combustion control system, to  bring about near perfect combustion, should be made by manually adjusting the __________.

Answer_2: Stationary nozzles with impulse rotor blading.
Answer_3: Reaction stages followed by velocity-compounded blading.
Answer_4: Velocity-compounded stages followed by reaction blading.

Answer_1: increase the flow of gases through the furnace
Answer_2: decrease the flow of gases through the furnace
Answer_3: increase heat transfer to the mud drum

Question_Title: Steam drum water level indicators must be calibrated to compensate for density differences between the indicated drum water level, and the actual drum water level.  If no compensation is made, the indicator will show a __________.
Answer_1: lower level than exists in the drum with the error becoming greater as the drum pressure decreases
Answer_2: lower level than exists in the drum with the error becoming greater as the drum pressure increases
Answer_3: higher level than exists in the drum with the error becoming greater as the drum pressure decreases
Answer_4: higher level than exists in the drum with the error becoming greater as the drum pressure increases

Question_Title: When vapor is in contact with and remains at the same temperature as the liquid from which it was generated, the  vapor and liquid are said to be in a/an __________.

Answer_1: increase in the fuel oil flow before an increase in the forced draft pressure
Answer_2: decrease in the forced draft air pressure before a decrease in the fuel oil flow
Answer_3: increase in the forced draft air pressure before an increase in the fuel oil flow
Answer_4: increase or a decrease in the fuel oil flow and forced draft air pressure simultaneously

Answer_1: one or more nozzles with one row of rotating blades
Answer_2: a single pressure stage with two or more velocity stages
Answer_3: a low velocity steam jet from a nozzle
Answer_4: two or more simple impulse stages

Question_Title: Rows of tubes installed along the walls, floor, and roof of the furnace are called __________.

Answer_4: Decrease the steam pressure to the air ejector nozzles.

Question_Title: The life of the furnace lining can be affected by __________.
Answer_3: the proper application of inspection criteria

Question_Title: In most marine boilers, the primary reason the first few rows of generating tubes, called screen or furnace row tubes, are made larger in diameter than the rest of the generating tubes is because __________.
Answer_1: they require more water flow since they are exposed to the  greatest heat

Answer_3: they must act as downcomers to ensure proper circulation

Question_Title: Boiler refractories previously baked out and fired are more sensitive to __________.

Answer_2: seal the casing during periods of low casing pressure
Answer_3: seal the casing during periods of high casing pressure
Answer_4: provide a constant flow to the gland leak off condenser

Answer_4: set of gas baffles in the screen tubes

Question_Title: Nichrome wire is used when patching boiler furnaces for __________.

Answer_4: Secure all drains prior to admitting any steam to avoid damage to traps.

Answer_1: fuel oils having high ash content
Answer_3: prolonged feedwater contamination of fuel oil

Question_Title: Which constituent of fuel oil determines the specific heat?
Which of the listed refractory materials is capable of providing structural stability?

Answer_3: the cool sample has a higher conductivity measurement and the total dissolved solids in the water are easier to identify
Answer_4: the degree of acidity as measured on the pH recorder is amplified by cool water temperatures

Answer_2: Acts as a gas-side layer at high temperature areas in D-type boilers.

Answer_3: to provide cushioning of individual pieces against  concentrated stresses

Answer_3: desired pH has been attained in the sample

Answer_2: open the feedwater valve wide, due to the effect of shrink

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the advantage  of castable insulation over either insulating brick or insulating block installations?

Answer_2: auxiliary stop valve fully open and the auxiliary stop-check  valve used to regulate the amount of flow

Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Answer_3: two or more stages of velocity compounding
Answer_4: two or more rows of nozzles in which no pressure drop exists

Answer_1: prevent excessive overheating of the condensate pumps

Answer_2: chemically treat feedwater to remove carbonic gas

Question_Title: The high pressure steam drain system is normally collected  by the __________.

Allowance for axial expansion of the steam turbine due to temperature changes is provided for by the use of __________.

Answer_2: decrease in the pressure drop between the water inlet and outlet

Question_Title: A two-element boiler feedwater regulator is controlled by __________.

Question_Title: The most serious fireside burning of the boiler superheater tubes is the result of __________.

Answer_4: the tubes becoming steam bound or dry

Question_Title: If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds, what weight of air will be necessary to burn one pound of fuel to operate a boiler at 10% excess air?

Answer_1: increase the effective blade surface area without increasing blade weight
Answer_2: prevent any pressure drop from occurring through the moving blades
Answer_3: provide a means for mounting the shrouding on the blade tips
Answer_4: reduce losses through blade tip leakage

Question_Title: The purpose of the division plates installed in boiler superheater headers is to __________.

Answer_2: ensure proper steam flow, thus preventing 'short circuiting' of superheater loops
Answer_3: provide a means of controlling steam passage in response to throttle demands

Question_Title: A two-element feedwater regulator responds directly to changes in __________.

Answer_1: divert the flow of condensate from the first stage heater to the vent condenser
Answer_2: maintain a proper condensate level in the condenser hotwell
Answer_3: recirculate condensate to the atmospheric drain tank
Answer_4: drain excess feedwater to the distilled water tank

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions in a water-tube boiler generating tube could cause tube failure, even if the water gage glass shows the proper level?

When a boiler water test indicates a pH value of 6, you should __________.
Answer_1: check the DC heater for possible malfunction
Answer_3: chemically treat to lower the pH to normal level
Answer_4: chemically treat to raise the pH to normal level

Question_Title: What is used to compensate for the increased possibility of blade vibration ocurring with impulse turbine blading?

Answer_3: Securing the blade tips with shrouding.
Answer_4: Seal stripping the groove within the turbine casing.

Question_Title: In a D-type boiler, which of the tubes listed would be located in the generating tube bank?
If water hammer develops while opening the valve in a steam line, which of the following actions should be taken?
Answer_1: Shut the steam valve at once, open the drain valves until all moisture is drained, shut the drain line valves, and slowly open the steam valve again.
Answer_2: Continue to fully open the steam valve as the drain line valves are opened until all moisture is drained, shut the drain line valves.
Answer_3: Stop opening the steam valve, open the drain line valves, resume opening the steam valve slowly, and shut the drain line valves after the steam valve is open fully.
Answer_4: Increase the speed of opening the steam valve to rapidly heat the line to stop the water hammer.

Question_Title: Two-element feedwater regulators operate by sensing __________.
Answer_1: boiler water level and steam flow
Answer_2: boiler water level and steam pressure
Answer_3: boiler water level and feedwater flow

Question_Title: High pressure steam drains are normally discharged to the __________.

Answer_1: used in the economizer and air heater
Answer_4: required to change water into steam

Question_Title: When securing a boiler, the burner registers are to be left open for a few minutes to __________.

Answer_3: draining the steam piping before operating any machinery
Answer_4: ensuring that all drain lines are properly insulated

Question_Title: If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds, what is the weight of air per pound of fuel when operating a boiler at 5% excess air?

Answer_1: form a labyrinth seal between the casing halves

Answer_4: increase contact pressure between the casing halves' flanges

Answer_2: Stopping of the fuel oil service pump

Question_Title: Clogged gas passages in a boiler may result in __________.

Question_Title: If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds, what will be the weight of the air necessary to burn one pound of fuel to operate a boiler at 20% excess air?

Answer_4: pure and treated to a pH of 10.5 to 11.0

Answer_4: decrease steam velocity in the nozzles of an impulse turbine

Question_Title: Excess air must be provided to an operating boiler to allow for __________.

Answer_1: ensure a steady boiler water level at all loads

Question_Title: If a quantity of saturated steam consists of 90 percent steam and 10 percent moisture, the quality of the mixture is  __________.

Answer_4: flame will be a deep red color

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of strainers are installed between the fuel oil heater and the burner manifold?

Question_Title: Reduction gear bearing bridge gage readings should be taken after __________.

Question_Title: The purpose of the mica used in a boiler water gage glass assembly is to prevent __________.

Question_Title: Improper boiler feedwater deaeration could be directly linked to __________.

Question_Title: In a closed feedwater system, the greatest deaeration of condensate occurs in the __________.
