Answer_3: utilize a portable rubber impeller transfer pump

Question_Title: The purpose of the relief valve in a fuel oil service system is to __________.
Answer_1: protect the system from high discharge pressure
Answer_4: supply constant pressure to the burner combustion control valves

Question_Title: A high percentage of carbon dioxide in boiler flue gases indicates __________.
Answer_4: nearly complete combustion of fuel oil

Question_Title: A basic comparison can be made between a low pressure evaporator operation and a main condenser with regards to the removal of noncondensable gases. The comparable section within the main condenser is specifically the __________.
The purpose of the pressure control disk installed in the  soot blower illustrated is to __________.
Answer_1: control the velocity and distance of the steam valve passing from the soot blower element
Answer_2: reduce the steam supply pressure to properly rotate the soot blower
Answer_3: control the amount of arc during rotation of the soot blower element
Answer_4: assist in the intial opening of the valve at the begining of the soot blower operation

Question_Title: For a period of time immediately after being secured, turbines should be rotated slowly to avoid __________.
Answer_1: damage to the reduction gear teeth
Answer_3: excessive strain on the quill shaft flexible coupling

Question_Title: A boiler accumulation test is used to measure the __________.
Answer_1: lifting pressure of the boiler safety valves
Answer_2: total relieving capacity of the boiler safety valves
Answer_3: steam generating capacity of the boiler

Question_Title: The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.

The best indication that a bearing is being properly lubricated is by the __________.
Answer_1: oil pressure at the lube oil pump discharge
Answer_2: lube oil strainer condition during cleaning and inspection
Answer_3: oil temperature indicated by the bearing thermometer
Answer_4: oil temperature leaving the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: If the flue gas oxygen content is too high, you should __________.
Answer_2: adjust the fuel oil service system
Answer_3: increase the forced draft fan speed

Question_Title: The firing range of a steam assisted fuel atomizer is regulated to cope with changes in the steam demand by varying the __________.
Answer_4: shape of the atomized fuel cone

Question_Title: Which steam plant watch operating condition will require priority attention over the other conditions listed?
Answer_2: High level lube oil storage tank
Answer_3: Low sewage tank chlorination section level
Answer_4: Low lube oil level in the operating feed pump

Question_Title: In a reaction turbine, the fixed blades function to __________.
Which of the conditions listed will provide 'blowdown' after the safety valve has lifted?
Answer_1: The valve is held open by a pressure pilot line.
Answer_2: Once the valve has opened, the existing steam pressure acts on an enlarged area creating an opening force greater than  that which opened the valve.
Answer_3: Once the valve lifts, the set opening pressure changes.
Answer_4: The safety valve opens gradually but with decreasing lift during the blowdown period.

Question_Title: Which of the following items should be checked each time the firing rate or forced draft pressure is adjusted?
The amount of fuel oil atomized by a steam atomization burner depends on the atomizing steam pressure, the fuel pressure and the __________.
Oil accumulation in boiler water would __________.
Answer_1: cause foaming and carryover from the boiler
Answer_3: prevent acid attack on the boiler tubes

Question_Title: Which steam plant watch operating condition will require priority attention over the other situations listed?
Answer_1: Low level in lube oil sludge tank
Answer_2: High level in lube oil in storage tank
Answer_3: Low level effluent in chlorination section of sewage tank
Answer_4: High bilge water level throughout engineroom

Question_Title: As found in a reduction gear drive system, thrust bearings  serve to __________.
Answer_1: transmit the force produced by the propeller to the structure of the ship
Answer_2: limit the radial movement of the shaft
Answer_4: hold the main engine in place

Question_Title: Proper bracing and support of the boiler safety valve escape piping is necessary to __________.
Answer_1: prevent condensate from accumulating in lines
Answer_2: prevent stressing of the safety valves
Answer_3: allow for back pressure formation in the line
Answer_4: prevent scale from lodging on the valve seat

Question_Title: If the steam flow input device to a two-element feedwater regulator valve fails, the regulator operates as a __________.
Which following condition could occur if the distilled water tank level indicator has been giving an erroneously high reading?
Answer_1: It is possible to lose vacuum if the level drops below the  make-up feed piping connection.
Answer_2: Past logbook entries must all be changed to indicate actual amounts.
Answer_3: The tank may overflow in the engine space causing unnecessary damage to electrical equipment.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: In a tubular-bowl type centrifugal lube oil purifier, any solids separated from the oil are __________.
Efficient boiler operation is indicated when the percentage by volume of carbon dioxide present in combustion gases is  between __________.
In a steam assist atomizer, the fuel oil/steam mix takes place entirely within the __________.
Foaming and moisture carryover in a boiler can be caused by an __________.
Answer_1: excessive amount of dissolved solids in the boiler water
Answer_2: excessive acidity level in the boiler water
Answer_3: inadequate amount of dissolved oxygen in the boiler water
Answer_4: inadequate alkalinity content in the boiler water

Question_Title: In a reaction turbine, the axial thrust due to the reactive force on the rotor blading drives the rotor __________.
Safety valves should be set to lift at or below the maximum working pressure allowed by the __________.
If the feedwater flow input device to a multi-element feedwater regulator fails, the valve will be controlled as a __________.
The term 'shrink' relates to a change in boiler water level which __________.
Answer_1: results when the feed rate becomes erratic during maneuvering
Answer_2: is due to the steam bubbles below the surface occupying a smaller volume
Answer_3: results in a rapid change of steam temperature
Answer_4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question_Title: The purpose of the air chamber at the discharge side of a steam reciprocating boiler feed pump is to __________.
Answer_2: reduce pulsations in the feed line
Answer_3: adjust the speed of the pump
Answer_4: provide for the addition of boiler compound

Question_Title: Which steam plant watch operating condition will require priority attention over the other situations listed?
Answer_1: Low level, lube oil gravity tank
Answer_2: High level, lube oil storage tank
Answer_3: Low level, chlorination section of the sewage tank
Answer_4: Low lube oil level to operating, chemical dosing pump

Question_Title: Generally, a 12% to 14% content of carbon dioxide in boiler flue gases indicates __________.
Answer_2: a high vanadium content in the fuel oil
Answer_3: proper combustion of the fuel oil

Question_Title: High temperature at the superheater outlet would be caused  by __________.
Foaming in boiler water is a result of __________.
What physical changes will occur to the steam within a boiler that has been properly bottled up when additional heat is applied?
Answer_1: The steam pressure and it specific volume will remain constant.
Answer_2: The pressure will increase and the volume will remain constant.
Answer_3: The pressure will remain constant and the specific volume will increase.
Answer_4: The pressure will increase and the specific volume will decrease.

Question_Title: Which of the following types of main propulsion turbines is most likely to require a dummy piston or cylinder arrangement to counterbalance axial thrust?
The bottom blow valve should be used to remove sludge and solids which have settled out of circulation after the boiler __________.
Answer_4: is being brought up to steaming pressure

Question_Title: Which of the listed mediums should be used when water washing a boiler?
If a boiler is brought on the line with its steam pressure  much higher than that of the boiler already on the line, there is danger of __________.
What steps should be taken if excessive steaming and vigorous bubbling occurs in the first section of the drain  inspection tank?
Answer_1: Systematically locate and isolate the faulty traps in the main steam piping to the turbogenerator.
Answer_2: Locate and secure any unnecessarily opened steam trap bypass valve.
Answer_3: Secure the fuel oil heater currently in use.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct and each step should be taken  promptly.

Question_Title: When you are transferring fuel oil to another double bottom tank precautions to be observed should include __________.
Answer_1: plugging gooseneck tank vents to prevent accidental overflow
Answer_2: maintaining a high transfer rate until a slight trickle of oil is observed flowing from the overflow line
Answer_3: sounding the tanks frequently and reducing the transfer rate while topping off
Answer_4: maintaining a supply of chemical dispersant to cleanup minor oil spills adjacent to the ship

Question_Title: What percentage of CO2 in a boiler flue gas analysis would  indicate perfect combustion?
Compared to the return flow oil burner system, an internally mixed steam atomizer requires __________.
Answer_4: greater turbulence in the air/oil stream

Question_Title: Foaming in boiler water is caused by __________.
What will occur if the level of the atmospheric drain tank  (fresh water collector) is permitted to continuously decrease while the vessel is underway?
Answer_1: The amount of condensate pumped to the contaminated evaporator will decrease.
Answer_2: The pressure of the contaminated steam system will drop once the tank is empty.
Answer_3: Make-up water will be automatically added to the tank via a vacuum drag arrangement.
Answer_4: There is a possibility of loosing vacuum in the main condenser.

Question_Title: In which type of turbine does a pressure drop exist through the fixed blades and the moving blades?
The purpose of the boiler bottom blow valve is to __________.
Answer_1: remove scum from the steam drum during steaming
Answer_2: control steam drum water level in an emergency
Answer_3: remove heavy solids from the water drum

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed would cause the stern tube lube oil head tank level to decrease?
Answer_1: An increase in sea water temperature.
Answer_2: The entry of sea water into the system.
Answer_3: The proper closure of a drain valve.
Answer_4: A worn or damaged stern tube seal.

Question_Title: The distilled water tank has been determined to be 75% full. The tank connection to the pneumericator has been disconnected for a maintenance check.  If the pneumericator operates correctly, the gage should indicate __________.
Answer_1: a value equal to three fourths of the  actual level
Answer_2: a false high reading possibly permitting the entry of air into the system
Answer_3: the minimum value display along the provided scales
Answer_4: the absence of mercury in the system

Question_Title: During an inport watch onboard a tank vessel while cargo operations are in progress, with the jacking gear engaged and running, you notice a 200 gallon drop in the reduction  gear lube oil sump level.  Which components or conditions should be checked immediately?
Answer_1: Inspect proper line-up of lube oil service pumps.
Answer_2: Confirm with deck officer that there was a change in vessel trim.
Answer_3: Verify the correct line-up of the lube oil transfer tank gravity overflow line.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: A steam propelled tank ship is operating at sea and despite troubleshooting the system by all the vessel's engineers, the transfer of fuel to the settler has not been possible and the settler will be empty in a few minutes.  As the watch engineer, your NEXT step should be to __________.
Answer_1: repeat all the steps that have been taken to determine the cause of the problem
Answer_2: call out other engineers for assistance
Answer_3: line up the diesel cold start system
Answer_4: stop the main engine and secure the generator

Question_Title: In which order should the chemical test analysis of boiler  flue gas samples be made?

Answer_1: Low level of lube oil in cleansing tank
Answer_2: High level of lube oil in storage tank
Answer_3: Low level effluent in chlorination section of sewage tank
Answer_4: High water level in main propulsion boiler

Question_Title: Foaming in a boiler can be caused by __________.
What steps should be taken if excessive steaming and vigorous bubbling occurs in the first section of the drain  inspection tank?
Answer_1: Secure the fuel oil heater currently in use.
Answer_2: Locate and open any unnecessarily closed steam trap bypass  valves.
Answer_3: Systematically locate and isolate any faulty traps in the contaminated steam system piping.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct and should be performed in the order as shown.

Question_Title: Which steam plant watch operating condition requires priority attention over the other conditions listed?
Answer_2: High lube oil storage tank level
Answer_3: Low sewage tank chlorination section level
Answer_4: Vapor issuing from deaerating heater vent

Question_Title: The guarding valve installed in a boiler bottom blow line prevents __________.
Answer_1: loss of steam and water from a steaming boiler due to a leaking bottom blow valve
Answer_2: leakage from the blow line back to an idle boiler
Answer_3: entry of seawater into idle boilers due to leaking skin and bottom blow valves

Question_Title: Which steam plant watch operating conditions requires priority attention over the other situations listed?
Answer_1: High level of lube oil in the refrigeration compressor
Answer_2: High water level in the deareating feedwater heater
Answer_3: Low level effluent in chlorination section of sewage tank
Answer_4: High level water in the fuel oil sludge tank

Question_Title: The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
A salinity indicator cell is located in the __________.
Answer_1: seawater side of the main condenser

Question_Title: A closed feedwater system when compared to an open feedweater system has the advantage(s) of __________.; ;  I. being capable of removing a greater percentage  of dissolved oxygen; II. having fewer components to maintain
A mechanical carbon dioxide recorder operates by detecting  the difference between air and the __________.
Answer_3: soot content of the flue gases
Answer_4: specific weight of the flue gases

Question_Title: Which of the following procedures represents the proper care of unused burners during low load conditions?
Answer_1: They should be removed, cleaned, refitted with smaller tips and reinstalled to be ready for immediate use.
Answer_2: They should be removed, cleaned and stored in the rack on the burner bench.
Answer_3: They may be left in place, with fuel and steam secured as long as they are not fouled.
Answer_4: They may be left in place, but only if they are clean and if fuel oil is recirculated to provide cooling.

Question_Title: For a gravity type lube oil system, a remote pressure sensing device is installed at the point of highest static head pressure on the main unit to enable the watch engineer to __________.; ;  I. be certain that the bearings are being adequately lubricated; II. determine if there is sufficient lube oil pressure to the main engine
Superheated steam is provided to operate the main steam turbine instead of saturated steam due to its __________.; ;  I. higher thermal energy per pound ; II. lesser erosive action on turbine blading

Operating a steam turbine propulsion unit at moderate speed, in an area with extremely cold seawater, and the main circulating pump providing full cooling water flow to the condenser will result in __________.
Answer_1: excellent plant efficiency due to higher attainable vacuum
Answer_2: increased plant efficiency due to increased condensate  depression
Answer_3: increased effectiveness of the air ejectors due to the increased main condenser vacuum
Answer_4: reduced plant efficiency due to the inability of the air ejectors to remove excessive air accumulation from the condenser

Question_Title: Before giving a boiler a bottom blow, it should be taken off the line and then the __________.
Answer_1: water level initially lowered below normal
Answer_2: boiler steam pressure should be increased
Answer_3: water level initially raise above normal
Answer_4: boiler air cock should be cracked

Question_Title: Which of the following locations could desuperheated steam be consider to occur?; ;  I. spray attemporator  ; II. main engine extractions
When testing boiler flue gas with a chemical absorption apparatus, to obtain accurate results  __________.
Answer_1: prevent any air from contaminating the gas sample
Answer_2: analyze for CO, O2 and CO2 in that order
Answer_3: run each analysis for at least 3 minutes
Answer_4: purge the apparatus with air before use

Question_Title: One function of burner atomization steam is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain a constantly high fuel pressure
Answer_2: prevent overheating of the atomizer when secured
Answer_3: maintain a constantly high fuel temperature
Answer_4: impart swirling motion to the oil for efficient combustion

Question_Title: A thick dark colored ring three to four inches wide forming at the steaming level in the boiler steam drum is usually evidence of __________.

Answer_1: High temperature steam is used in the whistle.
Answer_2: Condensate drains from the horn each time the whistle is blown.
Answer_3: A water separator is installed in the steam supply line.
Answer_4: The diaphragm separates condensate from steam.

Question_Title: An excessive power loss in a straight reaction turbine is commonly caused by __________.
When is the best time to give a boiler a bottom blow?
Answer_1: Just before placing it on the line.
Answer_2: Just after placing it on the line.
Answer_3: Just after taking it off the line.
Answer_4: When the boiler pressure has dropped to zero.

Question_Title: If the salinity indicator located in the main condensate pump discharge piping causes an alarm to sound there is a danger of __________.

The differential temperature of the main condenser circulating water during normal operation will be affected by __________.; ;  I.  Change in circulating pump speed  ; II.  The addition of make up feed
The absence of carbon monoxide in the flue gas of a boiler  indicates __________.
A boiler has a steam delivery capacity of 100,000 pounds per hour, and is equipped with four steam atomizing burners.  If the load range of the burners is 4 to 1, this means that __________.
Answer_1: the boiler may be operated down to 25,000 pounds per hour without securing any burners
Answer_2: the boiler may be operated down to 25,000 pounds per hour only after three burners are secured
Answer_3: if two burners are operating, steam output will be a minimum of 50,000 pounds per hour
Answer_4: all four burners combined can supply up to 400,000 pounds of steam per hour

Question_Title: Excessive alkalinity of boiler water will contribute to the possible problem of __________.
Answer_4: sodium sulfite reacting with dissolved oxygen

Question_Title: A vent line is provided on each water box of the main condenser in order to prevent __________.; ;  I. excess pressure from being exerted on the tube  sheet  ; II. vapor binding of the main circulating pump
An energy loss associated with a reaction turbine, but not  an impulse turbine, is __________.
Which of the precautions listed should be taken prior to blowing down a boiler water wall header?
Answer_1: Relieve the pressure and cool down the boiler.
Answer_2: Raise the water level above the surface blow.
Answer_3: Take the boiler out of service.
Answer_4: Reduce the firing rate of the boiler to its minimum.

Question_Title: Which condition would cause an excessively high level in the deaerating feedwater tank (Direct Contact) heater during maneuvering?
Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the distilled water tank.
Answer_2: Excessive recirculation of condensate to the auxilary condenser.
Answer_3: Improper operation of the live steam makeup valve supplying the auxiliary exhaust system.
Answer_4: Open bypass valve to the automatic makeup valve assembly.

Question_Title: If a salinity alarm system indicates 2.5 grains per gallon  at the main condensate pump discharge, your first action should be to __________.
Answer_1: blowdown the boilers and add make up water
Answer_2: chemically test the condensate for chloride content
Answer_3: reduce main engine speed and line up the exhaust to the auxiliary condenser
Answer_4: calibrate the salinity cell for accuracy

Question_Title: Air leaks to the boiler inner casing could cause __________.; ;  I. oxidation of furnace surfaces  ; II. less than adequate combustion temperatures
The differential temperature of the main condenser circulating water will be affected by __________.; ;  I.  change in sea temperature  ; II.  degree or amount of scaling or fouling
In a steam assist fuel oil atomizer, the steam pressure is  higher than the oil pressure at __________.
Babbitt metal is used to make __________.
A steam supplied heat exchanger will fail to maintain the designed quantity of heated liquid output if the  __________.; ;  I. steam supply absolute pressure is increased  ; II. tubes are leaking
Leakage over the ends of the blade tips, as a result of the pressure differential between each row of blades in a reaction turbine, can be reduced by __________.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: If a boiler is being steamed at a high firing rate, blowing down a water wall header without taking any other precaution could result in __________.
Answer_1: excessive strain on boiler blowdown lines
Answer_2: erratic operation of the automatic feedwater regulating valve
Answer_3: load imbalance between other boilers on the line

Question_Title: Scavenging air lines are connected to stack periscopes to __________.; ;  I. keep the mirrors clean  ; II. protect the optical devices from boiler combustion gases

A flue gas air heater, when installed in a boiler, would be accompanied by the operating characteristic(s) of __________.; ;  I. higher furnace temperatures than a boiler without an air heater  ; II. greater heat absorption per pound of fuel
If a ship is to be laid up for an indefinite period, the steam side of the main condenser should be __________.
Answer_4: pressurized to approximately 5 psig with nitrogen, 99.5% pure by volume

Question_Title: When required, the metal thickness of boilers can be tested by __________.; ;  I. non-destructive gauging  ; II. drilling, followed by visual inspection
The efficiency of boiler combustion can be measured by the  relative proportions of certain elements in the flue gases. The elements measured are __________.
Answer_3: carbon dioxide, oxygen, and carbon monoxide
Answer_4: nitrogen, carbon dioxide, and carbon monoxide

Question_Title: Why should the fuel oil be recirculated before lighting off a cold boiler?
Answer_1: To allow the fuel strainers to thoroughly clean the fuel.
Answer_2: To heat the fuel enough for proper atomization.
Answer_3: To ensure that all water is removed from the fuel.
Answer_4: To allow fuel pressure to buildup gradually.

Question_Title: The formation of a pit in a boiler tube is most likely to occur when __________.
Answer_4: the tube metal acts as a cathode

Question_Title: While bunkering your ship, the #3 double bottom tanks across are the last to be filled, with the centerline tanks being  relatively the largest.  These four tanks were empty at the beginning of bunkering, and each of the four transfer valves are the same size and have been opened the same number of turns.  In general, you would find that __________.
Answer_1: all four tanks will be topped at the same time
Answer_2: to top off the centerline tanks last, the valves to the outboard tanks should be choked closed until the static leg pressure begins to rise
Answer_3: to top off the centerline tanks last, the valves to these tanks should be choked closed until the static leg pressure begins to rise
Answer_4: it is best to top off the outboard tanks last as small tanks are easier to control when completing the filling of the tanks.

Question_Title: Excessive clearance between reaction blade tips and the turbine casing will result in __________.
Answer_2: a pressure drop across the blades
Answer_3: steam leakage over the blade tips

Question_Title: Blowing down a water wall header while steaming a boiler at a high firing rate could result in __________.
Answer_1: excessive strain on boiler blowdown lines
Answer_2: the thermo-hydraulic feedwater regulator valve slamming closed
Answer_3: a load imbalance between other boilers on the line
Answer_4: an interruption in the water circulation

Question_Title: In order to test the lifting pressure of the deaerating feed heater relief valve, you would __________.; ;  I.  close the auxiliary exhaust dump valves to the  main and auxiliary condensers  ; II. increase the set point of the reduced steam  pressure to the auxiliary steam system

For a gravity type lube oil system, a remote pressure sensing device is installed on the main unit to enable the watch engineer to __________.; ;  I. determine if there is sufficient lube oil flow to the main engine  ; II. be certain that the bearings are being adequately lubricated
Electrolytic corrosion in the condenser circulating water system can be reduced by __________.
Answer_1: decreasing the velocity of the circulating water through the waterboxes
Answer_2: using zinc plates in the waterboxes
Answer_3: chemically treating the condensate formed in the hotwell
Answer_4: decreasing the volume of water in the system

Question_Title: In order to prevent fires from occuring in drum type rotating air heaters __________.; ;  I. soot blowers need to be used when boiler is operating at low loads  ; II. stack gas temperatures should be maintained as low as possible
Which condition would cause a dangerously low level in the  deaerating feedwater tank (Direct Contact) heater during maneuvering?
Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the distilled water tank  via the automatic dump valve.
Answer_2: Excessive recirculation of condensate to the drain  inspection tank.
Answer_3: Improper operation of the auxiliary exhaust live steam dump valve.
Answer_4: Open bypass valve of the automatic/pneumatic makeup valve assembly.

Question_Title: Which test(s) are normally required to be performed during an annual inspection?; ;  I. An accumulation test  ; II. An evaporation rate test
Dissolved oxygen entrained in the feedwater entering a boiler can cause __________.
The differential temperature of the main condenser circulating water will be affected by __________.; ;  I.  decrease in circulating pump pressure  ; II.  degree or amount of scaling or fouling
Which of the listed procedures should be followed in preparing a main propulsion plant for getting underway?
Answer_1: Start the condensate and circulating pumps, check and start the lube oil system, engage the turning gear, then start the first-and second-stage air ejectors and the gland sealing.
Answer_2: Start the condensate and circulating pumps, check and start the lube oil system, start the air ejectors and the gland sealing system, then engage the turning gear.
Answer_3: Check and start the lube oil system, engage the turning gear, start the condensate and circulating pumps, start the gland sealing system and second-stage air ejector.
Answer_4: Check and start the lube oil system, start the second-stage air ejector and the gland sealing system, start the condensate and circulating pumps.

Question_Title: Under what operating conditions may water wall header drains be used for blowdown?
Answer_1: Only if the fires are secured and no steam is being generated.
Answer_2: During periods of carryover in the steam drum.
Answer_3: When the water level is out of sight in the gage glass.
Answer_4: When it is necessary for rapid drainage of the boiler.

Question_Title: A water-tube type boiler is more efficient than a fire-tube type boiler as __________.   I. a water-tube boiler requires less maintenance  II. the water-tube boiler produces more pounds of   steam per pound of boiler

A water-tube type boiler when compared to a fire-tube type boiler has an advantage of __________.; ;  I. a water-tube boiler requiring less chemical compounding  ; II. the fire-tube boiler providing a greater amount  of heat transfer to the water as the hot gases  pass through the tubes
Vapor blowing from the air ejector condenser vent may be caused by __________.
Answer_2: excess makeup feed being taken into the system

Question_Title: A vent line is provided on each water box of the main condenser in order to prevent __________.; ;  I. insufficent head pressure being developed on the  circulating pump discharge  ; II. inadequate heat transfer from developing during  normal operation
When burning fuel oil in a boiler, a high CO2 content is desired in the stack gas because __________.
Answer_1: more heat is liberated by the production of CO2 than CO
Answer_2: less excess air is required to produce CO2 than CO
Answer_3: efficient combustion is indicated even though the heat liberated is less than the heat produced by burning to CO
Answer_4: efficient combustion is indicated and the heat liberated is equal to the heat produced by the formation of CO

Question_Title: When recirculating fuel oil prior to cold boiler start-up,  which of the listed actions should be carried out?
Answer_3: Open the fuel oil meter bypass.
Answer_4: Open the fuel oil heater bypass.

Question_Title: Babbitt is a metal alloy commonly used for lining __________.
Machinery operating features are designed to help conserve energy.  Which of the following results will not contribute to energy conservation?
Prior to rolling the main turbines in preparation for getting underway, you should __________.
Answer_1: check the bilge level warning light to ensure it is extinguished
Answer_2: open the reduction gear casing access plates and inspect the lube oil spray pattern
Answer_3: circulate the lube oil through both banks of the cooler

Question_Title: Advances in metallurgy and improved methods of boiler tube  fabrication has led to lighter tubes with wall thicknesses  in the vicinity of 0.1 inches.  A characteristic of these thin walled tubes is __________.

Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the distilled water tank.
Answer_2: Excessive recirculation of condensate to the auxiliary condenser.
Answer_3: Improper operation of the condensate makeup valve.
Answer_4: Improper operation of the condenser level square root extractor.

Question_Title: Scale in the air ejector first-stage nozzle could cause a decrease in the __________.

A rapid loss of water from the deaerating feed tank and the sudden overflow of water from the distill tank would be caused by __________.; ;  I.  a sudden increase in steam demand while  maneuvering  ; II.  an unrestricted opening in the condensate spill  line from the deaerating feed tank

A flue gas air heater, when installed in a boiler would be accompanied by the operating characteristic(s) of __________.; ;   I. higher uptake temperatures than a boiler without an air heater   ; II. lower corrosion rates in the uptakes and economiser
When preparing to light off a cold boiler, the fuel oil should be recirculated until it is __________.
Answer_2: thoroughly cleaned by the fuel oil strainers

Question_Title: In a water-tube boiler, waterside scale formation is caused by __________.

Which of the following problems can occur from improper main turbine warm-up?
If it becomes necessary to remove water from a pressurized  main boiler, it should be directed __________.
Answer_2: overboard through the bottom blow line

Question_Title: Which condition would cause a dangerously low level in the deaerating feedwater tank (Direct Contact) heater as the vessel is increasing from maneuvering to sea speed?
Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the drain inspection tank via the automatic dump valve
Answer_2: Excessive recirculation of condensate to the drain transfer tank
Answer_3: Internal collapse of a rubber expansion joint located in the condensate pump suction line
Answer_4: Clogged "Y" strainer at the condensate inlet of the pneumatically operated condensate recirculating valve assembly

Question_Title: Excessive priming in a propulsion boiler can lead to severe damage of the __________.; ;  I. downcomers installed in a "D" type boiler  ; II. main steam turbine reduction gears
Insufficient cooling water circulation through air ejector  intercondensers and aftercondensers will cause __________.
Answer_1: decreased vacuum in the main condenser
Answer_2: overheating of the air ejector nozzles

Question_Title: The first and second stage air ejectors used with large sea water cooled steam, surface type condensers are designed to __________.; ;  I.  establish vacuum  ; II.  maintain vacuum
An explosion or flareback could occur in a boiler if __________.
Answer_1: too much excess air were supplied for combustion
Answer_2: the boiler firing rate exceeded the end point of circulation
Answer_3: the fuel being burned had been heated to the flash point
Answer_4: the firebox is not purged before attempting to light a fire

Question_Title: Boiler downcomers serve the purpose of __________.; ;  I. distributing water within the water or mud drum  ; II. increasing the end point of carry-over
Boiler water hardness is increased by __________.
Answer_2: scale forming salts in the feedwater
Answer_4: improper operation of the DC heater

Question_Title: A badly warped boiler water tube can be reworked and bent back into shape by __________.; ;  I. heating it with a torch and reforming it with a soft mallet  ; II. cold pressing it back into shape with a hydraulic jack
Turbine throttling losses can best be described as a loss of energy occurring __________.
Answer_1: as a result of friction created when steam passes through the nozzle block
Answer_2: whenever there is leakage of steam from one stage to another through the throttle valve packing gland
Answer_3: as a result of fluid friction caused by frequently  throttling the turbine wheel and blade speed
Answer_4: as steam passes through the steam admission valve and there is a drop in pressure without the performance of work

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the advantage  of using a small diameter boiler tube over a larger diameter tube?
Answer_1: Small diameter tubes reduce gas turbulence in the tube banks.
Answer_2: Small diameter tubes reduce the heating surface area.
Answer_3: Small diameter tubes are less affected by the insulating properties of soot.
Answer_4: Small diameter tubes provide for greater heat transfer rates.

Question_Title: The steam drum installed in "D" type boilers serve to provide __________.; ;  I. a water reserve necessary for proper boiler  operation  ; II. an area for steam and moisture to separate
If the cooling water flow through the air ejector intercondensers and aftercondensers is inadequate, which of the problems listed will occur?
Answer_3: Loop seal will overheat and flash.

Question_Title: In order to test the lifting pressure of the deaerating feed heater relief valve, you would __________.; ;  I.  place a gag on the relief valve  ; II.  increase the set point of the reduced steam pressure to the auxiliary steam system
Before an explosion can occur in a boiler furnace, there must be an accumulation of unburned fuel, sufficient air to form an explosive mixture, and a __________.
Answer_1: space large enough for the explosion to occur
Answer_2: ground in the burner ignition electrode
Answer_3: high steam demand on the boiler
Answer_4: source of ignition for the explosive mixture

Question_Title: The vent line from the main condender water boxes was not opened when the waterside was recharged. This would __________.; ; I.  lead to a build up of pressure on the tube sheet  of greater than 40 psig.; II.  prevent the design vacuum from being attained  under normal operating conditions at sea
Scale formation on the waterside of boiler tubes, is generally produced by __________.
Answer_1: the salts of calcium and magnesium
Answer_4: accumulations of phosphates in the feedwater

Question_Title: Burning of the firesides of tube in a water tube boiler is a direct result of __________.; ; I. flame impingement  ; II. excessive fuel atomization
Which of the following statements represents an example of a throttling loss in a turbine?
Answer_1: Friction as steam passes over the walls of the nozzles.
Answer_2: Steam leaving the last stages of the turbine.
Answer_3: Steam passing through a steam admission valve.
Answer_4: Steam leaking over the tips of fixed and moving blades.

Question_Title: The greatest resistance to heat transfer from the fireside  to the waterside of a water-tube boiler takes place in the  __________.
Answer_2: soot buildup directly on the tube exterior
Answer_3: gas film layer surrounding the tube
Answer_4: moving water and steam inside the tube

Question_Title: Which condition would cause a dangerously low level in the deaerating feedwater tank (Direct Contact) heater as the vessel is increasing from maneuvering to sea speed?
Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the drain inspection tank via the automatic dump valve.
Answer_2: Excessive recirculation of condensate to the drain  transfer tank.
Answer_3: Improper operation of the auxiliary exhaust live steam dump valve.
Answer_4: Clogged "Y" strainer at the air supply of the pneumatically operated condensate makeup valve assembly.

Question_Title: Excessively hot water returning to an atmospheric drain tank indicates __________.
Answer_1: the condensate recirculating valve is open
Answer_2: there is a loss of circulating water
Answer_3: a steam trap is hung open

Question_Title: An accumulation of slag build up on the boiler furnace floor will cause __________. ;  I. peeling of furnace brickwork ;  II. overheating of the furnace floor
The most troublesome corrosive substances in boiler water are oxygen and __________.
Throttling the burner air register of a lit burner could result in __________.
Answer_1: carbon deposits on the register doors
Answer_2: carbon deposits on the furnace walls
Answer_3: too much excess air for combustion
Answer_4: excess combustion temperature in the furnace

Question_Title: Failure to remove calcium and magnesium from feedwater before it reaches the boiler can result in tube __________.
Which of the effects listed describes the changes in the velocity and pressure of the steam as it passes through a nozzle?
In a watertube boiler, circulation is developed by the difference in the __________.; ;  I. tube length and various diameters  ; II. densities of the hot and cold water

A ruptured boiler tube should be removed by __________.; ;  I. spliting the remaining tube sections with a safety ripping chisel  ; II. cutting out most of the tube and then allowing the remaining portion to disintegrate as the boiler is normally fired
Which of the conditions listed may be indicated by the lifting of the DC heater relief valve?
Answer_1: A malfunctioning auxiliary exhaust make-up steam  regulating valve.
Answer_3: Low back pressure in the auxiliary exhaust line.
Answer_4: Low water level continually maintained in the DC heater.

Question_Title: A set of first and second stage air ejectors are used with a large sea water cooled steam condenser. If the first stage air ejector is not in operation __________.; ;  I.  vacuum can not be established   ; II.  maximum operating vacuum can not be maintained
Sediment in fuel oil will cause __________.
The distance piece in a boiler burner register assembly, provides for adjustment of the __________.
Answer_1: diffuser to attain the desired amount of secondary air flow
Answer_2: atomizer position to obtain the best mixing of air and oil
Answer_3: quantity of the primary and secondary air cones for best air flow
Answer_4: total volume of air and fuel admitted through the register

Question_Title: The vent line from the main condender water boxes was not opened when the waterside was recharged. This would __________.; ;  I.  lead to vapor binding of the main circulating  pump  ; II.  contribute to a higher than normal condensate  temperature entering the air ejector condenser
Which steam plant watch operating condition will require priority attention over the other situations listed?
Answer_1: Low oil level in the steering gear sumps
Answer_2: High lube oil level in all storage tanks
Answer_3: Low level effluent in chlorination section of sewage tank
Answer_4: Low bilge water levels throughout entire engineroom

Question_Title: An intermediate chamber is used in conjunction with labyrinth packing on a compound turbine for sealing steam __________.
Answer_1: leak off during periods of internal vacuum
Answer_2: supply during periods of low internal pressure
Answer_3: supply during periods of high internal pressures

Question_Title: Before giving a boiler a surface blow, you should __________.
Answer_1: raise the water level 2 or 3 inches above normal
Answer_2: lower the water level to the normal level
Answer_3: reduce the boiler firing rate to the minimum
Answer_4: take the boiler off the line and let it cool 1 hour

Question_Title: If flaking of a hard alloy tube is noticed while the tube is being expanded into the tube sheet, this would indicate that __________.; ;  I. excessive pressure is being applied to the mandral   ; II. the incorrect mandral is being used

Answer_1: condensate supplied to the DC heater
Answer_3: feedwater recirculated from the feed pump
Answer_4: makeup feed introduced to the system

Question_Title: Sediment in fuel oil will cause __________.
Answer_1: wear in the fuel oil pumps
Answer_2: clogging of the fuel oil heaters

Question_Title: In an air register assembly, the largest quantity of air passes through the __________.
Answer_2: stationary air foil or bladed cone

Question_Title: Carbon dioxide dissolved in boiler water is dangerous in a  modern power boiler because the gas __________.
Answer_1: forms carbonic acid which attacks the watersides
Answer_2: breaks the magnetic iron oxide film inside boiler tubes
Answer_3: combines with sulfates to cause severe waterside pitting
Answer_4: combines with oxygen to cause severe waterside scaling

Question_Title: A convergent-divergent nozzle functions to __________.
Answer_3: decrease steam velocity and increase steam pressure
Answer_4: decrease the specific volume of steam

Question_Title: Before commencing a surface blow, the boiler __________.
Answer_2: water level should be lowered to the surface blow line
Answer_3: water drum should be checked for sludge
Answer_4: water level should be raised 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.6 cm) above normal

Question_Title: The purpose of the boiler furnace corbel is to __________.;  ; I. protect the water drum from direct flame impingement ; II. support the furnace wall
In a boiler equipped with an automatic feedwater regulator, erratic variations in the water level could be caused by __________.
Answer_1: high solids content and foaming in the drum

Question_Title: A boiler water tube would burn out as a result of __________.; ;  I. direct flame impingement  ; II. excessive soot accumulation
Water washing of the water-tube boiler firesides is necessary to maintain efficient operation, but can lead to __________.;  ; I. sulfuric acid corrosion  ; II. deterioriation of the refactory

Answer_1: leaving the registers open on a hot boiler
Answer_2: load changes on the boiler while answering bells
Answer_3: allowing the furnace to cool too slowly
Answer_4: cold feedwater passing through the boiler economizer

Question_Title: The two most common causes of boiler corrosion attributable to boiler water are dissolved oxygen and __________.

Answer_3: loss of load with resultant turbine overspeed

Question_Title: Before giving a boiler a surface blow, you must __________.
Answer_1: open the skin valve on the blowdown line
Answer_2: secure the fires in the furnace
Answer_3: lower the water level to a half glass
Answer_4: increase the boiler steam pressure above normal

Question_Title: The purpose of firebrick in a water tube boiler furnace is to __________. ;  ; I. protect the tubes from direct flame impingement   ; II. confine the combustion gases within the furnace

Answer_4: open the makeup feed vacuum drag line

Question_Title: Thin sheets of mica are installed in boiler gage glasses to __________.   I. reduce the possibility of the glass from becoming   etched  II. limit the possibility of glass being blown out   into the fire room

Answer_1: To prevent cracking the furnace refractory.
Answer_3: To allow more rapid furnace cooling.

Question_Title: In a boiler where the drum water level is automatically controlled, which of the following conditions could cause erratic variations in the water level?
Answer_1: High total dissolved solids content and foaming in the drum.
Answer_4: Inability to maintain or correct high feedwater temperature.

Question_Title: Sliding contact bearings are classified into two general categories: journal bearings and __________.

When the rate of heat transfer through tube walls is so reduced that the metal becomes overheated, which of the following conditions will result in the boiler?
The purpose of the water tube boiler furnace refractory is to __________. ;  ; I. protect the water drum from direct flame impingement  ; II. reinforce and strengthen the casing
Saltwater contamination of condensate could occur at which  component?

The internal feed pipe in a D-type marine boiler provides __________. ;  ; I. distribution of feed water evenly throughout the steam drum ; II. guidance of the feedwater towards the downcomers as it enters the drum

Answer_1: plugging gooseneck tank vents to prevent accidental overflow
Answer_2: maintaining a high transfer rate until a slight trickle of  oil is observed flowing from the overflow line
Answer_3: sounding the tanks frequently and reducing the transfer rate as the level approaches maximum fill
Answer_4: maintaining a supply of chemical dispersant to cleanup minor oil spills adjacent to the ship

Question_Title: The main reason for keeping an operating boiler burner register fully open while steaming is to prevent __________.

Answer_3: tripping the throttle trip by hand

Question_Title: In automatic combustion control systems, increasing or decreasing a loading pressure by a set amount is called __________.

Once a huddling chamber type safety valve has begun to initially open, it will then pop open due to the __________.; ;  I. expansion of the steam leaving the nozzle  ; II. forces exerted on the projecting lips
A common gas dissolved in water contributing to the greatest amount of corrosion in a condensate system is __________.

In a water tube boiler, waterwall tubes are effectively used to __________. ;  ; I. decrease the amount of refractory material necessary in non-waterwall installations  ; II. allow for significant increases in the combustion rates

Answer_1: filtering and purifing before being pumped to the burners
Answer_2: purging of any large air bubbles that have formed
Answer_3: heating to allow water and sediment to settle out
Answer_4: heating to the correct temperature for proper atomization

Question_Title: Shortly after shutting off the fuel to a boiler which is to be secured, the __________.
A sudden increase in boiler water hardness or chloride content could indicate __________.
Answer_3: bilge water leaking into the makeup feed tanks

Question_Title: Thin sheets of mica are installed in boiler gage glasses to __________.  ; ;  I. reduce the effects of thermal exposure on the glass;  II. enhance the ability of the operator to observe the water level from a distance
The most critical period of main turbine operation is during cold start-up, rather than hot shutdown because __________.
Answer_1: lubricant film thickness during start-up is considerably less than the dimensions of gear surface irregularities
Answer_2: differential expansion can result from the temperature difference between the rotor casing and foundation
Answer_3: the danger of blade erosion damage from steam impingement is greater during start-up
Answer_4: harmonic vibrations associated with critical speed can easily be reached during start-up

Question_Title: An accumulation test is performed on the boiler to determine the suitability of the safety valves and the set points __________.;  ;  I. if the boiler normal operating pressure is permanently reduced  ; II. when the steam generating capacity is increased
Carbon dioxide formed by improper chemical treatment in the boiler, may cause corrosion in the __________.
Which of the conditions listed should be attended to first  upon taking over the watch and why should this step be taken?
Answer_1: Excessive dumping of feedwater to the drain inspection tank. Failure to prevent will cause overflow and loss of distilled water.
Answer_2: Salted up evaporator draining to bilge.  Must immediately be restarted to insure sufficient distilled and potable water  quantities.
Answer_3: High level in fuel oil sludge tank.  Necessary to pump contents to settler to prevent overflow of the tank into the bilges.
Answer_4: Broken air line to condensate makeup actuator.  Repair or place in bypass control to insure proper levels throughout  condensate and feedwater systems.

Question_Title: The main reason for having a low suction line on the fuel  oil service or settling tanks is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent loss of suction during rough weather
Answer_2: decrease suction head on the pump
Answer_3: increase the amount of fuel available for use

Question_Title: What is the purpose of the movable air doors in an air register?
Answer_1: Regulate the temperature of air entering the furnace.
Answer_2: Function to open and close the register.
Answer_3: Maintain airflow across the forced draft fan.

Question_Title: The internal feed pipe in a D-type marine boiler provides __________. ; ;  I. distribution of feed water evenly throughout the water drum  ; II. guidance and distribution of chemicals throughout the steam drum

A leaking boiler desuperheater may be indicated by a/an __________.; ; I. gradual, but continual rise in phosphate readings in only one boiler  ; II. inability to maintain normal working pressure in the auxiliary steam system

Answer_1: rotor design and the amount of thrust to be counteracted
Answer_3: the length and diameter of the equalizing line
Answer_4: the volume of the exhaust trunk and pressure drop over the last stage

Question_Title: The combustion air pressure is increased when using the steam soot blowers to 'blow tubes' in order to __________.; ;  I. aid in the process of removing soot deposits  ; II. prevent the steam from extinguishing the fires
If the salinity indicator registers high salinity in the hotwell, you should suspect the cause to be __________.
Answer_2: leaking tubes in the third-stage heater
Answer_3: high water pressure in the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: Corrosion of the flue gas side of the economiser can be a result of the __________.;   ; I. stack gas temperature being lower than the dew point  ; II. feedwater temperature being excessively cool
Which of the following actions should be taken FIRST when  water is found in the fuel oil settling tank?
Answer_1: Shift pump suction to an alternate settling tank.
Answer_2: Shift to alternate or standby fuel oil service pump.
Answer_3: Sound the settling tank with water indicating paste.
Answer_4: Determine the extent of water contamination by reading the pneumercators.

Question_Title: A boiler desuperheater is installed in high pressure boilers to  __________.   I. maintain the essential flow of feedwater   into the drum  II. raise the feedwater temperature entering the steam   drum
The axial position of a turbine rotor is controlled by the thickness of the __________.

Answer_2: remove floating impurities from boiler water
Answer_3: disrupt circulation in a steaming boiler
Answer_4: have no effect on boiler alkalinity

Question_Title: When starting a turbogenerator in an automated plant, you  must provide lube oil pressure to the unit by means of __________.
Answer_1: a line from the other generator
Answer_2: a line from the gravity tank
Answer_4: the hand operated or auxiliary lube oil pump

Question_Title: When preparing to hydrostatically test water-tube boilers,  you should __________.
Answer_1: fill the boiler with water not less than 70F (21.1C), nor more than 160F (71.1C)
Answer_2: make arrangements for simultaneously testing main and auxiliary steam stops with water and steam pressure
Answer_3: remove all inspection plates and manhole covers as required by the marine inspector
Answer_4: have the boiler warmed to a temperature not exceeding 100F (37.8C)

Question_Title: The relieving capacity of the superheater safety valves is considered to be insufficient when the working pressure of the boilers is __________.; ;  I. increased  ; II. Decreased

When heated, fuel oil will __________.
If one burner of a group of operating burners in a steaming boiler is cut out, the register doors for that burner should be __________.
The proper oil inlet temperature for centrifuging lube oil should be __________.
A disk-type centrifuge is set up for continuous use on the main turbine lube oil system.  In order to batch centrifuge a small quantity of diesel oil from a storage tank, __________.
Answer_1: the speed of the centrifuge must be increased
Answer_2: another centrifuge should be used to avoid the possibility of contaminating the main lube oil system
Answer_3: the number of conical disks must be increased
Answer_4: the feed temperature must be decreased to 100F

Question_Title: A rotor position micrometer measures rotor __________.
Answer_1: radial position relative to the casing
Answer_2: radial position relative to the micrometer
Answer_3: axial position relative to the casing
Answer_4: axial position relative to the micrometer

Question_Title: Which of the listed methods can be used to blowdown a boiler without securing the fires?
Answer_2: Bottom blow from the mud drum over the side.
Answer_3: Blowdown the rear water wall header.
Answer_4: Blowdown the front water wall header.

Question_Title: Scavenging air pressure is provided to the steam soot blowers to __________.; ;  I. keep steam from accumulating in the soot blowing element while another element is being operated  ; II. prevent corrosive combustion gases from entering the elements when the system is secured
Which of the conditions listed could prevent a centrifugal  condensate pump from developing its rated capacity?
Answer_1: Venting the pump to the vacuum side of the condenser.
Answer_2: Closing the water seal line to the packing gland.
Answer_3: Flooding of the main condenser hotwell.
Answer_4: Operating the pump with a positive suction head.

Question_Title: As lube oil absorbs moisture its dielectric strength can be expected to __________.
Answer_3: increase with an increase in viscosity
Answer_4: increase with a decrease in viscosity

Question_Title: Using an oil temperature-viscosity chart, you can determine the recommended __________.
Answer_1: fuel oil flash point for best combustion

Question_Title: While standing your engine room watch at sea, you notice the D.C. heater level is gradually dropping as indicated by the remote level indicator.  Which of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Do nothing as this is a common marine plant occurrence.
Answer_2: Immediately open the automatic make-up feed bypass valve.
Answer_3: Check the condensate level in both the main and auxiliary  condenser hotwells.

Question_Title: What steps should be taken if large quantities of fuel oil are found in the drain inspection tank?
Answer_1: Change over to the standby fuel oil heater.
Answer_2: Open steam trap bypass of the fuel oil heater that is on line.
Answer_3: Secure the lube oil purifier and its associated heater.

Question_Title: After starting the main lube oil pump in a gravity-type lube oil system, you should verify that the gravity tanks are full by __________.
Answer_1: looking at the overflow sight glass
Answer_4: observing the flow from the bearings

Question_Title: Journal bearings used with modern turbine rotors are manufactured in two halves in order to __________.
Answer_1: permit removal of the bearing without removing the rotor from the turbine
Answer_2: facilitate interchanging with other bearing halves
Answer_3: maintain axial alignment and reduce thrust
Answer_4: provide for positive oil flow at all loads

Question_Title: The boiler gage glasses should be periodically blowndown to __________.
Answer_2: provide water samples for the second assistant
Answer_3: maintain the proper water level in the steam drum
Answer_4: remove any sediment from the glass

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions must be carried out before the superheating of saturated steam can occur in a boiler?
Answer_1: The firing rate of the boiler must be increased.
Answer_2: The flow of feedwater to the boiler must be increased.
Answer_3: The steam must be removed from contact with the water from which it was generated.
Answer_4: The boiler pressure must be raised.

Question_Title: The main condenser is losing 2" Hg vacuum every 5 minutes.  In an hour, the absolute pressure will have increased by approximately __________.
Air in the main condenser is harmful because it will __________.
Answer_1: decrease the turbine exhaust steam pressure
Answer_2: decrease the vacuum in the main condenser
Answer_3: cause heat to be transferred too rapidly
Answer_4: cause the turbine casing to warp and bow

Question_Title: The relieving pressure of the superheater safety valves is permitted to be reset without exchanging the valves when the working pressure of the boilers is __________.; ;  I. increased  ; II. Decreased
Bunker "C" fuel oil is heated prior to atomization to __________.
Which of the conditions listed can cause the crackling sound of a water hammer?
Answer_1: Steam rushing over the water in a pipe, resulting in the sudden change of steam bubbles rupturing on the internal surface.
Answer_2: The pressure of the steam striking a wave of water moving through the pipe in the opposite direction.
Answer_3: The rapid expansion of water passing through a pipe and flashing into steam as a result of the constant pressure drop.
Answer_4: The flow of high velocity steam entrained with drops of water, striking another wave of water or piping bend in the system with considerable force.

Question_Title: A back pressure trip on an auxiliary turbine functions to secure the device if the __________.
Answer_2: discharge pressure of a turbine driven pump is excessive
Answer_3: gland seal leakoff pressure is too high
Answer_4: exhaust pressure rises above a preset limit

Question_Title: Which of the listed order of valves represents the proper  installation of the main feedwater supply line to a marine propulsion boiler?
How is the axial clearance indicator used on a turbine?
Answer_1: The axial clearance indicator is inserted in the depth gauge well until it rests on the reference boss, and the reading  is noted.
Answer_2: After the axial clearance indicator is screwed into contact with the rotor, shims are placed in the clearance well, and the thickness is measured.
Answer_3: The arm of the axial clearance indicator is pushed so contact is made with a rotor, and the reading on the scale  is noted.
Answer_4: A bridge gauge is placed across the bearing, and the gap between bridge and rotor is measured by the axial clearance indicator.

Question_Title: The boiler water gage glasses should be blown down  __________.
Answer_1: when you are in doubt about the water level
Answer_2: twice each day on the midnight and afternoon watches
Answer_3: every 12 hours of steady boiler steaming operation
Answer_4: when the boiler water level changes in a steaming boiler

Question_Title: Which of the listed items are the two most commonly used opposing forces involved in the operation of a constant pressure feed pump governor?
Answer_1: Steam inlet pressure and pump discharge pressure.
Answer_2: Pilot valve steam pressure and control valve spring pressure.
Answer_3: Steam inlet pressure and adjusting spring tension.
Answer_4: Pump discharge pressure and adjusting spring compression.

Question_Title: If the condensate in the loop seal of the intercondenser is lost, __________.
Answer_1: no condensate will flow through the system
Answer_2: some air will be drawn into the main condenser
Answer_3: the air ejector will not operate
Answer_4: the air ejector will become overheated

Question_Title: The boiler feedwater regulating valve will vary the unity relationship between steam flow and feedwater flow during __________. ; ;  I. changes in load ; II. continuous periods of overload operation
Fuel oil is heated before atomizing to __________.
46 CFR requires that __________.
Answer_1: the OCMI be notified of repairs to  boilers and unfired pressure vessels
Answer_2: the fuel burned in boilers of tankships shall have a flash  point of not less than 140F
Answer_3: a half-pint sample of each load of fuel be drawn and sealed at the time of supply and preserved until that fuel is exhausted

Question_Title: Water circulation in a water-tube boiler is a result of the __________.
Answer_1: difference between the area and length of the water-tubes
Answer_2: differences in density within the circulated water
Answer_3: velocity added to the water by the feed pump
Answer_4: siphon action of steam leaving the drum

Question_Title: Properly filing the ends of carbon ring segments removed from a turbine gland will __________.
Answer_1: reduce the ring segment end clearance
Answer_2: reduce the clearance between the assembled ring segments and shaft
Answer_3: increase the possibility of steam leakage past the rings
Answer_4: increase the possibility of air leakage into the turbine

Question_Title: To properly blowdown a boiler gage glass, you should __________.
Answer_1: blow through the top (steam) connection first
Answer_2: blow through the bottom (water) connection first
Answer_3: never disconnect the chains that connect the upper and lower cut out valves
Answer_4: take up snugly on upper and lower gage glass packing nuts prior to blowing down

Question_Title: Noise caused by condensate striking bends or fittings in a  pipe line is called __________.
Prior to taking on bunkers in a deep tank previously used to carry dry cargo, you should __________.
Answer_1: test the fixed fire extinguishing system in that tank
Answer_2: inspect and test the tank heating coils for damage
Answer_3: install a quick-closing valve in the sounding tube
Answer_4: chemically clean and gas free the tank

Question_Title: The double bottom tanks on your vessel are used to store heavy fuel oil.  In general, there are six sets of tanks with the port/starboard outboard tanks being an average 33% to 50% capacity smaller than the port/starboard centerline  tanks.  Also, the tanks forward are smaller than those aft, with the 3's and 5's being relatively the largest double bottoms.  In general, with a minimum amount of fuel oil on  board, the bunkering process should be to fill the __________.
Answer_1: aft tanks, then the midship tanks, finally all forward tanks to use the increase in pressure to force the oncoming fuel  forward
Answer_2: forward tanks, then the 3's and 5's, and finish with the aft tanks moving successively aft to bring the draft at the bow down as quickly as possible
Answer_3: forward tanks, then fill the aft tanks, and complete the bunkering by filling the outboard then centerline 3's and 5's to avoid high pressure in static overflow leg
Answer_4: forward then the aft tanks, and completing the process by with the centerline, then the outboard 3's and 5's, as small tanks are easier to control when topping off

Question_Title: The primary purpose of the heater used in a pressurized fuel oil system is to __________.
Answer_1: reduce fuel oil viscosity for proper atomization
Answer_2: reduce fuel oil specific gravity for better combustion
Answer_3: increase the fire point of the fuel oil
Answer_4: improve the flash point of the fuel oil

Question_Title: On a main propulsion turbine bearing, the readings obtained with a bridge gage represent the __________.
If the engineer on watch has reason to doubt the accuracy of the water level showing in the boiler gage glass, he should FIRST __________.
Decreasing condensor vacuum is found to be caused by a loss of  the condensate loop seal.  To reestablish the loop seal, you should __________.
Answer_1: crack open the recirculating line from the DC heater to the condenser hotwell
Answer_2: close in on the recirculating line from the DC heater to the condenser hotwell
Answer_3: bypass the regulating valve in the condensate recirculating line until the loop refills
Answer_4: close the loop seal valve until the loop refills and reopen slowly

Question_Title: While on watch aboard a 900 psi (6.2 MPa) steam vessel, you suddenly hear a loud, piercing, high-pitched noise.  Which  of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Vacate everyone from the engine room immediately, as this is the preliminary signal that CO2 is about to be released.
Answer_2: Rapidly move towards the direction of the noise to  investigate the probable source.
Answer_3: Cautiously move towards the source of the noise, sweeping the beam of your flash light ahead of you.
Answer_4: Move away from the noise to find a broom, then cautiously advance, sweeping the handle ahead of you to locate the source.

Question_Title: Fuel oil is heated before it reaches the burners to __________.

Answer_3: removing all grease from around the bolts
Answer_4: painting the sliding surfaces to prevent corrsion

Answer_2: a steam trap is hung open

Question_Title: During a maintenance inspection of a turbogenerator, the integral turbine wheels are tapped with a hammer.  What condition may be indicated by a dead sound?

Question_Title: Steam drains from fuel oil heating coils can be returned to the condensate and feedwater system __________.
Answer_1: through a direct connection to the heating drain header
Answer_2: through a vacuum drag line connection to the fuel heater
Answer_3: after being collected in the drain inspection tank
Answer_4: after first passing through the DC heater

Question_Title: All oil-fired main propulsion burners with automatic safety control systems must automatically close the burner valve when___________.
Answer_1: flame in boiler furnace is confirmed

Question_Title: A bridge gage is used to measure __________.

Answer_1: check pressure pulsations in the feed line
Answer_2: prevent backflow of water from the boiler in the event of a feed pump failure
Answer_3: provide feed pump positive discharge head
Answer_4: reduce feed pump discharge pressure loading

Answer_1: a modulating pressuretrol, sensing both steam and temperature

Answer_4: an electrode sensing high water level

Question_Title: A malfunction in the DC heater is indicated by __________.
Answer_1: the boiler requiring excessive amounts of oxygen scavenging chemicals

Answer_3: condensate coming in contact with steam inside the heater
Answer_4: air flowing from vent condenser vent

Question_Title: While standing watch in the engine room, power is suddenly lost, but the main breaker has been observed to not have 'tripped' with the on line generator still running.  As the watch engineer you should_________.
Answer_1: attempt to re-establish power with the 'on-line' generator
Answer_2: start up the stand by generator and trip the breaker to the 'on-line' generator, before attempting to place the stand-by generator on line
Answer_3: only need to trip all non-critial breakers before trying to re-establish power
Answer_4: standby for orders from the bridge

Question_Title: When securing a fuel oil heater you should __________.
Answer_1: open the fuel oil temperature regulator bypass, widely
Answer_2: cut out the steam before securing the oil flow
Answer_3: stop the oil flow and then cut out the steam
Answer_4: remove all fuel oil pressure from the system by securing the service pump

Question_Title: While standing watch in the engine room, power is suddenly lost, but the main breaker has been observed to not have 'tripped'.  The standby generator has automatically started, but when attempting to parallel it with the 'on-line unit' the synchroscope begins to rotate counterclockwise the more you increase generator speed.  As the watch engineer you should_________.
Answer_1: attempt to re-establish power with the 'on-line' generator
Answer_2: standby for orders from the bridge
Answer_3: trip all non-critial breakers before trying to re-establish power
Answer_4: trip the 'on-line' generator and its breaker, before attempting to place the stand-by generator on line

Question_Title: Thrust clearances indicated on a main propulsion turbine bearing clearance diagram are __________.
Answer_1: normal clearances for operation under routine steaming conditions
Answer_2: cold clearances to which the bearing was initially set
Answer_3: minimum clearances that indicate when bearing renewal is necessary
Answer_4: maximum clearances which should not be exceeded when the turbine is warmed up

Question_Title: On a boiler equipped with pilot actuated safety valves, which of the valves listed will be actuated first?
Answer_3: Pilot actuated safety valve for the superheater safety valve
Answer_4: Pilot actuated safety valve for the drum safety valve

Question_Title: Standing watch underway at sea in the engine room there is a complete loss of electrical power.  When power is restored, the steering gear pump motor will___________.
Answer_1: have to be restarted from the steering gear room
Answer_2: have to be reset before restarting

Question_Title: While standing watch underway in the engineroom, failure of the normal power supply will cause the emergency generator to be placed on the line by the __________.
Excessive condensate depression can result in __________.
The fins on the tubes of a fin type fuel oil heater are provided to __________.

While underway at sea, a mechanical malfunction in one of the ship's service generators operating in parallel, requires that you must secure that generator.  In order to prevent a possible overload to the remaining generator, which of the following sequential courses of action should be taken?
Answer_1: Trip the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker and prime mover throttle trip.
Answer_2: Trip all nonvital distribution feeder circuit breakers, decrease the load on that generator using the governor, trip the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker, and trip the prime mover throttle.
Answer_3: Trip the malfunctioning generator's circuit breaker and distribution feeder circuit breakers.
Answer_4: Trip all nonvital distribution feeder circuit breakers, the malfunctioning prime mover turbine throttle trip, and the generator circuit breaker.

Question_Title: The thrust bearing wear on a turbine may be determined by checking the __________.
One of the important functions of the superheater safety valves is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain a constant steam flow in the desuperheater
Answer_4: maintain a constant steam flow in the auxiliary steam line

Question_Title: While standing watch in the engine room which of the following actions should be taken to reestablish a 'blown' air ejector loop seal?
Answer_1: Decrease the steam pressure to the air ejector nozzels.
Answer_2: Shut off the steam to the second stage air ejector momentarily then open it again.
Answer_3: Momentarily close the valve in the loop seal line, then reopen slowly.
Answer_4: Increase the condensate flow through the air ejector.

Question_Title: Excessive condensate depression will result in __________.
Answer_1: increased oxygen rejected in the condenser
Answer_4: increased air absorption by the condensate

Question_Title: The consideration that is MOST important when determining the minimum temperature of fuel oil in storage tanks is the __________.
While underway on watch in the engine room of a steam vessel, the proper valve positions for controlling feedwater to the boiler using the auxiliary feed system should be __________.
Answer_1: the auxiliary check valve fully open and the stop valve used to regulate the amount of flow
Answer_2: the stop valve fully open and the auxiliary check valve used to regulate the amount of flow
Answer_3: the stop and check valves fully open and the feed pump speed used to regulate the amount of flow
Answer_4: the check valve fully open and the stop valve regulated by the feedwater regulator

Answer_2: with a blank installed in the high pressure turbine steam inlet

Answer_4: with the high pressure turbine exhausting directly to the main condenser

Question_Title: If a boiler superheater safety valve is leaking at normal working pressure, the quickest method of determining and possibly solving the problem is to __________.
Answer_1: blow out the valve by several short lifts with the hand lifting gear
Answer_2: fully open the superheater safety drain valve for several seconds
Answer_3: lower the firing rate until the leakage stops
Answer_4: raise the firing rate until the leakage stops

Question_Title: Fuel oil settling tanks are used to __________.
Answer_3: facilitate the stripping of sludge and water

Question_Title: In the majority of marine power plants, the fuel oil heater installations are divided into several units because __________.
Answer_1: more heating is required for lower loads
Answer_2: auxiliary steam is better utilized in this system
Answer_3: proper plant operation can be continued while repairs are made
Answer_4: oil leakage into the condensate system is less likely with this system

Question_Title: While a vessel is underway the low pressure turbine high-speed pinion is damaged.  The pinion is then removed from the gear train.  Under these circumstances, the main unit is capable of which speed and direction?
Answer_3: Reduced speed ahead and full speed astern
Answer_4: Reduced speed astern and full speed ahead

Question_Title: Which of the conditions will occur FIRST if the steam flow  to the main engine, from a boiler with mechanical atomization, when at full power is suddenly stopped?
Answer_2: Dual element automatic feedwater regulator will admit additional water to compensate for shrinkage.

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed should be immediately reported to the engineering officer on watch?

Answer_3: Oil in the drain inspection tank.
Answer_4: Water trickling in through the stern gland.

Question_Title: The advantage of a counterflow fuel oil heater, as compared to a parallel flow fuel oil heater, is that the counterflow heater __________.
Answer_1: produces a higher oil temperature at any given steam temperature
Answer_2: has a larger heat transfer area providing greater heat transfer
Answer_3: has thinner tube walls providing greater heat transfer
Answer_4: is not subject to coking if overheated

Answer_1: Leaks developed in the suction piping.
Answer_2: Friction losses as a result of improperly sized pipe.
Answer_3: Gases or vapors released in the liquid as a result of greater than normal pressure drops.

Answer_2: normal wear for a high temperature unit
Answer_3: excessive chemical treatment of the boiler water
Answer_4: improper seating of the diaphragm joint

The designed discharge head would be reduced.;  II.  The packing life would be reduced.

Answer_3: the condenser hotwell to be completely drained at low speeds

Answer_2: hammering noises in the equipment or transmission lines

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the operation of the solenoid valve in the fuel oil manifold of an automatically fired boiler?

Answer_2: carrying the brine level below normal

Answer_4: Gravity tanks are fitted with an overflow alarm.

Question_Title: Why are scale deposits on the inside of boiler tubes objectionable?

Answer_2: Poor heat transfer due to scale deposits overheats tubes.
Answer_3: The metal of the tube interior is eaten away by scale.
Answer_4: Hydroxyl ions liberated by the scaling process form acid in the boiler water.

Question_Title: Prior to relieving the watch you should first check the fireroom status by verifying the  boiler water level and ___________.

Question_Title: Air leaks through the inner or outer casings of a boiler will __________.

Answer_1: the amount of water discharging from the lube oil purifier
Answer_2: sounding the lube oil settling tank
Answer_4: checking oil for unusually low temperature

Question_Title: While underway on watch, you notice that you need to constantly increase the coil pressure in the high pressure contaminated evaporator to maintain capacity.  Which of the following may be the cause?

Question_Title: Condensate from fuel oil heating coils return to the __________.

Answer_1: decreased plant efficiency due to higher attainable vacuum

Answer_3: reduced plant efficiency due to excessive condensate temperature depression
Answer_4: increased effectiveness of the air ejectors due to the increased main condenser vacuum

Answer_1: wear of radial dummy piston packing strips
Answer_2: wear of gland seal and diaphragm labyrinth packing

Answer_3: emulsification occurs with resultant loss of lubricating qualities
Answer_4: oil additives break down into amino acids and polyglycerides when in contact with water

Question_Title: Why are the condensate drains from the fuel oil heaters and fuel oil tank heating coils returned to the drain inspection tank?

Answer_4: As a safety precaution to prevent oil leaks into the bilges.

Answer_2: impair the effectiveness of the air purge cycle

Answer_4: impair the operation of the high steam pressure limit switch

Answer_1: oxidation of the exposed furnace walls

Answer_3: a heavy fuel must be blended

Answer_1: If the reverse side of the weld is inaccessible, complete penetration is unnecessary.
Answer_2: After excavation is completed, and prior to welding, the excavated area shall be examined by spot radiography.
Answer_3: No repairs by welding shall be made, except temporary emergency repairs, without prior approval of the Officer in Charge, Marine Inspection.
Answer_4: Post weld heat treatment of repaired cracks is only required if the pressure part is fabricated of alloy steel.

Question_Title: When relieving the watch in the fireroom, you should first check the  ___________.

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed would indicate water carryover to a turbine?

Question_Title: Desuperheated steam can be found at the __________.

Question_Title: What will occur if the fuel oil heater condensate returns are not opened or are partially plugged?
