Answer_2: hold the turbine at that speed until vibration stops
Answer_3: stop the turbine and not answer any more bells
Answer_4: immediately slow the turbine to see if the vibration will stop

Question_Title: What causes carbon to adhere to the inside surfaces of a fuel oil heater?
Answer_1: Too much carbon in the fuel

Question_Title: Vibration in main propulsion turbines could be caused by __________.
Answer_2: high pressure steam in the first-stage
Answer_3: high vacuum in the main condenser

Question_Title: Desuperheated steam from the control desuperheater is returned to the main superheater to control the outlet temperature by the action of __________.
Answer_3: an orifice in the superheater inlet header

Question_Title: Carbon deposits in a fuel oil heater are caused by __________.
Which of the conditions listed is the most common source of torsional vibration in a geared turbine drive?
The main function of a desuperheater is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain uniform steam flow through the superheater while providing auxiliary steam as required
Answer_2: heat the water in the drum while maintaining sufficient flow through the generating tubes
Answer_3: provide the boiler with additional steam generating surface while providing a sufficient reservoir for surface blow
Answer_4: heat the water in the drum while providing additional steam generating surface in the boiler

Question_Title: Carbonization of the conductive surfaces of a fuel oil heater results in reduced heating capacity because __________.
Answer_1: a fluid film layer covers the solid contaminants and increases heat transfer
Answer_2: the relative velocities of the fluids must be decreased causing a corresponding loss of heat transfer
Answer_3: the thermal conductivity of solidified contaminants is poor
Answer_4: radiational heat transfer becomes severely impaired

Question_Title: What should you do if you detect an abnormal vibration in the operating main propulsion turbine?
Answer_1: Notify the chief engineer and stand by the throttles.
Answer_2: Immediately slow the turbine until the vibration ceases.
Answer_4: Open the turbine drains until the vibration ceases.

Question_Title: One purpose of a desuperheater installed in a boiler steam  drum is to __________.
Answer_4: remove all superheat from generated steam

Question_Title: The overheating of fuel oil in the fuel oil heaters may result in __________.
Answer_3: ineffective straining of the fuel oil
Answer_4: low fuel oil service pump discharge pressure

Question_Title: The slight wavy appearance of the tips of reduction gear teeth is a result of __________.
Answer_3: the method of manufacture and does not harm the gears
Answer_4: uneven bearing wear due to gross misalignment

Question_Title: A boiler fitting used to protect the superheater and to provide reduced temperature steam for use by auxiliaries is the __________.
If the fuel oil temperature in the fuel oil heater  attains an excessive temperature, what will happen?
Answer_1: Carbon deposits will build up on the heating surfaces.
Answer_2: The fuel heater relief valve will open immediately.
Answer_3: The fuel oil pump will lose suction.
Answer_4: The fuel oil recirculating valve will automatically close.

Question_Title: A pressure drop occurs across both the moving and fixed blades of a reaction turbine as a result of the __________.
Answer_1: reversing blades causing a velocity drop with resultant pressure drop
Answer_2: conversion of the thermal energy to pressure energy always resulting in a pressure drop
Answer_3: interstage diaphragms creating a nozzle effect in the steam flow
Answer_4: moving and fixed blades being shaped to act as nozzles

Question_Title: Water-tube boilers having integral uncontrolled superheaters are equipped with internal desuperheaters to __________.
Answer_1: lower the temperature of bleed steam in a reheat type plant
Answer_3: lower superheated steam pressure for use in auxiliary machinery
Answer_4: provide desuperheated steam for auxiliary machinery

Question_Title: An internal leak in a fuel oil heater can result in __________.
Answer_1: water contamination of the fuel oil
Answer_2: oil contamination of the heater drains

Question_Title: The pressure drop existing across the diaphragm of a pressure compounded impulse turbine necessitates __________.
Answer_1: installation of a dummy piston and equalizing line to reduce thrust
Answer_2: installation of a packing seal to minimize interstage leakage
Answer_3: circumferential dovetailing to secure the rotor blades
Answer_4: Seal strippng the tips of the turbine blades

Question_Title: Under steady steaming conditions, the superheater outlet temperature is regulated by the __________.

The contaminated steam system is secured for repairs.  Live steam is supplied to the fuel oil heating system and its returns are directed to the drain tank.  Considering these  circumstances, an undetected leak in an idle fuel oil heater could eventually lead to __________.
Answer_4: sputtering burners and possible loss of fires

Question_Title: The packing ring in an interstage diaphragm of a turbine is prevented from rotating by __________.
Answer_1: a horizontal joint key extending into a slot
Answer_2: spring tension exerted on retaining rings
Answer_3: steam pressure exerted on the packing segments
Answer_4: the weight of the diaphragm acting on the packing ring

Question_Title: Steam leaving the desuperheater is used to __________.
Answer_3: supply additional steam for propulsion during overload conditions
Answer_4: provide steam for propulsion during low speed operation

Question_Title: Condensate accumulation in the steam side of a fuel oil heater could result in __________.
Answer_1: scale accumulation in an operating heater
Answer_2: water contamination of the fuel oil
Answer_3: reduced heating capacity in an operating heater
Answer_4: annealing of the heater tube bundles

Question_Title: While making your rounds, you notice the main lube oil temperature to be higher than normal.  To remedy this situation, you should __________.
Answer_1: speed up the main lube oil pump
Answer_2: open the lube oil cooler seawater inlet valve wider
Answer_3: throttle in on the lube oil cooler seawater discharge valve
Answer_4: increase the opening of the lube oil cooler seawater discharge valve

Question_Title: Shrouding, with regards to steam turbines, is rolled to the curvature of the blade ends and fitted to the blade __________.
Overheating of the generating tubes will occur when a boiler reaches its end point of __________.
Condensate accumulating in the steam side of a fuel oil heater could result in __________.
Answer_4: immediate oil contamination of the condensate

Question_Title: Which turbine blade is best suited for high pressure installations?
Which 'end point' will result in the most severe damage to  the boiler?
The rate of fouling on the oil side of fuel oil heaters is  directly related to the __________.
Answer_1: quality of the steam flow through the heater
Answer_2: shape of the heating coils in the heater
Answer_3: pressure on the oil in the heater
Answer_4: rate of oil flow through the heater

Question_Title: Which of the following statements about boilers is correct?
Answer_1: A hot boiler will continue to generate steam after the fires are secured.
Answer_2: No boiler will continue to generate steam after the fires are secured.
Answer_3: The water level in a properly operated boiler will not shrink or swell.
Answer_4: Loss of water will not harm a boiler if the water level can be restored.

Question_Title: The rate of fouling on the oil side of a fuel oil heater is inversely related to the __________.
Answer_1: quality of steam flowing through the heater
Answer_2: flow rate of fuel oil through the heater
Answer_3: shape of the heating coils in the heater
Answer_4: pressure on the oil in the heater

Question_Title: When increasing the firing rate of a boiler, which of the following should be carried out FIRST?
Answer_1: Increasing of the forced draft air pressure.

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed would indicate a dirty fuel  oil strainer?
Answer_2: Dirt and sediment deposits in the atomizers
Answer_3: Decreasing pressure drop across the strainer
Answer_4: Decreasing fuel oil pressure at the burner manifold

Question_Title: Guardian valves are installed on main propulsion turbines to __________.
Answer_1: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element while the vessel is maneuvering
Answer_2: provide an emergency means of quick throttle closing
Answer_3: provide a means to supply steam directly to the astern element of the turbine
Answer_4: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element at full sea speed

Question_Title: To safely increase the firing rate of a boiler, you should  always increase the forced draft pressure __________.
Answer_3: by opening the burner register wider

Question_Title: If one fuel oil strainer of a duplex unit becomes clogged while the vessel is steaming at sea, the FIRST action should be to __________.
Answer_1: clean the dirty strainer as quickly as possible
Answer_2: change the oil flow over to the clean side
Answer_3: stop the fuel oil service pump

Question_Title: To safely decrease the boiler firing rate, you should always reduce the fuel pressure __________.
Answer_1: after reducing the forced draft pressure
Answer_2: before reducing the forced draft pressure
Answer_3: by opening the oil recirculating valve
Answer_4: by opening the fuel pump relief valve

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning safety and relief valve escape piping?
Answer_1: Expansion joints or flexible pipe connections are prohibited.
Answer_2: The piping shall be led as near vertical as possible to the atmospheric drain tank.
Answer_3: The piping should be supported and installed so that no stress is transmitted to the valve body.

Question_Title: If you noted a large difference in the pressures indicated  by a duplex pressure gage to the fuel oil system strainer,  you should __________.
Answer_1: increase the fuel pump discharge pressure
Answer_2: reduce the firing rate of the boilers
Answer_3: shift to a clean fuel oil strainer
Answer_4: secure the fuel oil service pump

Question_Title: If a fuel oil solenoid valve fails to secure the fuel oil supply to the starboard boiler upon loss of the forced draft air supply, you should immediately __________.
Answer_1: open the crossover damper manually from the port forced draft fan
Answer_2: reset the starboard forced draft fan circuit breaker on the main switchboard
Answer_3: stop the fuel oil service pump
Answer_4: manually close the quick-closing valve in the fuel oil line to the starboard boiler

Question_Title: While maneuvering out of port, you answer a stop bell.  You notice a lot of steam coming out of the gland exhaust condenser vent, in addition to the main condenser hotwell level being low.  For this condition you should __________.
Answer_3: manually recirculate condensate and add some makeup feed
Answer_4: increase steam pressure to the air ejectors

Question_Title: When securing a main propulsion turbine equipped with carbon packing glands, the vacuum should always be broken before securing gland seal steam because __________.
Answer_1: turbine rotor well will expand faster than the casing
Answer_2: cold air drawn across the carbon packing will damage it
Answer_3: jacking gear will be unable to be engaged
Answer_4: gland seal leak off lines will fill with water

Question_Title: When raising steam on a cold boiler under normal conditions, you should always __________.
Answer_1: raise steam within one hour or less
Answer_3: use a small orifice burner sprayer plate to start
Answer_4: use a large orifice burner sprayer plate to start

Question_Title: With vacuum up and the main propulsion turbine standing by  while awaiting engine orders, it is necessary to roll the unit alternately ahead and astern every five minutes to __________.
Answer_1: distribute the gland sealing steam evenly throughout the glands
Answer_2: slowly bring the lube oil and bearings to operating temperature
Answer_3: warm the astern guarding valve and the low lube oil pressure throttle trip
Answer_4: reduce the possibility of warping the turbine rotors

Question_Title: The time taken to raise steam on a cold boiler should always be __________.
Answer_1: the time specified by the boiler manufacturer
Answer_2: not less than a full 24 hour
Answer_4: as short as possible to avoid over expansion

Question_Title: If the boiler fires are extinguished by water entrained in  the fuel oil, you should FIRST __________.
Answer_3: reduce the load on the boiler

Question_Title: Any abnormal condition or emergency that occurs in the engine room must be reported immediately to the __________.
After the steam pressure has risen to about 5 pounds more than the pressure of the boilers already on the line, you can __________.
Answer_3: put the boiler on the line

Question_Title: Water in the fuel supply to a steaming boiler can be detected by __________.
Answer_1: observation of the fuel oil heater drains
Answer_4: dense white smoke being observed in the periscope

Question_Title: How many pinion gears are required in an articulated, double reduction gear set for a cross-compounded turbine?
Water emulsified in the fuel oil when supplied to a boiler  is indicated by __________.
Answer_2: lower than normal fuel oil pressure

Question_Title: In a regenerative air heater, air is bypassed around the heater while __________.
If the fires in a boiler furnace begin sputtering or hissing, you should suspect __________.
Answer_1: excessive fuel pressure at the burners
Answer_4: water contamination of the fuel oil

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the reason why the babbitt of a turbine journal bearing is relieved at the point of oil entry along the horizontal joint?
Answer_1: To prevent oil from backing up in the supply line.
Answer_2: To permit oil to discharge through the rear of the bearing.
Answer_3: To prevent hydraulic pressure buildup when the journal rotates.
Answer_4: To permit the rotor journal to draw oil around the shaft.

Question_Title: Stack type air heaters are bypassed when a vessel is in port in order to prevent __________.
Answer_1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Answer_2: interference with the operation of the soot blowers
Answer_3: corrosion of the heater due to the low stack temperatures
Answer_4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question_Title: When boiler fires begin sputtering, indicating water in the fuel oil settling tank, you should __________.
Answer_1: start the alternate fuel oil service pump
Answer_2: shift to the service pump low suction
Answer_3: change suction to the alternate settling tank
Answer_4: reduce the fuel pump operating speed

Question_Title: The following information was recorded after a recent L.P. turbine bearing installation.  The bearing temperature was  logged at the indicated time intervals as:; ; 1200-110F(43C); 1210-123F(51C); 1220-136F(58C); 1230-149F(65C); 1240-153F(67C); 1250-155F(68C); 1300-155F(68C); ; The shaft RPM and lube oil cooler outlet temperature remained constant. The readings indicate __________.
Answer_2: water in the lube oil system

Question_Title: In an emergency, an auxiliary turbine can be stopped by __________.
Answer_2: actuating the throttle hand tripping device
Answer_3: rotating the hand lube oil pump backwards
Answer_4: increasing the load on the driven unit

Question_Title: One function of the air and flue gas bypass dampers installed in regenerative type air heaters is to __________.
Answer_1: avoid excessive cooling of the stack gases during low load  operation
Answer_2: regulate combustion air temperature at normal firing rates
Answer_3: reduce the load on the element drive motor
Answer_4: reduce the temperature of the double undulated heating elements

Question_Title: The safety valve nominal size for propulsion boilers and superheaters must be not less than 1 1/2 inches and not more than 4 inches.  The term 'nominal size' refers to the __________.
When the fires begin to sputter, you should __________.
Answer_3: take suction from another settling tank

Question_Title: A regenerative type air heater should be bypassed at low load in order to __________.
Answer_1: prevent chipping of the ceramic coating
Answer_2: prevent condensation in the steam baffling
Answer_3: avoid excessive cooling and condensation of the exhaust gases
Answer_4: maintain a positive seal on the replaceable basket

Question_Title: If the fires in both boilers start to sputter, you should immediately __________.
Answer_1: shift feed suction to the double bottom
Answer_2: speed up the fuel oil pump

Question_Title: Rotating flyweights acting against a spring force makes up a simple type of __________.
Air for combustion is bypassed around the boiler air heater when the __________.
Answer_3: combustion control system is in manual
Answer_4: boiler is steaming at low rates

Question_Title: If the fires start sputtering while steaming under steady conditions, which of the actions listed should be taken?
Answer_1: Start the standby fuel oil service pump.
Answer_3: Shift over to another fuel strainer.
Answer_4: Shift suction to another settling tank.

Question_Title: The main throttle valve on a turbine admits steam directly  into the __________.
When a vessel is in port, stack type air heaters are bypassed in order to prevent __________.
Answer_1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Answer_2: corrosion of the heater due to low stack temperatures
Answer_3: excessive back pressure in the furnace due to low flow rates
Answer_4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question_Title: Oil in the contaminated drain inspection tank results from  __________.
Answer_1: a defective relief valve on the fuel oil heater
Answer_2: improper drainage of the fuel oil heater coils
Answer_3: a leaking heating coil in a fuel oil settling tank
Answer_4: operating the fuel oil heater at excessive temperatures

Question_Title: If a turbine bearing high temperature alarm sounds, you should immediately __________.

Answer_1: steam generating capacity of an individual boiler
Answer_2: steam relieving capacity of safety valves
Answer_3: maximum combined oil consumption of all oil burners installed on a single boiler
Answer_4: maximum combined steam generating capacity for all  propulsion boilers of a single plant

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions would indicate a dirty atomizer sprayer plate?
Answer_2: Carbon deposits on the register doors.
Answer_3: Dark streaks in the burner flame.

Question_Title: In a steam turbine and reduction gear main propulsion plant, the sending unit for the low oil pressure signal is usually installed __________.
Answer_1: at a point on the inlet side of the main bearings as close  to the bearings as possible
Answer_2: at a point on the outlet side of the main bearings as close to the bearings as possible
Answer_3: at the point of highest pressure in the supply line to the  bearings
Answer_4: at the point of lowest pressure in the supply line to the bearings

Question_Title: Where three gear trains, i.e. high pressure first reduction, low pressure first reduction, and second reduction are each contained in a separate and sequential portion of the gear  housing, the reduction gear unit is known as __________.
Before blowing tubes in a boiler equipped with steam soot blowers, you should __________.
Answer_3: reduce the forced draft fan speed

Question_Title: If the fuel oil service piping was leaking upstream of the  quick-closing valve, you should be able to stop the leak by closing the __________.

Answer_1: bubbles in the sight flow glasses
Answer_2: sludge in the lube oil strainers
Answer_3: high level in the lube oil sump
Answer_4: high temperature of the lube oil leaving the bearing

Question_Title: Rotating flyweights, acting against a spring force, will provide a simple type of __________.
Before using the steam soot blowers to blow tubes at sea, you should __________.
Which of the conditions listed can cause the flame of a mechanically atomized burner to be blown away from the burner tip when you are attempting to light off?
Answer_1: Insufficient excess air is being supplied to the furnace.
Answer_2: Fuel oil viscosity is too low.
Answer_4: The secondary air cone is improperly adjusted.

Question_Title: Hot running bearings can be caused by __________.
A constant speed hydraulic governor would more than likely  be installed on a __________.
In preparing to blow tubes at sea, you should __________.
Poor atomization accompanied by an elongated flame from a steam atomization burner is MOST likely caused by __________.
Answer_1: the fuel oil temperature being too low
Answer_2: improper operation of traps in atomizing steam return piping
Answer_3: the forced draft fan too slow for the boiler load

Question_Title: An excess pressure governor should be used on a __________.
Boiler forced draft pressure should be increased before blowing tubes to __________.
Answer_4: prevent a drop in steam pressure

Question_Title: Fluctuations in the atomizing steam pressure at the burners could be caused by a/an __________.
Answer_1: malfunctioning steam trap in the atomizing steam system

Question_Title: The constant pressure governor of a turbine-driven feed pump maintains which of the following pressures at a constant value for all capacities?
After routine blowing of tubes at sea, there should be a decrease in the __________.
Answer_3: excess air required for complete combustion

Question_Title: A triple element, main propulsion, boiler feedwater regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Answer_4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question_Title: When slight sputtering is detected at the boiler atomizer,  you should __________.
Answer_1: check for water in the fuel supply
Answer_3: shut off the oil supply and purge the furnace
Answer_4: close burner register shutters and increase fuel oil service pump speed

Question_Title: Guardian valves are installed on main propulsion turbines to __________.
Answer_1: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element while the vessel is maneuvering
Answer_2: provide an emergency means of quickly closing the throttle
Answer_3: provide a means to supply steam directly to the astern element of the turbine
Answer_4: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element while at full sea speed

Question_Title: Which of the listed operational precautions is necessary before blowing tubes?
Answer_2: Open all drains in soot blower steam supply piping.
Answer_3: Thoroughly warm all soot blower steam supply piping.

Question_Title: A pneumatic dual element, main propulsion, boiler feedwater regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.

Answer_1: friction in the governor linkage and control valve
Answer_2: excessive sensitivity in the governor control valve
Answer_3: speed droop designed into the governor system
Answer_4: hydraulic slippage in the governor servomotor system

Question_Title: Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blower elements to __________.
Answer_1: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating  through blowing arcs
Answer_2: prevent buildup of soot on the element
Answer_4: prevent the backup of combustion gases into soot blower heads

Question_Title: A single element boiler feedwater regulating system used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Answer_4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question_Title: Lube oil coolers are necessary in most engine lubricating systems because __________.
Answer_1: engine oil is used continuously and cooling prevents the oil from wearing out
Answer_2: harmful acids will be condensed and then removed by the centrifuge
Answer_3: cooling increases viscosity and aids in maintaining the oil film strength
Answer_4: cooling decreases viscosity and improves engine thermal efficiency

Question_Title: The arc through which a steam soot blower element blows is  regulated by the __________.
In a multi-burner firebox, a burner tip with a scratched or enlarged orifice will __________.
Answer_1: have no effect on the flow of oil if the proper pressure is maintained
Answer_2: result in an uneven flow of oil through the burner
Answer_3: cause a high fuel oil return line back pressure

Question_Title: Which of the following types of bearings are used for the reduction gears in a marine steam turbine installation?
The primary purpose of the boiler internal dry pipe is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent priming and foaming in the boiler drum
Answer_2: remove all moisture from steam leaving the boiler
Answer_3: permit a flow of nearly dry saturated steam
Answer_4: prevent foreign materials from entering the steam drum

Question_Title: Excessive accumulation of carbon deposits on a boiler burner throat ring and diffuser could result in __________.
Answer_2: a reduced boiler fuel oil pressure

Question_Title: To accurately measure the amount of wear on a high speed pinion journal bearing with a bridge gage, you must __________.
Answer_1: be sure that the area of greatest wear is at 90 to the measuring pin
Answer_2: shift the journal to position the pinion off center in the  bearing
Answer_3: raise the journal to a height equal to the oil clearance
Answer_4: roll the bearing shell until the wearing zone is at the bottom

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents one operational characteristic of a cyclone steam separator?
Answer_1: Unit reduces the circulation of the steam and water mixture in the boiler.
Answer_2: Unit imparts a rotational motion to the steam and water mixture.
Answer_3: Steam is forced to the outer side of the separator by centrifugal force.
Answer_4: Water is forced upward by centrifugal force.

Question_Title: Carbon deposits on the boiler burner throat ring is usually caused by __________.
Answer_4: the burner cycling on and off

Question_Title: As steam first enters the main propulsion turbine, which of the following energy conversions takes place?
Circulation of boiler water to the water wall tubes is maintained by the __________.
Failure of the fuel oil service pump to maintain fuel oil flow to the burner could be caused by __________.
Precautions to be observed prior to starting a turbine driven cargo pump, should include __________.
Answer_1: assuring that the turbine casing drains are wired closed
Answer_2: observing the operation of the overspeed trip
Answer_3: open all governor oil relay drains
Answer_4: checking the hand tripping device for proper operation

Question_Title: When preparing to cut a boiler in on the line, you determine that the steam pressure of the incoming boiler is about 5 psig above line pressure.  Which of the following steps should you take next?
Failure of the fuel oil service pump to maintain fuel oil flow to the burners of the boiler could result from __________.
Answer_2: carbon deposits on the ignition electrode
Answer_3: leaks in the pump suction line

Question_Title: Which of the listed tubes provides circulation to the water wall tubes?
If oil is found in the fuel oil heating drain system when using live steam directly to the heating coils, which of the actions listed should be taken?
Answer_2: Shift contaminated drains to proper holding area.
Answer_4: Shift to low fuel oil suction.

Question_Title: Fuel oil may be discovered in the contaminated drain inspection tank when the __________.
Answer_4: steam operated fuel oil pump leaks

Question_Title: A back pressure trip on an auxiliary turbo-generator functions to secure the device if the __________.
Answer_2: discharge pressure of a turbine driven pump is excessive
Answer_3: gland seal leakoff pressure is too high
Answer_4: exhaust pressure rises above a preset limit

Question_Title: The function of downcomers installed in water-tube boilers  is to __________.
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_4: decrease the rate of steam generation

Question_Title: A leak in the heating coils of a fuel oil heater will first show up as __________.
Answer_1: water in the fuel oil supply
Answer_2: oil in the drain inspection tank

Question_Title: When a main propulsion turbine throttle malfunction develops, affecting both the main and secondary control stations, you should __________.
Answer_1: override the automated circuit and manually control the engine
Answer_2: override the automated circuit and shut down the engine
Answer_3: allow the automatic shutdown circuit to shut down the engine, then locate the problem
Answer_4: immediately make an entry in the engine log

Question_Title: Downcomers installed in water-tube boilers function to __________.
Answer_1: distribute feedwater within the water drum
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_3: accelerate the generation of superheated steam
Answer_4: accelerate water circulation in the boiler

Question_Title: A suspected leak in an operating fuel oil heating coil is normally confirmed by __________.
Answer_1: checking the pH of heating coil returns

Question_Title: In steam turbine and reduction gear units, lube oil coolers installed in the lube oil system are located between the __________.
Answer_1: lube oil pumps and gravity tanks
Answer_3: gravity tanks and lube oil sump
Answer_4: lube oil sump and lube oil pumps

Question_Title: Downcomers installed in water-tube boilers function to __________.
Answer_1: distribute feedwater within the water drum
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_3: cool the tubes adjacent to the burner throats
Answer_4: ensure proper circulation to the water wall headers

Question_Title: A leak in a heating coil in a fuel oil storage tank should  be detected quickly by __________.
Answer_1: an increase in fuel oil temperature
Answer_2: observing oil on the contaminated evaporator steam coils
Answer_3: the presence of fuel oil in the inspection tank
Answer_4: the sputtering of burners in the boilers

Question_Title: In a segmental pivoted-shoe thrust bearing, the thrust load among the shoes is equalized by the __________.
Downcomers are used in modern boilers to __________.
Answer_1: circulate water to the mud drum

Question_Title: Accumulation of fuel oil in the boiler double casing could  be caused by __________.
Downcomers are frequently mounted outside the boiler casing on a water-tube boiler for the purpose of __________.
Answer_1: reducing heat in the downcomers and improving water circulation
Answer_2: improving the cooling of the lower tube banks
Answer_3: causing suspended solids in the boiler water to settle in the water drums
Answer_4: providing for easy maintenance and repair

Question_Title: Fuel oil accumulation in a boiler double front is caused by __________.
Because of the pressure drop existing across each diaphragm, the flow of steam between the nozzle diaphragm and the rotor of the turbine is held to a minimum by __________.
The boiler economizer provides additional heat to the __________.
Carbon deposits on the diffuser and register throat ring of a burner __________.
Answer_1: interfere with air flow around the burner
Answer_2: cause pre-ignition of the atomized fuel
Answer_3: allow heat loss to the boiler casing
Answer_4: are of no consequence and may be left in place until a fireside inspection allows time for removal

Question_Title: Most auxiliary turbines do not require an external source of gland sealing steam because they __________.
Answer_2: exhaust to pressures above atmospheric pressure
Answer_3: utilize carbon packing rings at the low pressure end
Answer_4: operate with only a small amount of axial thrust

Question_Title: A check valve is located between the economizer and the steam drum to __________.
Answer_1: assure a positive feedwater flow through the economizer
Answer_2: assure a positive feedwater flow to the steam drum
Answer_3: prevent the feed pump from becoming vapor bound
Answer_4: prevent steam and water drum losses should an economizer casualty occur

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed could be responsible for the flame of a mechanical atomizer to blow out when attempting  to light off?
Answer_1: The openings in the diffuser are improperly adjusted.
Answer_2: The radial air doors are closed.
Answer_3: The distance piece is improperly adjusted.
Answer_4: The viscosity of the fuel oil is too low.

Question_Title: The minimum feedwater inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Answer_1: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Answer_3: temperature of steam bled off the HP turbine

Question_Title: When preparing water-tube boilers for hydrostatic testing,  they shall be filled with water at not __________.
Heating the fuel oil to an excessively high a temperature in a fuel oil heater will cause __________.
Answer_1: a loss of fuel oil suction

Question_Title: Large temperature and pressure drops in the first stage of a combination impulse and reaction turbine are caused by __________.
Answer_2: steam passing through a single row of blades more than once
Answer_3: using a dummy piston and cylinder to offset axial thrust
Answer_4: a velocity-compounded impulse stage at the high pressure end of the turbine

Question_Title: The minimum feedwater inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Answer_2: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Answer_3: surface area of the third stage heater
Answer_4: radiant heat transfer in the furnace

Question_Title: A sequential lift, nozzle valve control bar utilizes which  of the following operating principles?
Answer_1: A lifting beam mechanism engages valve stems of varying lengths.
Answer_2: A hydraulic piston raises or lowers groups of valves according to pressure received from a governor.
Answer_3: A hydraulic piston raises or lowers individual valves according to pressure received from a governor.
Answer_4: A servomotor, mechanically connected to nozzle valve handwheels, opens or closes the valves in accordance with the type of electrical signal received.

Question_Title: What part of the turbine assembly is used to relieve strain on the turbine caused by thermal stress?
Whenever operating a boiler, whose economizer is bypassed,  always keep in mind that __________.
Answer_1: it is necessary to fire more fuel to maintain the required  evaporative rating
Answer_2: there is always the danger of metal oxidation in the economizer
Answer_3: less heat is actually being transferred to the steam because of the decrease in the ratio of gas to steam weight

Question_Title: According to U. S. Coast Regulations (46 CFR), water-tube boilers shall be hydrostatically tested on passenger vessels every __________.

Answer_1: Start the standby fuel service pump.
Answer_2: Increase the fuel service pump speed.
Answer_3: Increase the furnace air supply pressure.
Answer_4: Shift to the settler high suction.

Question_Title: Contaminated steam generators are usually __________.

Answer_1: keep the forced draft discharge dampers open wide
Answer_2: permit full maneuvering capability without the necessity of changing blower speed
Answer_4: ensure that all burners will remain ignited at low load

Question_Title: In the operation of a lube oil clarifier, the position of the oil-water interface should be __________.
Answer_2: maintained by the number of disks in the disk stack
Answer_4: maintained by the diaphragm-type, weir control valve

Question_Title: The purpose of a contaminated steam system is to __________.
Answer_2: ensure fouled heating coil returns from fuel tanks do not contaminate boiler feedwater
Answer_3: distill makeup feed for use as potable water
Answer_4: ensure an uncontaminated source of feed for the makeup evaporator

Question_Title: The component of a Kingsbury thrust bearing which transmits the thrust from the shaft to the oil film and shoes is the  __________.

Answer_1: control the air volume to a steaming boiler
Answer_2: prevent air from entering an idle boiler furnace
Answer_3: provide a natural draft when the blower is secured
Answer_4: equalize the forced draft air between steaming boilers

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the inspection of water-tube boilers?
Answer_1: All mountings shall be opened up and examined by a Coast Guard inspector at eight year intervals after the initial inspection.
Answer_2: All boiler mounting studs or bolts shall be removed for examination by a Coast Guard inspector every 4 years after  initial inspection.
Answer_3: Boiler mountings attached to boiler nozzles must be opened  and removed for examination every 8 years.
Answer_4: Boiler mountings attached directly to the boiler plating by screwed studs and nuts shall be removed and examined every 8 years.

Question_Title: A contaminated steam generator is used to produce saturated vapor from collected __________.

Answer_1: The circulating pump need not operate when low pressure steam is required.
Answer_2: Boiler tubes are less likely to overheat.
Answer_3: A steam accumulator is not required.

Question_Title: Why is a flexible I-beam rigidly mounted at the forward end of the main turbine?
Answer_1: To relieve stress on the hull.
Answer_2: Allow for turbine casing expansion and contraction.
Answer_3: To relieve stress at the light end of the turbine.
Answer_4: Prevent the reaction developed within the turbine from being transmitted to the hull.

Question_Title: If a feed pump failure causes the boiler water to drop out  of sight in the gage glass, the engineer should FIRST __________.
Answer_1: secure the fires, steam stops and then add water
Answer_2: secure the fires, reduce steam load and start standby feed  pump
Answer_3: reduce the steaming rate and then cool the boiler with the  force draft fan
Answer_4: reduce the steaming rate and then add water

Question_Title: Steam piping subject to main boiler pressure must be hydrostatically tested at specified intervals.  Therefore,  which of the following statements is true?
Answer_1: The piping must be tested at a pressure and temperature specified by a Coast Guard marine inspector.
Answer_2: The piping must be tested at 1 1/2 times working pressure every 4 years.
Answer_3: Piping under 3 inches nominal pipe size need not be hydrostatically tested.
Answer_4: The piping must be tested at 1 1/2 times maximum allowable  pressure every 4 years.

Question_Title: When starting a turbogenerator, you must provide lube oil pressure to the unit by means of __________.
Answer_1: a line from the other generator
Answer_2: a line from the gravity tank
Answer_4: the hand operated or auxiliary lube oil pump

Question_Title: Lower than normal steam pressure in an operating boiler may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: a sudden drop in superheater outlet temperature
Answer_3: a low water level in the steam drum

Question_Title: Which action should be taken if the water level in the gage glass drops out of sight and the burner fails to secure automatically?

Answer_1: change the position of the turbine throttle valve
Answer_2: change the position of the governor lever
Answer_3: vary steam pressure in the steam chest

Question_Title: The water level in one boiler of a two boiler plant rapidly falls out of sight, which of the following actions should be carried out FIRST?
Answer_1: Secure the fuel oil to the low water boiler.

Question_Title: The rotating speed of the tubular bowl centrifuge is more than twice that of the disk type.  The reason for this is __________.

Answer_2: the friction affecting rotation is not as significant with a narrow diameter bowl
Answer_3: the drag bushing is used to permit the higher speed of rotation

Question_Title: The reversing turbine is normally used for which of the following operations?

Answer_1: The marine inspector may require any boiler to be drilled to determine its actual thickness any time its safety is in doubt.
Answer_2: At the first inspection for certification after a water-tube boiler has been installed for ten years, it shall be gaged  by drilling to determine the actual extent of deterioration.

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is used to compensate for the expansion and minor misalignments occurring between the main turbines and the reduction gears?

Answer_2: will begin to lose its water seal

Question_Title: Why are convergent-divergent nozzles used in high-pressure  turbine applications?
Answer_2: They are less susceptible to steam erosion than other nozzle types due to their shape.
Answer_3: They produce a larger pressure drop and therefore are more  efficient than other nozzle types.
Answer_4: They direct the steam flow more efficiently than other nozzle types.

Question_Title: When water is removed from lube oil passing through a centrifugal purifier, the water removed will __________.
Answer_2: force the diameter of the oil column within the bowl to be narrowed

Answer_4: displace an equal amount of water from the bowl seal

Question_Title: Which of the parts listed for a reaction turbine serve the  same function as the nozzles of an impulse turbine?

Answer_1: It supplements the main lube oil pump flow while paralleling the generators.
Answer_2: It empties the governor control reserve prior to shutting down.
Answer_3: It assists in opening the governor control valve while starting the unit.
Answer_4: It permits the changeover of lube oil filters.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the centrifuging of lubricating oil?

Answer_2: Centrifuging is more efficient when the oil is preheated prior to centrifuging.
Answer_3: Silicones are water soluble and easily removed by centrifuging.

Question_Title: In addition to the direction of steam flow, which of the descriptions listed may also be used to classify turbines?
Answer_1: The method in which the steam causes the turbine rotor to rotate.
Answer_2: The type of staging and compounding of steam pressures and  velocities.
Answer_3: The division of the steam flow.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes how the main propulsion turbine overspeed relay initiates closing of the throttle valve?
Answer_1: Excessive centrifugal force causes a spring loaded weight to trip a valve latch.
Answer_2: Excessive centrifugal force causes spring loaded flyballs to actuate a control lever.
Answer_3: Excessive speed causes an oil pump to develop sufficient  pressure to activate a spring loaded relay valve which tends to close the steam control valve.
Answer_4: Excessive speed causes an increase in lube oil control temperature which actuates a solenoid oil dump valve.

Question_Title: If the engineer on watch has reason to doubt the accuracy of the water level shown in the boiler gage glass, he should __________.

Answer_1: admits more steam to the steam chest
Answer_2: increases the steam flow to the HP turbine first stage
Answer_3: increases the pressure of steam in the steam chest
Answer_4: bypasses the flow of steam directly to the later turbine stages

Question_Title: In a disk type centrifugal purifier, the contaminated oil enters the bowl __________.
Answer_1: at the bottom through the oil inlet
Answer_2: at the top through the regulating tube
Answer_3: through the neck of the top disk

Question_Title: Which of the descriptions listed applies to a Rateau stage?
Answer_1: One set of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Answer_2: One set of nozzles and one row of moving blades.
Answer_3: Two sets of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Answer_4: Two sets of nozzles and one row of moving blades.

Question_Title: One boiler of a two boiler plant has ruptured a tube and the water cannot be maintained in sight in the gage glass. After securing the fires, your next action should be to __________.
Answer_2: stop the fuel oil service pump

Answer_1: the OCMI be notified of repairs to  boilers and unfired pressure vessels

Question_Title: Which of the following methods is used to lubricate main propulsion turbine reduction gears?

Question_Title: Should one boiler on a two boiler vessel suffer serious tube damage, the Officer-in-Charge, Marine Inspection may issue a permit (Form CG-948) to proceed to another port for repair __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following actions should be carried out if the boiler water level is falling due to a tube failure?

Question_Title: The maximum temperature rise of oil passing through any reduction gear set, or bearing, should not exceed __________.

Answer_4: Two or more simple impulse stages aligned in tandem in one  casing.

Answer_4: steam binding of the feedwater regulating valve sensing line from the top of the steam drum

Answer_1: insufficient circulating water flow through the condenser
Answer_2: a steam inlet valve being partially open

Answer_4: both the moving and stationary blades

Question_Title: Why do double flow reaction turbines produce very little axial thrust?

Answer_2: successive temperature drops through the seal stages

Answer_4: very fast in relation to their normal operating speeds

Question_Title: The pinion gears used in main propulsion reduction gear mechanisms are generally constructed of __________.
