Question_Title: In marine articulated double reduction divided power path gear sets, the first and second reduction gears are usually of fabricated construction.  Why are the gear teeth usually cut in a temperature controlled room?
Answer_2: To prevent ambient conditions from affecting the machining  process.
Answer_3: To control the size of the journals.
Answer_4: To control stress in the webbing.

Question_Title: The superheater vents should always be open when __________.
Answer_3: lighting off or securing the boiler
Answer_4: the water level is lower than normal

Question_Title: Which of the following statements defines the term 'axial float' in reference to reduction gears?
Answer_1: The gears are not subject to excessive tooth loads due to mismatching of the journal bearing halves.
Answer_2: The gears are double-helical and axial thrust is eliminated.
Answer_3: The gears are capable of free motion, neither supporting nor being supported radially by other gears.
Answer_4: The gears are capable of free motion, neither supporting nor being supported axially by other gears.

Question_Title: The scavenging air for soot blowers is supplied by the __________.
Which of the following represents one of the designed functions of reduction gears?
Answer_1: Change rotary motion into linear motion.
Answer_2: Combine multiple speed inputs into a single low speed output.
Answer_3: To amplify low speed to high speed.
Answer_4: Utilize a single engine input and convert to multiple propeller output.

Question_Title: When securing the main engine, which of the listed procedures should be carried out to remove or reduce condensation from the interior of the main reduction gear  casing?
Answer_1: Circulate oil until oil and gear casing have reached ambient temperatures.
Answer_2: Continue to operate the lube oil purifier until there is no water discharge.
Answer_3: Continue to operate the lube oil cooler and rotate the engine with the turning gear.

Question_Title: In a gravity lube oil system, a sight glass is installed in a line near the operating platform.  This line connects the __________.
Answer_1: bottom of the gravity tank and the lube oil headers
Answer_2: bottom of the gravity tank and the sump
Answer_3: gravity tank overflow and the lube oil headers
Answer_4: gravity tank overflow and the sump

Question_Title: A Kingsbury, or pivot shoe type thrust bearing, can bear much greater loads per square inch of working surface than  can parallel surface bearings because provisions are made in the Kingsbury bearing __________.
Answer_1: for adjusting the filler piece thickness behind the pivotal-shoes to give a more accurate fit
Answer_2: for automatically adjusting clearances to the correct value when wear occurs
Answer_3: for the shoes to tilt slightly, thereby allowing the formation of a wedge shaped oil film under a thrust load
Answer_4: to allow the shoes to pivot and remain parallel with the collar when thrust loads are applied

Question_Title: If saltwater leaks into and contaminates the main lubricating oil system, which of the following remedial actions should be taken?
Answer_1: Locate the leak and seal it off when time permits.
Answer_2: Disengage the jacking gear and allow contaminated oil to cool to engine room temperature.
Answer_3: Secure the engines and prevent the circulation of contaminated oil.
Answer_4: Seal off the leak and promptly remove all contaminated oil  from steel parts and surfaces.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the principle  of operation of the Kingsbury type thrust bearing?
Answer_1: A flat film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a wedge shaped oil film.
Answer_2: A flat film of oil can carry heavier loads than a wedge shaped oil film.
Answer_3: A wedge shaped film of oil absorbs less heat than a flat oil film.
Answer_4: A wedge shaped film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a flat oil film.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the function of the center groove machined on a double-helical gear?
Answer_1: It allows the gears slight axial movement without gear damage.
Answer_2: It allows a path for oil to escape regardless of the direction of rotation.
Answer_3: It prevents excessive axial thrust loads from developing on the teeth.
Answer_4: It is used to distribute oil to the gear teeth.

Question_Title: As the rate of combustion is increased in a boiler, more steam is generated because the __________.
Answer_2: weight rate of hot gas flow increases

Question_Title: By which of the following means can rotating parts of the main reduction gear be examined?
When raising steam on a boiler, the superheater drains should __________.
Answer_1: be opened to remove condensate, and then closed when the first burner is lit
Answer_2: be closed until just before line pressure is reached, and then given a short blow period
Answer_3: be closed until after the air cock is closed, and then opened until the boiler is placed on line
Answer_4: remain open or partially open until steam blows through the lines, and then the valves should be closed

Question_Title: The maintenance of reduction gear units is principally concerned with attention to keeping the  __________.
Answer_1: reduction ratio constant between the speed of the turbine and the speed of the driven element
Answer_2: upper half of the gear casing secured to the lower half
Answer_3: gears supplied with clean oil at the proper operating pressure and temperature
Answer_4: drive gears aligned with drive shaft

Question_Title: After steam has been raised and a boiler is being placed on the line, the superheater vent can be closed when __________.
Answer_1: main and auxiliary steam line drains are opened
Answer_2: the boiler steam stops have been warmed up
Answer_3: boiler pressure is 5 psi above line pressure
Answer_4: the boiler is supplying auxiliary steam

Question_Title: Which immediate action should you take when the temperature of one shaft bearing increases above its normal operating temperature?
Answer_1: Stop the unit and carefully inspect the bearing.
Answer_2: Stop the unit and replace the bearing.
Answer_3: Check the bearing for proper lubrication.
Answer_4: Check for proper water circulation to the lube oil coolers.

Question_Title: When a boiler is up to pressure and is being placed on the  line, you should secure the __________.
Which of the following problems is likely to occur if the lube oil level in the sump is too high?
Answer_3: The main engine could not be operated at full speed.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions can cause excessively high superheater outlet steam temperature in an automated boiler?
Answer_1: High water level in the steam drum.
Answer_2: Excessive heat transfer in the control desuperheater.
Answer_4: A malfunction of the windbox airflow transmitter.

Question_Title: Sludge tanks are used in an oil lubricating system to receive __________.
Answer_1: makeup oil that is to be added to the system after settling
Answer_2: foreign liquid matter, discharged from the lube oil purifier or the stripping pump
Answer_3: bilge slops that can be reclaimed after clarification
Answer_4: all of the oil that passes through the lube oil coolers

Question_Title: On a boiler equipped with an uncontrolled interdeck superheater, reducing the feedwater temperature to the steam drum will cause the superheater outlet temperature to __________.
Dirt and/or metallic particles in a reduction gear  lubricating oil system may cause which of the following problems to occur?
In herringbone helical gear sets, the tooth contact loading __________.
Answer_1: is both a sliding and rolling action
Answer_2: is distributed over several teeth simultaneously
Answer_3: is distributed between two opposing helices

Question_Title: A cloudy or milky appearing lube oil sample, taken from the main lubricating oil system could be caused by __________.
Answer_1: insufficient cooling water to the lube oil cooler
Answer_2: excessive cooling water to the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: Reduction gears on main propulsion turbines are double helical cut to __________.
Answer_4: reduce the size and weight of the bull gear

Question_Title: The steam generating capacity of a boiler depends upon the  __________.
Answer_2: relative size of tubes and downcomers

Question_Title: In a disk type lubricating oil centrifuge __________.
Answer_1: the centrifuge driving gears are lubricated by the reclaimed oil as it leaves the bowl
Answer_2: all dirt and sludge are discharged with the cooling water
Answer_3: sealing water must never be supplied until after oil is fed to the unit
Answer_4: deterioration of the bowl ring gasket will cause the purifier to lose its water seal

Question_Title: Under otherwise normal steaming conditions, an abnormally high temperature at the superheater outlet of a single furnace boiler would indicate __________.
Answer_1: poor heat transfer in feedwater heaters
Answer_4: excessive steam supply to fuel oil heaters

Question_Title: Main reduction and pinion gears are double helically cut to __________.
Answer_2: decrease reduction gear radial bearing loads
Answer_3: increase tooth deflection at high speeds
Answer_4: decrease the number of teeth in contact

Question_Title: When answering a full astern bell from half ahead, the superheater outlet temperature on a single furnace boiler will __________.
Answer_1: increase sharply with the increased firing rate
Answer_2: decrease due to the increase steam volume used
Answer_3: decrease momentarily and then increase proportionately with load demand

Question_Title: The purpose of the pressure control disk installed in the multi-nozzle soot blower, as shown in the illustration, is  to __________.
Answer_1: control the pressure exerted on the steam valve disk when the cam secures the steam supply
Answer_2: reduce the steam supply pressure to the proper soot blower  operating pressure
Answer_3: control the pressure exerted on the valve spring retainer
Answer_4: increase the pressure in the steam supply line for proper soot blower operation

Question_Title: Most main reduction gear units employ double helical cut gears, rather than single helical cut gears, because double helical cut gears __________.
Answer_1: eliminate the need for a turbine dummy piston
Answer_2: eliminate the need for spherically seated bearings

Question_Title: Lube oil temperature leaving the lube oil coolers is regulated by throttling the __________.
In an automatically fired boiler, increasing the temperature of the feedwater entering the steam drum will ultimately result in a/an __________.
Answer_1: increase in the quality of superheated steam
Answer_3: decrease in the degree of superheat
Answer_4: decrease in the quality of steam entering the superheater

Question_Title: The purpose of the main reduction gears is to __________.
Answer_1: transmit vibration and thrust to the ship's hull
Answer_2: reduce high turbine RPM to an efficient propeller RPM
Answer_3: reduce engine room noise levels during high speed operations
Answer_4: provide a means of reversing the main engines in an emergency

Question_Title: If a tube should leak in an operating main steam turbine lube oil cooler, the water will not immediately contaminate the oil because the __________.
Answer_2: plug type bypass valve will open
Answer_3: cooling pump would automatically shut off
Answer_4: oil pressure is greater than the water pressure

Question_Title: An air vent is installed on some reduction gear casings to  __________.
Answer_1: avoid the accumulation of flammable oil vapors
Answer_3: admit cooling air to the gearing

Question_Title: During high speed operation of the main turbine propulsion  unit, the heat absorbed by the lubricating oil is removed by the __________.
Which of the following bearings is designed to take loads applied to the axis of the shaft?
In some lube oil systems, the temperature of the lube oil downstream from the lube oil cooler is directly regulated by __________.
Answer_1: a thermostatically controlled valve which bypasses oil around the cooler
Answer_2: the amount of latent heat that the oil carries away from the bearings
Answer_4: The operating speed range of the equipment

Question_Title: When the temperature of the main steam turbine lubricating  oil is lowered, an increase will occur in the __________.
Thrust bearings are installed in main propulsion turbines to __________.
Answer_3: eliminate the need for dummy piston

Question_Title: To test an automatic low lube oil pressure trip on an idling turbogenerator and at the same time prevent the chance of bearing damage, you should __________.
Answer_1: actuate the overspeed trip, making a note at what pressure  the oil is dumped from under the operating piston
Answer_2: close the generator steam throttle valve and then ensure a  supply of oil through the hand or standby pump when the pressure drops to 5-6 psi
Answer_3: secure the steam supply to the throttle valve and then observe the oil pressure during the slowdown and throttle trip and ensure a supply of oil through the hand or standby pump when the pressure drops to 2-3 psi
Answer_4: ensure the standby lube oil pump, if so equipped, is properly lined up and set in the 'auto' mode, or the hand pump is being operated and then actuate the emergency trip

Question_Title: In a steadily steaming boiler, carryover is indicated by a/an __________.
Answer_2: sudden increase in superheater outlet temperature
Answer_3: sudden decrease in superheater outlet temperature

Question_Title: Which of the following methods provides for axial movement  in a gear type flexible coupling?
Answer_1: External teeth on the floating member are allowed to slide  between internal teeth on the shaft ring.
Answer_2: Each gear is allowed to slide on its shaft between retaining collars.
Answer_3: A coupling permits free relative radial motion of the gear  and pinion, thereby allowing axial movement.
Answer_4: Opposing helices act to balance axial thrust with the coupling.

Question_Title: The plugging of an excessive number of superheater tubes will result in __________.
After a prolonged shutdown of a main propulsion turbine, and before the turning gear is operated, the lube oil temperature should be at least __________.
A rapid fluctuation of the superheater outlet temperature on a steady steaming boiler could indicate __________.
Answer_2: excessive steam flow through the superheater
Answer_4: failure of the internal auxiliary desuperheater

Question_Title: What is the significance of pinion deflection in the operation of reduction gears?
Answer_1: Pinion deflection causes unequal tooth loading.
Answer_2: Deflection is minimal because the pinion is rigid.
Answer_3: Deflection increases the load at the center of the pinion.
Answer_4: Deflection decreases the load at the ends of the pinion.

Question_Title: At a given pressure, erosion of steam piping and machinery will be minimized by utilizing __________.
A heavy accumulation of soot on the fireside of the superheater can cause a __________.
Answer_1: low superheater outlet temperature because of the insulating effect of soot
Answer_2: high superheater outlet temperature because of reduced steam flow
Answer_3: high superheater inlet temperature because of decreased heat transfer
Answer_4: high superheater outlet temperature because of gas laning

Question_Title: Why is a high lube oil level in the main engine reduction gear sump undesirable?
Which of the listed operational checks should be continuously made on the main propulsion reduction gears?
Answer_2: Inspect alignment between gears and turbine.
Answer_3: Check teeth for pitting and scuffing.

Question_Title: After the housing has been bolted down, the final check of  reduction gear tooth contact is usually made by __________.
Boiler superheaters are designed to __________.
Answer_1: raise the sensible heat of the steam
Answer_2: increase the overall mechanical efficiency of the plant
Answer_3: provide continuous steam flow to the control desuperheater
Answer_4: raise the latent heat of the steam

Question_Title: Excessive thrust bearing wear in a main propulsion turbine  should FIRST become apparent by __________.
Answer_1: rubbing noises when jacking over the main unit
Answer_2: metal particles in the lube oil purifier
Answer_3: an intermittent vibration when changing speed

Question_Title: Increasing the amount of excess air to a boiler equipped with an uncontrolled interdeck superheater will cause the steam temperature at the superheater outlet to __________.
Oil flowing through the sight glass in the line between the lube oil gravity tank and main sump indicates the __________.
Answer_3: lube oil suction strainer is clogged

Question_Title: Gear surface failure caused by exceeding the endurance limit of the surface material is characterized by __________.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: An excessively high superheater temperature could be the result of __________.
Which of the following conditions is indicated by the oil flowing through a lube oil gravity tank bull's eye?
Answer_1: Excessive oil is stored in the gravity tank.
Answer_2: Sufficient oil flow is being supplied to the gravity tank.
Answer_3: Insufficient oil is being pumped to the gravity tank.

Question_Title: If a pressure drop does not exist across the superheater in a steaming boiler __________.
Answer_2: the drum safety valve is about to lift ahead of the superheater safety
Answer_3: there is no steam flow through the superheater
Answer_4: the feedwater temperature is too low

Question_Title: If a spring bearing begins to run at an abnormally high temperature, you should __________.
Answer_1: increase the water flow to the main lube oil cooler
Answer_2: immediately stop the shaft to prevent seizing
Answer_3: slow the shaft, if possible and supply emergency cooling water to the spring bearing housing
Answer_4: alternate the shaft speed to flush out the bearing

Question_Title: Superheaters of the convection type are heated __________.
Answer_1: by direct contact with the flame

Question_Title: You would not see a flow through the bull's-eye of the lube oil gravity tank overflow line when the __________.
Answer_1: main engines are stationary at a stop bell
Answer_2: main engines are secured and the turning gear is engaged
Answer_3: the lube oil service pumps are secured
Answer_4: main engines are turning at normal sea speed

Question_Title: Under operating conditions of constant load and rate of combustion, which of the following conditions will happen to the superheater when the amount of excess air to the furnace is increased?
Answer_2: The rate of heat transfer is decreased.
Answer_3: The rate of steam flow is increased regardless of all other firing conditions.

Question_Title: The temperature of steam at the superheater outlet is effected by the __________.
Answer_3: amount of moisture contained in the steam

Question_Title: The lube oil cooler will be used as a heater for the main propulsion unit __________.
Answer_1: when the vessel is operating at full speed
Answer_2: if the oil temperature is below 120F
Answer_3: when warming up a cold plant
Answer_4: when lube oils of different viscosities are used

Question_Title: Which statement is true concerning operational factors affecting the degree of superheat in a single furnace boiler?
Answer_1: As the rate of combustion increases, the degree of superheat increases throughout the entire firing range.
Answer_2: With a constant firing rate and steam consumption equal to generation, a decrease in the incoming feedwater temperature results in a superheat temperature decrease.
Answer_3: With large amounts of excess air, superheater outlet temperature will decrease due to the lack of sufficient time for heat transfer to take place.
Answer_4: Carrying boiler water total dissolved solids higher than normal could result in a decrease in the degree of superheat.

Question_Title: Rapid fluctuation in the superheater temperature of a steady steaming boiler indicates __________.
Rapid fluctuation of the superheater outlet temperature is  caused by __________.
The purpose of oil deflector rings for turbine shafts include __________.
Answer_2: preventing oil leakage along the shaft
Answer_3: forming the lube oil spray pattern
Answer_4: removing emulsified lube oil from the sump

Question_Title: The primary purpose of the refractory in a marine boiler is to __________.
Answer_1: conduct the heat of combustion away from the water wall tubes
Answer_2: protect the furnace casing and retain furnace heat
Answer_4: protect the superheater from convectional heat transfer

Question_Title: The purpose of the refractory lining of a water-tube boiler furnace is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent flames from impinging on tubes
Answer_2: assist in maintaining the heat of combustion within the furnace
Answer_4: protect the superheater from convectional heat transfer

Question_Title: A secondary function of the refractory installed in a marine boiler is to __________.
Answer_2: direct the flow of combustion gases
Answer_3: maintain air flow through the burner diffuser

Question_Title: The gravity tank in a gravity lube oil system serves to __________.
Answer_2: supply the lube oil service pump with a positive suction head
Answer_3: settle lube oil prior to purifying
Answer_4: maintain oil supply for several minutes to bearings should  the lube oil service pump fail

Question_Title: Which of the problems listed will reduce boiler efficiency?
Answer_3: Tolerating unacceptable levels of carbon monoxide in flue gas.

Question_Title: As compared with a typical front fired boiler, which of the listed conditions represents an advantage of a top fired boiler?
Answer_1: No division tube wall separating the convection and radiant sections of the furnace is ever required.
Answer_3: More uniform heat distribution and gas dwell is obtained within the furnace.
Answer_4: A lower fuel flow rate can be allowed, thus increasing economy.

Question_Title: On a ship equipped with a gravity type lube oil system, which of the conditions listed will occur FIRST if the main lube oil pump discharge pressure is lost?
Answer_1: All bearing oil pressure will be lost.
Answer_3: The astern throttle will immediately open.
Answer_4: Lube oil will be provided to the bearings and gears via the gravity tank overflow line.

Question_Title: Which of the listed absorbing agents could be used in a boiler during a dry lay up period?
A water-tube boiler can be laid up either wet or dry.  If it is to be laid up wet, you should __________.
Answer_1: completely fill the boiler with water, then blowdown to steaming level
Answer_2: completely fill the boiler with deaerated feedwater and maintain a slight pressure
Answer_3: drain and refill the boiler each week
Answer_4: drain and refill the boiler when the pH goes above 6

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is the engineer's FIRST warning that the main lube oil pump has stopped?
Answer_1: Gravity tank low level alarm will sound.
Answer_2: Lack of oil in the overflow bull's-eye is observed.
Answer_3: High main engine bearing temperatures will be noted.
Answer_4: Low main sump level alarm will sound.

Question_Title: When a propulsion boiler is removed from service for an extended period, why should the firesides be thoroughly cleaned and dried?
Answer_4: Reduce the possibility of thermal spalling.

Question_Title: Which of the listed actions should be carried out if a ship is to be laid up for an indefinite period of time?
Answer_1: Boilers to be laid up wet should be completely filled.
Answer_2: All fuel tanks should be cleaned and gas freed.
Answer_3: All potable water tanks should be cleaned and disinfected.

Question_Title: When you are installing a new furnace floor in an oil fired boiler, the clearance between the firebricks should be large enough to __________.
Answer_1: allow for expansion without subjecting the joint to flame penetration
Answer_2: facilitate rebricking at required maintenance intervals
Answer_3: allow for proper filling with slag under normal operating conditions
Answer_4: allow for installation of plastic chrome ore after drying

Question_Title: Supply pressure to the main lube oil header of a gravity feed lube oil system is __________.
Answer_1: the result of the height of the gravity tank above the manifold
Answer_2: the sum of the lube oil static head pressure and service pump discharge pressure
Answer_3: the difference between the lube oil static head pressure and service pump discharge pressure
Answer_4: merely the service pump discharge pressure, since the static heads of the lines to and from the gravity tank cancel out  one another

Question_Title: To assure a long service life for boiler refractory materials after installation, the most effective method is  to __________.
Answer_1: maintain a high furnace temperature at all times
Answer_2: patch refractory with plastic chrome ore
Answer_3: properly secure refractory with anchor bolts
Answer_4: avoid rapid temperature changes and follow recommended operating procedures

Question_Title: Magnets located in lube oil strainers serve to __________.
Answer_1: remove all metallic particles from the lube oil
Answer_2: remove ferrous metallic particles from the lube oil
Answer_3: remove nonferrous metallic particles from the lube oil
Answer_4: hold the strainer cover in place when removing or installing the cover bolts

Question_Title: Which of the listed procedures is the most important factor to take into consideration when making repairs to the refractory surrounding the burner openings?
Answer_1: All cracks must be completely filled.
Answer_2: Finished repair surfaces must be smooth.
Answer_3: Design refractory cone angle must be maintained.

Question_Title: A furnace wall in which there are open spaces around the brick as a result of firebrick shrinkage, is __________.
Answer_1: normal and need only be cleaned

Question_Title: In a pressure type main propulsion turbine lubrication system, the lube oil service pumps normally take suction from the main sump and discharge directly to the __________.
When drying and baking are impractical, or time is not available, which of the listed materials could be used to repair both burner openings and gas baffles?
Water can enter the lube oil system of a main propulsion turbine unit from __________.
Answer_1: leaky tubes in secured lube oil coolers
Answer_3: vents on tanks and gear casings

Question_Title: When cleaning the waterside of boiler tubes with a powered  rotary brush, the brush should kept in motion to __________.
The temperature of emulsified lubricating oil entering a purifier from a preheater should range between __________.
Maximum heat transfer rates in a marine boiler can be obtained by __________.
Answer_1: maintaining the recommended boiler water pH
Answer_2: treating the boiler water with oxygen scavenging chemicals
Answer_4: keeping the watersides free from scale deposits

Question_Title: Water retained in the lube oil system of a main propulsion  turbine installation is undesireable because it __________.
Answer_1: causes pitting of the gear teeth
Answer_3: raises the flash point of the oil to a dangerously high level
Answer_4: results in excessive cooling of bearing surfaces

Question_Title: The correct method of expanding a generating tube at the boiler drum tube sheet is to roll __________.
Answer_1: to a depth less than the thickness of the drum tube sheet
Answer_2: to a depth greater than the thickness of the drum tube sheet
Answer_3: heavily at the tube end prior to welding the tube to the drum tube sheet
Answer_4: slightly at the tube end prior to welding the tube to the drum tube sheet

Question_Title: If the main and standby lube oil service pumps of the main  engine fail while underway at sea, __________.
Answer_1: an emergency supply of oil in the gravity tank will provide time to crash stop the turbine and gears
Answer_2: the reduction gear bearings will immediately fail
Answer_3: the turbine bearings will immediately fail
Answer_4: emergency lubrication can be supplied through the use of the hand pump

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions is the cause of heavy flaking of an alloy tube being rolled or expanded into a tube header?
Answer_1: Tube is brittle as a result of long storage time at high temperatures.
Answer_2: Tube has a flaw at the point of tube sheet entry.
Answer_3: Diameter of the tube roller is too large.
Answer_4: Excessive tube roller pressure is being applied.

Question_Title: If lube oil pressure to the main turbines is lost while underway at sea speed, the rotor should be stopped  immediately.  This is accomplished by __________.
Answer_2: tightening the stern tube packing gland
Answer_3: securing all steam to the turbines
Answer_4: admitting astern steam to the turbines after securing ahead steam

Question_Title: What is the FIRST thing that will happen if both the main and standby lube oil pumps fail on a geared main propulsion turbine operating at full sea speed?
The process of flaring the section of a boiler tube extending beyond the tube sheet into the drum is known as __________.
Which of the conditions listed could cause an oil flow sight glass, of a main turbine bearing, to be completely filled with oil?
Answer_2: A restriction in the oil drain line to the sump.
Answer_3: Excessive air trapped in the lube oil system.
Answer_4: Oil being circulated at too cold a temperature.

Question_Title: Proper lagging of a single-element feedwater regulator is  accomplished by applying the insulation material __________.
Answer_1: to the steam connection, but not water connection
Answer_2: to the water connection, but not steam connection
Answer_3: to both connections, including finned areas
Answer_4: only as necessary to prevent possible injury

Question_Title: Magnets are installed in the main propulsion turbine lube oil strainers to attract metal particles released through wearing of the __________.
When testing boiler safeties, those valves not being tested are prevented from lifting by __________.
Answer_3: temporarily increasing the valve spring pressure

Question_Title: If the main turbine bearing lube oil pressure drops to 'zero' and cannot be restored immediately, you should __________.
Answer_1: notify bridge and crash stop the engine
Answer_2: reduce turbine rotor speed until lube oil sump level returns to normal
Answer_3: reduce turbine rotor speed and pump lube oil with the hand  emergency pump
Answer_4: strike down makeup lube oil from the gravity tanks

Question_Title: To prevent safety valves from lifting when a boiler is being hydrostatically tested, you should __________.
Answer_1: tie down the hand lifting gear

Question_Title: If you are underway at full speed on a vessel fitted with a main propulsion turbine pressure lubrication system, which  of the following actions will be necessary upon complete loss of lube oil pressure?
Answer_1: Slow the main engines and strike down additional oil from the gravity tank.
Answer_2: First close the ahead throttle valve, then open the astern  guardian valve, and then open the astern throttle to admit  astern steam as quickly as possible.
Answer_3: Secure main steam to the turbines immediately and engage jacking gear.
Answer_4: Secure main steam to the turbines and break vacuum on the main plant immediately.

Question_Title: Which of the precautions listed should be taken when gagging a boiler safety valve?
Answer_1: Do not allow the gag to contact the safety valve stem.
Answer_2: Tighten the gag only with the special wrench supplied with  the gag.
Answer_3: Ensure that all moving parts of the safety valve are free to move before installing the gag.
Answer_4: Tighten the gag only finger tight to prevent damage to the  valve stem, disc or seat.

Question_Title: What immediate action should you take if you are on watch and note 'zero' lube oil pressure for the operating main turbine?
Answer_1: Immediately increase cooling water flow to lube oil cooler.
Answer_2: Slow the turbine to minimum speed and watch the bearing temperatures.

Question_Title: Safety valve gags should only be installed hand tight in order to prevent __________.
If a lube oil pump fails to build up discharge pressure, the cause could be the __________.
When using the universal color contrast-type dye penetrant  to examine a boiler weldment, any surface defect will appear __________.
Answer_3: white against a dull red background
Answer_4: bright red against a white background

Question_Title: Abnormally low lube oil service pump pressure may be the result of __________.
An excessive pressure differential across a lube oil strainer could indicate __________.
Answer_2: the filter elements are installed upside down
Answer_3: the relief valve is stuck open

Question_Title: When installing new safety valve escape piping, precautions should include assuring that __________.
Answer_1: bends or elbows in the line do not exist
Answer_2: no stress is transmitted to the valve
Answer_4: the piping leads directly to the bilge

Question_Title: While a vessel is underway, which of the conditions listed  would indicate a leak in the lube oil cooler?
Answer_2: Excessive water discharge rate from the lube oil purifier.
Answer_4: Corrosion of the journals and bearings.

Question_Title: Which of the listed operating practices is considered as safe, and should be followed when opening and inspecting the waterside of a boiler?
Answer_1: Open the water drum manhole before opening the steam drum manhole.
Answer_2: Wire all valves closed that connect to other boilers.
Answer_3: Remove handhole plate dogs with a slugging wrench.
Answer_4: Ventilate the waterside until completely dry.

Question_Title: When a sudden increase in pressure occurs in a forced lubrication system, you should check for a __________.
Answer_1: loss of oil flow across one of the bearings
Answer_3: ruptured tube in the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: Oil deposits can be removed from the waterside of boilers by 'boiling out' with a/an __________.
When there is a sudden increase of lubricating oil pump discharge pressure in a force feed lubricating system, you  should FIRST check the __________.
Answer_3: lubricating oil flow from the bearings

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of waterside deposits can normally be removed by boiling out a boiler?
A sudden increase in lube oil pressure to the main turbine  would indicate __________.
Answer_1: a leak in the gravity tank

Question_Title: Which of the listed factors is true concerning the  application and use of plastic fireclay furnace refractory?
Answer_1: The volume stability and bond strength are practically equal to standard brick and is therefore used extensively throughout in side wall construction.
Answer_2: The plastic should, where possible, be hand rammed in a horizontal direction toward the casing to guard against the forming of horizontal cleavage planes.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the unchecked growth of microbiological organisms within a fuel system?

Answer_2: The fuel in the tank will loose its fluidity, solidify, and be the cause of an expensive removal process.
Answer_3: Corrosion of various metal components will occur due to the formation of hydrogen sulfide gas.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: If the feed pump for an auxiliary boiler fails to deliver the feed water to the boiler, the cause may be __________.

Question_Title: When there is a flame failure in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler, the __________.

Question_Title: Cooling the intake air supplied to a diesel engine will __________.

Question_Title: The water in an auxiliary boiler should be tested for chloride content to determine __________.

Question_Title: Excessive return oil pressure from a variable capacity return flow fuel oil burner system on an automatic auxiliary boiler, will cause __________.

Answer_2: crankshaft speed in a two-stroke cycle diesel engine

Answer_4: one-fourth times crankshaft speed in a four-stroke cycle diesel engine

Question_Title: Wristpin bearings are difficult to lubricate because of their oscillating motion and __________.

Answer_3: cause automatic restart after a purge period
Answer_4: cause an explosion in the boiler furnace

Question_Title: When an auxiliary boiler is secured and you expect to relight the unit within six hours, you should __________.

Answer_3: flush the boiler and close the waterside airtight

Question_Title: If the combustion control system of an automatically fired  auxiliary boiler fails to restart from the normal shutdown  mode, you should check for __________.

Answer_3: prevent hardened scale deposits in the water drum

Question_Title: A sprayer plate marked 32Y20, as used in a return flow fuel oil system, should only be used with a/an __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is indicated by the presence of water in the scavenging air receiver?

Question_Title: The speed of the camshaft in a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine, running at 950 RPM, is __________.

Question_Title: Explosion relief valves on diesel engine crankcases should  relieve the pressure at not more than __________.

Answer_3: the same speed as the crankshaft

Question_Title: What is the purpose of the 'window' installed in the housing of an individual jerk pump?

Question_Title: For diesel engine piston cooling, lubricating oil can be supplied to the pistons by a/an __________.

Answer_4: the operation of the thermostatic valve

Question_Title: On a turbocharged, medium-speed, diesel engine, which of the following problems is an indication of a restricted air intake passage?

Answer_3: the same speed as the crankshaft
Answer_4: a speed independent of the crankshaft

Question_Title: Oil for piston cooling is delivered through the connecting  rod to a compartment in the piston head, then distributed as a result of piston motion, and finally drained to the crankcase through one or more holes or pipes. This procedure is known as the _____________ .

Question_Title: An indication of a diesel engine air intake being partially clogged, is __________.
Answer_1: low firing pressure and low exhaust temperatures
Answer_2: low firing pressure and normal exhaust temperatures
Answer_3: high firing pressure and low exhaust temperatures
Answer_4: high firing pressure and high exhaust temperatures

Question_Title: An important design characteristic of an explosion relief valve for a diesel engine is the ability to __________.

Answer_2: open quickly against crankcase pressure to prevent a possible implosion
Answer_3: close quickly in order to prevent an inrush of air
Answer_4: close slowly to permit proper seating of the valve disc and neoprene sealing surfaces

Question_Title: Which chemical listed is utilized to prevent and correct most microbial infections occurring within fuel storage systems?

Answer_2: Through the sprayer plate drilled passages.

Question_Title: If a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is running at 1550 RPM, the speed of the camshaft will be __________.

Question_Title: The method of piston cooling in which oil is delivered through the connecting rod to a compartment within the piston, then distributed by the motion of the pistons, and  allowed to drain to the crankcase via one or more holes or pipes, is termed __________.

Question_Title: Proper housekeeping to prevent the formation of microbiological growths within a fuel system includes the prevention of water accumulations and the use of __________.

Question_Title: Two solenoid control valves are required on large automatic auxiliary boilers, and will simultaneously shut off the fuel in the event of __________.

Question_Title: The solenoid valves in the fuel oil supply line to an automatically fired auxiliary boiler, are automatically closed by __________.

Question_Title: If the intake, or exhaust valve stem clearance is found to  be excessive, in addition to too little movement of the rocker arms, you should check for __________.

Question_Title: Why should the main steam stop valve of an auxiliary boiler be eased off its seat and then gently closed before lighting off?
Answer_2: To examine the valve stem for scars or nicks.

Question_Title: One function of the fuel pump delivery check valve is to __________.

Answer_3: maintain popping pressure in the high pressure steel piping to the injector

Answer_4: increase fuel consumption per horsepower hour

Question_Title: Flame failure in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler can result from a/an __________.

Answer_1: Vent air from the steam drum
Answer_3: Lift the safety valves by hand

Answer_2: thrown off from the main bearings

Answer_2: Inspect and clean burner fuel oil solenoid valves

Answer_2: On the suction side of the delivery pump

Question_Title: As a general rule, the recommended operating water jacket outlet temperature range for medium and high speed marine diesels with closed cooling systems is __________.

Answer_3: recycle exhaust gas to the turbocharger
Answer_4: minimize moisture condensation in the boiler gas passages at low loads

Question_Title: The fuel oil supply system to an automatic auxiliary boiler, will automatically shutdown if the boiler __________.

Answer_3: cooling water pumps are directly reversible
Answer_4: jacket water temperature is more easily controlled

Question_Title: The diesel engine exhaust gas bypass, as fitted with some waste heat boilers, is installed to __________.
Answer_1: prevent engine back pressure at heavy loads

Answer_3: prevent boiler corrosion at low engine loads
Answer_4: improve engine fuel consumption at any load

Question_Title: 'Loop,' 'uniflow,' 'crossflow,' and 'return-flow' are terms used to describe various types of __________.

Answer_1: The damper on the inlet side of the furnace is moved to the open position for a given number of seconds and then moved  to the closed position.
Answer_2: The damper on the inlet side of the furnace is moved to the open position for a given number of seconds and then moved  to the low fire position.
Answer_3: The damper is moved to the closed position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the low fire position.
Answer_4: The damper in the uptakes is moved to the wide open position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the low firing rate position.

Question_Title: High stack temperature occurring in an auxiliary boiler could be a result of __________.

Answer_3: a faulty transformer in the ignition circuit

Question_Title: The principal difference between loop scavenging and crossflow scavenging, as used in single acting diesel engines, is the __________.
Answer_1: direction of air flow within the cylinder
Answer_4: volume of air admitted to the cylinder

Question_Title: An inline engine having a nine inch bore and more than eight cylinders will __________.
Answer_1: incorporate the use of two explosion relief valves

Question_Title: The PRIMARY function of a waste heat boiler is to __________.

Answer_3: sludge formation cannot occur in the steam separator
Answer_4: waterside blowdown will not be required

Question_Title: In a diesel engine closed freshwater cooling system where the cooling water pressure drop through the engine is 10 psig, and the pressure drop through the heat exchanger is 4 psig.  The cooling water pump must produce a discharge head of at least __________.

Answer_3: metering device in the air supply line

Question_Title: A safety valve on an auxiliary boiler simmers constantly and can not be stopped by several quick blow-offs using the hand relieving gear.  The problem may be __________.

Answer_4: increase jacket water temperature for easier starting in cold weather

Question_Title: Which of the air intake systems listed will result in the lowest specific fuel consumption?

Answer_4: one crankshaft except in cases where an opposed piston design is required

Question_Title: An auxiliary boiler is equipped with a return flow fuel atomization system, which uses a/an __________.

Answer_1: controls the flow of feedwater to the boiler

Answer_3: secures the fires when a fusible plug burns out
Answer_4: automatically regulates the quantity of oil and air flow to the burner

Question_Title: In a diesel engine closed freshwater cooling system employing a radiator, proper water temperature can be obtained by __________.
Answer_2: passing cooling water through a space heater
Answer_3: passing cooling water through the lube oil cooler
Answer_4: piping exhaust gases across the radiator front

Question_Title: If the combustion control system of an automatically fired  auxiliary boiler fails to relight the burner after a normal shutdown, you should check for a/an __________.

Question_Title: A waste heat boiler is installed on some diesel propelled vessels to __________.

Question_Title: Automatic combustion control systems for auxiliary boilers  are designed to cycle burners on and off in response to the __________.

Question_Title: Camshafts are usually driven by timing gears or __________.

Question_Title: Which of the listed parts on a fire-tube auxiliary boiler requires a written report to the Officer-in-Charge of Marine Inspection when renewed?

Answer_3: close sharply when the pressure drops to its set pressure

Question_Title: Additional explosion relief valves are fitted on separate spaces of the crankcase, such as gear or chain cases for camshaft or similar drives, when the __________.
Answer_1: overall volume of such spaces exceeds 21 cubic feet
Answer_2: possibility of explosion exists due to the formation of volatile gases
Answer_3: unit is operating in extreme overload conditions
Answer_4: gross volume of such space exceeds 0.6 cubic meter

Question_Title: When conducting a hydrostatic test on a water-tube  auxiliary boiler, the test water should be heated to a temperature of at least 70F.  This is done to __________.
Answer_1: minimize the coefficient of expansion within the varying types of metals used in boiler construction
Answer_2: help prevent the formation of condensation on the tube exteriors
Answer_3: eliminate oxygen being carried into the system

Question_Title: A photoelectric cell installed in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler burner management system __________.
Answer_1: opens the burner circuit upon sensing a flame failure
Answer_2: detects a flame failure by monitoring radiant heat from glowing refractory
Answer_3: requires mechanical linkage to secure the burner fuel supply
Answer_4: must be bypassed at low firing rates

Question_Title: The maximum allowable working pressure on a packaged auxiliary boiler is 200 psig.  The normal working pressure  for one particular packaged boiler is 175 psig.  Which of the following safety relief valve settings would be proper  for this boiler?
The valve cam slope angle determines the __________.
Answer_2: acceleration rate of valve opening and closing
Answer_4: diameter of intake and exhaust valves

Question_Title: The rate of fuel injection in a diesel engine cylinder depends primarily on __________.
Answer_1: the size of the holes in the fuel nozzle

Question_Title: A smoking burner with a pulsating flame in an auxiliary boiler, is an indication that the __________.
Answer_1: fuel oil supply temperature is normal

Question_Title: On an automatically fired auxiliary boiler, the steam pressure limit switch is wired into the burner electric circuit to __________.
Answer_1: sound an alarm when the burner is shut off
Answer_2: energized the flame scanner circuit when high boiler pressure is reached
Answer_3: shut off the burner when the cutoff pressure is reached
Answer_4: prevent burner operation in the event of low boiler water level

Question_Title: A variable capacity, pressure atomizing, fuel oil burner functions to __________.
Answer_2: provide a wide range of combustion
Answer_3: provide a constant fuel return pressure

Question_Title: The firing range of a variable capacity, return flow-type fuel atomizer is regulated to meet steam demand by varying  the __________.
Excessive vibration from an auxiliary boiler could be caused by __________.
After lighting off a cold, automatically fired, auxiliary boiler, as steam begins to form, you should __________.
Answer_2: give the boiler a bottom blow

Question_Title: In a coil-type forced circulation auxiliary water-tube boiler __________.
Answer_1: steam is recirculated through heating coils in the boiler
Answer_2: hot water flashes to steam in the flash chamber
Answer_3: unevaporated feedwater is lost through the atmospheric vent
Answer_4: response to steam demand is slower than in a fire-tube boiler

Question_Title: The shape of a diesel engine cam determines the __________.
Answer_1: points of opening and closing of the valve
Answer_2: velocity of opening and closing of the valve
Answer_3: amount of the valve lift from its seat

Question_Title: Which of the following devices is normally provided to prevent oil starvation in a diesel engine lubrication system utilizing the 'full flow' principle?
Answer_3: Pressure relief bypass line around the filter

Question_Title: Corrosion inhibitors and/or soluble oils are added to diesel engine cooling systems to __________.
Answer_1: maintain low pH in the cooling water
Answer_4: form a protective film on metal surfaces

Question_Title: Cylinders diameters greater than 230 mm require additional  safety devices when the scavenging spaces are openly connected to the cylinders. Which of the following devices will be used to protect such spaces?
Answer_4: Stacked plate type inlet check valves

Question_Title: If poor combustion occurs in an auxiliary boiler due to an  air damper linkage being out of adjustment, you would adjust the linkage and then __________.
Answer_2: test the high and low fire solenoids
Answer_3: check the photocell window for carbon deposits
Answer_4: check the burner ignition electrode gap

Question_Title: Which of the automatic boiler controls listed should be tested prior to lighting off an auxiliary boiler?
Answer_3: Voltage output of the ignition transformer
Answer_4: Insulation resistance readings in the ignition system high  tension leads

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions would cause 'panting' in a steaming auxiliary boiler?
The valve cam slope angle determines the __________.
Answer_1: opening and closing points of the valve
Answer_2: opening and closing rate of the valve
Answer_4: amount of time the valve remains open

Question_Title: The accumulation of carbon deposits building up near the injection nozzle tip is least likely to occur when using which of the listed types of fuel injector nozzles?
A large low speed main propulsion diesel engine may become overloaded by_______________.; ;   I.  a heavily fouled hull ;  II.  strong head winds and heavy seas
Which of the following statements concerning the operation  of a coil-type forced circulation auxiliary water-tube boiler is correct?
Answer_1: Water is continuously circulated through a preheater before it enters the flash chamber.
Answer_2: Steam is generated in the heating coils and is force fed to an accumulator.
Answer_3: Unevaporated boiler water collects in the bottom of the accumulator.
Answer_4: Moisture is removed from generated steam in a radiant superheater.

Question_Title: If oil is dripping from the burner of a coil-type auxiliary steam generator, the cause may be __________.
Answer_1: the oil valve not seating properly
Answer_3: carbon on the burner nozzle causing deflection of oil spray

Question_Title: In a forced circulation auxiliary boiler, steam is formed in the __________.
Ignition failure in an automatically controlled auxiliary boiler can be caused by __________.
The arrangement and shape of the cams on a diesel engine camshaft directly control which of the listed groups of operating conditions?
Answer_2: Firing order, valve timing, and valve lift
Answer_3: Fuel consumption, efficiency, and cylinder pressure
Answer_4: Scavenge pressure, compression ratio, and exhaust pressure

Question_Title: Fuel injectors used in heavy fuel oil systems are usually provided with cooling to reduce __________.
A spring-loaded relief valve is located on some lube oil filters in full flow systems to __________.
Answer_1: prevent overpressurization of the filter cartridge
Answer_2: prevent overpressurization of the filter casing
Answer_3: bypass the filter should it become clogged
Answer_4: limit the lube oil outlet pressure

Question_Title: A diesel engine cooling water system with a pH factor of 3.0 indicates a condition of __________.
What is required for crosshead type engines that have a scavenging space in open connection to the cylinder?
Answer_1: The air flow from the scavenging space must always be protected by plate type check valves and under no circumstance may other devices be used.
Answer_2: A suitable gasket for the interface of both manifolds is necessary to prevent recirculation of scavenging gases, while additionally minimizing exhaust gas leakage.
Answer_3: The scavenging space is to be permanently connected to an approved fire extinguishing system, entirely separate from  the fire extinguishing system of the engine room.
Answer_4: The required equipment for a crosshead type engine is totally dependent upon manufacturers ability to placate market demands.

Question_Title: A sudden flame failure in an operating auxiliary boiler, equipped with an automatic combustion control system and burning light fuel, could be attributed to a __________.
Answer_1: dead or malfunctioning step up transformer

Question_Title: The flame safeguard controls of a large automatically fired auxiliary boiler, may consist of a __________.
Which of the following statements concerning fire-tube boilers is correct?
Answer_1: Combustion gases flow through the tubes.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements about a coil-type forced  circulation auxiliary water-tube boiler is correct?
Answer_1: Steam bubbles are generated in the flash chamber.
Answer_2: Steam is recirculated to the heating coils.
Answer_3: Response to steam demand is comparatively rapid.
Answer_4: Unevaporated feedwater drains to the bilge.

Question_Title: In a diesel engine cooling water system, a pH of 6.0 indicates a/an __________.
Indirect cooling of fuel injector nozzle holders for diesel engines is accomplished primarily by __________.
Answer_1: heat conduction into the injected fuel oil
Answer_2: heat conduction into the water jacket wall
Answer_3: water circulation through passages in the holder
Answer_4: fuel oil circulation through passages in the holder

Question_Title: In which of the following areas of a crosshead engine is a  permanently connected fire extinguishing system required?
Answer_1: Exhaust manifolds in excess of eight inches in diameter.
Answer_2: Crankcases having a gross volume in excess of 21 cubic feet.
Answer_3: Turbocharger inlet piping in excess of twelve inches in diameter.
Answer_4: Scavenging spaces in open connection to the cylinders.

Question_Title: Ignition failure in an auxiliary boiler can be caused by __________.
Answer_3: excess fuel pressure at the nozzle

Question_Title: When two cams of the same diameter, one with tangential flanks and the other with convex flanks are compared, the cam with tangential flanks will cause___________.
The pH value of water in a diesel engine closed cooling water system should be maintained between __________.
The purpose of the safety relief valves installed on an auxiliary boiler is to __________.
Answer_1: relieve excess fuel oil pressure during the 'off' fire cycle
Answer_2: admit water to the dry pipe
Answer_3: throttle the forced draft fan output for proper combustion
Answer_4: reduce excess steam pressure in the boiler

Question_Title: An AC diesel generator incapable of being paralleled with  the main bus normally employs an isochronous governor in order to __________.
Answer_1: increase speed droop in proportion to load
Answer_2: maintain a frequency of 60 cycles per second
Answer_3: increase or decrease engine speed upon load demand

Question_Title: The most common contaminate of governor hydraulic fluid is  __________.
Which of the substances listed is satisfactorily removed from the fuel by a centrifugal oil purifier?
A magnetic strainer is used in the diesel engine reduction  gear oil system to remove small particles of __________.

A two stroke diesel engine exhaust temperature will be lower than a four stroke diesel engine of the same displacement because the  __________.; ;  I.  mep is lower and the scavenging air is cooling the  exhaust gases ;  II. valve overlap in a four stroke diesel engine is  greater
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: Neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: Which of the following listed construction details of internal combustion engines is required?
Answer_1: A warning notice to caution against the opening of a hot crankcase for a specified period of time after shut down.
Answer_2: The use of end block construction for engines developing over 1000 brake horsepower.
Answer_3: Removable cylinder liners must be used for engines  developing over 1000 brake horsepower.
Answer_4: All engines shall be provided with an exhaust gas pressure  monitoring system.

Question_Title: The safety valve installed on a coil-type auxiliary boiler  is located on the __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning pressure limit switches and pressuretrols installed on auxiliary boilers?
Answer_1: They are bimetallic elements sensing temperature differentials corresponding to pressure changes.
Answer_2: They consist of a bellows assembly, linked with a snap action switch, through a pressure adjusting mechanism.
Answer_3: They automatically relieve excessive steam pressure by acting as a pilot to the safety valve.
Answer_4: They automatically restart the burner sequence via the high water level signal.

Question_Title: A port-and-helix fuel injection pump having upper and lower plunger helixes is designed to __________.
Answer_1: vary fuel delivery and return pressure
Answer_2: vary the beginning and ending of injection

Question_Title: When checking zincs in a saltwater cooled heat exchanger, you should __________.
Answer_1: paint the zincs to stop corrosion
Answer_2: insulate the zincs to alter the temperature
Answer_3: replace the zincs if they are 50% consumed
Answer_4: file the zincs to change the shape

Question_Title: In reducing engine speed to an efficient propeller speed by the use of reduction gears, __________.
Answer_1: speed and torque are both reduced
Answer_2: speed is reduced and torque remains unchanged
Answer_3: speed is reduced and torque is increased
Answer_4: speed is sometimes unchanged while torque is increased

Question_Title: One advantage of hydraulic clutches over mechanical clutches in diesel engine installations is __________.
Answer_1: the power is transmitted at a very high efficiency of 60%
Answer_2: the torsional vibrations are transmitted directly to the reduction gears
Answer_3: each clutch has a separate oil gland for reverse operation
Answer_4: no mechanical connection exists between the driving and driven elements

Question_Title: A diesel generator governor is hunting.  After changing the oil the governor is flushed and the compensation needle valve is adjusted; but the hunting persists.  You should NOW __________.
Answer_2: calibrate the fuel pump rack settings
Answer_3: set the speed droop adjustment to zero
Answer_4: carefully check for binding in the governor linkage

Question_Title: In order to reverse the rotation of a two-stroke/cycle loop scavenged, direct reversing, propulsion diesel engine, the  cam positions must be changed for the __________.
Some fuel injection systems utilize port-and-helix metering. Which of the following statement describes a system 'timed  for port closing'?
Answer_1: Injection has a variable beginning and a constant ending.
Answer_2: Injection is metered by an external delivery valve.
Answer_3: Injection has a constant beginning and variable ending.
Answer_4: Injection will not occur until the helix closes the delivery valve.

Question_Title: During a routine round of a diesel engine generator, you observe a low oil level in the governor sump. If there is no visible sign of external leakage, you should suspect the cause to be a/an  __________.
Answer_1: leakage through the governor drive shaft oil seal
Answer_2: leakage through the power piston oil seal
Answer_4: defect in the sight glass gasket

Question_Title: A continuous fluctuation of the speed, due to overcontrol by the governor, is known as __________.
Airflex clutches are used to transmit power from a diesel engine to the propeller shaft.  A restricted orifice is used in the control air system of this unit to __________.
Answer_1: delay deflation of the clutch being disengaged
Answer_2: delay inflation of the clutch being engaged
Answer_3: reduce the deflation time of both clutches
Answer_4: reduce the inflation time of both clutches

Question_Title: The purpose of try-cocks used on an auxiliary boiler is to  __________.
Answer_1: provide an alternate means of determining the water level,  if the gage glass fails
Answer_2: provide a means of adding chemical feed to the boiler water
Answer_3: provide a means for blowing down the gage glass
Answer_4: act as a steam sentinel valve, if any of the fusible plugs  should melt

Question_Title: When an additional load is applied to a diesel engine which is using an air bladder clutch unit that is inadequately inflated, you can expect __________.
Answer_4: excessive wear on the thrust bearings

Question_Title: A diesel engine is equipped with an isochronous hydraulic governor.  A decrease in load will cause the engine speed to __________.
Answer_3: decrease slightly then returned to original speed
Answer_4: increase slightly then returned to original speed

Question_Title: The reversing cams of some four-stroke/cycle diesel engines are brought into position by __________.
Answer_1: sliding the camshaft along its axis
Answer_4: moving the idler sprockets in the drive chain

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes a fuel injection pump marked 'timed for port closing'?
Answer_1: Injection has a constant beginning and variable ending.
Answer_2: The pump stroke determines the amount of fuel injected.
Answer_3: Fuel is metered by the pump's delivery valve.
Answer_4: Timing reference marks should be changed.

Question_Title: Internal combustion engines are to be fitted with governors to prevent the engines from exceeding the rated speed by more than __________.
Slippage of an air operated friction clutch can result from __________.
Misalignment of the drive shaft and propeller shaft flanges can be detected by using a dial indicator or __________.
The temperature at which an adjustable bellows type thermostatic valve operates is determined by __________.
Answer_1: changing the position of the actuating bulb
Answer_2: replacing the bellows with a heavier spring
Answer_3: varying air loading pressure to the bellows
Answer_4: changing the spring compression opposing the bellows

Question_Title: In addition to the normal governor, each main engine having a maximum continuous output of 300 hp and over, which can be declutched or which drives a controllable pitch propeller,  __________.
Answer_1: is not required to have any additional overspeed protection provided a hydraulic governor is used
Answer_2: and is a direct reversible engine, is required to have an  overspeed trip set to secure the fuel to the engine when its rated speed is exceeded by more than 15 percent
Answer_3: is to be fitted with a separate overspeed device so adjusted that the speed cannot exceed the maximum rated speed by more than 20 percent
Answer_4: will not require any additional overspeed protection provided a mechanical type governor is used

Question_Title: Where one or more diesel driven AC generators are operating in parallel, reducing the value of the speed droop to 'zero' on one unit will allow that unit to __________.
Answer_1: gradually reduce its speed as load is applied
Answer_3: automatically divide and balance the loads
Answer_4: effectively anticipate the amount of fuel necessary to bring the engine up to the proper output to accept the increased  load

Question_Title: What is the crank angle between any two crank throws in the firing order of a four-stroke/cycle, in line, eight cylinder diesel engine?
Increasing the load on an engine using a double-helix type  injection pump varies the effective stroke of the pump to start __________.
Effective hydraulic coupling operation depends upon a certain amount of __________.
If the cooling water temperature and the lube oil temperature in a diesel engine are too high, the cause can  be __________.
Answer_4: excessive wear of the cooling water pump

Question_Title: Most large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engines use duplex lube oil strainer to __________.
Answer_1: decrease the time required between cleanings
Answer_2: remove all large and small foreign objects
Answer_3: ensure a positive flow of oil at all times
Answer_4: ensure that all lube oil has been treated twice

Question_Title: While inspecting the main bearings on a diesel engine you find impregnated dirt and scratches in the bearing surface. You would, therefore, suspect that __________.
Answer_2: water was present in the oil
Answer_3: the lube oil was not being properly filtered
Answer_4: the maximum allowable bearing pressure had been exceeded

Question_Title: The gage glass on a coil-type auxiliary boiler is connected to the __________.
The linear motion of a diesel engine piston is converted into the rotary motion required to drive gears, propeller shafts, and generators by the __________.

The port-and-helix metering pumps, used in diesel fuel injection systems, are usually designed to produce a constant beginning and a variable ending of fuel injection. These pumps are usually __________.
Where would a coarse screen wire-mesh strainer normally be found on a diesel engine lubrication system?
High diesel engine cooling water temperatures can be caused by __________.
Which of the listed problems would be indicated by an accumulation of water in one cylinder, in addition to the crankcase of an idle diesel engine?
One advantage of electromagnetic slip couplings is  __________.
Answer_2: torque increases with a decrease in excitation current
Answer_3: the coupling rapidly responds to sudden changes of load
Answer_4: excitation and induction power losses appear as a change in torque instead of rotational speed between the primary and  secondary elements

Question_Title: If a hydraulic governor has been refilled with oil, the engine should be operated until it reaches normal temperature, then the air should be purged, and the __________.
Answer_2: compensating needle valve should be opened fully
Answer_3: compensating needle valve should be adjusted to stabilize operation
Answer_4: speed limiting device should be adjusted

Question_Title: The rotary motion of a diesel engine crankshaft is obtained from the up and down motion of the piston via the __________.
Unusually low oil pressure in the lube oil header of a diesel engine is the result of a/an __________.
Answer_1: pressure regulating valve being stuck in the closed position
Answer_2: restricted lube oil passage in the engine
Answer_3: air leak in the lube oil cooler
Answer_4: air leak in the oil pump suction line

Question_Title: High diesel engine cooling water temperatures can be caused by __________.
Answer_4: no air in the cooling system

Question_Title: A diesel engine is operating at 1800 RPM and driving a propeller at 600 RPM.  What is the speed reduction ratio?
The power loss associated with slip in a fluid coupling appears as __________.
The purpose of the compensating adjustment used in a diesel engine hydraulic governor is to __________.
When the steam pressure drops below a set value on an automatically fired auxiliary boiler, fitted with rotary cup atomizers, the combustion control system will __________.
Answer_1: increase the fuel oil control valve opening
Answer_3: decrease the back pressure regulating valve opening
Answer_4: decrease the supply steam control valve opening

Question_Title: The main reason counterweights are added to crankshafts is to __________.
Answer_3: provide uniform loading and wear of main bearings
Answer_4: increase the strength of the crank webs

Question_Title: An individual injection pump is designed for variable beginning and constant ending of injection.  For diesel engines operating at constant speeds, the start of injection will __________.
Answer_4: always occur at top dead center

Question_Title: Diesel engines driving alternators operating in parallel must maintain a set frequency regardless of load changes. The governor characteristic used to accomplish this is known as __________.

The control system for a controllable pitch propeller can be programmed __________.; ; I.  to produce a maximum combined propeller and engine efficiency between pitch and a given engine speed ; II. for continuous operation of the engine at pre-set conditions
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: At what pressure should a cylinder relief valve of an internal combustion engine be set to relieve?
Answer_1: The device should be set to relieve at a pressure not more  than 40 percent in excess of the maximum firing pressure.
Answer_2: The valves should be set to just stop relieving with the engine running at full speed.
Answer_3: Cylinder relief valves should only be adjusted by an authorized repair facility with the permission of the OCMI.
Answer_4: Cylinder relief valves are no longer required for large low speed engines due to advancements in combustion engineering.

Question_Title: When changing the direction of propeller shaft rotation in a diesel plant equipped with a pneumatic clutch, you must pause at neutral to allow the __________.
A viscous damper, as used on a marine diesel, is a sealed precision built device which dampens the torsional  vibrations in the __________.
The end of fuel injection in a port-and-helix metering pump can be controlled by __________.
Answer_1: uncovering a fuel port in the pump barrel
Answer_2: covering a fuel port in the pump barrel
Answer_3: closing the fuel pump delivery valve
Answer_4: opening the fuel pump delivery valve

Question_Title: Loss of lubricating oil pressure to the main propulsion diesel engine will actuate a/an __________.
Higher than normal jacket water temperatures occurring in all cylinders of a diesel engine can result from a/an __________.
Answer_3: cavitation erosion in the water jackets

Question_Title: If the operating speed of a diesel engine increases without an apparent change in the engine control settings, you may  suspect a __________.

Trapped air was bled from the hydraulic system of a diesel  engine governor while it had been operating at idle speed.  Oil was added to restore the correct level and the air vent plug tightened.  The compensating needle valve should then  be gradually __________.
Answer_2: closed until it is approximately 1/16 of a turn open
Answer_3: closed to cause the engine to hunt in order to purge trapped air from the new oil
Answer_4: closed until engine hunting is eliminated

Question_Title: Automatically fired auxiliary boilers use fuel oil strainer arrangements of either the simplex type or __________.
When centrifuging heavy fuel oil, an important factor to consider is the __________.; ; I.  flow rate ; II. viscosity of the fuel oil
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: A crankshaft whose center of gravity coincides with its center line is said to be __________.
The amount of fuel injected in a particular time, or degree, of crankshaft rotation is termed __________.
In a normally operating diesel engine, the main source of lubricating oil contamination in the crankcase is a result  of the __________.
Answer_2: air when no air cleaners are used
Answer_4: breakdown of the lubricating oil by dilution

Question_Title: Which of the following problems will cause above normal cooling water temperatures in a diesel engine using a closed freshwater cooling system?
Answer_1: An air leak in the header tank cover
Answer_2: Benzotriazole found in the primary water

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents an advantage of an electromagnetic clutch?
Answer_1: Large misalignments can be tolerated between the shaft and  engine coupling.
Answer_2: Slip is held to a minimum when reversing shaft rotation.
Answer_3: Engine torsional vibrations to the driven shaft are eliminated.
Answer_4: It aids in maintaining power factor.

Question_Title: Two air compressors are provided for the starting air system and should be capable of __________.
Answer_1: charging the starting air containers within one hour
Answer_2: providing the minimum quantity of starting air at all times
Answer_3: supplying all the air necessary to start both the main engine and an auxiliary at the same time
Answer_4: topping off all receivers at the required design pressures

Question_Title: Which of the following adjustments is always required whenever the diesel engine governor oil has been drained and renewed?
The air supplied to a diesel engine is compressed to __________.; ; I.  provide heat for the ignition of the fuel ; II. decrease injection delay
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: The possibility of damage from operating a diesel engine at critical speeds is reduced by the use of __________.
Answer_4: a cast iron bed plate with good flexible qualities

Question_Title: On small diesel engines, a noticeable decrease in the time  interval between the replacement of the lube filter cartridge indicates __________.
If the jacket water temperature of an operating diesel engine suddenly rises above normal, the cause can be attributed to __________.
Answer_2: excess chromate treatment of the jacket water
Answer_3: a clogged raw water sea suction
Answer_4: cavitation erosion of the heat exchanger tubes

Question_Title: On a diesel engine equipped with a hydraulic speed control  governor, hunting in many cases can be corrected by adjusting the __________.
In an auxiliary boiler steam and water system, the highest  pressure will be in the __________.
How is the diesel engine operating RPM affected when a 'ZERO DROOP' setting is selected on the governor?
Answer_1: The RPM will drop to low idle when load is applied.
Answer_2: The RPM must be manually controlled by the load limit knob.
Answer_3: The governor has no control over RPM in this mode.
Answer_4: The RPM will remain the same with or without load.

Question_Title: The amount of fuel delivered by a helical plunger fuel injection pump is controlled by __________.
A dirty diesel engine oil filter element can best be detected by __________.
Answer_2: the pressure drop across the filter
Answer_4: decrease in oil viscosity from the filter

Question_Title: If the coolant temperature of a closed cooling water system for a diesel engine gradually increases, the trouble usually is __________.
Answer_1: a broken shaft on the freshwater pump
Answer_2: an excessive accumulation of scale in the heat exchanger
Answer_3: an incorrect thermostatic element operating range
Answer_4: lube oil in the cooling water

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning the lubrication of diesel propulsion engines used in vessels over 300 gross tons is most accurate?
Answer_1: Lubrication systems using engine driven lube oil pumps do not require any additional independent arrangements when such arrangements have been proven reliable.
Answer_2: The use of engine driven pre-lube pumps is permitted on vessels with propulsion systems developing less than 500 shaft horsepower.
Answer_3: When forced lubrication is used for propulsion engines, one independently driven stand-by pump is to be provided in addition to the necessary pumps for normal operation.
Answer_4: Lubrication systems where two oil coolers are fitted require a minimum of two temperature control devices which may be actuated by similar sensors.

Question_Title: In an electromagnetic coupling, torque to the driven shaft  is limited by the __________.
If an auxiliary diesel engine will not crank but can  be barred over, the trouble may be __________.
Increasing the load on an engine equipped with a constant speed mechanical governor, will cause the engine speed to initially __________.
The small end of the connecting rod is attached to the piston with a __________.
When the lower edge of the spiral begins to uncover the release port in a jerk pump, the __________.
Answer_1: pumping continues until the plunger travels its full stroke
Answer_2: effective pumping stroke of the plunger ends
Answer_3: pressure drops slowly until the full stroke is attained
Answer_4: plunger rotates to the zero delivery position until the next stroke

Question_Title: The pressure differential across a diesel engine lube oil system duplex filter should be checked to __________.
Answer_1: determine the need for filter cleaning
Answer_2: measure any change in oil viscosity
Answer_4: determine the need for batch filtration

Question_Title: Some diesel engines are fitted with a thermometer in the cooling water outlet from each cylinder.  If the cooling water temperature from all cylinders begins to rise above normal, you should suspect __________.
Answer_4: insufficient fuel delivery to all cylinders

Question_Title: Proper operation of the main engine reduction gear set requires the operator to monitor __________.
The torque transmitted by an electromagnetic slip coupling  is dependent upon excitation and the __________.
On a diesel engine equipped with an isochronous governor, if the 'speed droop' control is reduced to the 'zero' setting, the engine __________.
Answer_1: speed will drop drastically with any increase in load
Answer_2: will stop due to zero fuel supply
Answer_3: will stall upon application of load
Answer_4: speed will remain fairly constant despite load changes

Question_Title: The duration of fuel injection developed by an individual port-and-helix fuel injection pump, is determined by the __________.
What could cause the bypass valve in a full-flow lubrication system to open?
Answer_2: Bypass valve setting is too high

Question_Title: You are operating a main propulsion diesel engine at a constant load when the jacket water temperature begins to rise.  This could be caused by __________.
Answer_4: high water level in the expansion tank

Question_Title: Where the size and design of an engine is such that lubrication before starting is not necessary and an attached pump is normally used, __________.
Answer_1: an additional pump is not required provided the engine driven pump is capable of producing sufficient pressure regardless of the direction of rotation
Answer_2: no additional pumps are required if the vessel is equipped  with two propulsion engines clutched to reduction gears through a suitable arrangement
Answer_3: an independently driven pump capable of suppling each engine with sufficient quantities of oil during ahead operations is required
Answer_4: an independently driven stand-by pump is not required if a  complete duplicate of the attached pump is carried as a spare

Question_Title: When air is delivered under pressure to one of the glands of an air-bladder clutch, the __________.
Answer_1: inside diameter of the clutch gland increases
