Answer_2: inside diameter of the clutch gland decreases
Answer_3: gland rotates out of contact with the drums
Answer_4: clutch begins to rotate with the engine

Question_Title: Wear occurring at the tips of the reduction gear teeth is usually the result of __________.
The amount of fuel injected into a cylinder by a unit injector is controlled by __________.
Answer_1: the firing pressure in the cylinder
Answer_3: varying the length of the plunger stroke
Answer_4: varying the clearance between the injector cam and the injector rocker arm

Question_Title: Before starting a diesel engine that has an engine driven lube oil pump, the engineer should __________.
Answer_2: cut in the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: The principal purpose of refractory and insulation  installed in the firebox of an auxiliary boiler is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent slag accumulation on the corbels
Answer_2: protect the inner casing and reduce heat loss
Answer_3: direct the force draft into the space between the inner and outer casings, to maintain a pressure seal
Answer_4: prevent flame impingement on the generating tube bank

Question_Title: If an engine operates at 900 RPM at no load, and at 870 RPM at full load, the speed droop is __________.

When two direct air start reversable medium speed diesel engines are coupled in parallel to a common propeller shaft, which of the operating conditions listed will apply during extended periods of maneuvering?
Answer_1: Full horsepower is available ahead and astern.
Answer_2: Mechanical reduction gearing is not required.
Answer_4: One engine will be turning ahead and the other astern with the appropriate engine clutched in and out to answer bells.

Question_Title: Air bubbles in a hydraulic governor can cause __________.

The amount of fuel delivered for each cycle must be in accordance with the engine load, and the same quantity of fuel must be delivered to each cylinder for each power stroke at that load.  Which of the following statements describes this requirement?
In a diesel engine lube oil system, which of the following  parts should be lubricated first?
Fuel oil transfer systems used onboard diesel propelled vessels are required to have __________.
Answer_1: two fuel oil transfer pumps provided where one is to be independent of the main engine
Answer_2: two fuel oil transfer pumps, with a combined capacity exceeding the maximum comsumption of the main engine
Answer_3: engine driven transfer pumps and only used in constant speed applications
Answer_4: the capacity of the engine driven pump exceed the consumption rate of the engine to which it is attached

Question_Title: Fins are installed on the fireside of the water-tubes, used in waste heat boilers, to __________.
Answer_1: decrease the velocity of gases flowing past the tubes
Answer_2: reduce the accumulation of soot deposits on the tubes
Answer_4: increase the heat transfer surface area

Question_Title: If a main propulsion diesel engine hunts excessively at idle speed, you should __________.
Answer_2: drain and flush the governor and replace the oil

Question_Title: Although slip in pneumatic clutches is normally undesirable in modern pneumatic clutch arrangements, some reduction gear units are provided with an optional slip clutch which is used to an advantage in __________.
Answer_2: controlling the warm up of clutch friction surfaces
Answer_3: obtaining maneuvering speeds below engine idle speed
Answer_4: limiting shock loads transmitted to the engine in heavy weather

Question_Title: At dead center, the centerline of the connecting rod usually coincides with the __________.
The most crucial time for any bearing with regards to lubrication is __________.
Answer_2: after proper oil viscosity is reached

Question_Title: Immediately after starting a diesel engine, normal raw water and jacket water pressures are indicated.  However, the jacket water temperature continues to rise.  If there is no change in the sea temperature, you should suspect __________.
Answer_4: a high level in the surge tank

Question_Title: In a simple hydraulic governor with speed droop, oil under  pressure is maintained ready for use in the __________.
The hunting of a diesel engine may be caused by __________.
Auxiliary boilers can be classified as __________.
Fins are installed on the fireside of the water-tubes used  in waste heat boilers to __________.
Answer_1: decrease the velocity of gases flowing past the tubes
Answer_2: increase the rate of heat transfer

Question_Title: Connecting rods in a diesel engine are used to connect the  __________.
The term 'proper metering', as applied to a diesel fuel injection system, can be best defined as __________.
Answer_1: delivering the same quantity of fuel to each cylinder for each power stroke according to engine load
Answer_2: maintaining the metering adjustment for a reasonable period under all load conditions
Answer_3: timing fuel injection to obtain maximum power and good fuel economy
Answer_4: distributing the fuel to all parts of the combustion chamber for proper combustion

Question_Title: The magnetic lock between the armature and field in an electromagnetic coupling is established by __________.

The main propulsion diesel engine jacket water temperature  rises above normal, with the raw water sea suction and the  expansion tank water level being normal.  Which of the following problems is most likely the cause?
Answer_2: Eroded zinc pencils in the heat exchanger.
Answer_3: Steam formation in the expansion tank.
Answer_4: Excessive leakage from jacket water pump seals.

Question_Title: When fuel oil heaters are required for main engine  operation, __________.
Answer_1: each heater shall have the capacity to supply the main engine at full power
Answer_2: at least two heaters of approximately equal size are to be  installed
Answer_3: the system shall be designed to permit series or parallel operation

Question_Title: The rate of heat transfer in a water-tube auxiliary boiler  can be increased by __________.
Answer_1: operating the boiler at less than normal water level
Answer_2: installing fins on the firesides of water-tubes
Answer_3: increasing the amount of excess air to the burners
Answer_4: treating the boiler water with chemical oxygen scavengers

Question_Title: Which of the couplings listed will prevent shock loads from being transmitted to an engine?
Governor hunting is caused by __________.
In a diesel engine, pistons are attached to the crankshaft  by __________.
Regarding jerk-type fuel pumps as used on some auxiliary diesel engines, the delivery cutoff point is controlled with a __________.
A diesel engine using lube oil with too high a viscosity will exhibit __________.
Answer_1: increased starting difficulty in cold weather

Question_Title: Some diesel engines are fitted with a thermometer in the cooling water outlet from each cylinder.  If the cooling water temperature from an individual cylinder begins to rise, you should suspect __________.
Large steam drums are not required in the design of a coil-type auxiliary water-tube boiler because __________.
Answer_1: steam and water are separated in the accumulator (flash chamber)
Answer_2: the heat of combustion is sufficient to remove all moisture from the steam
Answer_3: the volume of steam is small at low pressures
Answer_4: automatic burner cycling controls steam volume and quality

Question_Title: If the compensating needle valve of a hydraulic governor is opened more than necessary the governor will __________.
Answer_1: have a larger than normal dead band
Answer_2: produce excessive speed response to a load change
Answer_3: respond slowly to any change in engine load
Answer_4: stabilize engine speed at the new governor setting

Question_Title: The plunger in a jerk pump is rotated until the release port is uncovered.  If the port remains uncovered all of the time, which of the listed operations will occur?
Answer_2: The maximum effective stroke will be attained.
Answer_3: The fuel delivered to the cylinder will be excessive.
Answer_4: The injection nozzle will overheat and carbonize.

Question_Title: Immediately after any diesel engine is started, the engineer should check the __________.
One result of operating a diesel engine at light load with  excessively low cooling water temperatures is a/an __________.
Piping from booster pumps to injection systems are to be at least __________.

The best method for determining the amount of eccentricity or offset misalignment between the disconnected propeller  shaft coupling flange and the reduction gear output flange is by using a __________.
Answer_1: straight edge laid across the flange edges
Answer_2: thickness gauge between the separated flange faces
Answer_3: bridge gauge to check the position of each flange in relation to the other
Answer_4: dial indicator mounted on one flange indicating any misalignment of the other flange

Question_Title: Hydraulic couplings will transmit torque equal to the input torque by means of energy changes in a rotating vortex of liquid.  For the vortices to form, there must be __________.
Answer_1: slip between the impeller and runner
Answer_2: less than 2 per cent slip between the impeller and runner
Answer_3: axial thrust generated by the runner pinion shaft
Answer_4: momentary torsional vibration transmitted by the driving impeller

Question_Title: In diesel engines designed with a crosshead, the motion of  the piston rod can be described as __________.
Answer_1: reciprocating at the piston pin, rotary at the crank pin
Answer_2: reciprocating at the crank pin, rotary at the piston pin

Question_Title: Which of the following will occur when the lower edge of the spiral, on the plunger of a jerk pump, uncovers the spill port?
Answer_2: The pressure drops and fuel delivery stops.
Answer_3: The plunger rotates to the no fuel position.
Answer_4: The barrel rotates to the zero effective stroke position.

Question_Title: If the jacket water temperature in an auxiliary diesel engine cooling system is lower than normal, the probable cause is __________.
Answer_1: air binding of the engine cooling system
Answer_2: a cracked water cooled exhaust manifold

Question_Title: Before any work is done on a burner in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler, you should always __________.
Answer_2: allow the boiler to cool completely
Answer_3: lock all safety interlock switches closed
Answer_4: close all manually operated fuel valves

Question_Title: If the a main propulsion diesel engine governor works irregularly with a jerking motion, a possible cause can be  __________.
When reassembling the bowl of a disk-type centrifuge, the bowl or locking ring is rotated __________.
Answer_1: clockwise, due to the bowl rotating clockwise
Answer_2: clockwise, due to the bowl rotating counterclockwise
Answer_3: counterclockwise, due to the bowl rotating clockwise
Answer_4: counterclockwise, due to the bowl rotating counterclockwise

Question_Title: Pitting in the area close to the pitch line and on the same end of each gear tooth of a reduction gear unit would be caused by __________.
Which of the components listed is only found in an opposed piston engine?
In a jerk pump, the amount of fuel that will be forced through the spray nozzle on each upward stroke of the plunger depends on __________.
Answer_2: the slope of the fuel cam
Answer_4: the number of sleeve segments engaged with the rack

Question_Title: To guarantee that a reduction gear bearing is receiving proper oil supply, you should check the __________.
Answer_1: lube oil temperature at the cooler outlet
Answer_4: lube oil pressure to the bearing

Question_Title: If the coolant temperature is excessively low as it passes  through the internally cooled fuel injectors, the injectors may be damaged by __________.
Answer_3: carbon deposits on the leakoff inlet
Answer_4: over lubrication of the needle valve

Question_Title: Valves and fittings used with diesel engine fuel oil pressure piping may be threaded in sizes up to and including 60 mm O.D., but screwed unions __________.
Answer_1: are to be used on pressure lines in sizes 33 mm O.D. and over
Answer_2: over 33 mm O.D. will be permitted in lieu of flanged connections
Answer_3: shall not be used in any instance where the fitting is subjected to excessive vibration
Answer_4: are not to be used on pressure lines in sizes 33 mm O.D. and over

Question_Title: Constant capacity, pressure atomizing, fuel burners designed to meet a wide variation in steaming loads on an auxiliary  boiler, are __________.
Answer_1: automatically supplied with warmer air on demand
Answer_2: automatically supplied with more fuel on demand
Answer_3: equipped with standard variable capacity atomizers
Answer_4: cycled on and off in response to steam demand

Question_Title: Adjustments to the compensating needle valve in a hydraulic governor should be made with the engine at __________.
Answer_1: maximum power at a normal load
Answer_2: maximum power and load under normal conditions
Answer_4: normal operating temperature without a load

Question_Title: The fuel oil strainers located in the fuel oil service system of an automatic auxiliary heating boiler are either  the duplex type or the __________.
Which of the following design features will reduce the possibility of overheating the top compression rings of a cast iron piston?
Answer_1: The top ring is located as close to the piston rim as possible.
Answer_2: The inside surface of the piston head is rounded into the ring belt.
Answer_3: A nickel-bearing insert is cast into the top ring groove.
Answer_4: A heat dam design is sometimes used in the piston head.

Question_Title: In an electromagnetic slip coupling, the slip __________.
Answer_1: reduces magnetic pull caused by non-concentric electromagnets
Answer_2: reduces resonance and accentuates the turning moment irregularities
Answer_3: transmits electromagnetic flux through the primary circuit
Answer_4: generates the low frequency current which excites the secondary electromagnet

Question_Title: Which of the listed diesel engine operating conditions should be checked immediately after any diesel engine is started?
Answer_4: Water level in the expansion tank

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning a hydraulic coupling?
Answer_1: Accurate alignment between the rotating members is extremely important.
Answer_3: Torque is controlled by the volume of oil in the coupling.
Answer_4: Torsional vibrations from the engine are transmitted directly to the hull by the coupling.

Question_Title: During extremely cold weather, while starting an engine, it turns too slowly and fails to start.  This problem is most  likely the result of __________.
When transmitted by a reduction gear, diesel engine speed is reduced and the torque available for work  __________.
Which of the couplings listed is normally not repairable, and is usually replaced if completely damaged?
The purpose of a heat dam used in some diesel engine cast iron pistons is to __________.
Answer_1: concentrate all heat in the piston crown
Answer_2: increase the distance heat must travel from the crown to  the top ring groove
Answer_3: ensure that all heat in the piston crown is conducted to the top ring
Answer_4: provide a short direct path for heat to flow from the crown to the top ring

Question_Title: Load control on a diesel engine is accomplished by  __________.
Answer_1: regulating the speed of the turbocharger
Answer_2: rotating the fuel injector pump plunger
Answer_3: regulating the speed of the fuel oil transfer pump

Question_Title: Immediately after starting a small high-speed diesel engine, you should check the __________.
Prolonged operation of a diesel engine with a closed cooling water system, at lower than normal designed operating temperatures can __________.
Valves used in diesel engine fuel oil pressure piping are to be __________.
Answer_1: so constructed as to permit packing under pressure
Answer_2: solenoid released upon the failure of engine lubrication
Answer_3: either of the gate or globe valve type
Answer_4: forge constructed under the approval of the Marine  Inspector

Question_Title: Auxiliary boilers are divided into several classifications, one of which is __________.
Movement of the pump control rack in a fuel injection system using individual plunger-type pumps __________.
Answer_1: changes the position of the fuel inlet ports
Answer_2: changes the length of the pump stroke
Answer_3: varies the quantity of fuel delivered
Answer_4: varies the compression of the delivery valve spring

Question_Title: A diesel engine with a full speed of 1000 RPM drives a propeller at 300 RPM.  What is the speed reduction ratio?
A faulty thermostatic bypass valve, in a diesel engine cooling system, can result in __________.
Answer_3: scale formation on the saltwater side

Question_Title: Which of the listed governor characteristics will greatly affect the load sharing relationship between paralleled diesel generators?
Auxiliary boilers are divided into several classifications, one of which is __________.
One of the most common causes of reduction gear failure is  gear wear caused by scoring as a result of __________.
The purpose of the separating nozzle in the accumulator of a water-tube, coil-type, steam generator is to separate __________.
Answer_1: dry steam from the steam and water mixture

Question_Title: A direct acting, pneumatically controlled governor for a diesel engine operates in a range of 10 to 50 psi.  The fuel rack position is at 20 millimeters when the governor air pressure is 30 psi.  If the governor air pressure changes to 20 psi, the fuel rack setting will change to __________.
The major cause of trouble in a mechanical-hydraulic governor is contamination of the hydraulic fluid by __________.
Cast iron pistons used in large propulsion diesel engines are constructed with __________.
Answer_1: no taper for the entire length
Answer_2: the skirt being tapered and smaller than the crown
Answer_3: the skirt being tapered and larger than the crown
Answer_4: the crown being tapered and smaller than the skirt

Question_Title: The amount of fuel delivered by a unit injector is  controlled by the __________.
Which of the listed substances can be satisfactorily removed from diesel fuel by centrifuging?
An emergency diesel generator cooling system is equipped with an automotive type thermostat.  If the thermostat bellows loses its charge, the thermostat will __________.
Answer_1: open, and the coolant temperature will increase
Answer_2: open, and the coolant temperature will decrease
Answer_3: close, and the engine coolant temperature will increase
Answer_4: close, and the coolant temperature will decrease

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning ABS rules for fuel oil injection systems as found on diesel propelled vessels?
Answer_1: Check valves are to be located at the service tank and be so arranged as to be operable from the uppermost platform of the engine compartment.
Answer_2: Cut-out valves are to be located at the service tanks and be so arranged as to be operable from the engine room floor plates.
Answer_3: Strainers are to be provided in the fuel oil injection pump discharge line and shall be capable of being cleaned while  the engine is in operation.
Answer_4: The injection line is to be of seamed drawn pipe and fittings are to be extra heavy.

Question_Title: Downcomers installed on auxiliary package boilers are protected from direct contact with hot gases by __________.
Pitted reduction gear teeth having a deep blue color with evidence of overheating have been operated with __________.
Which of the listed problems will happen when the water level of a fire-tube type auxiliary boiler approaches the crown sheet?
Compensating needle valve adjustments to a hydraulic governor should be made with the engine __________.
Answer_1: running at normal operating temperature without load
Answer_2: running at half speed and at normal temperature
Answer_3: running at maximum power and load under normal conditions
Answer_4: developing maximum power at normal load

Question_Title: The upper section of a piston is called the __________.
The effective pump stroke of an individual port-and-helix fuel injection pump is determined by the __________.
A waterside fusible plug, installed in a fire-tube auxiliary boiler __________.
Answer_1: would be located in the center of the crown sheet and inserted from the fireside
Answer_2: by design, is drilled with a tapered hole so that boiler water pressure holds the fusible metal in the bronze body
Answer_3: is required by Coast Guard Regulations as an excess pressure relieving device

Question_Title: Which of the following characteristics is true relative to  meshing spur gears?
Answer_1: The gear of larger diameter will rotate at a slower RPM.
Answer_2: Both gears will operate in the same direction.
Answer_3: The teeth on the larger gear are larger than the teeth on the smaller gear.
Answer_4: The teeth on the larger gear are smaller than the teeth on the smaller gear.

Question_Title: A horizontal fire-tube package boiler, incorporating a two-pass design, is basically constructed with __________.
Answer_1: the rear of the boiler being used as a combustion chamber
Answer_2: extensive fireside baffling used to its fullest, enabling increased heat transfer rates
Answer_3: removable spiral metal gas retarders being inserted in the  tubes to decrease the gas velocity to a minimum, thus extracting the maximum caloric heat value

Question_Title: Engine displacement is equal to the cylinder __________.
Answer_2: area times the stroke, times the number of cylinders
Answer_4: volume times the stroke, times the number of cylinders

Question_Title: When passing through mesh contact, the teeth of a reduction gear first go through a series of actions best described as __________.
The fusible plugs used in fire-tube auxiliary boilers are installed in the __________.

A main propulsion diesel engine is fitted with a pneumatically actuated governor, having an operating range  of 10 to 60 psig.  The current fuel rack setting is 15 mm at 30 psig.  If the air pressure to the governor is increased  to 40 psig, the fuel rack setting will change to __________.
Why is the ring belt narrower in diameter than the skirt of a piston designed for a diesel engine?
Answer_1: To allow for greater expansion due to higher operating temperature.
Answer_2: To seal the cylinder against leakage of combustion gases.
Answer_3: To provide an additional surface for oil cooling.
Answer_4: To provide additional strength for the crown and lower structure.

Question_Title: The amount of fuel delivered by a helical plunger type fuel injection pump is controlled by __________.
Cooling water pumps driven by direct-reversing diesel engines are usually __________.
Answer_1: curved impeller vane with tangential outlet
Answer_2: curved impeller vane with concentric outlet
Answer_3: straight impeller vane with concentric housing
Answer_4: straight impeller vane with tangential housing

Question_Title: If the operating element of a thermostatic valve installed  in a diesel engine cooling system malfunctions, it may result in __________.
Answer_1: a low level in the engine expansion tank
Answer_4: malfunctioning of the jacket water heater

Question_Title: In a diesel engine, excessive cylinder liner wear will cause __________.; ; I.  increased blowby ; II. wear between the piston ring and groove
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: To correct a hunting problem in a main propulsion diesel engine hydraulic governor, you should __________.
The color of the engine exhaust from a diesel propelled ship should be __________.
Which of the listed governor operating characteristics is considered to be isochronous?
The diameter of a piston is usually less at the crown than  at the skirt, in order to __________.
Answer_1: facilitate the installation of piston rings
Answer_2: allow for the expansion of the piston during operation
Answer_3: prevent crankcase vapors from entering the combustion chamber
Answer_4: reduce wearing of the upper cylinder liner

Question_Title: On a diesel engine equipped with individual jerk type fuel  pumps, adjustments should be made to the tappets (push rods) of the pumps to __________.
Answer_4: change from light to heavy fuel

Question_Title: Which of the following manufacturing methods is recommended for diesel engine fuel injection line piping?
The power output of a turbocharged diesel engine will drop  if the cooling water flow through the aftercooler is interrupted because the __________.
A burned exhaust valve may be detected by a higher than normal __________.
Answer_2: exhaust temperature from a particular cylinder

Question_Title: Helical reduction gears, as used with main propulsion drive trains, are constructed so that several teeth are meshed at the same time to __________.
Answer_2: translate heavy load into high speed output
Answer_4: allow construction with fewer gear teeth

Question_Title: What occurs in the combustion space of a diesel engine cylinder shortly after ignition and before the piston reaches TDC?
Answer_1: Rapid increase in temperature with constant pressure.
Answer_2: Rapid increase in pressure with constant temperature.
Answer_3: Rapid increase in pressure and temperature.
Answer_4: Rapid increase in volume and decrease in pressure.

Question_Title: Successful combustion inside the cylinders of a diesel engine is dependent upon __________.
Answer_3: proper mixing of fuel and air

Question_Title: Which of the combustion parameters listed is used in a diesel engine, but NOT related to the injection system?
An advantage of aluminum pistons, when compared to cast iron pistons is __________.
The control rack to a unit injector regulates fuel delivery by __________.
Answer_1: altering spring tension on the plunger
Answer_2: rotating the helix of the plunger
Answer_3: regulating the lift of the check valve
Answer_4: altering the actual length of the plunger stroke

Question_Title: The air bladder clutch used with some reversing reduction drive gears, consists of __________.
Answer_3: multi-plate friction plates with sliding collars

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions will develop if the flow  of 'raw' cooling water to a diesel engine is obstructed?
Answer_1: Air will enter the cooling system.
Answer_2: Carbon will plug the water cooled exhaust manifolds.
Answer_3: The jacket water temperature will rise.
Answer_4: The lube oil viscosity will increase.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions will occur if a diesel engine exhaust valve is leaking?
Answer_1: Loss of compression for that cylinder

Question_Title: Fuel oil penetration into the cylinder of a diesel engine is __________.
Answer_4: nonexistent in the precombustion chamber system

Question_Title: Precombustion chambers, air cells, and energy cells in high- speed, small bore diesel engines all serve to increase __________.
Some medium and high-speed diesel engines require reduction gear units to provide a useful propeller speed.  In most reduction gears, the bull gear __________.
Answer_1: must churn the oil in the sump
Answer_2: is connected to the propeller shaft
Answer_3: is driven at the highest RPM
Answer_4: compensates for alignment variations between the engine and pinion gear

Question_Title: If the piston stroke in a four stroke cycle diesel engine is 10 1/2 inches and the speed of rotation of the crankshaft is 720 RPM, what is the average piston speed?
Which of the following statements best describes the operational characteristics of an isochronous governors?
Answer_1: They are suitable for use on main propulsion units.
Answer_2: They strive to maintain a constant prime mover speed for all values of steady load.
Answer_3: They cause a proportional drop in prime mover speed as the  load is increased.
Answer_4: They have poor sensitivity at high RPM.

Question_Title: The fuel injection pumps on a diesel engine are controlled  by a linkage system attached to the __________.
What type of fitting is to be used on diesel engine fuel injection line piping?
Improper cooling of a diesel engine cylinder liner due to the accumulation of scale deposits, may cause __________.
Answer_4: poor contact between compression rings and liner

Question_Title: Diesel engine exhaust gas temperatures can be used to determine individual cylinder __________.
The volume of available air supply required by an air clutch varies with the __________.
Answer_2: volume of the supply line between the control valve and the clutch

Question_Title: The principal characteristic of an isochronous governor is  it will __________.
Answer_1: slow the machine down as the load is increased
Answer_2: shut down the engine if it overspeeds
Answer_4: maintain a constant speed with variations of load

Question_Title: Which statement about diesel engine combustion is true?
Answer_1: Combustion does not begin until the piston starts down on the power stroke.
Answer_2: Maximum combustion pressure is reached before TDC.
Answer_3: Turbulence in the cylinder causes a delay in ignition.
Answer_4: Maximum cylinder firing pressure is not developed until the piston passes TDC.

Question_Title: Which of the listed design features is most common to a two-stroke/cycle low-speed main propulsion diesel engines?
All of the diesel engine cylinder firing pressures are normal, yet all of the exhaust temperatures are low.  Which of the following situations is responsible for this condition?
Keel coolers fouled with marine growth, will result in __________.
Proper atomization of fuel in diesel engine combustion chambers will __________.
Governors used on diesel engines to limit the load must be  equipped with __________.
The ability of a fuel particle to travel into the combustion chamber before burning is called __________.
The effective stroke of a constant-stroke, individual, fuel injection pump is varied by the __________.
Insufficient piston cooling for a large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine burning heavy fuels, can result in __________.
Answer_1: high temperature corrosion and burning off of piston crown  metal
Answer_2: dangerous thermal expansion of the piston skirt

Question_Title: A piston in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine makes four strokes during each __________.
The diesel engine valve subjected to most severe conditions of service is the __________.
The lower section of a piston is called the __________.
The function of the window cast into the housing of an individual jerk pump is to __________.
Answer_1: allow the pump to be timed to the engine
Answer_2: check for sludge on the pump barrel
Answer_3: check that the fuel return passages are clear
Answer_4: set up the fuel rack calibration in cubic millimeters

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is most likely to occur if oil containing moisture is continuously fed to a purifier operating as a clarifier?
Answer_1: The purifier must be operated at a higher temperature.
Answer_2: The purifier must be operated at a higher speed.
Answer_3: The purifier will gradually change operation to separation.
Answer_4: The bowl will eventually fill with water.

Question_Title: Scale and dirt accumulation in the waterside of a lube oil  cooler will be indicated by a gradual increase in the lube  oil __________.
Which of the following statements is an accurate description of fuel injection piping used on diesel engines with a cylinder bore of 250 mm and above?
Answer_1: The piping shall be so arranged to allow for uncomplicated  removal of the fuel injection equipment and other associated components located on the cylinder head.
Answer_2: All high pressure piping shall be of the double lined type, with the outer leakoff line suitably channeled to a dedicated tank.
Answer_3: All storage tanks connected to the leakoff piping of fuel injection systems shall be provided with high level alarms  and sufficient means for emptying.
Answer_4: The piping is to be effectively shielded and secured to prevent fuel or fuel mist from reaching a source of ignition on the engine or its surroundings.

Question_Title: A change in the degree of fuel atomization in a diesel engine would most greatly affect __________.
Which of the following devices is a common basic element with nearly all mechanical governors?
Answer_3: Weights acted on by centrifugal force

Question_Title: Theoretical perfect combustion in a diesel engine yields by-products of __________.
Gear-type flexible couplings are often used in diesel engine drive trains because they __________.
Answer_1: require no lubrication under normal operating conditions
Answer_2: compensate for gross misalignment in the drive train
Answer_3: are able to transmit high torque, even where slight misalignment exists
Answer_4: will rapidly disconnect the engine from the line shaft

Question_Title: In a bypass type lubrication system for a diesel engine, the dirty oil line to the centrifuge should be taken from the __________.
Answer_3: bottom of the lube oil sump
Answer_4: outlet from the lube oil header

Question_Title: Which of the following factors tends to increase scale formation on the saltwater side of a heat exchanger used in a diesel engine cooling water system?
Answer_1: Baffle plates that have been bent during prior removal.
Answer_2: Leaks in the cooler tube nest.
Answer_3: Operating the engine while maintaining a high sea water outlet temperature.
Answer_4: A punctured sea water strainer supplying cooling water to the heat exchanger.

Question_Title: If the peak to peak pressure pulsation in the diesel engine fuel injection return piping exceeds 285 psi what special provision is to be provided?
Answer_1: The piping shall be shielded and secured to prevent fuel or fuel mist from reaching a source of ignition on the engine  or its surroundings.
Answer_2: The piping shall be directed to the fuel oil day tank, in addition it shall enter below the normal operating level of the tank.
Answer_3: Most diesel injection systems do not develop high pressures in their return lines due to regulations prohibiting installation of valves in these lines.
Answer_4: Return piping is required to be protected by relief valves  which relieve to the diesel oil settling tank.

Question_Title: Diesel engine exhaust temperatures may be used to indicate  __________.
In a diesel engine, a leaking exhaust valve can cause __________.

When used with reversing reduction gears, medium-speed diesel engines should be bolted to their foundations with fitted bolts at the drive end and clearance (loosely fitted) bolts in other locations. This is done to __________.
Answer_1: maintain alignment when the ship's hull is working in heavy seas
Answer_2: ensure engine vibrations correspond to the natural frequency of the hull
Answer_3: permit the engine to expand away from the driven equipment  as the engine heats up and expands

Question_Title: The piston wrist pin used in some diesel engine pistons is  prevented from contacting the cylinder wall by a __________.
In a diesel engine mechanical-type fuel pump, the delivery  check valve is opened by __________.
What is the term given to the process of breaking up fuel oil into very fine particles for better combustion?
The most severe cavitation erosion occurring on the waterside of diesel engine wet cylinder liners normally occurs __________.
Answer_1: throughout the lower one-half of the liner
Answer_2: throughout the upper one-half of the liner
Answer_3: at TDC opposite the thrust side of the liner
Answer_4: near the middle of the thrust side of the liner

Question_Title: For a given fuel, a change in the compression ratio will affect the ignition lag by which of the listed means?
Answer_1: An increase in compression ratio will increase the ignition lag.
Answer_2: An increase in compression ratio will decrease the ignition lag.
Answer_3: A decrease in compression ratio will decrease the ignition  lag.
Answer_4: A decrease in ignition lag will increase the compression ratio.

Question_Title: Turbulence in a diesel engine cylinder is of major  importance in providing __________.
The required amount in the change of speed necessary before a governor will make a corrective movement is known as __________.
Which of the following problems may occur if the opening pressure of a fuel injection nozzle is greater than specified by the engine manufacturer?
Answer_1: The amount of fuel injected will be increased.
Answer_2: The start of injection will be retarded.
Answer_3: The nozzle will permit fuel to dribble.
Answer_4: The spray pattern will be distorted.

Question_Title: In a full floating wristpin, the pin is prevented from sliding against the cylinder walls by __________.
Exhaust valve grooving and corrosion is caused by certain components of residual fuel oil.  These components are sodium, sulfur, and __________.
Whether using a centrifuge or a simple filter, oil cleaning and filtration will be the most effective when the oil is at a __________.
Answer_1: high temperature and a high viscosity
Answer_2: high temperature and a low viscosity
Answer_3: low temperature and a high viscosity
Answer_4: low temperature and a low viscosity

Question_Title: Cavitation erosion in the cooling water system of a diesel  engine usually occurs at the pump impeller, and on the waterside of the __________.
High firing pressures and a low exhaust temperature in a diesel engine may result from __________.
Poor combustion in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.

After each speed change, the compression of the diesel engine governor speeder spring is returned to a constant value, regardless of the amount of movement of the fuel control mechanism and engine load.  Hence, this results in  __________.
Fuel oil discharged to the diesel engine cylinder is atomized at the __________.
The longer the ignition delay period occurs in a diesel engine, the __________.
Answer_1: less fuel will enter the cylinder
Answer_2: lower will be cylinder compression temperatures
Answer_3: more complete will be fuel combustion
Answer_4: more rapid will be the rise in combustion pressure

Question_Title: The load is always placed on the lower half of the main bearings in a/an __________.
Which term describes piston pins having bearing surfaces in both the piston bosses and connecting rod eye?
Diesel engine fuel oil leakage should be drained and additional precautions provided to __________.
Answer_1: return this oil to the proper storage tank
Answer_2: prevent contamination of lubricating oil by fuel oil
Answer_3: ascertain an accurate measurement of this leakage

Question_Title: The easiest way to locate a defective diesel engine exhaust valves is by __________.
Which of the following devices is common to both mechanical and hydraulic governors?
Answer_1: Direct linkage between the ball-head and fuel rack

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions will tend to increase the ignition delay period of combustion in a compression ignition engine?
Answer_1: Using a fuel oil with a higher cetane number.
Answer_3: Reducing the injected fuel oil droplet size.

Question_Title: A flexible coupling is located between the __________.
Answer_4: thrust bearing and the worm gear

Question_Title: Exhaust pyrometer readings provide an indication of the __________.
Answer_2: distribution of the load between engine cylinders
Answer_3: amount of fuel penetration into the engine cylinders
Answer_4: indicated horsepower of the engine cylinders

Question_Title: When is fuel injected into a cylinder of diesel engines?
Answer_1: Before air in the cylinder is compressed.
Answer_2: After air in the cylinder is compressed.
Answer_3: After combustion gases in the cylinder have expanded.
Answer_4: As air is taken into the cylinder.

Question_Title: Injection lag can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: improper timing of the intake valves

Question_Title: To manually bypass a strainer or filter in a shunt type lube oil filtering system, __________.
Answer_3: open the bypass valve to the sump and then close the isolation valves
Answer_4: close the isolation valves and then open the bypass valve

Question_Title: If the raw water supply pressure for a diesel engine cooling system is below normal, you should check for a __________.
A change in the degree of fuel atomization in a diesel engine cylinder has the greatest effect on the __________.
In most marine single reduction gear units, the bull gear is driven by the __________.
The rate of pressure rise during the period following fuel  ignition process in a diesel engine, is influenced chiefly  by the __________.
Answer_4: length of the ignition delay period

Question_Title: A change in engine speed is required before a governor is able to make a corrective movement of fuel rack.  This aspect of governing is commonly expressed as a percent and  is known as __________.
On most diesel engines, the governor controls the output speed by __________.
Answer_1: controlling the amount of fuel injected into the cylinders
Answer_2: varying the speed of the turbocharger
Answer_4: changing the timing of the fuel injection camshaft

Question_Title: Proper dispersion of fuel in a diesel engine cylinder is dependent upon the __________.
Piston cooling fins are located __________.
Answer_1: on top of the piston crown
Answer_3: at the base of the piston skirt
Answer_4: inside the cylinder liner cooling water jacket

Question_Title: Compared to other fuel injection systems, unit injectors operate with virtually no __________.
When cleaning a duplex strainer, it is important for __________.
Answer_1: the pressure to be bled prior to opening the compartment cover
Answer_2: the lube oil to be allowed to cool before removing the basket
Answer_3: the cleaning fluid used to be more viscous than the lube oil
Answer_4: a new cover gasket to be installed when reassembling the unit

Question_Title: In a closed cooling water system, which of the following problems can cause the water pressure to fluctuate?
Answer_1: An open vent in the cooling system.
Answer_3: A restricted water passage in the engine.
Answer_4: Air entrained in the cooling water.

Question_Title: Why is it necessary to compress the air charge in the cylinders of a diesel engine?
Answer_2: To insure pumpimg losses are held to a minimum.

Question_Title: The average exhaust temperature of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine with a turbine-driven supercharger is lower than a similar four-stroke/cycle diesel engine at equal loads because __________.
Answer_1: two-stroke/cycle diesel engines have a higher M.E.P. than four-stroke/cycle diesel engines
Answer_2: four-stroke/cycle diesel engine exhaust is cooled by scavenging air
Answer_3: two-stroke/cycle diesel engines have a lower M.E.P. than four-stroke/cycle diesel engines
Answer_4: the opening of the two-stroke/cycle diesel exhaust ports or valves occurs much later than in four-stroke/cycle diesel engines

Question_Title: Diesel fuel oil having a low cetane rating can result in __________.
Besides the use of piston cooling fins to assist in cooling, they also provide extra strength for the piston __________.
Differential needle valves used in fuel injectors are directly closed by __________.
A dirty lube oil strainer can result in __________.
In a closed cooling system for a turbocharged, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine, fluctuating water pressure can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: improper venting of the cooling system
Answer_2: carrying the expansion tank water level too high
Answer_3: a totally clogged impeller in the cooling water pump
Answer_4: an incorrectly set cooling system temperature control

Question_Title: The governor controlling a diesel engine modulates  crankshaft RPM by adjusting the __________.
High exhaust temperature and black smoke exhausting from an auxiliary diesel engine can be caused by __________.
Individual cylinder performance in a diesel engine is routinely determined by exhaust gas __________.
Any increase in the exhaust back pressure of a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine will __________.
Answer_2: aid in silencing the exhaust noise

Question_Title: The driving force of a propeller is transmitted to the hull through the_____________.
If fuel injection to a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine begins earlier than designed, ignition may be delayed because the __________.
Answer_1: cylinder compression pressure may not be high enough
Answer_2: cylinder compression temperature may be too high
Answer_3: fuel oil injection pressure may not be high enough
Answer_4: scavenge and purge process is incomplete

Question_Title: In a full flow type lube oil system, the bypass relief valve will lift due to __________.
Answer_2: excessive lube oil pump discharge pressure

Question_Title: Which of the following problems can cause fluctuating pressures in the closed cooling system of a main propulsion diesel engine?
Answer_1: Defective temperature controls in the system.
Answer_2: Cavitation in the cooling water pump.
Answer_3: Opened vent in the cooling system.
Answer_4: Restricted water passages in the engine.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning diesel engine cooling water systems?
Answer_1: Each engine must have its own engine driven cooling water pump capable of providing cooling for all ranges of operation.
Answer_2: Propulsion engines with bores exceeding 200 mm are to be fitted with a means to display the cooling water temperature of each cylinder.
Answer_3: At least two independent sea suctions are to be provided for supplying water to the engine jackets or to the heat exchangers.
Answer_4: Suitable strainers are to be fitted between the circulating pumps and heat exchangers when sea water is used for direct cooling.

Question_Title: Sensitivity for a diesel engine governor is described as the __________.
Answer_1: governor's speed of response to variations in engine load
Answer_2: ability to maintain desired engine speed without speed fluctuation
Answer_3: percent of speed change necessary for corrective action by  the fuel control
Answer_4: ability to maintain constant speed regardless of engine load

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning the factors affecting ignition delay is correct?
Answer_1: An increase in intake air temperature will increase ignition delay.
Answer_2: An increase in coolant temperature will decrease ignition delay.
Answer_3: An increase in combustion chamber turbulence will increase  ignition delay.
Answer_4: An increase in compression ratio will increase ignition delay.

Question_Title: Air motion is induced in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine  cylinder to improve air fuel mixing, and is known as __________.
Maintaining the proper fuel oil temperature will result in  __________.
Trunk type diesel engine pistons are effectively cooled when heat is __________.
Answer_2: transferred to water cooled cylinder walls

Question_Title: The minimum fuel oil delivery pressure required for efficient injection depends primarily on the __________.
Answer_2: maximum pressure in the engine cylinders during injection
Answer_3: quantity of the fuel to be injected
Answer_4: duration of the injection delay period

Question_Title: An increased pressure differential between the inlet and outlet of a strainer usually indicates the strainer is __________.
A diesel engine with a combustion chamber located between the crowns of two pistons is known as a/an __________.
In a diesel engine, crosshatch on the liner surface aids in __________.; ; I.  rapid ring seating ; II. the retention of lube oil
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Question_Title: Persistent knocking in one cylinder of an eight cylinder diesel engine would MOST likely be caused by __________.
Answer_1: using fuel oil with low cetane number

Question_Title: To successfully reduce an excessively high diesel engine exhaust gas temperature, you should __________.
Answer_1: reduce the engine driven fuel pump outlet pressure
Answer_2: retard the fuel injector timing to reduce power
Answer_4: reduce the load on the engine

Question_Title: Which of the two events listed occurs simultaneously in a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine?
High exhaust back pressure will result in an increase in __________.

A loop or cross scavenged engine utilizes the motion of its pistons and a turbocharger to provide scavenging air.  Which of the listed mechanical designs prevents the air under the pistons from being pumped back through the scavenge ports during the piston power stroke?
Which of the following statements concerning a closed type  fuel injection nozzle is true?
Answer_1: The hole type of a closed nozzle is self-cleaning.
Answer_2: Multi-hole type nozzles are only suitable for use in engines with precombustion chambers.
Answer_3: Most closed nozzles open inward under the pressure acting on the differential area of the needle valve.
Answer_4: The pintle type nozzles are most susceptible to carbon deposits building up in and around the orifice.

Question_Title: To determine if the lube oil filter elements need changing, __________.
Answer_1: open the filter and inspect the elements
Answer_2: check the lube oil pump discharge pressure
Answer_3: check the lube oil header pressure
Answer_4: check the pressure drop across the filter

Question_Title: Combustion gas venting through the expansion tank can be caused by a __________.
Diesel engine control can be obtained by the bridge __________.
Answer_2: only after the engine room control station is switched to 'bridge control'
Answer_3: whenever the secondary station is switched to 'bridge control'
Answer_4: with the approval of the chief engineer only

Question_Title: The direct cause of a crankcase explosion can be attributed to __________.
Answer_4: excessive lube oil in the crankcase

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct for the design and installation of diesel engine cooling water systems?
Answer_1: An alarm device with audible and visible signals is required for all cooling water systems.
Answer_2: Propulsion engines with bores over 200 mm are to be fitted  with cooling water thermometers at each cylinder.
Answer_3: Each totally enclosed cooling system shall be provided with a suitable head tank.
Answer_4: Drain cocks are to be provided at the lowest points of all cylinder water jackets.

Question_Title: Combustion knock can occur in the cylinders of a diesel engine under any condition permitting __________.
Answer_3: excess fuel in the combustion chamber
Answer_4: rapid vaporization of injected fuel droplets

Question_Title: One of the most common methods in preventing a diesel engine piston pin from contacting the cylinder wall is by the use  of __________.
The injection pressure of a hydraulic fuel injection nozzle can be increased by __________.
Answer_1: increasing fuel oil booster pump pressure
Answer_2: increasing the injector nozzle orifice size
Answer_3: removing shims from under the nozzle spring
Answer_4: increasing compression on the pressure spring

Question_Title: Many lube oil filters have pressure gages installed on both the inlet and outlet in order to indicate the pressure drop across the filter.  In normal operation, the pressure drop  will __________.
Answer_4: have no effect on filter operation

Question_Title: A cracked cylinder head on a diesel engine may be indicated by __________.
Answer_2: water draining from the fuel leak off valves
Answer_3: combustion gases venting at the expansion tank

Question_Title: Control of the main propulsion diesel engines can be shifted from the engine room to the wheelhouse from the __________.
The possibility of a diesel engine crankcase explosion will be increased by operating an engine __________.
Answer_1: with a crankcase vacuum between 1.5" and 2" of water
Answer_2: with a leaking crankcase inspection cover gasket
Answer_3: equipped with a crankcase exhaust blower which vents to fresh air
Answer_4: equipped with a turbocharger which utilizes a gear drive

Question_Title: Exhaust pipes of multiple engine installations are not to be interconnected, but are to be run separately to the atmosphere __________.
Answer_1: unless arranged to prevent the return of gases to an idle engine
Answer_2: to a point not lower than the highest load line
Answer_3: at a location segregated from other ventilation systems
Answer_4: and shall be protected by a rain guard or similar device

Question_Title: Excessive diesel engine cylinder exhaust back pressure will be caused by __________.
Answer_3: an obstruction in the exhaust silencer

Question_Title: A thrust bearing is used with a propulsion diesel engine to __________.
Answer_1: control axial movement of the crankshaft
Answer_2: transmit engine thrust to the propeller shaft
Answer_3: absorb vibrations in the propeller shafting
Answer_4: prevent propeller thrust from being transmitted to the hull

Question_Title: In a large slow-speed propulsion diesel engine, the force applied to the piston is __________.
Answer_1: against the crosshead during power stroke and away from the crosshead during the compression stroke
Answer_2: against the crosshead during the compression stroke and away from the crosshead during the power stroke
Answer_3: against the crosshead during the power and compression strokes
Answer_4: away from the crosshead during the power and compression strokes

Question_Title: Fuel supplied by each unit injector on a two-stroke/cycle single acting diesel engine is directed into each cylinder  at a very high pressure through the __________.
Turbulence of the compressed air charge in a diesel engine  cylinder increases __________.
A cracked cylinder head in an operating engine may be indicated by __________.
Answer_1: a steady flow of water from the expansion tank vent
Answer_2: combustion gases venting at the expansion tank
Answer_3: lower temperature at the cylinder head water discharge
Answer_4: water draining from the fuel leakoff lines

Question_Title: Combustion knock occurring in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.
Which of the following problems could develop due to the accumulation of oil vapors in the crankcase of a diesel engine?
Which of the following statements is a description of the combustion cycle?
Answer_2: The heat process which produces the force to initiate the movement of the engine parts.
Answer_3: The number of piston strokes involved.

Question_Title: The time between injection and ignition of the fuel is known as __________.
In using reduction gears to obtain efficient propeller speeds, __________.
Answer_1: they must be located at the after end of the engine
Answer_2: they can only be used with one engine at a time
Answer_3: they eliminate the need for controllable pitch propellers
Answer_4: they are connected to the engine with a flexible coupling

Question_Title: During the power stroke, the side thrust of a trunk type piston is a result of the angle __________.
Answer_1: formed by the connecting rod and the cylinder center line
Answer_2: formed by the piston in relation to the piston pin
Answer_4: between the master and link connecting rods

Question_Title: One problem resulting from a diesel engine fuel injector opening pressure being lower than specified by the engine manufacturer, is that the __________.
Answer_1: start of injection will always be retarded
Answer_2: duration of injection will always be reduced
Answer_3: quantity of fuel injected will always be decreased
Answer_4: quantity of fuel injected tends to be increased

Question_Title: Lube oil cannot be efficiently filtered if its __________.
Answer_3: pump discharge pressure is higher than the system's pressure
Answer_4: pump capacity is greater than the system's needs

Question_Title: A crack in a cylinder liner can be caused by __________.
Answer_3: operating the engine at low loads

Question_Title: An exhaust pipe from a internal combustion engine may not need to be insulated when __________.
Answer_2: it is of the water jacketed type
Answer_3: it is used as an emergency generator
Answer_4: special provision is made by the Chief Engineer

Question_Title: When oil vapor, oxygen and hot spots are present at the same time within a crankcase, which of the following hazards could develop?
For a given size engine, the two-stroke/cycle diesel engine will deliver more power than a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine because __________.
Answer_1: it has a longer power stroke
Answer_2: more air gets into the cylinder each stroke
Answer_3: it develops twice as many power strokes at the same speed

Question_Title: A sudden drop in diesel engine cylinder compression pressure can be caused by __________.
Ring groove inserts are occasionally used on aluminum alloy pistons to __________.
Answer_1: reduce the ring groove wear rate
Answer_3: lessen the wear on aluminum parts of the cylinder
Answer_4: allow for the greater expansion rate of aluminum

Question_Title: The minimum speed an engine must attain before ignition can occur depends upon __________.
Answer_1: the type and size of the engine

Question_Title: Lube oil filters remove contaminants from oil more  efficiently if the oil being filtered is __________.
Answer_4: pumped through the filter under high pressure

Question_Title: Coolant can be lost from a diesel engine jacket cooling water system by leakage from __________.
An automated diesel engine should normally shut down due to __________.
Which of the listed conditions is most likely to cause a crankcase explosion?
Answer_2: Fuel dilution of the lube oil

Question_Title: Which of the following statements pertains to propulsion engines with bores exceeding 200 mm?
Answer_1: There shall be a means to display the cooling water outlet  temperature of each cylinder.
Answer_2: All engines connected to controllable pitch propellers shall be of the direct reversible type.
Answer_3: The engines will be fitted with a means to display the exhaust gas temperature of each cylinder.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: A V-12 four-stroke/cycle 500 horsepower diesel engine is operating under a normal load, the firing pressures are low and the exhaust temperatures are high.  Which of the following problems is the most probable cause of this condition?
Answer_1: Fuel pump rack setting is too far out.
Answer_2: The air intake filter is missing.
Answer_3: The exhaust back pressure is too high.
Answer_4: The fuel pump rack setting is too far in.

Question_Title: An overcorrecting and unstable engine governor operation is known as __________.
What is the function of an engine's stationary parts?
Answer_1: To add power to the engine.
Answer_2: To keep the engine firmly attached to its supporting base.
Answer_3: To keep moving engine parts in their proper relative positions.

Question_Title: Proper filtering and straining of diesel fuel is important  because the __________.
Answer_1: fuel oil pump will overspeed if dirt is not removed
Answer_2: fuel oil transfer pumps cannot tolerate small amounts of grit in the oil
Answer_3: fuel injectors may be damaged by foreign particles in the fuel oil
Answer_4: dirty fuel will clog the intake air filter

Question_Title: Lube oil filters remove contaminants more efficiently if the oil being filtered is __________.

Diesel engine automated control systems may utilize sensing devices of dual function, with sensing ranges providing both alarm and engine shut down capability.  Which of the key points listed would only require an alarm sensor?
Crankcase explosions in propulsion diesel engines result from __________.
Answer_1: the splashing of lubrication oil by the crankshaft
Answer_2: the dilution of crankcase oil with particles of combustion
Answer_3: broken fuel lines spraying oil on the crankcase
Answer_4: the ignition of unburned fuel and air in the crankcase

Question_Title: Combustion knock occurring in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.
Answer_4: carbon buildup on the injector tips

Question_Title: Which of the items listed causes a direct acting mechanical governor to operate the engine fuel control linkage?
Thin bronze rings are inserted in the face of some chromium plated piston rings to __________.
Answer_1: promote piston ring seating in the cylinder
Answer_2: prevent rapid wear on the ring face
Answer_3: provide better lubrication of the piston ring
Answer_4: produce an even glaze on the cylinder

Question_Title: The two strokes of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine are __________.
Reduction gear casings are vented in order to __________.
Answer_1: allow windage to exist for cooling the gears
Answer_2: avoid a buildup of pressure within the gear case
Answer_3: minimize lube oil foaming within the case
Answer_4: allow for axial clearance between the gears

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed may occur in an operating diesel engine if air pockets form within the cylinder head  circulating water passages?
Answer_1: Hydraulic stress and distortion will develop.
Answer_4: An increase in trapped deposits of scale and dirt.

Question_Title: Air receivers installed in starting air systems are to be __________.
Answer_1: cylindrical in shape with service connections located at the top and bottom
Answer_2: opened and made available for inspection during biannual inspections
Answer_3: provided with automatic drain traps for the removal of moisture
Answer_4: so installed as to make the drain connections effective under extreme conditions of trim

Question_Title: Critical speed in diesel engines occurs when engine torque  pulsations become __________.
Answer_1: opposed to the crankshaft rocking couple
Answer_2: resonant with the crankshaft natural frequency
Answer_3: critical fore and aft crankshaft vibrations
Answer_4: horizontal whipping motions of the crankshaft

Question_Title: In the Otto cycle, the fuel/air mixture is ignited at what  point and by what means?
Answer_1: At TDC by heat generated by compression.
Answer_2: Just before TDC by heat generated by compression.
Answer_3: Just before TDC by spark ignition.

Question_Title: Which of the listed reasons is the most likely cause of a sudden drop in compression pressure in one diesel engine cylinder?
Answer_1: Missing filter segment of an intake filter

Question_Title: What is the function of the main thrust bearing?
Answer_1: Prevents lateral movement of the slow speed gear.
Answer_2: Transmits propeller thrust to the hull.
Answer_4: Prevents main reduction gear axial movement.

Question_Title: Which of the construction techniques listed is used on new  piston rings to facilitate run-in or seating?
Answer_1: Special ring facings with a thin bearing surface of antifriction metal.
Answer_2: The oil control ring face is machined at an angle of 10 degrees.
Answer_3: The ring diameter, when free, is machined slightly smaller  than the cylinder bore to allow for expansion at high combustion temperatures.
Answer_4: Oil control rings maintain continuous oil film.

Question_Title: Heat damage to fuel injection nozzles can be prevented by avoiding __________.
Answer_3: metallic contact between nozzles and cylinder heads
Answer_4: hard carbon deposit and varnish on the nozzles

Question_Title: Failure to ensure proper venting of the cooling system of a diesel engine can result in __________.
Answer_3: failure of raw water pump shaft seals

Question_Title: In a diesel engine, the time period between fuel injection  and ignition is usually defined as __________.
Failure to open the diesel engine test cocks after a long period of shutdown, prior to starting may result in __________.
Answer_2: damage to cylinder heads and pistons

Question_Title: The knock occurring when a cold diesel engine is started and continues while running at low speed, but stops when the engine reaches normal operating speed and temperature, is __________.
Answer_2: caused by a mechanical defect in one cylinder
Answer_3: caused by high fuel injection pressures

Question_Title: If a diesel engine's exhaust temperature is abnormally high, the cause could be __________.
Answer_4: too low of a compression ratio

Question_Title: The ability of the governor to prevent fluctuations in engine speed is termed __________.
In a simple mechanical governor, the __________.
Answer_2: flyweight centrifugal force is balanced by spring force
Answer_3: flyweight centrifugal force is balanced by hydraulic pressure
Answer_4: speeder spring alone actuates the fuel control rod

Question_Title: To minimize the formation of carbon deposits on fuel injection nozzles, you should __________.
Answer_1: avoid using liquid-cooled nozzles whenever possible
Answer_3: avoid prolonged overloading of the engine
Answer_4: make certain the gasket seal between the nozzle and cylinder head is tight

Question_Title: If the water level dropped rapidly in the expansion tank of a closed diesel engine cooling water system, you should suspect a __________.
Answer_1: loss of suction in the circulating pump
Answer_2: leak in the primary cooling system
Answer_4: burned or cracked piston in one cylinder

Question_Title: Each receiver in a starting air system which can be isolated from a relief valve __________.
Answer_1: is to be provided with a suitable fusible plug to relieve the pressure in case of fire
Answer_2: will incorporate the use of an automatic unloading device
Answer_3: will not be approved for classification purposes
Answer_4: and satisfy U.S.C.G. regulations shall be approved

Question_Title: The intake air ducting to a diesel engine should not draw from an area on deck where flammable vapors released from tanks are present, because __________.
Answer_1: flammable vapors will accelerate corrosion of the turbocharger
Answer_2: the engine may overspeed and the normal governor or overspeed trip will not be able to secure the engine
Answer_3: the flammable vapors will result in an excessively rich mixture which will increase the brake horsepower output

Question_Title: A gear type flexible coupling is precision built for __________.
Answer_3: high torque transmittal under limited misalignment  conditions
Answer_4: low axial thrust transmission under minimal alignment irregularities

Question_Title: A diesel engine piston ring face is in direct contact with  the __________.
Injectors for use with heavy fuel oil may be internally cooled by either water or light oil to __________.
Answer_1: prevent heat corrosion to internal components
Answer_2: increase fuel delivery rate and economy
Answer_4: avoid carbonization of the nozzle tips

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions can cause oil to  accumulate in the cooling system of a diesel engine?
Which of the types of reduction gearing listed is best suited for medium speed main propulsion units?
When a nozzle tester is used to check the spray pattern of a fuel injection nozzle, __________.
Answer_1: the valve should pop at 1/2 the actual set pressure
Answer_2: the needle valve spring should be removed
Answer_3: the nozzle should be adjusted to operate within 500 psi of the specified opening pressure
Answer_4: blood poisoning may occur if the fuel spray penetrates the skin of the operator

Question_Title: Vessels having main engines arranged for air starting are to be provided with at least __________.
Answer_1: one automatic drain serving both containers
Answer_2: two air starting containers of approximately equal size
Answer_3: one control air container and one starting air container
Answer_4: one additional means of starting the main engine

Question_Title: Kingsbury thrust bearings are lubricated by __________.
Answer_1: flooding the thrust bearing assembly with oil
Answer_2: submerging oil wiper rings in an oil bath
Answer_4: spraying oil directly on the thrust collar and shoes

Question_Title: Fuel is ignited in a diesel engine cylinder by __________.
In a diesel engine, the time taken to heat the fuel particles, turn them into vapor, and bring about combustion is called __________.
The function of diesel engine piston compression rings is to __________.
Answer_3: transmit heat from the piston to the cylinder liner
Answer_4: remove oil from the cylinder combustion space

Question_Title: If the coolant temperature is too low as it passes through  internally cooled fuel injectors, the injectors can be damaged by __________.
Answer_3: carbon deposits on the nozzle tip
Answer_4: inadequate lubrication of the needle valve

Question_Title: A directly connected or geared main propulsion diesel engine should be fitted with a/an __________.
Which characteristic of the Otto cycle occurs in the actual diesel cycle but NOT in the theoretical diesel cycle?
The principal hazard to personnel when a diesel nozzle tester is in use is __________.
A possible cause for an individual piston to knock when at  TDC on a slow-speed, two-stroke/cycle main propulsion diesel engine could be due to __________.
Answer_2: excessive bearing play within the running gear

Question_Title: Which of the bearing types listed is most commonly used in  smaller vessel main propulsion reduction gears as thrust bearings?
A diesel engine is operating with excessively high exhaust  temperatures at all cylinders.  To correct this condition,  you should FIRST __________.
Excessive diesel engine back pressure may be an indication  of __________.
Answer_1: carbon buildup in the exhaust manifold

Question_Title: The main reason for using bimetallic piston rings is to __________.
Answer_3: reduce the probability of ring fracture

Question_Title: In order to start a large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine on high viscosity fuel after an extended shutdown, the __________.
Answer_3: lube oil outlet temperature should be increased 20 above normal

Question_Title: A spring-loaded centrifugal flyweight governor responds to  reduced engine load with an immediate increase in __________.
Lube oil accumulating in the cooling water system of a diesel engine will result in __________.
A fuel leak occurs in the high pressure fuel piping between the injection pump and fuel nozzle.  This requires  immediate repair because of the __________.
Answer_4: poor combustion which will occur in that cylinder

Question_Title: The device used to limit engine torque at various engine speeds is called a __________.
Which of the speeder springs listed is more suitable for a  governor installed on an engine operating over a wide speed range?
In a diesel engine, internal combustion causes the piston to be moved by __________.
Answer_1: the simple admission of fuel and air into the combustion space only
Answer_3: specially designed parts connected to a shaft

Question_Title: A secondary function of diesel engine piston rings is to __________.
Answer_1: reduce friction losses in the engine
Answer_4: prevent excess lubricant from reaching the combustion space

Question_Title: When a nozzle tester is being used to test a 'closed' type  fuel injection nozzle, a clogged nozzle orifice will be indicated by a __________.
Answer_2: chattering sound when the nozzle closes
Answer_3: squealing sound midway in the pump stroke
Answer_4: popping sound when the nozzle opens

Question_Title: Where engine bores exceed 230 mm, a bursting disc or flame  arrester is to be fitted __________.
Answer_1: at the supply inlet to the control air manifold for non- reversing engines
Answer_2: on the exhaust manifold prior to the inlet of the turbochargers
Answer_3: on all devices subject to the by-products of combustion or  lubrication system vapors
Answer_4: in way of the starting valve of each cylinder for direct reversing engines having a main starting manifold

Question_Title: Engine coolant accumulating in the diesel engine lubricating oil can result from a __________.
Persistent knocking of one cylinder of a diesel engine ceases when the fuel supply to that cylinder is secured. This problem may be a result of __________.
In a Kingsbury thrust bearing, the thrust shoes are __________.
Answer_1: pivoted, and the thrust collar turns with the shaft
Answer_2: turned by the shaft, and the thrust collar is stationary

Question_Title: The purpose of the energy cell, or air cell, is to __________.

Answer_4: make a blast in the main chamber prior to the piston expansion stroke

Answer_1: use energy from fuel burned outside their cylinders
Answer_2: burn fuel in a combustion chamber that moves back and forth
Answer_3: burn fuel in a chamber where its energy moves a piston back and forth
Answer_4: use a continuous combustion process to impart rotary motion to the pistons

Question_Title: When more than one propulsion diesel engine is connected to a single propeller shaft through reduction gears, the gears are usually __________.

Answer_2: rotate the T-handle spindle one turn

Answer_4: blow compressed air through the disks

Question_Title: What is the best way of stopping an overspeeding diesel engine?

Question_Title: The thermal energy produced by an internal combustion engine is transformed into __________.

Answer_4: should be completed shortly after passing top dead center

Answer_2: prevents the formation of combustible gases in the  crankcase

Answer_3: Sluggish ring action on the piston
Answer_4: A mechanical defect in a working part

Question_Title: Routine monitoring of a diesel engine should include __________.

Answer_4: zero air pressure in the air starting system

Question_Title: White smoke exhausting from a diesel engine can result from __________.

Answer_1: cylinder lubricant is spread more evenly on the cylinder wall

Answer_3: to keep the ring ends from catching in the scavenging ports
Answer_4: to promote more even ring wear

Question_Title: A distorted spray pattern from a fuel injector can cause __________.

Answer_3: burning fuel with a high vanadium content
Answer_4: burning fuel with a lower sulphur content

Question_Title: A six cylinder, single acting, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine has a bore of 10 1/2 inches, and a stroke of one foot, producing 75 HP per cylinder at 720 RPM. What is the mean effective pressure for the stated conditions?

Answer_4: to enable six consecutive starts of a reversible engine

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the advantage  of a precombustion chamber used in an auxiliary diesel engine?

Answer_4: Excellent control of combustion can be attained.

Answer_1: During operation at low load and speed

Answer_4: rotate the knife-edge cleaner blades and drain off the sediment

Question_Title: Broken intake valve springs on one cylinder of a diesel engine can cause the engine to __________.

Answer_3: engine cylinder size to piston size
Answer_4: the number of compression strokes for a given horsepower

Answer_4: an overheated air supply line to that cylinder

Answer_3: manually operating a built-in scraper and draining the filter
Answer_4: flushing with any approved solvent then draining the system

Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Answer_3: there is too much lube oil in the cylinders

Answer_3: contain the major portion of the total clearance volume
Answer_4: contain a smaller portion of the total clearance volume

Answer_3: scrape excess lube oil from the liner on the downstroke

Question_Title: What may be used to protect starting air mains against explosions arising from improperly functioning starting valves?

Answer_3: one power stroke in a two-stroke/cycle engine
Answer_4: two piston strokes in a two-stroke/cycle engine

Answer_4: damp out fluctuations of the piston side thrust

Question_Title: What is commonly used to create turbulence in a diesel engine combustion system?

Answer_4: assure a positive means of scraping carbon accumulation from the cylinder

Answer_2: incomplete combustion and decreased fuel consumption

Answer_4: drain and then renew the lube oil supply

Question_Title: A broken pintle in a fuel injector usually causes __________.

Answer_2: Method of air charging a cylinder and expelling exhaust gases
Answer_3: Distance a piston travels during a stroke

Answer_3: The oil appears black in color.

Question_Title: On a diesel engine, using a distributer type air starting system, that is not running, which of the  following methods may be used to detect leaking air starting valves?

Answer_3: a combination of constant volume and constant pressure

Answer_3: relationships between pressure and volume during one stroke of the engine

Question_Title: The theoretical minimum compression ratio necessary to ensure compression ignition in a direct injection diesel engine is __________.

Question_Title: A multi-orifice fuel injection nozzle is usually used with  which of the listed types of combustion chamber?

Question_Title: A diesel engine emits blue exhaust smoke as a result of __________.

Answer_3: compression pressure in one of the cylinders

Question_Title: For most diesel propulsion and generator engines, the overspeed trip device will stop the engine by __________.

Answer_3: tripping the governor emergency stop lever

Question_Title: A diesel engine exhaust valve spring is under compression when __________.
Answer_2: the piston is at top dead center

Question_Title: If the diesel engine starter-drive mechanism fails to disengage after the engine starts, which of the following situations will occur?

Question_Title: The highest loads applied to the diesel engine crankshaft main bearings are __________.

Answer_1: provide energy to operate the engine between power impulses
Answer_2: neutralize the primary inertia force of the crankshaft
Answer_3: reduce the shock of starting loads on the main bearings
Answer_4: prevent the engine from operating at critical speed

Question_Title: An emergency diesel generator should automatically shut down in the event of __________.
Answer_2: a loss of lube oil pressure
Answer_3: the activation of the fixed CO2 system for the emergency generator space

Question_Title: Increasing the compression ratio of a diesel engine while maintaining the designed rate of fuel flow will result in __________.

Answer_1: Astern power is to be provided in a sufficient amount to secure proper control of the ship in all normal circumstances.

Answer_3: For main propulsion systems without reversing gears, controllable pitch propellers or electric propulsion drive, running astern is not to lead to overload conditions.
Answer_4: Astern power available will be equal to ahead power when controllable pitch propellers are utilized, thus discounting the need for increased operating parameters.

Question_Title: In a modern internal combustion diesel engine, the load carrying part of the engine is referred to as the __________.

Answer_1: only the replacement of the entire pump would be acceptable
Answer_2: the injection pump and injection nozzle must be replaced
Answer_3: either the barrel or plunger must be replaced
Answer_4: the barrel and plunger must be replaced as a unit

Question_Title: A well-lubricated bearing surface always appears __________.

Answer_4: breather or by means of a slight suction not exceeding 1" of water

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the results of  excessive microbiological growths within a fuel system?
Answer_1: All excessive amounts of growth will cause the main engines of the vessel to stall due to the inability to supply the proper quantities of fuel to satisfy the existing load.

Question_Title: If the detergent type lubricating oil being used in a diesel engine is black, the oil __________.

Answer_3: ring expansion from the heat of combustion

Question_Title: Surface irregularities, such as erosion and pitting on injection pump plungers, will __________.
