Question_Title: The oxidation by-products forming in diesel engine lube oil can cause __________.
In a large slow-speed propulsion diesel engine, the force applied to the crosshead is __________.
Answer_1: against the crosshead during power stroke and away from the crosshead during the compression stroke
Answer_2: against the crosshead during the compression stroke and away from the crosshead during the power stroke
Answer_3: against the crosshead during the power and compression strokes
Answer_4: away from the crosshead during the power and compression strokes

Question_Title: Uneven bolt tightening during the installation of a fuel injection pump can result in __________.
Answer_3: high torsional shock to fuel lines

Question_Title: Which of the following operational conditions will occur to the diesel engine lube oil at extremely high temperatures?
Answer_1: The oil oxidizes and forms carbon deposits.
Answer_4: Lubricating qualities of the oil are enhanced.

Question_Title: The purpose of end clearance on a diesel engine piston ring is to __________.
Answer_1: allow the combustion gases to press the ring down on the land
Answer_2: allow the combustion gases to get behind the ring and press it against the cylinder liner
Answer_3: prevent buckling and breaking of the ring
Answer_4: aid in protecting the oil film

Question_Title: If lost motion is present in an individual fuel injection pump, which of the following problems will occur?
Which of the listed conditions can cause a diesel engine to use too much lube oil?
A diesel engine is driving an alternator required to run at 1800 RPM.  The overspeed governor is normally required to be set within a range of __________.
Excessive lube oil consumption in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.
In diesel engines, hydraulic valve lifters are used to __________.
Which of the following problems can cause excessive consumption of the lubricating oil in a diesel engine?
Auxiliary diesel engines can be automatically shut down as a result of __________.
Valve lash, or clearance refers to the __________.
Answer_1: clearance between the top of the valve stem and the rocker  arm
Answer_3: clearance between the valve seat inserts and the head
Answer_4: out of roundness of the fuel injection cams

Question_Title: In some modern large diesel engines, which of the following is used as the support for the main bearings?
Excessive piston ring wear in a diesel engine will cause __________.
Sticking of diesel engine piston compression rings may be caused by __________.
What is the purpose of a hydraulic valve lash adjuster?
Answer_1: Compensates for the expansion and contraction of the valve stem due to changes in operating temperature.
Answer_2: Insures proper pressure in a hydraulic system.
Answer_3: Eliminates need to remove valve springs.
Answer_4: Provides easier removal of the valve cage.

Question_Title: If a diesel engine runs roughly, which of the systems listed is most likely to be at fault?
Worn diesel engine intake valve guides can result in __________.
Diesel engine valve springs function to __________.
Answer_2: keep the valves off their seats until the exhaust stroke is completed
Answer_4: open inlet valves when the air injection cycle begins

Question_Title: In the common rail system, excessive pressure in the header may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: improper adjustment of the bypass valve
Answer_2: a dribble in the fuel injection nozzle
Answer_3: insufficient leakoff through injection nozzle packing

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions can cause excessive lube  oil consumption in a diesel engine?
The intake and exhaust valves used in a diesel engine are returned to their seats by __________.
In a large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine, if the injectors have formed carbon around the nozzle holes, which of the following would help avoid further buildup?
Answer_3: Decrease load limit on the governor.

Question_Title: When a leak has developed in the lube oil cooler of an operating diesel engine, which of the listed operating conditions can be expected to occur?
Answer_3: Lube oil contaminated with fresh water coolant

Question_Title: A six cylinder, two stroke/cycle diesel engine is 83% efficient and has a cylinder constant of 0.998 while operating with a mean effective pressure of 15 kg/cm2 at a speed of 100 RPM.  What is the metric brake horse power developed?
If the jacket water temperature rises rapidly above normal  in a diesel engine, you should FIRST __________.
Valve cages are used on some large diesel engines to __________.
Answer_1: reduce wear on the valve stem
Answer_2: permit the use of alloy valve seat materials
Answer_3: reduce heat transfer from the valve seat

Question_Title: A 16 cylinder main propulsion diesel engine is operating at 90% of full load.  All cylinder exhaust temperatures are indicated at 950F, except the No. 7 cylinder which is indicated at 1100F.  All fuel racks are at 21-22 mm except No. 7 which is at 16mm.  The fuel injector nozzle for No. 7 cylinder was exchanged within the last 3 hours.  Which of the listed actions should be carried out NEXT?
Answer_1: Replace and retime No. 7 cylinder fuel pump.
Answer_2: Pull No. 7 cylinder piston and examine the rings.
Answer_3: Examine the governor linkage for binding.
Answer_4: Check the intake manifold pressure for evidence of burned intake valves.

Answer_2: air when air cleaners are not used
Answer_4: breakdown of the lubricating oil by dilution

Question_Title: In a diesel engine, a cylinder liner should be replaced if it is __________.; ; I.  scuffed ; II. Scored
Answer_3: both I and II are correct
Answer_4: neither I or II are correct

Answer_1: injection pump plungers stuck or worn

Question_Title: During warm-up the expansion of valve stems due to engine heat, is allowed for by the __________.

Question_Title: Excessive lube oil consumption can result from worn or broken __________.

Answer_3: Indicated cylinder temperature readings will increase.

Question_Title: When using a fuel with a higher than normal sulfur content  in an auxiliary diesel engine, you should __________.

Answer_2: change the lube oil more frequently than normal
Answer_3: maintain a higher air-box temperature than normal
Answer_4: maintain a higher air-box pressure than normal

Answer_3: A section of the removed compression ring

Question_Title: The process of supplying a diesel engine cylinder with air  at a pressure greater than atmospheric is called __________.

Excessive piston ring wear in a diesel engine will cause __________.
Which of the contaminants listed would remain in the lube  oil after filtering?

Answer_1: lower than normal cylinder pressure and low exhaust temperature

Question_Title: If the analysis of used lube oil indicates a high content of iron particles, this could indicate __________.

Answer_1: sea water temperature must never be warmer than 40F
Answer_2: jacket water pressure should always be greater than the sea water pressure
Answer_3: jacket water temperature must always be less than 60F

Question_Title: Late fuel injection in a diesel engine is indicated by low  firing pressure with __________.

Answer_3: fuel oil is leaking into the lube oil
Answer_4: the piston rings are excessively worn

Question_Title: Which of the following beneficial results can be expected from supercharging a previously naturally aspirated engine?

Answer_1: cavitation erosion in the water jackets
Answer_2: excess corrosion inhibitor in the coolant

Question_Title: The microbiological growths that affect fuel supplies can  easily be transported from one location to another by __________.

Question_Title: Late fuel injection occurring at, or after TDC in a diesel  engine is indicated by excessive exhaust smoke and  __________.

Answer_3: lube oil viscosity is always decreased

Question_Title: Compared to a naturally aspirated diesel engine, a  supercharged diesel engine has __________.

Answer_2: the injection pump and injection nozzle must be replaced
Answer_3: either the barrel or plunger must be replaced
Answer_4: the barrel and plunger must be lapped and blued.

Question_Title: The bore of a diesel engine cylinder describes the __________.

Answer_2: Open all air space drain cocks.

Question_Title: Late fuel injection in a diesel engine is indicated by black or gray exhaust smoke with a __________.

Answer_1: increase until the overspeed trip actuated
Answer_2: hunt until stabilized by the droop rod
Answer_3: decrease to a slightly lower value
Answer_4: remain the same until manually changed

Question_Title: The sludge tank installed in the diesel engine room is used to collect __________.; ;   I. sludge from the fuel oil centrifuge ;   II. water that has been collected in the settling tank.
If a few injector spray holes become plugged, the result could be __________.

Answer_1: Lube oil is diluted and its viscosity is reduced.
Answer_3: Bearings become pitted and immediately fail.

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is realized by the turbocharging of a previously naturally aspirated diesel engine?

Question_Title: If the speed of a turbocharged diesel engine is maintained  constant the turbocharger speed will __________.

Answer_4: remain unchanged as the load decreases

Question_Title: At top dead center, the centerline of the connecting rod usually coincides with the __________.
Why are some diesel engine cylinder liners plated on the wearing surface with porous chromium?
Answer_1: The chromium will not wear out the piston rings.
Answer_2: The chromium strengthens the liners in the way of the scavenging air ports.
Answer_3: Chromium eliminates the need for oil scraper rings.
Answer_4: Pores in the plating aid in maintaining the lube oil film.

Question_Title: A distorted spray pattern from a fuel injector can cause a  diesel engine to have __________.

Answer_3: reduce the intake air charge density

Question_Title: In a diesel engine, what is the advantage of precombustion chambers over the open type of combustion chamber?; ;  I.  Precombustion chambers permit coarser fuel  atomization.;  II. Precombustion chambers allow lower fuel injection  pressure.

Answer_1: an incorrect diesel generator governor speed droop  adjustment
Answer_2: a faulty reverse power relay within the main circuit breaker assembly
Answer_4: a different speed setting on each unit

Question_Title: The term 'diesel engine scavenging' means __________.

Answer_2: forcing the products of combustion out of the cylinder with the fresh air charge
Answer_3: collecting the air charge at the air cleaner
Answer_4: combustion and expansion of hot gas

Question_Title: Most large main propulsion diesel engines use duplex lube oil strainers to __________.
Answer_1: decrease the time required between cleanings
Answer_3: ensure a positive flow of oil at all times
Answer_4: ensure that all lube oil has been treated twice

Question_Title: In a large low-speed diesel engine excessive piston clearance can be restored by __________.
Answer_1: decreasing the thickness of the cylinder head gasket
Answer_2: inserting shims between the crankpin bearing box and the connecting rod foot
Answer_4: rotating the crankpin bearing until the proper end clearance is obtained

Question_Title: A method of finishing diesel engine cylinder walls to aid in the proper ring seating and lubrication is known as __________.

Question_Title: One device used to determine the amount of fuel dilution of diesel engine lube oil is a/an __________.

Question_Title: Higher than normal temperature air passing through the intake of a diesel engine will result in __________.

Answer_1: excessive wear during the seating period
Answer_2: excessive lubrication of the top ring
Answer_3: improper spreading of lubrication on the cylinder wall

Answer_2: provide more air for combining with the fuel

Question_Title: A properly honed diesel engine cylinder liner will __________.

Answer_1: Quantity of fuel injected tends to be decreased.
Answer_2: Quantity of fuel injected will always be increased.
Answer_3: Start of injection tends to be advanced.
Answer_4: Duration of injection will always be greater.

Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Answer_2: with only the exhaust valve open

Answer_3: prevent pump clogging from marine growth

Which instrument is used to take crankshaft deflection readings?

Question_Title: When accumulated carbon at the air inlet ports of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine is being removed, you should take care to avoid carbon particles __________.

Answer_2: Interrupt the fuel flow to the engine.

Question_Title: Dirt in a fuel oil system of a diesel engine can cause __________.
The power developed by a large slow-speed main propulsion diesel engine is dependent upon the __________.
Answer_1: quantity of air it takes in and retains in the cylinders during a given time period
Answer_2: proportion of trapped air that is utilized in the combustion process
Answer_3: thermodynamic efficiency of the engine cycle

Question_Title: During maneuvering operations for a direct reversing large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine, which of the following actions is used to stop the shaft from turning prior to changing the engine rotation for a vessel with moderate headway?
The most common diesel engine fuel system problems are caused by __________.
When a diesel engine is operated at partial load, as compared to full load, a decrease will occur in the average __________.
Answer_3: combustion pressure on the power stroke
Answer_4: compression pressure on the compression stroke

Question_Title: A ship is propelled by a direct reversing large, slow-speed, diesel engine.  One step in reversing the direction of propeller rotation for this vessel is by __________.
Answer_1: properly inflating the air operated clutch

Question_Title: Diesel engine fuel oil contamination often results in __________.
A diesel engine should not be operated at low loads for long periods of time because __________.
Answer_1: heavy carbon deposits will buildup on the valves and in the exhaust
Answer_2: fuel dilution is increased at low load

Question_Title: The major cause of fuel pump and injection system problems  is __________.
A diesel engine operating at a light load, when compared to operating at heavy load has an air/fuel ratio that is __________.
A dirty fuel oil filter element can be detected by __________.
Answer_2: the pressure drop across the filter
Answer_4: increase flow rate from the filter

Question_Title: Cylinder scavenging in a turbocharged, four-stroke/cycle, single acting, diesel engine is accomplished __________.
Answer_1: without cooling the pistons or cylinders
Answer_4: with only the exhaust valve open

Question_Title: Operating a propulsion diesel engine at less than 30% of designed normal load for prolonged periods will result in __________.
Answer_1: decreased fuel consumption per brake horsepower
Answer_4: carbon formation on combustion chamber surfaces

Question_Title: The main source of fuel pump and injection system malfunctions is __________.
Turbocharged four-stroke/cycle diesel engines utilize valve overlap for __________.
What harmful condition can result if a diesel engine is operated at very light loads for long periods of time?
A faulty injector in one cylinder of an operating diesel engine can be located by __________.
Answer_1: cutting out individual injectors and noting engine  performance

Question_Title: Early injection timing is indicated by __________.
Answer_1: high exhaust temperature and low firing pressure
Answer_2: high exhaust temperature and high firing pressure
Answer_3: low exhaust temperature and low firing pressure
Answer_4: low exhaust temperature and high firing pressure

Question_Title: In a turbocharged four-stroke/cycle diesel engine, the exhaust valve remains open until after top dead center and  the intake valve opens before top dead center to __________.
Answer_1: produce a scavenging effect in the combustion space
Answer_2: equalize cylinder and exhaust manifold pressures
Answer_3: alleviate the difference in valve size between the intake and exhaust
Answer_4: flush out condensate that collects after each compression stroke

Question_Title: Operating a diesel engine under light loads and at low temperatures for an extended period can result in __________.
Answer_1: formation of carbon on the intake and exhaust ports
Answer_4: an increase in lube oil viscosity due to fuel dilution

Question_Title: Incorrect timing of the fuel injection system is similar to the  effects of poor __________.
Answer_1: metering of the fuel flow to the injector
Answer_2: control of the rate of fuel injection
Answer_3: control of atomization of the fuel
Answer_4: distribution of the fuel throughout the combustion chamber

Question_Title: While maneuvering, you discover heavy smoke coming from the turbocharger casing, you should __________.
Answer_1: check the air filter for dirt
Answer_4: notify the bridge that you are going to shut the engine down

Question_Title: A change in the quality of fuel atomization by a diesel engine fuel injector would be caused by a/an __________.

Answer_3: air pressure to the intake manifold
Answer_4: purge of exhausted gases from the cylinders

Question_Title: In the construction of a diesel engine, what is the purpose of end plates?
Answer_1: To provide accessibility to the cylinder liners.
Answer_2: To add stability to the engine block.
Answer_3: To add rigidity to the block and a surface for attaching other parts.
Answer_4: To make a surface for the base.

Question_Title: When fuel enters the crankcase of a diesel engine, it __________.
Answer_1: dilutes the lube oil and reduces its viscosity
Answer_2: forms sulfuric acid in the lube oil
Answer_3: causes pitting and failure of the bearings
Answer_4: causes sludge deposits on valve stems

Question_Title: The exhaust ports of a diesel engine using the crossflow scavenging method are opened and closed by the __________.

As the intensity of the seas increase, the engine speed governor maintains the same RPM, although the  load indicator indicates an increase in load beyond its allowable limits.  Which of the following actions should be taken?
Answer_4: Ignore this situation as the engine can handle the load increase.

Question_Title: A change in the degree of fuel atomization in a diesel engine greatly affects the __________.
In a Roots-type rotary blower, the volume of air delivered  is directly proportional to __________.
A safety cover differs from other diesel engine access doors in that it is fitted with a __________.

On a diesel engine equipped with a Roots-type blower, __________.
Answer_1: the turbine speed depends on engine load
Answer_2: the air is compressed in the air cleaner
Answer_3: the blower speed is proportional to the engine speed
Answer_4: the blower lobes are lubricated by the engine lube oil

Question_Title: If a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine is overspeeding due to  leakage of lube oil into the cylinders, what should you do  to stop the engine?
Answer_1: Move the fuel control mechanism to the no fuel position.
Answer_2: Block the fuel supply by closing the master fuel valve.
Answer_3: Shut off the fuel supply and block the flow of intake air.
Answer_4: Relieve all pressure in the fuel system.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning fuel atomization in a diesel engine cylinder is correct?
Answer_1: The greater the atomization, the greater the penetration.
Answer_2: The greater the atomization, the lesser the penetration.
Answer_3: The degree of atomization has nothing to do with the degree of penetration.
Answer_4: Atomization and penetration are one and the same.

Question_Title: If a single cylinder relief valve on a main propulsion diesel engine begins to lift, but it is not possible to secure the engine, which of the following actions should be taken?
Answer_1: Increase the cooling water flow to the engine.
Answer_2: Secure or reduce fuel to that cylinder.
Answer_3: Screw down on the pressure adjusting spring to decrease popping pressure.

Question_Title: Clogged diesel engine fuel oil filters can cause __________,
Before shutting off the fuel supply to stop a medium or high-speed diesel engine, why is it necessary to allow the  engine to idle for a few minutes?
Answer_1: To prevent internal damage from local overheating.
Answer_2: To ensure the fuel nozzles are flushed clean.
Answer_4: To let the waste heat boiler reduce it's rate of steam generation.

Question_Title: A Roots-type blower installed on some diesel engines, serves to __________.
Answer_1: heat the cylinder for hotter compression
Answer_2: push out exhaust gases and replace them with fresh air
Answer_3: force cool air across the radiator, lowering the jacket water temperature
Answer_4: maintain a positive charge of fresh air in the crankcase thus eliminating the chances of a crankcase explosion

Question_Title: A normally operating diesel engine is shutdown by __________.
The compression of air in a positive displacement rotary supercharging blower, occurs only __________.
Answer_2: between the casing and blower lobes
Answer_3: after the engine reaches operating speed
Answer_4: as air moves into the discharge passage

Question_Title: When running a large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine on heavy fuel, which of the following precautions should be observed when switching back over to diesel oil?
Answer_1: The diesel oil must never be allowed to mix with the heavy  fuel.
Answer_2: The temperature of the fuel from the preheater should be gradually reduced after switching over the three-way valve.
Answer_3: The heating steam to the preheater should be increased  as soon as the diesel fuel passes through the three-way valve.
Answer_4: The heating steam must be secured before the diesel oil passes through the three-way valve.

Question_Title: Cylinder linings constructed as an integral part of the block, are characterized by which of the following  disadvantages?
Answer_4: They require special tools for removal.

Question_Title: The main propulsion diesel continues running after you try  to shut down.  You should now attempt to __________.
Answer_4: shut off the fuel at the day tank

Question_Title: A Roots-type blower installed on a direct reversible engine __________.
Answer_1: is engaged only when turning ahead
Answer_2: is geared so that air flow through the blower is always in  the same direction
Answer_3: reverses rotation along with the engine
Answer_4: exhausts to atmosphere when turning astern

Question_Title: Before being shut down, a diesel engine should idle a few minutes in order to __________.
Answer_2: make sure the fuel nozzles are flushed clean
Answer_3: prevent pressure buildup in the fuel lines

Question_Title: Insufficient end clearance on newly fitted piston rings in a diesel engine will cause the rings to __________.
Answer_1: jam in the least worn part of the cylinder when the rings expand
Answer_2: break in the most worn part of the cylinder when the rings  expand
Answer_3: wear eccentrically on the side opposite the end gap
Answer_4: overheat and jam at the top center on the combustion stroke

Question_Title: The power consumed during the scavenging process of a diesel engine is known as the __________.

Answer_2: hone the cylinder liner to allow ring installation
Answer_3: compress the rings tighter with a compressing tool
Answer_4: file the ends of the rings

Question_Title: Before installing rings on a diesel engine piston, you should check the ring __________.

Answer_3: renewing both driving and driven gears as a set
Answer_4: shimming and pinning the gears with proper backlash

Question_Title: When a diesel engine is operated with a piston ring having a cold gap clearance less than that recommended by the manufacturer, the ring will __________.

Answer_1: Reduce engine speed to idle before removing the filter.
Answer_2: Soak the dirty filter in kerosene only.
Answer_3: Blow out the air inlet with compressed air.
Answer_4: Cover the air inlet after removing the filter.

Question_Title: A visual inspection of the chrome plated piston compression rings at the liner ports reveals vertical brown streaks on  the face of the rings.  This condition indicates __________.

Answer_1: shiny face and bottom, black back and top
Answer_2: shiny face, black top, back and bottom
Answer_3: shiny face, bottom, back and top
Answer_4: black face, bottom, back and top

Question_Title: Following the failure of one turbocharger on a large, crosshead, main propulsion diesel engine, fitted with multiple turbochargers, which of the following actions should be taken prior to further operation of the engine?
Answer_1: Blank off the exhaust gas inlet to the damaged turbocharger.
Answer_2: Secure cooling and lubrication to the damaged turbocharger.
Answer_3: Lock the rotor of the damaged turbocharger.

Question_Title: A bright shiny appearance of the sealing surfaces on diesel engine compression rings indicates __________.

Answer_2: Increase the exhaust and intake valve overlap.
Answer_4: Decrease the amount of exhaust and intake valve overlap.

Question_Title: Visual inspection of chrome-plated piston compression rings reveals a black ring face at the position of the cylinder liner ports.  This condition indicates a ring which __________.
Answer_2: exceeds wear limits through normal wear

Question_Title: The face surface appearance of a shallow groove, stainless  steel, chrome plated compression ring should exhibit through its operating life a __________.
Answer_3: smooth surface displaying areas of stainless steel and chrome

Question_Title: Which of the changes in the valve timing listed should be carried out when a naturally aspirated four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is converted to a supercharged engine?
Answer_1: Retard the intake valve opening and advance the exhaust valve closing period.
Answer_2: Advance the intake and exhaust valve opening period.

Answer_4: Retard the intake and exhaust valve closing period.

Question_Title: When inspecting piston rings through the ports of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine, black areas on the sealing  surfaces are the result of __________.

Answer_1: The intake valve opening is advanced and the exhaust valve  closing is retarded.
Answer_2: The intake valve opening is unchanged and the exhaust valve closing is advanced.
Answer_3: The intake valve opening is retarded and the exhaust valve  closing is advanced.
Answer_4: The intake valve closing is retarded and the exhaust valve  closing is advanced.

Question_Title: Black areas on the sealing surfaces of piston rings indicate __________.

Answer_3: Excessive condensate forming in the air box.
Answer_4: A decrease in the air temperature differential between the  cooler inlet and outlet.

Question_Title: If sludge accumulates on the underside of a diesel engine piston, it will __________.
Answer_3: form an emulsion of lube oil and water

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions can cause below normal air pressure in the intake manifold of a turbocharged diesel engine?
Answer_1: Excessive piston blow-by to the manifold.
Answer_3: Accumulated water in the air boxes.

Answer_1: damaged upper piston rings and/or ring lands

Question_Title: Which of the following problems can cause an above normal air temperature to develop in the intake manifold of a turbocharged and aftercooled diesel engine?

Answer_1: a taper faced ring can be used
Answer_2: the cylinder surface is honed to the smoothest surface attainable
Answer_3: inlaid rings can be utilized in which the chrome center of  the ring face slightly protrudes beyond the cast iron edges
Answer_4: rings with increased back clearance are provided

Question_Title: If the turbocharger of a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine fails to operate, which of the following statements best describes the probable effect?
Answer_1: Intake manifold pressure will be high.
Answer_2: Intake manifold pressure will be unaffected.

Question_Title: A substance found in residual fuels which tends to cause exhaust valve corrosion and grooving, is __________.

Answer_1: Open the crankcase immediately to check for damage.
Answer_2: Apply fire fighting water through the crankcase breather.
Answer_3: Allow the engine to cool before opening the crankcase.
Answer_4: Assume that there is no damage to the crankshaft.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true regarding the installation of piston rings on two-stroke/cycle, diesel engines as compared to four-stroke/cycle, diesel engines?
Answer_1: In a two-stroke/cycle engine, the rings run hotter, requiring the end gap to be greater.
Answer_2: Some provision must be made in a two-stroke/cycle engine to keep the rings from binding in the ports.
Answer_3: No gap is required to exist between the ends of the ring when cold in a two-stroke/cycle engine, but a small gap is  required in a four-stroke/cycle engine.
Answer_4: The end gaps should be staggered on either side of a piston in a two-stroke/cycle engine, while staggering is not necessary in a four-stroke/cycle engine.

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions must be taken if an electric immersion heater is used to keep the coolant in a  diesel engine warm during the time the engine is secured?
Answer_1: The coolant temperature must be maintained at 180F.
Answer_2: The thermostatic bypass valves must be manually opened before the engine is started.
Answer_3: The pressure cap must be removed while the engine is secured.
Answer_4: Electrical power to the heater must be secured if the cooling system is to be drained.

Question_Title: The manufacturer of a particular diesel engine recommends when running on heavy fuel for the vanadium content not to  exceed 300 ppm.  If there are 10 ounces of vanadium per 3125 pounds of fuel just taken on board, which of the following  statements is correct?
Answer_2: The vanadium content is slightly above acceptable values.
Answer_3: The vanadium content is well within recommended limits.
Answer_4: The vanadium content will accelerate cylinder wear.

Question_Title: If a crankcase explosion occurs in a diesel engine, you should stop the engine and __________.
Answer_1: immediately open all crankcase relief ports
Answer_2: increase crankcase exhauster speed to draw cool air into the engine
Answer_3: allow the engine to cool naturally
Answer_4: increase crank case scavenge air to remove unburned gases

Question_Title: The service life of a worn aluminum piston for an auxiliary diesel, for which no spares are readily available, can be extended by __________.
Answer_1: turning down the piston skirt to concentric values

Answer_4: increasing the dimensions of the ring land grooves

Question_Title: If the turbocharger failed on an auxiliary diesel engine, which of the following conditions would probably occur?
Answer_2: The exhaust will contain black smoke.

Question_Title: The desirable properties of a marine fuel oil should include __________.
Answer_1: high flash point and high viscosity
Answer_2: low flash point and high viscosity
Answer_3: low heating value and high sulphur content
Answer_4: high heating value and low sulphur content

Question_Title: If a diesel engine has been stopped because of piston seizure due to severe overheating, the crankcase __________.
Answer_1: inspection covers should not be opened until the engine has cooled

Answer_3: scavenge pump should be immediately secured to prevent loss of lube oil
Answer_4: explosion covers should be opened slightly to provide extra ventilation

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions can result in the cracking of the piston lands?

Answer_1: The cylinder indicator cocks should be opened.
Answer_2: The sump lube oil scavenge pump should be secured immediately.
Answer_3: The explosion relief valves should be manually opened.
Answer_4: The crankcase should remain unopened until the engine has cooled.

Question_Title: Excessive side clearance between a piston ring and its groove will cause the ring to __________.
Answer_3: hammer the piston land above the ring
Answer_4: hammer the piston land below the ring

Question_Title: Cold weather starting of a diesel engine may be made easier by __________.
Answer_2: using a special fuel having a high ignition temperature

Question_Title: A thin film of oil on the lobes of a Roots-type blower indicates __________.

Answer_1: compression pressure in the cylinder will be higher

Answer_3: combustion gases will penetrate beneath the ring land
Answer_4: piston side thrust will be increased

Question_Title: Starting a large low-speed propulsion diesel engine on diesel fuel during cold weather conditions, will be made easier by __________.

Answer_1: the engine to run after the fuel has been secured

Answer_2: cause clogging of the fuel system
Answer_3: increase the ability of the engine to start in cold weather
Answer_4: produce corrosion in the cylinder and exhaust system at low loads

Question_Title: In certain cases, a cylinder liner can be refinished rather than replaced.  When properly honed, the __________.
Answer_1: cylinder should be cleaned with kerosene
Answer_2: cylinder liner should have a glazed appearance
Answer_3: liner surface should have a crosshatch pattern

Question_Title: Jacket water heaters are used on diesel engines to __________.
Answer_1: help the engine start easier in cold weather
Answer_2: maintain the proper jacket water pH
Answer_3: maintain the proper expansion tank water level

Question_Title: Which of the following problems may occur when using fuel oil with a high sulphur content?
A properly honed diesel engine cylinder liner will __________.

The large number of mechanical and pulsating vibrations developed in a diesel engine may damage an attached __________.
Answer_1: scavenged air pump because it is designed for steady state  operation rather than pulsating gas load

Answer_3: rotary blower because it operates at close tolerances over a small range of speeds and delivers its air charge at a certain resonant frequency
Answer_4: gas driven turbocharger because it has a wide speed range and high temperature materials that are subject to resonant vibration

Question_Title: The burning of fuel oil in a diesel engine having a high sodium content, will cause __________.
Answer_1: corrosion and grooving of exhaust valves
Answer_2: corrosion and gumming of the fuel injection pump
Answer_3: salt deposits in the exhaust manifold
Answer_4: slag deposits in the fuel injection equipment

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning cylinder liner wear in a single acting diesel engine is correct?
Answer_1: Uniformly excessive liner wear will not cause wear on the piston rings and grooves.
Answer_2: Liner wear is distributed equally between upper and lower portions of the cylinder.
Answer_3: Excessive liner wear causes wear between piston rings and grooves.
Answer_4: Liner wear is normally greatest in the middle of the cylinder.

Question_Title: Diesel engine starting difficulties due to cold intake air  temperatures, can be overcome by using a/an __________.

Answer_3: oil leaking into the turbocharger compressor end

Question_Title: The cetane number rates fuels for diesel engines according  to its __________.

Answer_1: Adjacent to the piston skirt when the crank is on TDC.
Answer_2: Along the lower part of the liner wall opposite the oil control ring.
Answer_3: Opposite the top ring shortly after piston travel has ended the compression stroke.
Answer_4: Opposite the oil control ring when the crank is on bottom dead center.

Question_Title: In diesel engineering practice, the term used to express the ignition quality of a particular fuel is __________.

Answer_1: reduced by increasing lube oil pressure

Answer_3: proportional to the lube oil viscosity
Answer_4: eliminated by heating the intake air

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions may be attributed to a fouled turbocharger compressor inlet screen or filter?
Answer_2: Increasing exhaust temperatures before the turbine.

Question_Title: The ignition quality of diesel fuel is indicated by its __________.

Answer_4: combustion gases in the cooling water

Question_Title: Cold weather starting of a diesel engine is more difficult  than warm weather starting due to __________.
Answer_1: use of low viscosity oil in cold weather

Answer_3: increased drag of pistons and bearings due to increased oil viscosity
Answer_4: higher compression pressures reached due to smaller clearances existing in the engine during cold weather

Question_Title: Why will a turbocharged diesel engine produce black smoke if excessive additional load is applied too quickly?

Answer_2: Insufficient heat transfer from the exhaust valves

Question_Title: Fluid type starting motors used for starting auxiliary diesel engines may either be of the piston type or the __________.

Question_Title: Fuel oil having a low cetane rating could result in __________.

Answer_2: The cetane number is an indication of the fuel's viscosity.
Answer_3: Ignition lag is reduced with fuels having a high cetane number.
Answer_4: The cetane number is of little significance in the  combustion process.

Answer_1: The cetane number is obtained by comparing the fuel with cetane, a colorless liquid hydrocarbon.

Answer_3: The highest cetane number of fuel is 100.

Question_Title: The insertion of shims between the foot of a marine type connecting rod and a bearing box would result in __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following operating conditions can occur when  shims are removed from the joint between the foot of a marine type diesel engine connecting rod and the bearing box?

Answer_3: operates with scavenge air under a positive pressure
Answer_4: operates without energy absorbing intake and exhaust strokes

Question_Title: With respect to diesel fuel, the ease with which a cold engine will start is dependent upon the __________.
Answer_2: high heating value of the fuel

Answer_4: internal flow resistance in the injectors

Question_Title: Worn main bearings will cause the compression ratio of an auxiliary diesel engine to __________.

Question_Title: Starting systems for large, low-speed, direct reversing, main propulsion diesel engines are usually __________.
A mixture of 45% cetane and 55% alpha-methyl-naphthalene is found to have the same ignition delay as a sample of diesel oil.  The sample can be described as having a/an __________.
In a large, low-speed diesel engine the clearance between the piston crown and cylinder head is found to be excessive.  In order to correct for this, you should __________.
Answer_1: build up the piston crown by metal spraying
Answer_2: build up the cylinder head by metal spraying
Answer_3: insert shims between the crankpin bearing box and the connecting rod foot

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of starting systems is often used on large, low-speed, direct reversing, main propulsion diesel engines?
An acceptable method of measuring for the correct rotational force applied to the connecting rod and main bearing bolts, is to use a __________.
Which of the following relationships exist between the temperature developed in a combustion space, and the compression ratio of the engine?
Answer_1: Higher compression ratios create higher temperature.
Answer_2: Higher temperatures create higher compression ratios.
Answer_3: Lower temperatures create higher compression ratios.
Answer_4: Higher compression ratios create lower temperatures.

Question_Title: Injection lag in a diesel engine may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: a higher cetane number of fuel oil
Answer_2: the diesel fuel used having a high viscosity
Answer_3: mechanical rigidity in the lube pump mechanism
Answer_4: a decrease in the fuel pump delivery pressure

Question_Title: Abnormal crankpin bearing and piston skirt surface wear indicate __________.
Answer_2: a clogged connecting rod oil passage

Question_Title: Diesel engine injection lag is caused by __________.
The pilot valves in an air pilot starting system for a two-stroke/cycle, direct-reversing, main propulsion diesel  engine are operated by either a ported distributor disc or  a/an __________.
Answer_4: individual cam for each pilot valve

Question_Title: Fuel oil injected into the cylinder of a diesel engine just after the piston passes top dead center, will __________.
Diesel engine crankshaft deflection readings are generally  taken at four crank positions.  Good engineering practice requires the deflection gage or indicator to be __________.
Answer_1: placed as near the crankpin axis as possible
Answer_2: removed each time the crankshaft is repositioned
Answer_3: left in place for all four readings
Answer_4: reset to zero for all four readings

Question_Title: Heat for igniting the fuel oil in the cylinder of a diesel  engine is generated by the __________.
Answer_2: compression of air by the piston

Question_Title: One method of determining crankshaft misalignment is by __________.
Answer_1: laying a straight edge across the crank webs at the crankpin and measuring the distance to the crankpin in two places
Answer_2: measuring the crank drop on either side of each crank throw while the crankshaft is slowly rotated through one  revolution
Answer_3: rotating the crankshaft through one revolution, pausing each 90 of rotation to measure bearing clearances, top and bottom
Answer_4: taking micrometer readings between the crank cheeks opposite the crankpin every 90 of crank angle rotation

Question_Title: Cams used to activate mechanically operated air starting valves on four-stroke/cycle diesel engines should have which of the valve lift profiles listed?
Answer_1: Abrupt lift with a short open period, and abrupt valve seating.
Answer_2: Gradual lift with a short fully open period, and accelerated valve closing.
Answer_3: Abrupt lift giving full valve opening for a long period, with gradual valve seating.
Answer_4: Gradual lift giving full valve opening for a long period, with gradual valve seating.

Question_Title: The minimum fuel oil delivery pressure required for diesel  engine injection depends primarily on the __________.
Answer_3: quality of fuel to be injected
Answer_4: duration of the ignition delay period

Question_Title: Which instrument is used to take crankshaft deflection readings?
The timing of diesel engine air starting valves is  controlled by __________.
Answer_1: the air start valve timing gears and rods

Question_Title: On an opposed-piston engine lower crank lead can be adjusted to change which of the listed operating conditions?
Answer_2: Exhaust events starting before scavenging events.
Answer_3: Exhaust events lasting longer than scavenging events.

Question_Title: Diesel engine air start valve timing is controlled by __________.
In the cylinder of a diesel engine, fuel is ignited by the  __________.
Answer_1: spark from a plug in the precombustion chamber
Answer_3: heat of compression within the cylinder
Answer_4: heat from the fuel injection nozzle

Question_Title: If there is a 'clicking' sound in the valve compartment of a diesel  engine, the cause may be __________.
A loud clicking noise from the valve compartment of an operating diesel engine would indicate __________.
Excessively worn, or polished ends on a diesel engine valve spring, indicate __________.
When a hydraulic valve lifter is on the base circle of the  cam, 'zero' valve lash is maintained by the __________.
Fuel oil day tanks for diesel engines must be checked and cleaned at regular intervals in order to remove __________.
Small cracks in the crankshaft bearing surface of a diesel  engine are an indication of __________.
Which of the following methods is used to prevent throttling of compressed air through the diesel engine air starting valves?
Answer_1: Holding the valve open for a long period
Answer_2: Increasing the starting air pressure used
Answer_3: Opening the starting air valve quickly
Answer_4: Reducing the starting air valve size

Question_Title: The depth of fuel oil in a tank is normally measured through the __________.

An eight cylinder, four stroke/cycle, single acting diesel engine has a 650 mm bore and a 1400 mm stroke.  What will be the developed indicated metric horsepower if the average mean effective pressure is 30 kg/cm2 at a speed of 100 RPM?
Starting air check valves are held firmly on their seats by __________.
Answer_3: air pressure on top of the valve differential piston
Answer_4: air pressure on the bottom of the valve differential piston

Question_Title: Fuel oil is regularly transferred to the day tank in order  to __________.
Answer_1: allow impurities to settle out of the fuel
Answer_2: allow air to escape from the fuel
Answer_3: make fuel available for immediate use

Question_Title: Following an overhaul of a crosshead type diesel engine, the engine is jacked over with the turning gear as part of the  pre-start procedure.  Which of the listed pre-start procedures should be carried out?
Answer_1: Ensure proper cylinder lube oil flow.
Answer_2: Open all air space drain cocks.

Question_Title: If water is found in the crankcase of a diesel engine, the  cause may be due to __________.
A six-cylinder, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is fitted with a rotary distributor type air starting system.  The speed of the rotating distributor disc is __________.
Standby, or emergency diesel generator day tanks should always be kept full to reduce the possibility of __________.
How does water enter the crankcase of a diesel engine?
Answer_2: As water vapor contained in blow-by.
Answer_3: Demulsifying lube oil passing through the main bearings.
Answer_4: Condensation from vapor formed in the expansion tank.

Question_Title: An accumulator used in a hydraulic starting system is generally located between the __________.
Answer_3: starting motor and the reserve tank

Question_Title: The device used to store a charged pressure for an hydraulic starting system is called the __________.
Which of the listed contaminants will be satisfactorily removed from fuel oil by centrifuging?
Water accumulating in the crankcase of a diesel engine could indicate __________.
Answer_4: excessive moisture in the scavenge air

Question_Title: One engine manufacturer recommends heavy fuel oil should not be heated above 80C to 95C (176F to 203F) before purification.  This upper limit should be observed to ensure against __________.
Answer_1: flattening of the bowl neoprene O-rings
Answer_2: operation within the explosive range of the fuel

Question_Title: Excessive valve clearance will cause a valve to open __________.
In a hydraulic starting system, oil to the starting motor flows from the __________.
On board supply vessels, a centrifuge is normally used to purify __________.
The most effective method in removing water from diesel fuel oil is by __________.
In a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine, piston blow-by can result in increased __________.
The diesel engine starter least likely to be affected by low ambient temperatures, is the __________.
Diesel engine piston ring blow-by is usually caused by excessive ring clearance at the ring __________.
During diesel engine warm-up, which type of valve lash adjuster listed allows for the change in length of the exhaust valves?
Hydraulic starters are installed on many lifeboat diesel engines instead of comparable air start systems, because __________.
Answer_1: hydraulic starters are the least expensive of all starting  systems
Answer_2: the system does not require high pressure piping
Answer_3: hydraulic systems turn diesel engines at higher rates of speed than air starters
Answer_4: the system can be manually recharged

Question_Title: Which of the bearings listed below is most widely used for  the main and connecting rod bearings of a modern high-speed diesel engine?
For optimum results, centrifugal purification of heavy fuel oil should be accomplished with the fuel at the lowest practicable __________.
In a diesel engine, blow-by is generally the result of worn __________.
The valve stem expansion associated with engine warm-up is  allowed for by the __________.
Which of the bearing types listed is commonly used for main bearings in small internal combustion engines?
Heavy residual fuel oils are heated prior to centrifuging to __________.
One cause of diesel engine piston ring blow-by is __________.
Bearing clearances in small high-speed diesel engines should be measured with __________.
Which of the types of motors listed is used in a hydraulic  starter?
Diesel engine 'blow-by' into the crankcase is caused by excessive ring __________.
Which type of motor listed is most commonly used in hydraulic starting systems for diesel engines?
A centrifuge will satisfactorily remove which of the following contaminants from fuel oil?
When an engine fitted with a hydraulic starting system starts up, the starter is protected from the higher speed of the engine by __________.
Answer_1: the immediate increase in hydraulic pressure
Answer_4: the pivoting of the shaft from being engaged with the flywheel

Question_Title: If fuel oil were being discharged from the waste water outlet of a fuel oil disk type centrifuge, operated as a separator, you should __________.
Answer_3: slow the centrifuge to its proper speed

Question_Title: In a diesel engine, blow-by is a result of combustion gases leaking into the crankcase past the __________.
In a Bendix starter drive, the initiation of pinion engagement with the flywheel ring gear is by __________.
A centrifugal fuel oil purifier should be shut down if __________.
Answer_3: the purifier has a bad vibration when started
Answer_4: water is discharged from the overflow line

Question_Title: Diesel engine blow-by is the leakage of combustion gases past the __________.
In a starting motor equipped with a Bendix drive, the pinion moves and meshes with the flywheel ring gear due to __________.
The camshaft on a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is used to operate the __________.
If the bowl of a disk type centrifugal purifier when operated as a separator is not primed, the __________.
Answer_1: oil has a tendency to emulsify in the bowl
Answer_2: purifier will act as a clarifier at the discharge ring
Answer_3: oil will be lost through the water discharge ports
Answer_4: oil solids will be deposited only at the intermediate top disk

Question_Title: In large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engines, piston ring groove wear usually occurs at the __________.
A diesel engine cylinder head can crack as a result of __________.
The use of push rods becomes necessary in a diesel engine when  __________.
Answer_1: the camshaft is located some distance below the valve gear
Answer_2: the rocker arms are pivoted near their centers
Answer_3: two or more valves must be opened and closed at the same time
Answer_4: hydraulic valve lash adjusters are used

Question_Title: If diesel fuel was discharging from the waste water outlet  of a disk type centrifugal purifier operating as a separator you should __________.
Answer_3: slow the purifier to its proper speed
Answer_4: put in an additional discharge ring

Question_Title: The ring lands on a large, low-speed, main propulsion diesel engine piston may crack due to __________.
Answer_3: high main lubricating oil system temperature

Question_Title: Which of the listed design features is found in an exhaust  valve and NOT in an intake valve?
Answer_2: Beveled edges on the valve head

Question_Title: In an auxiliary diesel engine, the reason for knurling the  piston skirt is to __________.
Which factor determines the ring dam size for a fuel oil, tubular bowl type, centrifugal purifier?
Answer_2: The quantity of water to be removed from the fuel.
Answer_3: The specific gravity of the fuel.
Answer_4: The quantity of dirt to be removed from the fuel.

Question_Title: Cracking of a diesel piston crown can result from __________.
Answer_2: the underside of the piston crown being excessively dirty, lowering the rate of heat transfer

Question_Title: Many diesel engine exhaust valves are being constructed with hollow stems filled with sodium in order to __________.
Answer_1: provide added wear protection against today's corrosive quality of fuel
Answer_2: increase overall valve strength due to the high gas pressures
Answer_3: assist in dissipating heat due to the extreme operating temperatures
Answer_4: reduce the overall weight of the valve thus helping eliminate valve spring surge and hammering

Question_Title: Marine auxiliary diesel engine starters utilizing Bendix drive gear are powered by an electric starting motor or __________.
In a diesel engine, which type of wrist pin uses bearings in the piston bosses, but is fixed to the small end of the connecting rod?
Poor quality fuel being used in a turbocharged medium-speed, diesel engine could result in __________.
If clearance between a piston and the cylinder wall is excessive, piston slap will occur.  The slap itself is caused by __________.
Answer_2: a breakdown of the lube oil film on the cylinder wall
Answer_3: worn piston boss piston pin bearings
Answer_4: fluctuating gas pressure in the combustion space

Question_Title: A built-up exhaust valve is one in which __________.
Answer_1: the stem and heads are made of different material
Answer_3: a replaceable valve disk is welded to the head
Answer_4: the self-centering action comes from motion of the valve stem in the guide

Question_Title: Brake specific fuel consumption is given in units of __________.
Which of the following statements concerning cylinder liner wear is true?
Answer_1: Liner wear is distributed equally between the upper and lower portions of the cylinder.
Answer_2: Excessive liner wear causes wear between piston ring and groove.
Answer_3: Excessive, but uniform liner wear will not cause wear between piston ring and groove.
Answer_4: Liner wear is normally greatest in the middle of the cylinder.

Question_Title: Valve rotators are commonly used on which of the listed diesel engine cylinder head valves?
To reduce the weight of the reciprocating parts, pistons of high-speed engines are made considerably shorter.  This results in __________.
Answer_1: less piston slap and quieter running

Question_Title: When comparing different fuels for different engines, the ignition quality of the fuel oil becomes a less critical consideration as __________.
Answer_1: the amount of lube oil additives increase

Question_Title: Scuffed cylinder liner surfaces in a diesel engine can result from __________.
The pinion of an electric starting motor used with a diesel engine engages the flywheel ring gear by a/an __________.
The adverse effects of burning high sulfur fuel can be compensated for by using a cylinder oil having sufficient __________.
Wear is usually greatest at the top of the cylinder bore of a diesel engine due to the __________.
Answer_2: skirt making the greatest amount of contact

Question_Title: A turbocharged, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine has a larger valve overlap than a naturally aspirated, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine in order to increase the __________.
Answer_3: air pressure to the intake manifold
Answer_4: cooling effect on the exhaust valves

Question_Title: Electric starting motors for diesel engines require high current for operation and __________.
Answer_1: require a generator as a source of power
Answer_2: will carry a 100% overload for a brief period
Answer_3: require a current/voltage regulator for proper operation
Answer_4: will overheat if operated continuously over 10 seconds

Question_Title: Piston cooling fins are located __________.
Answer_3: at the base of the piston skirt
Answer_4: inside the cylinder liner cooling water jacket

Question_Title: If the oil scraper ring drain hole in a diesel engine piston becomes plugged, __________.
Answer_4: the ring will immediately seize and buckle

Question_Title: Auxiliary diesel engine electric starting motors use __________.
Many cast iron pistons are designed with heat dams, which serve to __________.
Answer_1: keep piston crown temperatures elevated for smoother combustion
Answer_2: reduce the possibility of overheating the top compression ring
Answer_3: help retain the heat of compression to prevent ignition delay
Answer_4: help retain the heat of compression to prevent combustion knock

Question_Title: If the piston groove drain holes for the oil control rings  become clogged, which of the following is likely to occur?
Answer_1: The oil control rings will seat improperly and wear rapidly.
Answer_2: The piston will overheat due to insufficient lubrication.
Answer_3: Excessive oil will remain on the cylinder wall.
Answer_4: Light brown smoke will emanate from the engine exhaust.

Question_Title: During the process of cylinder scavenging, the size of the exhaust valve opening is __________.
Answer_1: most critical in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine
Answer_2: most critical in a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine
Answer_3: most critical in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine if it is turbocharged
Answer_4: of equal importance in a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine as  in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine

Question_Title: Diesel engine electric starting motors generally require heavier duty motors and operate at higher voltages than comparable starting motors for gasoline engines due to __________.
If the compression rings on a diesel engine piston become stuck in the ring groove, the cause may be due to __________.
Exhaust valve openings in a two-cycle diesel engine cylinder head are made as large as practical to __________.
Answer_1: increase back pressure during the exhaust process
Answer_2: facilitate periodic replacement of the valves
Answer_3: reduce the pumping loss associated with scavenging

Question_Title: Electric starting motors for diesel engines require high current for their operation.  As a result of this, they __________.
Answer_1: have a generator as a source of power
Answer_2: need a current-voltage regulator for proper operation
Answer_3: will overheat if operated continuously over ten seconds
Answer_4: will carry a 100% overload for a brief period

Question_Title: Cold clearances between the skirt of an aluminum piston and the cylinder liner is about __________.
Answer_1: twice as large as with a cast iron piston
Answer_2: the same size as with a cast iron piston
Answer_3: half as large as with a cast iron piston
Answer_4: the same size as the crown of an aluminum piston

Question_Title: Improperly fitted piston rings in a diesel engine can cause __________.
Answer_2: lower than normal lube oil temperature
Answer_3: higher than normal exhaust back pressure

Question_Title: Exhaust gases are generally removed from the cylinders of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine by __________.
Diesel engine piston seizure can be caused by __________.
In the cylinder head of a two-stroke/cycle diesel engine, valves are used for __________.
A six-cylinder, two-stroke/cycle diesel engine is fitted with a rotary distributing air starting system.  The speed  of the rotating distributor disc is __________.
Incomplete combustion in a running diesel engine can cause  piston rings to become stuck as a result of __________.
Answer_3: uneven heat expansion of the rings
Answer_4: uneven heat expansion of the piston

Question_Title: The exhaust system for a turbocharged two-stroke/cycle diesel engine functions to __________.
One end of a diesel engine cylinder is sealed by the cylinder head and the other end by the __________.
A sudden drop in compression pressure in one cylinder of a  diesel engine can be caused by __________.
The most common instrument used to measure diesel engine exhaust pressure is the __________.
In a two-stroke/cycle, opposed piston, diesel engine, one crankshaft operates several crank angles in advance of the  other crankshaft to __________.
Answer_1: allow the exhaust ports to open and close before the inlet  ports close
Answer_2: allow the scavenge ports to open and close simultaneously with the exhaust ports
Answer_3: prevent scavenge air pressure buildup in the cylinders
Answer_4: prevent the exhaust piston from reaching TDC and BDC before the intake piston

Question_Title: Low compression in a diesel engine could be caused by __________.
Answer_1: worn or broken cylinder liner sealing rings

Question_Title: When monitoring diesel engine performance, the most useful  instrument to use is the __________.
The difference in crank lead between the upper and lower cranks of an opposed piston engine causes the lower crankshaft to __________.
Answer_1: receive less power than the upper shaft
Answer_2: receive more power than the upper shaft
Answer_3: operate the fuel oil booster pump
Answer_4: rotate faster than the upper shaft

Question_Title: In an opposed piston engine, which of the following events  would happen if the lower crank lead were reduced from 12  to 0?
Answer_1: The exhaust ports would open before the scavenging ports.
Answer_2: The scavenging ports would open before the exhaust ports.
Answer_3: Neither the exhaust nor the scavenging ports would open.
Answer_4: The exhaust and scavenging ports would open simultaneously.

Question_Title: Worn main bearings in a diesel engine can result in __________.
Answer_4: excessive leakage past the piston rings

Question_Title: A pyrometer is an instrument commonly used to measure __________.
During the power stroke of a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine, most of the side thrust of a trunk-type piston is absorbed by the __________.
Low compression pressure in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.
A pyrometer is an instrument used to measure the temperature of the diesel engine __________.
Low compression pressure in a diesel engine is caused by __________.
Answer_1: low water in the expansion tank
Answer_4: worn or broken cylinder liner sealing rings

Question_Title: Thermocouple pyrometers are used on large, main propulsion  diesel engines to indicate the temperature of the __________.
Answer_4: lube oil at the bearing supplies

Question_Title: A connecting rod in a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is subject to __________.
Answer_1: tension load twice each crankshaft revolution
Answer_2: compression load during power and compression strokes
Answer_3: inertia load once every four crankshaft revolutions
Answer_4: bending loads at bottom and top dead center

Question_Title: Low compression pressure in a diesel engine can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: carbon deposits in the combustion space
Answer_2: carbon deposits on the piston crown

Question_Title: Exhaust gas pyrometers are useful for __________.
Answer_1: detecting faulty combustion in individual cylinders
Answer_2: adjusting fuel racks to maintain equal loading between cylinders
Answer_3: adjusting the load limit setting of the governor at idle conditions

Question_Title: When the quick acting valve to admit starting air to an air start motor is activated, the valve should be opened rapidly to __________.
Answer_1: prevent damage to the air line lubricator
Answer_2: ensure proper operation of the Bendix pinion
Answer_3: prevent damage to the valve seat
Answer_4: increase the air charge density to the motor

Question_Title: Low compression pressure in a diesel engine may be the result of __________.
Answer_1: insufficient fuel supply due to fuel pump valves sticking or leaking
Answer_2: excessive mechanical clearance between the piston crown and cylinder head

Question_Title: For a diesel engine, individual cylinder performance is commonly determined by exhaust gas __________.
Diesel engine air start system check valves are opened by __________.
In a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine the intake valves open __________.
Answer_1: before TDC and close after BDC
Answer_2: after TDC and close after BDC
Answer_3: before TDC and close before BDC
Answer_4: after TDC and close before BDC

Question_Title: Low compression in a diesel engine can be caused by  __________.
Answer_4: worn or broken cylinder liner sealing rings

Question_Title: Pyrometers commonly found on diesel engine exhaust systems, consist of __________.
Answer_2: a gas-filled bellows, a tube and a pressure gauge

Question_Title: Excessive valve lash in an auxiliary diesel engine will cause the valves to open __________.
The loss of the diesel engine cylinder air charge through leaky valves, piston rings, worn or scored liners, would be indicated by which of the following sets of conditions?
Answer_1: Low compression pressure and high exhaust temperature
Answer_2: Low firing pressure and high exhaust temperature
Answer_3: Low compression pressure and low exhaust temperature
Answer_4: Low firing pressure and low exhaust temperature

Question_Title: Which of the general advantages listed does the electrical  pyrometer have over the mechanical pyrometer?
Answer_1: When heated, it will move proportional to the amount the metal has lengthened or expanded.
Answer_2: The pointer associated with the pyrometer scale can be made to also measure engine RPM.
Answer_3: It can be utilized in exhaust manifolds and heat exchangers interchangeably.
Answer_4: It can indicate temperature at a distant point from the source of heat.

Question_Title: When an air started, four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is being cranked, the starting air is admitted to each cylinder during what would normally be the __________.
Which of the listed problems can be a cause of low  compression pressure in a diesel engine?
Which of the diesel engine exhaust mufflers listed is usually equipped with a spark arrestor?
When the cold valve lash is less than that specified by the manufacturer, diesel engine valves, operating at normal temperatures, will __________.
Low cylinder compression pressure and a high exhaust temperature may indicate __________.
Answer_3: a continuously open scavenge air port

Question_Title: A dry-type spark arrestor removes sparks from a diesel engine exhaust by __________.
Answer_1: increasing the linear velocity of the exhaust gases
Answer_2: changing directions of exhaust gas flow
Answer_3: decreasing the temperature of the exhaust gases
Answer_4: accelerating the exhaust gas through a reduced size orifice

Question_Title: If a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is started by admitting high pressure air into the cylinders, the pistons receiving the charge of starting air must be __________.
Answer_3: at the end of the power stroke
Answer_4: at the start of the intake stroke

Question_Title: If the valve lash on a diesel engine is set improperly, which of the following statements represents the most serious problem that can develop?
Answer_1: Too little lash will cause noisy operation and excessive wear.
Answer_2: Too much lash will cause the valve to open early and close  late.
Answer_3: Too little lash may prevent the valves from seating properly.
Answer_4: Too much lash may prevent combustion through loss of compression.

Question_Title: A drop in compression pressure in one cylinder of a diesel  engine can be caused by __________.
In a medium-speed marine propulsion engine equipped with direct air starting valves, the cylinders without air starting valves fire first because the __________.
Answer_2: fuel is admitted only to these cylinders during cranking
Answer_3: compression is released during starting by opening the exhaust valve
Answer_4: cylinders are not chilled by the expansion of the starting air

Question_Title: If you increase the clearance between a valve stem and rocker arm, which of the listed conditions will occur?
Answer_3: Amount of fuel injected will be increased.
Answer_4: Amount of fuel injected will be decreased.

Question_Title: Wet-type exhaust silencers, used with some auxilary diesel engines,  have which of the following design features in common?
Answer_1: The silencer is equipped with a water seal.
Answer_2: The exhaust gases are not mixed with cooling water.
Answer_3: The internal baffles break up the exhaust gas pulsation.
Answer_4: The exhaust noise is completely eliminated.

Question_Title: Reducing the clearance between a valve stem and rocker arm  will result in the valve __________.
Answer_1: having a shorter duration of opening
Answer_2: having a longer duration of opening

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions can cause lacquer to be deposited on a piston skirt?
A large two-stroke/cycle direct reversing diesel engine is to be reversed.  Prior to the admission of starting air you must __________.
Answer_1: line up the engine for restarting with light diesel oil
Answer_3: change the intake and exhaust valve cam positions
Answer_4: place the starting cam in the intermediate position

Question_Title: Which operating condition of a diesel engine is indicated by excessive firing pressures?
In a diesel engine, after ignition of the fuel occurs, but  before the piston reaches TDC, there is little change in the cylinder __________.
Which of the routine maintenance procedures listed is required for starting air receivers?
Answer_3: A close watch on temperature to prevent fluctuations in pressure.
Answer_4: Frequent cleaning to remove oil and foreign matter.

Question_Title: If you were inspecting the valve springs on an auxiliary diesel engine, your best indication of impending spring failure would be __________.
Answer_1: a glazed surface on the spring
Answer_4: cracks in the surface of the spring

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed could cause the cylinder relief valves on a large, low-speed, propulsion diesel engine to lift?
The exhaust system of a diesel engine is usually designed to remove exhaust gases and to __________.
When the solenoid of a Bendix drive type starter is energized by operating the starter switch, the __________.
Answer_1: plunger draws the flywheel ring gear into the drive position
Answer_2: plunger completes the circuit between the battery bank and starting motor
Answer_3: friction clutch causes the pinion to rotate into the starting position
Answer_4: control windings de-energize and force the plunger out

Question_Title: Worn cylinder head valve seats in a diesel engine will cause __________.
Answer_3: excessive pressure in hydraulic valve lash adjusters

Question_Title: Which of the following reasons represents why the designed  compression ratio of a gasoline engine is lower than that of a diesel engine?
Answer_1: Compression must be low for effective spark ignition.
Answer_2: Compression must be low for required horsepower and torque  generation.
Answer_3: Compression must be low to prevent preignition.
Answer_4: Compression must be low to have effective preignition.

Question_Title: In some Bendix drive electric starting systems, the sudden  shock of the pinion gear being engaged with the flywheel is absorbed by the __________.
Answer_2: pinion when it engages the ring gear

Question_Title: Which of the following operations will have a direct impact on the rate of wear in a cylinder liner __________.
Answer_1: amount of scavenge air to the cylinder

Question_Title: If the relief valve on a diesel engine cylinder lifts, the  cause could be due to __________.
Which of the listed characteristics is common to both wet and dry type diesel engine exhaust mufflers?
Answer_4: Both have a dust collecting chamber.

Question_Title: Scuffed cylinder liner wearing surfaces in a diesel engine  can result from __________.
Answer_4: applying load to a cold diesel engine

Question_Title: An increase in crankcase pressure generally indicates __________.
Exhaust pipes for separate diesel engines can be combined only  when __________.
Answer_1: space limitations prevent separately run pipes
Answer_2: the engines are small auxiliary units
Answer_3: they are arranged to prevent gas backflow to each engine
Answer_4: a waste heat boiler is installed

Question_Title: Scuffed cylinder liner wearing surfaces in a diesel engine  can result from __________.
A substantial increase in crankcase pressure could be an indication of __________.
Answer_2: the proper seating of new rings

Question_Title: Marine diesel engine dry-type mufflers reduce noise by __________.
Answer_2: decreasing back pressure at the exhaust manifold
Answer_3: allowing gases to expand and change direction of flow
Answer_4: constant pulse charging at the exhaust manifold

Question_Title: Which of the following operating characteristics of the Bendix drive friction clutch is associated with a Bendix drive starter?
Answer_1: Helps absorb the shock when the pinion engages the ring gear.
Answer_2: Disengages the pinion from the flywheel ring gear.
Answer_3: Engages the pinion with the flywheel ring gear.
Answer_4: Prevents the pinion starter from overrunning on the starter shaft.

Question_Title: You are inspecting the lower main precision bearings on a diesel engine.  You observe that about half the thin babbitt linings are of a milky white color. This condition is caused by __________.
Answer_1: large dirt particles in the oil supply
Answer_4: water contamination of the lube oil

Question_Title: An increase in diesel engine crankcase pressure generally indicates excessive __________.
A water jacket is placed around the exhaust manifolds of propulsion diesel engines to __________.
Answer_1: reduce heat radiation to the engine room
Answer_3: condense and drain moisture from exhaust gases
Answer_4: dampen exhaust gas pulsations in the manifold

Question_Title: A floating vessel will behave as if all of its weight is acting downward through the __________.
