Question_Title: Which of the following components provides a direct source  of seawater for the fire main system?
When a helicopter is lifting personnel from an enclosed lifeboat, the other individuals in the boat should  __________.
Answer_1: enter the water in case the person being lifted slips from  the sling
Answer_2: stand on the outside of the boat to assist the person being lifted
Answer_3: remove their lifejackets to prepare for their transfer to the helicopter
Answer_4: remain seated inside to provide body weight for stability

Question_Title: Which of the hazards listed is of a primary concern, other  than fire damage, associated with a class C fire?

One of the common hazards onboard a vessel is represented by the accumulation of harmful gases in tanks, holds, etc. Which of the following gases is the most dangerous to personnel safety in confined atmospheres, as it is absorbed by the blood 300 times more quickly than oxygen?
Which of the following should not be used as a treatment for a person who has received a head injury and is groggy or unconscious?

A small fire is reported in the forward cargo hold on a vessel equipped with a combination smoke detection/carbon dioxide fixed fire extinguishing system.  After ensuring the space is unoccupied and properly sealed off, you should NEXT __________.
Answer_1: operate the control heads mounted on the main pilot cylinders
Answer_2: close all three-way valve levers that are in the detecting  position with the exception of the valve(s) to the involved space
Answer_3: open the three-way valve whose number (on the handle) corresponds with the line index chart number for the space  on fire
Answer_4: lock the smoke detector indicator on the monitoring line, which automatically activates the CO2 extinguishing system

Question_Title: The jackknife stored on an inflatable liferaft will always be located __________.
Answer_1: in one of the equipment bags
Answer_2: in a special pocket near the forward entrance
Answer_3: on a cord hanging from the canopy
Answer_4: in a pocket on the first aid kit

Question_Title: A ship of 6000 gross tons constructed after June 30, 1974,  must have a fixed container, or enclosed deck area under or around each fuel oil vent, overflow, and fill pipe.  This fixed container, or enclosed deck area must have a capacity of at least __________.
When a rescue vessel approaches a lifeboat in heavy seas, the person in charge of the lifeboat should __________.
Answer_2: tie up to the rescue vessel
Answer_3: wait for calmer weather before transferring personnel
Answer_4: transfer only those personnel who are not seasick

Question_Title: The reading of a combustible gas indicator indicates the percentage of the __________.
Answer_1: concentration of flammable gas in a compartment
Answer_2: lower explosive limit of a flammable gas concentration
Answer_3: upper explosive limit of a flammable gas concentration
Answer_4: concentration by weight of nonflammable gas in a compartment

Question_Title: The fire main system should be flushed with fresh water whenever possible to __________.
Answer_4: eliminate cracking of fire hose linings

Question_Title: Foam is a very effective smothering agent, in addition __________.
Answer_1: it provides cooling as a secondary effect
Answer_2: works well on extinguishing electrical fires
Answer_3: can be used to combat combustible metal fires

Question_Title: A fire involving aluminum powder would be a class __________.
If a cargo tank has not been certified as gas free, __________.
Answer_1: entry without a breathing apparatus may be made at the top  of the tank since petroleum vapors are heavier than air
Answer_2: a man may work safely without breathing apparatus in cold weather, as vapors are less volatile
Answer_3: breathing apparatus would not be necessary in an emergency  as you would only be in the tank a short time
Answer_4: breathing apparatus should always be used

Question_Title: A crewman has suffered a blow to the head and various symptoms indicate a concussion.  Proper treatment should include __________.
Answer_1: turning the victims's head to the side to keep his airway open
Answer_2: positioning the victim so the head is lower than the body
Answer_3: giving the victim water but no food
Answer_4: placing a pillow only under the victim's head

Question_Title: One of the disadvantages of using carbon dioxide to extinguish a fire in an enclosed space is __________.
Answer_1: the 'snow' which is sometimes discharged along with the gas is toxic
Answer_2: prolonged exposure to high concentrations of CO2 gas causes suffocation
Answer_3: rapid dissipation of the CO2 vapor
Answer_4: the CO2 gas is lighter than air and a large amount is required to extinguish a fire near the deck

Question_Title: Inflatable liferafts are provided with __________.

According the Pollution Prevention Regulations, a tank vessel with a total capacity of over 250,000 barrels of cargo oil, having two loading arms with a nominal pipe size diameter of 10 inches, each being 75 feet in length, must have an enclosed deck area with a minimum capacity of __________.
You are testing the external inflation bladder on an immersion suit and find it has a very slow leak.  Which of  the actions listed should be taken?
Answer_3: Contact the manufacturer for repair instruction.
Answer_4: Some leakage should be expected and a topping off tube is provided; no other action is necessary.

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is an important consideration to remember when using a combustible gas indicator?
Answer_1: They detect vapor at the sample point only.
Answer_2: They do not work properly in oxygen deficient atmospheres.
Answer_3: Any movement of the needle indicates an unsafe condition specifically related to the toxicity of petroleum vapors present.

Question_Title: If for any reason it is necessary to abandon ship while far at sea, it is important for the crew members to __________.
Answer_1: separate from each other as this will increase the chances  of being rescued
Answer_2: get away from the area because sharks will be attracted to  the vessel
Answer_3: immediately head for the nearest land
Answer_4: remain together in the area because rescuers will start searching at the vessel's last known position

Question_Title: One of the limitations of foam as a fire extinguishing agent is that foam __________.
Answer_1: cannot be made with salt water
Answer_2: is heavier than oil and sinks below it surface
Answer_3: is corrosive and a hazard to fire fighters

Question_Title: A magnesium fire would be classified as a __________.
A good approach to personnel safety is to assume that all tanks and pumprooms are potentially dangerous.  You should  immediately leave an area whenever __________.
Answer_1: you have irritation of the eyes, nose, or throat
Answer_3: you experience an abnormal bodily sensation
Answer_4: any of the above conditions occur

Question_Title: In reviving a person who has been overcome by gas fumes, which of the following treatments would you AVOID using?
Answer_2: Prompt removal of the patient from the suffocating  atmosphere
Answer_3: Determine the need for, and administer CPR if appropriate

Question_Title: What danger to personnel exists when a carbon dioxide fire  extinguisher is discharged in a small enclosed space?
Inflatable liferafts are provided with a __________.

For a ship of 10,000 gross tons, constructed after 30 June  1974, a fixed container, or enclosed deck area, must exist  under or around each fuel oil tank vent.  The container must have a capacity of at least __________.
How is the external flotation bladder of an immersion suit  inflated?
Answer_1: It is inflated by a small CO2 bottle that is automatically  tripped when the front zipper is at the top of zipper track.
Answer_2: It is inflated by a small CO2 bottle that is manually tripped.
Answer_3: It is inflated by blowing through an inflation tube.
Answer_4: It inflates by sea water bleeding into the flotation bladder and reacting with a chemical.

Question_Title: When testing the atmosphere of a compartment with a combustible gas indicator, the operator must remember that  __________.
Answer_1: most petroleum vapors are lighter than air and accumulate around deck longitudinals
Answer_2: the indicator guarantees a safe atmosphere for a maximum of two hours
Answer_3: the meter scale indicates only the upper explosive range
Answer_4: the indicator tests only the atmosphere at the end of the suction tube

Question_Title: Lower level fire main stations in the engine room should undergo regular routine maintenance, including __________.
Answer_1: operating the self-cleaning strainers once a day
Answer_2: flushing out the hydrants with full fire main pressure
Answer_3: repacking valve stems at three month intervals
Answer_4: a weekly replacement of fire hose fittings

Question_Title: To keep injured survivors warm in the water, after  abandoning ship, they should __________.
Answer_1: be placed in the middle of a small circle formed by the other survivors in the water
Answer_2: float on their backs with their arms extended for maximum exposure to the air
Answer_3: remove their lifejackets and hold on to the uninjured survivors
Answer_4: sip water at fifteen minute intervals

Question_Title: According to 33 CFR Part 151, shipboard oil pollution emergency plans must be reviewed __________.
Answer_1: annually by the owner and a letter submitted six months prior to expiration
Answer_2: only once every five years and a letter submitted six months prior to expiration
Answer_3: and the entire plan resubmitted for approval once every five years, six months prior to expiration
Answer_4: annually by the owner and submit a letter to the Coast Guard within one month of the anniversary date of the plan approval

Question_Title: Limit switches on gravity davits should be tested by __________.
Answer_1: the engineers, from a panel in the engine room
Answer_2: shutting off the current to the winch
Answer_3: pushing the switch lever arm while the winch is running

Question_Title: If a person gets battery acid in their eye while filling a battery, they should FIRST wash the eye with __________.
When any fire has been extinguished with carbon dioxide, there is always the danger of the __________.
Answer_1: fire being reignited by residual heat
Answer_3: dry ice crystals clogging the machinery
Answer_4: atmosphere containing a dangerous charge of static  electricity

Question_Title: A safety feature provided on all inflatable liferafts is __________.
Answer_4: the use of water stabilizing pockets

Question_Title: A 1500 gross ton freight vessel, with a keel laid in 1969,  must have a fuel oil discharge containment for the fuel tank vents.  This containment must consist of __________.
Answer_2: portable containers of at least 5 U.S. gallon capacity
Answer_4: a container with a capacity of 3 barrels if it serves one or more vents; each with an inside diameter of 3 inches or more

Question_Title: A burning mattress is considered as which of the following  classes of fire?
The external flotation bladder of an immersion suit should  be inflated __________.
Answer_1: only after two hours in the water
Answer_2: only after four hours in the water

Question_Title: There is always a lower water pressure at the fire hose outlet than is found at the discharge of the pump.  Which of the following reasons is the common cause of this loss in pressure?
Answer_3: Friction in the piping and valves

Question_Title: The use of sinking and dispersing agents for the removal of surface oil is __________.
Answer_1: the most common method used in the United States

Question_Title: When operating gravity davits, __________.
Answer_1: the gripes should be released after the boat is moving
Answer_2: the davits should always be hand cranked the last 12 inches into the final stowed position
Answer_3: the boats are generally lowered by surging the falls around cruciform bits
Answer_4: the tricing pendant should be tripped prior to releasing the gripes

Question_Title: Which of the following can result in an oxygen deficiency in a closed space?
If a person gets something in his eye and you observe that  it is not embedded, you can __________.
Answer_1: get him to rub his eye until the object is gone
Answer_2: remove it with a match or toothpick
Answer_3: remove it with a piece of dry sterilized cotton rag
Answer_4: remove it with a moist cotton-tipped applicator

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft is floating in its container, attached to the ship by its painter, as the ship is sinking rapidly.  Which of the actions listed should be taken with  respect to the liferaft container?
Answer_1: Cut the painter line so it will not pull the liferaft container down.
Answer_2: Swim away from the container so you will not be in danger as it goes down.
Answer_3: Take no action as the pull on the painter will cause the liferaft to inflate and open the container.
Answer_4: Manually open the container and inflate the liferaft with the hand pump.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning an immersion suit and its use?
Answer_1: Only a light layer of clothing may be worn underneath.
Answer_2: They provide sufficient flotation to do away with the necessity of wearing a lifejacket.
Answer_4: A puncture in the suit will not appreciably reduce its value.

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators are used to detect flammable gases or vapors in the atmosphere.  As a safety feature, they are equipped with __________.
Which of the following conditions would be true if a serious leak developed in the main line of a horizontal, looped, fire main system?
Answer_1: It would not be possible to provide water beyond the point  where the break occurred.
Answer_2: The ruptured section could be isolated allowing water to be delivered to all other parts of the system.
Answer_3: The capability of the system would be greatly reduced due to the drop in line pressure but still remain operational through the use of the alternate loop.
Answer_4: Full fire main pressure could be maintained but only on one side of the vessel through the use of either the fore or aft isolation valve.

Question_Title: Records of garbage disposal are required to be maintained __________.
Answer_1: until each quadrennial Coast Guard inspection
Answer_2: until the end of each voyage
Answer_3: for a minimum of one year
Answer_4: for a minimum of two years

Question_Title: When using the hand crank to retrieve and stow a lifeboat on gravity davits, which of the listed precaution should always be observed?
Answer_1: Make certain the hand brake is disengaged.
Answer_2: Put the emergency disconnect switch in the 'off' position.
Answer_3: Make certain the crank is in the locked position.

Question_Title: A tank which has been sealed for a long period of time can  be dangerous because __________.
Answer_1: steel surfaces consume oxygen by rusting
Answer_2: sealed tanks usually form a vacuum
Answer_3: moisture condenses in the tank, displacing the oxygen
Answer_4: most tank coatings give off poisonous vapors in the presence of moisture

Question_Title: For a victim who is coughing and gagging, as a result of a  partial obstruction of the airway by a foreign body, a potential rescuer should __________.
Answer_2: wait for the victim to become unconscious then give four back blows followed by four abdominal thrusts
Answer_3: encourge the victim to continue coughing.  If the victim is unable to expel the object, arrange for prompt transport to an appropriate medical facilty
Answer_4: bend the victim over and give back blows

Question_Title: If you continue to wear extra clothing when entering the water after abandoning your vessel, it will __________.
Answer_4: make it more difficult to breathe

Question_Title: The operating cord on an inflatable liferaft also serves as a __________.
Fires occurring in combustible metals, such as sodium or magnesium, are classified as a __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Immersion suits should be worn during routine work on deck  to provide maximum protection.
Answer_2: After purchasing, the suit should be removed from its storage bag and hung on a hanger where it will be readily accessible.
Answer_3: During the annual maintenance, the front zipper should be lubricated only with manufacturers recommended lubricant
Answer_4: Small leaks or tears may be repaired using the repair kit packed with the suit.

Question_Title: The purpose of the wire stretched between the lifeboat davit heads is to __________.
Answer_1: keep the movement of the davits at the same speed
Answer_2: keep the davits from slipping when they are in the stowed position
Answer_3: prevent vibration during lowering of the boat

Question_Title: A tank has been sealed and unventilated for a long period of time.  Which of the following conditions does this indicate?
Answer_1: The tank is safe to enter.
Answer_2: The tank is especially dangerous to enter.
Answer_4: Water vapor present when the tank was sealed has oxidized.

Question_Title: You are in the mess room when a shipmate suddenly begins to choke, is unable to speak and starts to turn blue.  Which of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Administer abdominal thrust in an effort to clear the airway.
Answer_2: Make the victim lie down with the feet elevated to get blood to the brain.
Answer_4: Do nothing until the victim becomes unconscious.

Question_Title: In which of the circumstances listed would a carbon dioxide fire extinguishing agent be most effective?
The operating cord of the inflatable liferaft has a length  of __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion  suits is correct?
Answer_1: Immersion suits should be worn while performing routine work on deck.
Answer_2: After purchacing, the suit should be stowed in the storage bag in which it was received.
Answer_3: During the annual maintenance, the front zipper should be lubricated using light machine oil or mineral oil.
Answer_4: Any tear or leak will render the suit unserviceable and it  must be replaced.

Question_Title: The most common type of containment device for spilled oil  on the water is the use of __________.
Which of the following signals is used to report for boat stations or boat drill?
Answer_1: More than six short blasts followed by one long blast of the whistle.
Answer_2: A continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less  than 10 seconds.
Answer_3: One long blast followed by three short blasts of the whistle.
Answer_4: Three short blasts of the whistle.

Question_Title: If someone suffers a heart attack and has ceased breathing, you should __________.
Answer_1: immediately give a stimulant, by force if necessary
Answer_2: make the victim comfortable in a bunk

Question_Title: Which of the following health hazards found on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) is a reproductive hazard?
After a liferaft is launched, the operating cord __________.
Answer_3: is used to rig the boarding ladder
Answer_4: is cut immediately as it is of no further use

Question_Title: When using a handheld smoke signal in a liferaft, you should __________.
Answer_1: activate the signal on the downwind side
Answer_2: activate the signal on the upwind side
Answer_3: activate the signal inside the boat
Answer_4: activate the signal at the stern

Question_Title: An example of class "A" fire is a/an __________.
Answer_1: electrical fire in the engine room
Answer_2: oil fire in the engine room bilges
Answer_3: oil fire involving a grade "A" petroleum product

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators detect flammable gases, or vapors present in the atmosphere by an intricate system which includes __________.
How may a cargo tank atmosphere be tested for explosive gases?
Answer_1: Use the open flame test on a small sample that has been taken from the tank.
Answer_2: Send a gas sample ashore for laboratory analysis.
Answer_3: Enter the tank with a teledyne oxygen analyzer.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Suits are not required to automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to the wearer while swimming through burning oil.
Answer_4: The suits provide for limited body movement such as walking, climbing a ladder, and picking up small objects like a pencil.

Question_Title: Pressure within a firemain system will vary from point to point due to __________.
Answer_3: friction in the piping and valves

Question_Title: While at your lifeboat station, you hear a signal consisting of one short blast of the whistle.  This indicates __________.
A person suffering from a heart attack may show which of the following symptoms?
Before you initiate the engine room fixed CO2 system to extinguish a serious fire, you would __________.
After having thrown the liferaft and stowage container into the water, the liferaft is inflated by __________.
Answer_2: forcing open the container which operates the CO2

Question_Title: The temperature at which a liquid, as listed on a Material  Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), will change to a gas is called its __________.
The lowest temperature at which a liquid, listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), gives off enough vapor to ingnite in the presence of an ignition source is called its __________.
Combustible gas indicators are used to detect flammable gases, or vapors present in a tank.  This is accomplished by an intricate instrument incorporating a/an __________.
While fighting a fire, in order to utilize two hoses from a single 'wye' gate attached to a hydrant outlet, you need only turn the valve handle __________.
Answer_1: at the base of the "Y" in either direction
Answer_2: at the base of the "Y" counterclockwise 180

Question_Title: A vessel having a concentration of weight toward the top of the vessel is said to be __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Not all models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit will still be serviceable after a brief (2 seconds) exposure to flame and burning.
Answer_4: The wearer of the suit is no way restricted in body movement and the suit may be donned well in advance of abandoning ship.

Question_Title: Persons who have swallowed a non-petroleum based poison are given large quantities of warm, soapy water or warm salt water to __________.
Answer_2: absorb the poison from the blood
Answer_3: neutralize the poison in the blood
Answer_4: increase the digestive process and eliminate the poison

Question_Title: Why is it necessary to warn engine room personnel before activating the fixed CO2 system?
Answer_1: To make them aware there is a fire.
Answer_2: To let them know they should leave the engine room.
Answer_3: To prevent possible injury from frostbite.
Answer_4: To make them aware that ventilation will automatically stop.

Question_Title: Hydrogen sulfide gives crude oil the sour odor of rotten eggs.  A hazard to personnel regarding hydrogen sulfide  is __________.
An inflatable liferaft can be launched by __________.
Answer_3: throwing the entire container overboard, then pulling on the operating cord to inflate the raft

Question_Title: The signal given to commence lowering the lifeboats is __________.
Answer_1: 3 short blasts of the ship's whistle
Answer_2: 1 short blast of the ship's whistle
Answer_3: 3 long blasts of the ship's whistle
Answer_4: 1 long blast of the ship's whistle

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators incorporate the use of a/an __________.
In cleaning up an oil spill, the use of chemical agents would __________.
Answer_1: absorb the oil for easy removal
Answer_2: remove the oil from the water
Answer_3: disperse or dissolve the oil in the water

Question_Title: If fuel is burned from only the starboard tanks, the ship will __________.
Puncture leaks in the lower tubes, or bottom of an  inflatable liferaft should first be stopped by using __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Not all models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit reduces the rate of body cooling and greatly increases the survival time in cold water.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to a wearer  swimming in burning oil.
Answer_4: The suit provides a full range of body movement and is suitable for routine wear on deck.

Question_Title: To reduce mild fever the MOST useful drug is __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning carbon dioxide when used as a fire extinguishing agent?
Answer_1: Carbon dioxide is corrosive when exposed to fire.
Answer_2: Carbon dioxide should be applied slowly to a large engine room fire.
Answer_3: Its total cooling effect is far greater than water.
Answer_4: Its smothering effect is excellent for class B fires.

Question_Title: Hydrogen sulfide is the constituent giving sour crude oil the characteristic odor of rotten eggs.  One of the hazards associated with hydrogen sulfide is __________.
Answer_3: its high toxicity resulting in death
Answer_4: dependency addiction to the highly toxic fumes

Question_Title: A raft should be manually released from its cradle by __________.
Answer_1: cutting the straps that enclose the container
Answer_2: removing the rubber sealing strip from the container
Answer_3: loosening the turnbuckle on the securing strap
Answer_4: pushing the button on the hydrostatic release

Question_Title: A fire in a pile of canvas would be classified as a __________.
When taking samples of a tank atmosphere with an explosimeter, you should __________.
Answer_1: only sample around the deck longitudinals as gases are lighter than air
Answer_2: sample only near the ullage openings as all vapors  accumulate there
Answer_3: avoid sampling in the vicinity of deep webs to prevent false readings
Answer_4: sample as much of the tank as possible, especially at the bottom

Question_Title: When whistle signals are used as commands for launching the lifeboats, one short blast means __________.
Answer_4: drill is over, secure all boats

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: All models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to the wearer while swimming through burning oil.
Answer_4: The wearer of the suit is not severely restricted in body movement and permits the wearer to perform any form of strenuous work.

Question_Title: The atmosphere of an empty fuel tank is tested and  designated "gas free".  Which of the following statements is correct concerning this tank?
Answer_1: The concentration of flammable gas in the compartment is less than 10% of the lower flammable limit.
Answer_2: The tank should be frequently retested.
Answer_3: The gas free status is good as long as the initial  conditions remain unchanged.

Question_Title: Which of the following best defines First Aid?
Answer_2: Setting of broken bones and transport of victim
Answer_3: Emergency treatment of the injury at the scene.
Answer_4: Dosage of medications and application of bandages

Question_Title: Which of the following terms is the minimum temperature at  which a liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), gives off sufficient vapor concentration to ignite  in the presence of an ignition source?
In cleaning up an oil spill, the use of straw or reclaimed  paper fibers would be an example of which type of oil removal?
The most important thing to remember when launching an inflatable liferaft by hand is to __________.
Answer_3: ensure that the operating cord is secured to the vessel
Answer_4: inflate the raft on the vessel, then lower it over the side

Question_Title: A fire in a pile of dunnage would be classified as a __________.
To detect the presence of explosive gases in any space, tank, or compartment, you should use a __________.
While at your lifeboat station, a signal consisting of two  short blasts of the ship's whistle is sounded.  This indicates  __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is FALSE?
Answer_1: They should be worn while working on deck if the possibility exists of being washed overboard.
Answer_2: The suit is received from the manufacturer in a bag intended to be used for storage of the suit onboard ship.
Answer_3: During the annual inspection and maintenance, the zipper should be lubricated according to manufacturers recommendations.
Answer_4: A small leak of water into the suit will destroy the protective qualities against hypothermia.

Question_Title: What information can be obtained from a marine chemist's certificate on a tank barge?
Answer_1: The number of fire extinguishers required onboard.
Answer_2: The quality of the barge's cargo.
Answer_3: The tanks which are safe to enter when the certificate was  issued.

Question_Title: Symptoms of sugar diabetes include __________.
The fire extinguishing action of CO2 is derived mostly from __________.
Answer_1: a blanket of bubbles formed on the surface of the fire
Answer_4: isolating the heat from the fuel

Question_Title: Which type of fire extinguisher is most prone to the freezing when exposed to low temperatures?
To launch a liferaft by hand, you should __________.
Answer_1: cut the casing bands, throw the liferaft over the side and  it will then inflate
Answer_2: detach the operating cord, throw the raft over the side and it will then inflate
Answer_3: cut the casing bands, throw the raft over the side and pull the operating cord
Answer_4: throw the liferaft over the side and pull the operating cord

Question_Title: A fire involving trash and paper waste would be classified  as a __________.
Hydrocarbon vapors are usually detected by the use of the __________.
While reading the Muster List ("Station Bill"), you find 'three (3) short blasts on the whistle and three (3) short rings on the general alarm bells,' this signal is for __________.
Answer_2: dismissal from fire and emergency stations

Question_Title: What statement about immersion suits is FALSE?
Answer_1: The suit should be worn only when abandoning ship.
Answer_2: The suit is received from the manufacturer in an outer storage bag that should be used aboard ship for storing the suit.
Answer_3: The front zipper should be lubricated according to  manufacturer's specifications.
Answer_4: Immersion suits provide protection against hypothermia even if there is a small leak or tear.

Question_Title: A category of health hazard, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) which includes teratogens and mutagens, is called a __________.
A liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), having a flash point below 100F (37.78C) is called a/an __________.
If a diabetic suffers an insulin reaction and is conscious, he should be given __________.
Answer_2: orange juice or a candy bar

Question_Title: A liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS)  having a flash point at or above 100F is called a/an __________.
If an emergency pump control is used as the emergency shutdown on a tank vessel, it must stop the flow of oil through __________.
Answer_4: a means that is not dependant on electrical power

Question_Title: An ullage reading is the distance from a given point at the __________.
Answer_1: sounding tube to either side of the tank
Answer_2: top of the tank down to the bottom of the tank
Answer_3: top of the liquid down to the tank bottom
Answer_4: top of the sounding tube down to the surface of the liquid

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft is hand-launched by __________.
An instrument used to detect explosive gas/air mixtures, usually measures the concentration in terms of the lower explosive limit, and is known as a __________.
A person manning a fire hose under pressure with an all-purpose nozzle attached, should be aware that the nozzle is most difficult to control when the handle position is changed from __________.
Answer_3: low velocity to high velocity fog

Question_Title: When should distress flares and rockets be used?
Answer_1: Only when there is a chance of them being sighted by rescue vessels.
Answer_2: They should be set off at half-hour intervals.
Answer_3: They should be set off at one-hour intervals.

Question_Title: Physical data on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) which  describes chemicals that produce health effects requiring medical attention where damage may be permanent but is neither life-threatening nor seriously disabling, is called __________.
Emergency signals for use on a river passenger vessel are to be conspicuously posted and listed on the __________.
If a person with diabetes has been injured, the symptoms of the onset of a diabetic coma would include __________.
Answer_4: slurred speech and loss of coordination

Question_Title: The most effective method in the use of a CO2 fire  extinguisher is for the discharge to be directed at the __________.
Answer_2: top and sides of a fire
Answer_3: base or nearest edge of a fire

Question_Title: Which of the following items is NOT required to be contained in the vessel's oil transfer procedures?
Answer_1: A line diagram of the vessel's oil transfer piping.
Answer_2: The number of persons on duty during oil transfer operations.
Answer_3: Any special procedures for topping off tanks.
Answer_4: The location and capacity of all fuel and cargo tanks on the vessel.

Question_Title: If a raft is to be released manually, where should the operating cord be attached before throwing the raft overboard?
Answer_1: Do not attach the cord to anything but throw it overboard with the raft container.
Answer_2: To some fixed object on the ship.

Question_Title: In each inflatable raft, what piece of equipment is provided to make quick, emergency, temporary repairs to a cut, or rip in a raft?
An applications for a waiver of any requirements of the regulations for oil transfer operations must be submitted __________.
Firehose can be used for purposes other than firefighting service when __________.
The three positions of an all-purpose fire nozzle are __________.
Answer_1: forward: off, center: fog, back: solid stream
Answer_2: forward: solid stream, center: fog, back: off
Answer_3: forward: fog, center: solid stream, back: off
Answer_4: forward: off, center: solid stream, back: fog

Question_Title: A tankship has 40 gallons of 6% foam concentrate aboard. Approximately how much foam solution can be produced from this supply?
Why should you wear a self-contained breathing apparatus before entering a closed compartment to fight a fire?
Answer_1: The fire produces carbon monoxide which causes an oxygen deficiency in the brain and body, leading quickly to death.
Answer_2: The fire produces smoke, which contains toxic gases that cause breathing difficulties and irritation of the  respiratory tract.
Answer_3: The fire consumes oxygen which may lead to asphyxiation.

Question_Title: The relief valve on a fire pump is set at 25 psi (1.75 kPA) above the pressure necessary to maintain the required fire  hose streams, or __________.
No person may serve as the person-in-charge of oil transfer operations on more than one vessel at a time __________.
Answer_2: unless authorized by the Captain of the Port
Answer_3: unless radio communication is set up between the vessels
Answer_4: unless the vessels are moored clear of all docks

Question_Title: A solid stream of water is produced by an all-purpose firefighting nozzle when the handle is __________.
The tendency of a ship to resist a change in trim is __________.
You are wearing a self-contained breathing apparatus while  fighting a fire in an enclosed space.  If sudden strong resistance to breathing is experienced, your first action should be to __________.
Answer_1: tug twice on your lifeline and slow your breathing until help arrives
Answer_3: take a deep breath and remove your apparatus for adjustment
Answer_4: give two or three strong exhalations to increase the flow through the apparatus

Question_Title: A vessel sailing through the specific special areas may discharge or dispose of __________.
Answer_2: fairly dense material that will sink, i.e. metal cans or glass bottles at anytime
Answer_3: victual waste when at least 12 nautical miles from shore

Question_Title: Where there are multiple accident victims, which injuries should be the FIRST to receive emergency treatment?
Answer_3: Back injuries with spinal cord damage

Question_Title: When launching an inflatable liferaft, you should make sure that the operating cord is __________.
Answer_1: fastened to some substantial part of the vessel

Question_Title: No person may serve as the person-in-charge of both the vessel and the facility during oil transfer operation unless __________.
Answer_1: there is ready access between the two
Answer_2: the vessel and facility are immediately adjacent
Answer_3: the person in charge has a rapid means of transportation between the two
Answer_4: the Captain of the Port authorizes such procedure

Question_Title: How does an inert gas system on a tanker function to prevent explosions in cargo tanks?
Answer_2: Maintains a positive pressure on the vent header to cool the flammable vapors.
Answer_3: Inert gas filters out the flammable vapors from the cargo tank spaces.
Answer_4: Inert gas dilutes the flammable vapor and air concentrations to keep them below the lower explosive limit.

Question_Title: The addition of weight at the longitudinal center of flotation will __________.
Answer_1: increase the forward draft and decrease the after draft
Answer_2: decrease the forward draft and increase the after draft
Answer_3: have no effect on the trim
Answer_4: have no effect on the stability

Question_Title: When you are wearing a self-contained breathing apparatus, you should immediately return to fresh air if you feel __________.
Answer_1: heat in the canister or hose
Answer_2: excess air flow in the mask
Answer_3: two pulls on the safety line
Answer_4: nauseous, dizziness or high breathing resistance

Question_Title: Where there are multiple accident victims, which type of injury should be the first to receive emergency treatment?
The purpose of the four water pockets, located on the underside at each corner of the raft, is to __________.
Answer_1: stow rainwater; these four spaces will not take up valuable space
Answer_2: act as stabilizers by filling with sea water as soon as raft is inflated and in an upright position
Answer_3: hold the freshwater required by regulation to be provided in the raft when packed

Question_Title: The process that occurs when heat is generated by a chemical reaction within a substance and continues to a point of ignition is known as __________.
An inert gas system on a tanker should be used to __________.
Answer_1: prevent the generation of flammable or combustible gas in tanks
Answer_2: blow out cargo lines to prevent gas concentrations
Answer_3: dilute tank atmospheres to keep gas concentrations  below the lower explosive limit
Answer_4: prevent fires in the pumproom by continually displacing flammable vapors

Question_Title: The low velocity fog applicator used in conjunction with the all-purpose firefighting nozzle, should always be __________.
Answer_1: stored in the rack when not in actual use
Answer_2: attached to the nozzle by the chain
Answer_3: coated with heavy grease to prevent corrosion
Answer_4: left in place in the all-purpose nozzle

Question_Title: What should you do when the alarm bell on a self-contained  breathing apparatus sounds?
Answer_2: Open the bypass valve on the regulator and immediately evacuate the contaminated area.
Answer_3: Move the reserve lever to the 'reserve' position on the regulator and reset the alarm so you can evacuate the area  when it sounds again.
Answer_4: Move the tank selector lever to the full tank position and  reset the alarm so you can evacuate the area when it sounds again.

Question_Title: To serve as the person in charge of oil cargo transfer operations onboard a self-propelled tank vessel, an individual must __________.
Answer_4: have a letter from the company stating his qualification

Question_Title: In managing a situation involving multiple injuries, the rescuer must be able to __________.
Answer_2: rapidly evaluate the seriousness of obvious injuries
Answer_3: accurately diagnose the ailment or injury

Question_Title: When an oil fire has been extinguished, the surface of the  oil should be kept covered with foam to prevent __________.
Answer_1: air from contacting the oil vapors permitting reignition
Answer_3: spontaneous combustion below the oil surface
Answer_4: toxic fumes from escaping to the surface

Question_Title: For a fixed CO2 fire fighting system, if the maximum quantity of carbon dioxide required to be maintained aboard the  vessel is 2450 pounds,  the minimum nominal pipe size of the fixed system branch lines to the various spaces must be __________.
Water pockets on the under side of an inflatable liferaft are for __________.
Through which of the listed processes is heat produced in spontaneous ignition?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding the  fog applicators used in conjunction with the combination nozzle?
Answer_1: All cargo and miscellaneous vessels must be equipped with high velocity fog applicators for use with the required combination nozzle at each station.
Answer_2: In machinery spaces, the applicators should be 10 to 12 feet in length to insure all portions of the bilge can be effectively reached.
Answer_3: On container ships, an applicator termed a bayonet or piercing type utilizes a sharp tip for cutting and  penetrating the metal skin of a container.

Question_Title: While wearing a self-contained breathing apparatus, the user must be aware of the bulkiness of the unit in order to avoid confined spaces.  Of what other limitations should the user be aware?
Answer_1: The weight of the unit changes the user's center of gravity.
Answer_2: The lens of the facepiece reduces the user's peripheral vision.
Answer_3: The attached lifeline limits the user's mobility.

Question_Title: According to 33 CFR Part 156, each pressure gage used in an oil transfer operation must be accurate to within __________.
After an injury, which of the following can be determined by examining the condition of a victim's pupils?
Answer_1: The degree of pain being suffered.
Answer_3: Whether or not the brain is functioning properly.
Answer_4: Whether or not the victim's blood pressure is normal.

Question_Title: When fighting an oil or gasoline fire, which of the listed  fire extinguishing agents should NEVER be sprayed directly  into the fire?
In the event of a fire, the doors to a stairtower must be closed to prevent the spread of fire by____________.
What is placed on the under side of an inflatable liferaft  to help prevent it from being skidded by the wind or overturned?
Hazardous conditions exist which may result in spontaneous  combustion when __________.
Answer_1: oil soaked rags are stowed in the machine shop

Question_Title: A person suffering from possible broken bones and internal injuries should __________.
Answer_1: be examined then walked to a bunk
Answer_3: not be allowed to lie down where injured but moved to a chair or bunk
Answer_4: not be moved but made comfortable until medical assistance arrives

Question_Title: What is the primary purpose of a splint applied in first aid?
Bleeding from a vein may be ordinarily controlled by __________.
Answer_2: applying direct pressure to the wound
Answer_4: pouring ice water directly into the wound

Question_Title: A wiper has a small, gaping laceration of the arm that is not bleeding excessively.  What can be done as an alternative to suturing to close the wound?
Answer_2: Use temporary stitches of sail twin.
Answer_3: Wrap a tight bandage around the wound.
Answer_4: Apply butterfly strips, then a sterile dressing.

Question_Title: During oil transfer operations, who would be responsible to guarantee that the posted transfer procedures are being followed?
If it is necessary to remove a victim from a life threatening situation, the person giving first aid must __________.
Answer_1: pull the victim by the feet
Answer_2: avoid subjecting the victim to any unnecessary disturbance  during movement
Answer_3: not move the victim to a another location until all injuries have been assessed
Answer_4: place the victim on a stretcher before attempting removal

Question_Title: The longer an oil fire is permitted to burn, the __________.
Answer_3: less chance there is of reignition

Question_Title: You have abandoned ship and are in charge of a liferaft.  How much water per day should you permit each occupant to drink after the first 24 hours?
On most makes of inflatable liferafts, the batteries to operate the light on the inside of the rafts can be made to last longer by __________.
Answer_1: unscrewing the bulb during the daylight
Answer_2: operating the switch for the light
Answer_3: taking no action as there is no way of preserving power
Answer_4: taking no action as they shut off automatically in daylight

Question_Title: Fires resulting from spontaneous combustion are usually caused by the improper disposal of __________.
Changing rescuers while carrying out artificial respiration should be done __________.
Answer_2: by not stopping the respiration for more than five minutes
Answer_3: only with the help of two other people
Answer_4: without losing the rhythm of respiration

Question_Title: You are attempting to administer CPR to a victim.  When you blow into his mouth it is apparent that no air is getting into the lungs.  What should you do?
Answer_1: Raise the victim's head higher than his feet.
Answer_2: Blow harder to force the air past the tongue.
Answer_3: Re-tip the head and try again.
Answer_4: Press on the victim's lungs so that air pressure will blow out any obstruction.

Question_Title: To safely enter a closed compartment, where CO2 has been released from a fixed extinguishing system, you should __________.
Answer_1: test the air with an Orsat apparatus
Answer_3: wear a canister type gas mask
Answer_4: test the air with an explosimeter

Question_Title: A person on a fixed, or floating platform engaged in oil exploration, located 10 nautical miles from nearest land MAY discharge __________.
First aid treatment for small cuts and open wounds is to __________.
Answer_1: stop the bleeding, clean, medicate, and cover the wound
Answer_2: lay the patient down and cover the wound when the bleeding stops
Answer_3: apply an ice pack to the wound and cover it when the bleeding stops
Answer_4: apply a hot towel to purge the wound, then medicate and cover it

Question_Title: Immediately after a class "B" fire has been extinguished by the use of foam, crewmen should __________.
Answer_1: carefully apply a low velocity fog over the foam blanket
Answer_2: wade through the foam blanket to evenly distribute the foam
Answer_3: be careful not to disturb the foam blanket
Answer_4: sweep the foam blanket overboard and secure firefighting equipment

Question_Title: In all but the most severe cases, bleeding from a wound should be controlled by __________.
Answer_3: submerging the wound in lukewarm water
Answer_4: applying direct pressure to the wound

Question_Title: The air spaces in the floor of an inflatable raft will provide protection against __________.
Answer_3: tears in the outside skin of bottom of the raft

Question_Title: Spontaneous combustion can result from __________.
Answer_1: water dripping on a running electric motor
Answer_2: oil soaked rags stored in a closed compartment
Answer_3: smoking in a battery room or near a battery storage locker
Answer_4: an open flame near a fuel tank vent

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed would be safe to use in a compartment with insufficient oxygen?
Which of the following statements is true concerning a low  velocity fog tip?
Answer_1: It is usually kept in the nozzle when stowed.
Answer_3: It is chained to the combination nozzle.

Question_Title: A person has suffered a larceration of the arm.  Severe bleeding has been controlled by using a sterile dressing and direct pressure.  What should you do next?
Answer_1: Apply a torniqiuet to prevent the bleeding from restarting.
Answer_2: Apply a pressure bandage over the dressing.
Answer_3: Remove any small foreign matter and apply antiseptic
Answer_4: Administer fluids to assist the body in replacing the lost blood.

Question_Title: No person may discharge garbage from a vessel located near a fixed or floating platform engaged in oil exploration at a  distance of less than __________.
Which of the following methods is a convenient and effective system of examining the body of an injury victim?
Answer_1: Compare the corresponding parts of the body.
Answer_2: Watch the patient's eyes as you probe parts of the body.
Answer_3: Look for discoloration of the patient's skin.
Answer_4: Look for uncontrolled vibration or twitching of parts of the body.

Question_Title: Which of the fire extinguishing agents listed is the most effectively used for putting out a paint locker fire?
Antiseptics are used principally to __________.
The air spaces in the floor of an inflatable liferaft will  provide protection against __________.
Answer_2: loss of air in the sides of the raft

Question_Title: Spontaneous combustion can occur in __________.
Answer_1: paint thinner in an open can
Answer_3: oily rags stored in an unvented compartment

Question_Title: The rescuer can best provide an airtight seal during mouth-to-mouth resuscitation by pinching the victim's nostrils and __________.
Answer_1: cupping a hand around the patient's mouth
Answer_3: applying his mouth tightly over the victim's mouth

Question_Title: Why should you wear a self-contained breathing apparatus before entering the engine room after the fixed CO2 system  has been discharged to combat a major fire?
Answer_1: Because carbon dioxide dilutes the oxygen concentration in  the atmosphere and may cause asphyxiation.
Answer_2: Because carbon dioxide breaks down in a fire into carbon monoxide which may cause blood poisoning in the person breathing this gas.
Answer_3: Because carbon dioxide is a colorless and odorless gas that becomes highly toxic in the presence of high temperatures and will quickly incapacitate a person exposed to this gas.
Answer_4: This action is unnecessary as carbon dioxide is not poisonous nor toxic but is a relatively harmless gas.

Question_Title: A person on a fixed or floating platform engaged in oil exploration MAY discharge food waste into the sea when the  distance from the nearest land is at least __________.

Answer_2: how to diagnose an illness from symptoms

Question_Title: Which of the listed fire extinguishing agents would be incorrect for the direct use on a gasoline or oil fire?

Answer_1: lashings on the floor of the raft for the passenger's feet
Answer_3: safety straps on the inside of the raft
Answer_4: ridges in the floor of the raft

Question_Title: In which of the areas listed is a fire resulting from spontaneous combustion most likely to occur?

Answer_1: tighten the high velocity fog tip
Answer_2: put the control handle in the solid steam position
Answer_3: put the control handle in the fog position
Answer_4: remove the high velocity fog tip

Question_Title: A squeeze-grip type carbon dioxide portable fire extinguisher has been partially discharged.  It should be __________.
Answer_1: replaced in its proper location regardless of weight
Answer_2: replaced in its proper location if weight loss is no more than 15%
Answer_3: labeled empty and recharged as soon as possible
Answer_4: replaced in its proper location if weight loss is no more than 25%

Question_Title: Which statement is FALSE regarding Halon as a fire extinguising agent?
Answer_1: It is more effective than CO2.

Question_Title: Which of the circumstances listed is an exception to the garbage discharge requirements in Annex V to MARPOL 73/78?
Answer_1: The garbage to be discharged will sink.
Answer_2: Garbage accumulation onboard has exceeded storage space.
Answer_3: A person falls overboard, and a plastic ice chest is thrown for flotation.
Answer_4: The destination port or terminal cannot receive garbage.

Question_Title: If a victim is unconscious, you should first look for evidence of __________.

An example of a combustible liquid is __________.
The canopy of your liferaft should __________.
Answer_1: go into place as the raft is inflated
Answer_2: be put up after everyone is aboard
Answer_3: be put up only in severe weather
Answer_4: be used as a sail if the wind is blowing

Question_Title: The most likely place for a fire to start through the process of spontaneous combustion is in __________.
When welding or burning aboard a vessel, you must be certain that the space __________.
Answer_3: has no oil or flamable material in the area

Question_Title: To prepare a low velocity fog applicator for use, __________.
Answer_1: replace the high velocity tip with the fog applicator and pull the handle to the middle position
Answer_2: insert the applicator in the solid stream outlet of the all-purpose nozzle and pull the handle back half way
Answer_3: replace the high velocity tip with the applicator and pull  the handle back all the way back
Answer_4: insert the applicator in the solid stream outlet of the all-purpose nozzle and pull the handle back to the solid stream position

Question_Title: Which statement is TRUE regarding Halon as a fire extinguising agent?
Answer_1: It is more effective than CO2.

Question_Title: To prevent the spread of fire by convection you should __________.
Answer_2: cool the bulkhead around the fire
Answer_3: close all openings to the area

Question_Title: The term "discharge", as it applies to the pollution regulations, means __________.

Answer_1: at the seat of the fire, starting near the edge
Answer_2: over the top of the fire
Answer_3: at the main body of the fire
Answer_4: to bank off a bulkhead onto the fire

Question_Title: If a small fire initially breaks out in the engine room bilges, in which of the following sequences should the fire extinguishing agents or systems be used?
Answer_1: Fixed CO2, semi-portable CO2, then hand portable CO2.
Answer_2: Semi-portable CO2, fixed CO2, then hand portable CO2.
Answer_3: Hand portable, semi-portable CO2, then as a last resort the fixed CO2 system.
Answer_4: Hand portable, fixed CO2, then as a last resort the semi-portable CO2.

Question_Title: The vapors given off by heated fuel oil are flammable, explosive, and __________.
Generally, which of the following gases is used to inflate  liferafts?
The chief source of spontaneous combustion aboard tankers is __________.
Fire prevention during welding or burning aboard any vessel should include __________.
Answer_1: posting a fire watch in the immediate area
Answer_2: providing an extinguisher which is ready for immediate use
Answer_3: requiring the fire watch to remain on post for 30 minutes after the completion of welding or burning

Question_Title: Which extinguising agent is most likely to allow reflash as a result of not cooling the fuel below its ignition temperature?

You are about to enter a compartment to investigate a suspected smoldering fire. If you're not wearing an self-contained breathing apparatus, you should test the compartment's atmosphere to determine if there is/are __________.
Answer_1: sufficient oxygen to sustain human life
Answer_2: an explosive mixture in the compartment
Answer_3: a toxic atmosphere in the compartment

Question_Title: If it becomes necessary to pump bilges while a vessel is in port, which of the following procedures should be followed?
Answer_1: Pump only if the discharge is led to a shore tank or barge.
Answer_2: Pump only during the hours of darkness.
Answer_3: Pump only on the outgoing tide.
Answer_4: Pump only as much as is necessary.

Question_Title: When fighting a fire in an enclosed space, the hose team should crouch as low as possible to __________.
Answer_3: allow the heat and steam to pass overhead

Question_Title: You have just extinguished an oil fire on the floor plates  of the engine room with a 15 pound CO2 extinguisher.  Which of the listed dangers should you now be preparing to handle?
Answer_2: Sudden stoppage of the main engine.
Answer_3: Complete lack of oxygen in the engine room.
Answer_4: Chemical reaction of the CO2 and oil forming carbonic acid.

Question_Title: The vapors given off by heated fuel oil are heavier than air and are __________.
Liferafts are less maneuverable than lifeboats due to their __________.
All of the following are part of the fire triangle EXCEPT __________.

Answer_1: Opening switches in the space to de-energize circuits.
Answer_2: Closing switches adjacent to the space to operate vent fans.
Answer_3: Leaving electrical circuits energized in the space.
Answer_4: Securing all power to the space from a remote location.

Question_Title: A low velocity fog applicator is retained in an all-purpose nozzle by a bayonet joint.  The applicator is prevented from rotating in the joint by __________.
In order to discharge a CO2 portable fire extinguisher, the operator must FIRST __________.
Answer_4: squeeze the two trigger handles together

Question_Title: A person reports to you with a fishook in his thumb.  To remove it you should __________.
Answer_3: cut the skin from around the hook
Answer_4: push the barb through, cut it off, then remove the hook

Question_Title: The minimum bursting pressure for each cargo hose assembly  must be at least __________.
A tourniquet should be used to control bleeding ONLY __________.
Answer_3: when all other means have failed
Answer_4: to prevent bleeding from minor wounds

Question_Title: The best way to combat an engine room bilge fire is through the use of a __________.
Answer_1: dry chemical extinguisher and solid stream water
Answer_2: foam extinguisher and low velocity water fog
Answer_3: foam extinguisher and solid stream water

Question_Title: Diesel fuel vapors __________.
Answer_1: can not be ignited by a spark unless the vapor is in a confined space
Answer_3: can not be ignited by a spark unless they are at their autoignition temperature

Question_Title: You have abandoned ship and are in an inflatable raft that  has just inflated.  You hear a continuous hissing coming from a fitting in a buoyancy tube.  Which of the following  statements identifies the cause of this situation?
Answer_1: The saltwater is activating the batteries of the marker lights on the canopy.

Answer_3: A deflation plug is partially open allowing the escape of CO2.
Answer_4: Excess inflation pressure is bleeding off and should soon stop.

Question_Title: Which of the following procedures reduces the possibility of an interior ventilation duct fire from rapidly spreading?
Answer_1: Having a portable CO2 ready at each duct opening.
Answer_3: Having a fire hose charged at each duct opening.

Question_Title: The date of each fire and boat drill conducted on a MODU must be recorded __________.
To produce a low velocity water fog spray with an all-purpose fire hose nozzle, you must __________.
Answer_1: push the nozzle handle completely forward
Answer_2: change the fire pump discharge pressure
Answer_3: pull the nozzle handle completely back

Question_Title: You are administering chest compressions during CPR.  Where on the victim's body should the pressure be applied?

Answer_1: They can not be ignited by a spark unless the vapors are in a confined space.

Question_Title: Which of the practices listed should be avoided since it represents a fire hazard?
Answer_3: Stowing oily rags in a paint locker

Question_Title: When administering mouth to mouth resucitation to an adult, you should breathe at the rate of how many breaths per minute?

Answer_1: having the proper equipment for the process

Question_Title: Most totally enclosed lifeboats are equipped with which of the following?
Answer_2: Tanks for the storage of drinking water

Question_Title: The lifeline which is part of a fireman's outfit must be __________.

Question_Title: A hand portable CO2 fire extinguisher is effective on burning oil only __________.

Question_Title: When taking on fuel it is important to remember that petroleum vapors are __________.

Answer_2: store paint cans on metal shelves only

Question_Title: You are at sea in an inflatable liferaft.  In high latitutes, the greatest danger is __________.
Answer_1: collapse of the raft due to cold temperatures

Question_Title: The only portable electrical equipment permitted in a compartment which is not gas free is a lamp that is __________.

Answer_1: Immediately after the fire is extinguished.

Answer_1: each raft should go in a different direction in search of land
Answer_2: the possibility of a search aircraft finding you is increased by spreading out
Answer_3: reduce the number of rafts by getting as many people as possible into as few rafts as possible

Answer_3: Sudden stoppage of the main engine.

Question_Title: A crewmember has a small, gaping laceration of the arm that is not bleeding excessively.  What can be done as an alternative to suturing to close the wound?
Answer_2: Use temporary stitches of sail twin.
Answer_3: Wrap a tight bandage around the wound.
Answer_4: Apply butterfly strips, then a sterile dressing.

Question_Title: Petroleum vapors are heavier than air and __________.

Answer_4: are of no concern if the wind is blowing

Question_Title: When a ship is abandoned and there are several liferafts in the water, one of the FIRST things to be done is __________.
Answer_1: separate the rafts as much as possible to increase chances  of detection
Answer_2: transfer all supplies to one raft

Question_Title: An extinguishing agent which effectively cools, dilutes combustible vapors,removes oxygen, and provides a heat and smoke screen is __________.

Question_Title: A conscious victim who has suffered a blow to the head has symtoms that indicate the possibilty of concussion.  If the patient feels no indication of neck or spine injury, recommended treatment would include __________.

Answer_3: A continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less  than 10 seconds, supplemented by the continuous ringing of  the general alarm bells for not less than 10 seconds.
