Question_Title: Which of the listed fire extinguishers would be most effective to use on a fire in a small electric motor?
A liquid having a flash point above 80F, but below 150F,  would be termed a grade __________.
Progressive flooding in the engine room may be minimized by securing watertight boundaries and __________.
What must be accurately determined to assess the potential  for progressive flooding after your vessel has been damaged?
Answer_1: The integrity of the watertight boundaries.
Answer_2: The capacity of the water sprinkler system.
Answer_3: The operation of the machinery space bilge level alarms.

Question_Title: For a victim who is coughing and gagging, as a result of a  partial obstruction of the airway by a foreign body, a potential rescuer should __________.
Answer_1: encourage the victim to continue coughing.  If the victim is unable to expel the object, arrange for prompt transport to an appropriate medical facility
Answer_2: wait for the victim to become unconscious then give four back blows followed by four abdominal thrusts
Answer_3: lay them down in a comfortable position
Answer_4: bend the victim over and give back blows

Question_Title: When a rescuer discovers a burn victim in the vicinity of electrical equipment or wiring, his first step is to __________.
Answer_1: remove the person from the vicinty of the electrical equipment or wiring
Answer_2: shutdown electrical power in the area
Answer_3: flush water over any burned area of the victim
Answer_4: apply ointemnt to the burned area of the victim

Question_Title: You have found a person laying prone and not breathing.  An electric wire is touching the victim.  Which of the actions listed is the FIRST thing you should do?
Answer_3: Shut off power or remove the wire from the victim.
Answer_4: Leave the accident scene and summon medical assistance.

Question_Title: You are making a round of the engine room and approaching the motor driven cargo pumps and discover a person laying at the foot of the ladder.  What action should be taken?
Answer_1: Immediatly enter the area to see if the person is conscious.
Answer_2: Leave the scene and continue on your watch rounds.
Answer_3: Promptly notify the deck watch officer.
Answer_4: Send the QMED to the area and have him determine if the person appears conscious.

Question_Title: A continuous sounding of the vessel's whistle, supplemented by a continuous ringing of the general alarm bells for a period of not less than 10 seconds, is the signal for __________.
The jettisoning of topside weight from your ship serves which purpose?
Answer_1: It returns the ship to an even keel.
Answer_3: It lowers the center of gravity.
Answer_4: It raises the center of gravity.

Question_Title: Which of the fire extinguishing agents listed is the safest to use when combating a class C fire?
If the cause of severe list, or trim is due to off-center ballast, counterflooding into empty tanks will __________.

During counterflooding to correct a severe list or trim aggravated by an off center load, your ship suddenly takes a  list or trim to the opposite side.  Your first couse of action  should be __________.
Answer_1: continue counterflooding in the same direction
Answer_2: continue counterflooding, but in the opposite direction

Question_Title: If the ship takes a sudden severe list or trim from an unknown cause, the first action is to __________.
Answer_1: determine the cause before taking countermeasures
Answer_2: assume the shift is due to off center loading
Answer_3: counterflood on the side opposite the list or trim
Answer_4: assume the cause is environmental forces

Question_Title: If the cause of a sudden severe list or trim is negative initial stability, counterflooding into empty ballast tanks may __________.
Answer_2: cause an increase in the righting arm
Answer_3: bring the unit to an upright equilibrium position
Answer_4: cause the unit to flop to a greater angle

Question_Title: Each fire hydrant is required to have at least one spanner  wrench and at least one __________.

If you hear a continuous blast of the whistle for a period  of not less than 10 seconds; supplemented by a continuous ringing of the general alarm bells for the same time period, you should __________.
Answer_4: proceed to your man overboard muster station

Question_Title: Which of the listed fire extinguishers is recommended for use on an electrical switchboard fire?
Which of the petroleum products listed has the lowest flash point?
When taking tank soundings,  coating the tape with chalk helps to __________.
Answer_2: show the depth of any water in an oil tank

Question_Title: During loading of petroleum products, what is the minimum pressure required to be maintained on the cargo tanks by the inert gas system?
It is important to test lifeboat davit limit switches on a regular basis to prevent _________?
Answer_2: the possibility of the davit wires parting when the lifeboat is being retrieved and stowed in its davit.
Answer_4: the lifeboat from being lowered at an unsafe speed.

Question_Title: A continuous blast of the ship's whistle for a period of not less than 10 seconds, supplemented by a continuous sounding of the general alarm for a period of not less than 10 seconds, is the __________.
In accordance with SOLAS regulations, which of the following is true concerning inflatable liferaft battery powered lights?
Answer_1: Outside and inside canopy lights must be manually switched on after inflation.
Answer_2: The lights must be capable of being shut off during daylight hours to extend battery life.
Answer_3: The lights must automatically turn on and off by photoelectric cells.
Answer_4: The lights must always remain on.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning Halon  1301 fire extinguishing equipment?
Answer_1: The agent is highly toxic at normal room temperature.
Answer_2: The stored operating pressure is lower than carbon dioxide extinguishers.
Answer_3: Halon extinguishes the fire by smothering action.
Answer_4: The agent can not be used on electrical fires because it leaves a residue.

Question_Title: Transverse oscillating rotation about the longitudinal axis of a vessel is known as __________.
The angular motion which a vessel makes about a transverse axis is known as  __________.
Rolling is the transverse oscillating rotation of the vessel about what axis?

If you hear a continuous blast of the whistle for a period  of not less than 10 seconds, supplemented by a continuous ringing of the general alarm bells for not less than 10 seconds, you should go to your __________.
The most frequent cause of oil tanker pollution can be attributed to  __________.
Answer_2: routine discharge of oil during ballasting and tank crude oil washing

Question_Title: What would be the most probable cause for a high pressure alarm to be activated in a low pressure CO2 fixed fire extinguisher system ?
Answer_1: An air leak has developed in the tank.
Answer_2: The tank cooling system has malfunctioned.
Answer_3: The pilot cylinder discharge valve is leaking.
Answer_4: An excessive amount of insulation has been installed on the tank and piping.

Question_Title: What would be a major consequence of allowing the refrigeration system of a low pressure fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system to remain inoperable?
Answer_1: The entire charge may eventually be lost due to CO2 boil-off venting through the relief valve.
Answer_2: Liquid CO2 would overflow from the tank through the drain line as the temperature increased.
Answer_3: Excessive condensation inside the tank would freeze causing a restriction in the discharge piping.
Answer_4: The warmed charge of CO2 would not be effective in extinguishing a fire.

Question_Title: When a ship's low-pressure CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system is activated from a remote location, what determines the quantity of CO2 that will be released into the selected compartment?
Answer_1: A timer mechanism controls the discharge valve and is preset for the space being activated.
Answer_2: The discharge of CO2 will continue until the temperature of the space returns to ambient conditions.
Answer_3: The CO2 tank is divided into separate sections designated for each protected space.
Answer_4: The number of discharge nozzles in the space will determine the quantity released.

Question_Title: A continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less  than 10 seconds, supplemented by the continuous ringing of  the general alarm bells for not less than 10 seconds, would indicate a __________.
A ship's low-pressure CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system is normally designed for a storage tank pressure and temperature of approximately __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
Which of the following statements is FALSE concerning the regulations pertaining to the carbon dioxide cylinder room for a CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system?
Answer_1: The compartment must be properly ventilated.
Answer_2: The ambient temperature of the room should never be allowed to exceed 130 degrees farhenheit.
Answer_3: The door must be kept unlocked.
Answer_4: The compartment shall be clearly identified and marked.

Question_Title: Normally manned machinery spaces protected by a fixed carbon dioxide system are required to be fitted with audible alarms so arranged that the alarm will be sounded prior to the discharge of CO2 by at least _________.

Normally manned machinery spaces protected by a fixed carbon dioxide system are required to be fitted with audible alarms so arranged that the alarm will be sounded prior to the discharge of CO2 by at least __________.
In a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system, where provision is made for the release of CO2 by the operation of a remote control, provision is also to be made for releasing the CO2 from __________.

When pilot cylinder pressure is used to initialize the release of CO2 from a fixed fire extinguishing system containing four storage cylinders, what would be the minimum number of pilot cylinders required in this installation?
Fixed carbon dioxide extinguishing systems for machinery spaces are actuated by one control operating the stop valve leading to the space and __________.
Answer_1: the same control releasing the CO2
Answer_2: a separate control releasing the CO2
Answer_3: two separate controls to release the CO2
Answer_4: three separate controls to release the CO2

Question_Title: A fixed carbon dioxide extinguishing system for a machinery space, designed with a stop valve installed in the line leading to the protected space, is actuated with __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning the control station activation handles for a space protected with a CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system?
Answer_1: Only one control activation handle is required for discharge piping systems designed without a separate stop valve.
Answer_2: Two separate control handles are required when a stop valve is installed in the CO2 discharge line leading to the protected space.
Answer_3: An alarm must sound for at least 20 seconds before CO2 is released into a space that is likely to be occupied.

Question_Title: Mobile offshore drilling units not required to have an official logbook shall __________.
Answer_1: maintain a logbook on Form CG-706
Answer_2: not be required to maintain a logbook
Answer_4: report only major events to the OCMI

Question_Title: Before making any welded repairs to the internals of a vessel's fuel tank in a U.S. port, the tank must be examined by __________.
A vessel's stability is greatly reduced by liquid free surface.  Which of the listed conditions would develop the  greatest adverse effect?
Answer_2: Tanks which have been pressed up to full capacity.
Answer_3: Tanks which have been completely emptied.

Question_Title: What first aid is appropriate for skin contact with tank residue from a cargo of leaded gasoline?
Answer_1: Cover the affected area with petroleum jelly.
Answer_2: Immerse the area in a solution of boric acid.
Answer_3: Wash the area with soap and water immediately.
Answer_4: Administer a strong stimulant and treat for shock.

Question_Title: A class "D" fire would involve the burning of __________.

While in a foreign port, burning and welding repairs are to be carried out on a section of heating coil located in a tank having last contained a grade "D" product.  Which of the following procedures should be followed when a certified marine chemist is not available?
Answer_1: It is solely the chief engineer's responsibility to ensure  all safety precautions are observed, and all entries are to be made in the engine room log.
Answer_2: The repair work cannot be done at this time due to the lack of the chemist's certificate.
Answer_3: Prior to any hot work, an inspection must be made by the senior officer present, and an entry made in the official logbook.
Answer_4: Repairs should proceed as scheduled since a chemist's certificate is not required for that type of work.

Question_Title: The principal effect of liquid free surface is dependent upon the volume of displacement of the vessel and the __________.
Answer_1: height of liquid in the tank
Answer_2: amount of liquid in the tank
Answer_4: weight of liquid in the tank

Question_Title: A fuel tank is considered to be gas free when the tank is __________.
Answer_1: inerted with carbon dioxide for 24 hours
Answer_2: free of most flammable gas concentrations
Answer_3: thoroughly ventilated for at least 24 hours
Answer_4: free of dangerous concentrations of flammable or toxic gases

Question_Title: Any single ship's compartment sustaining partial flooding with free communication to the sea will __________.
A tank or compartment is considered gas free when it is free of dangerous concentrations of __________.
Excessive free surface occurring in tanks carrying liquid cargo should be avoided in order to __________.
Where grades A, B, C, and D liquid cargoes are involved, power-driven or manually-operated spark producing devices shall not be used in the cargo pump room unless __________.
Answer_1: the compartment itself is gas free
Answer_4: all cargo tanks have been inerted

Question_Title: Servicing of a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher aboard ship would include ensuring that the __________.
Answer_1: pressure gage is within the operating range
Answer_2: powder is not caked and there is a full charge
Answer_3: cartridge weight is not less than 1/4 ounce of weight stamped on cartridge
Answer_4: recharge of weight loss exceeds 10% of the weight of charge

Question_Title: Vessel stability is greatly affected when water or fuel tanks are partially filled as a result of the __________.
Which of the following precautions are necessary when using any electrical equipment in a hazardous location, such as a cargo pumproom?
Answer_1: The pumproom is to be gas free.
Answer_2: The adjacent compartments are to be gas free.
Answer_3: Each compartment where flammable gas is expected to accumulate is to be closed and secured.

Question_Title: The powder in a dry chemical fire extinguisher __________.
Answer_1: is always ready for use and requires no attention
Answer_2: may cake up and fail to discharge properly if not occasionally agitated
Answer_3: deteriorates to an unusable condition within three years
Answer_4: puts out the fire with its cooling action

Question_Title: When any tank or compartment is partially filled with a liquid free to move as the ship rolls, the free surface effect is present.  This condition will usually __________.
After a fire has been extinguished in a closed space, personnel may safely enter the space when __________.
Answer_1: smoke density has been decreased sufficiently to see the bulkhead opposite the compartment's entrance
Answer_2: a lifeline and explosion proof flash light are used
Answer_3: all smoke and toxic fumes are removed and an adequate oxygen supply is present
Answer_4: overhaul has been completed to remove any possible source of reignition

Question_Title: Ships are less stable when water or fuel tanks are  partially filled because of the __________.

To prevent an explosion when the pumproom has not been certified gas free and repairs are to be carried out, the only type of portable electric equipment allowed in the pumproom would be an approved __________.
Answer_1: explosion proof self-contained battery powered lamp
Answer_3: marine drop lamp and extension cords

Question_Title: Which of the following procedures should be used to examine a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher?
Answer_1: Make certain that the pressure cartridge has not been punctured.
Answer_2: Check to see that hose and nozzle are clear.
Answer_3: Ensure that dry chemical is not become caked.

Question_Title: Adverse effects due to free surface will result when __________.
Answer_1: the vessel is trimmed by the stern
Answer_2: the vessel's draft is decreased exposing more surface area  to the wind and current
Answer_3: the vessel's draft is increased, thus increasing the vessel's wetted surface area
Answer_4: a portion of liquid is removed from a full tank

Question_Title: Before a shipboard fire can be declared completely out, which of the following steps is/are essential?
Answer_1: The cause of the fire is to be known.
Answer_2: The fire area is safe for men to enter without a breathing  apparatus.
Answer_3: The fire area is sufficiently cooled so that accidental skin burns will not occur.

Question_Title: Proper maintenance of a dry chemical fire extinguisher will include __________.
Answer_4: shaking the extinguisher to loosen the caked-up portions of the powder

Question_Title: A vessel whose fuel tanks are half full is subject to __________.
If there has been a fire in a closed unventilated compartment it may be unsafe to enter because of __________.
On a newly constructed oceangoing vessel of 10,000 gross tons, equipped with an approved 100 ppm oily water  separator, and bilge monitor, the bilge monitor continuous  record must be __________.
Answer_1: kept readily available for 1 year only
Answer_2: detached monthly for enclosure in the Oil Record Book
Answer_3: maintained onboard for not less than 3 years
Answer_4: initialled after each engineering watch by the watch engineer

Question_Title: Vessel stability can be adversely affected by __________.
When reentering an engine room that has been flooded with CO2, the investigating team should initially __________.
Answer_1: leave the access door partially open
Answer_2: enter from the lowest possible level
Answer_3: enter from the highest level with breathing apparatus

Question_Title: Liquid petroleum products will become electrically charged  as a result of the __________.
Answer_1: splashing or spraying of oil into a tank
Answer_2: movement of water droplets in an oil filled tank
Answer_3: oil moving through the pipe lines
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: On U.S. inspected ships, oily water separating equipment, bilge alarms, and bilge monitors must be approved under __________.
If you find that the pressure cartridge on a dry chemical fire extinguisher has been punctured, you must __________.
Answer_1: replace the pressure cartridge and weigh the chemical charge
Answer_2: replace the entire charge of chemical agent
Answer_4: weigh the pressure cartridge to determine if it must be replaced

Question_Title: Free surface effect occurring in tanks should be avoided to __________.
When you hear three short blasts on the ship's whistle and  the same signal on the general alarm bells, you __________.
Answer_1: are required to be at your liferaft
Answer_3: should point to the man overboard

Question_Title: Following an engine room bilge fire which is believed to be extinguished after using a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system, the investigating team should reenter the closed space __________.
Answer_1: no sooner than 15 minutes after the fire is believed extinguished
Answer_3: via the lowest access door and equipped with SCBAs no sooner than 30 minutes after the fire is believed extinguished
Answer_4: via the highest access door and equipped with SCBAs

Question_Title: Fuel tanks should never be filled by cascading liquid through an open hatch or manhole because __________.
Answer_1: excessive fuel vapors will be released
Answer_2: static electricity could be generated by fuel falling through vapor-laden air
Answer_3: spillage of fuel could occur with an open hatch
Answer_4: water contamination of the fuel could occur

Question_Title: When petroleum products are handled, static electricity can be generated by __________.
Answer_1: splashing or agitation of the fluids

Question_Title: When handling petroleum products, static electricity is generated by moving machinery and __________.
Which of the following methods will reduce the possibility  of producing an electrical spark?
Answer_1: Using a cargo hose with a built in electrical bonding wire.
Answer_2: Connecting a bonding wire between the shoreside piping and  the vessel.
Answer_3: Placing an insulating flange or a section of nonconducting  hose in the hose setup.

Question_Title: To initially combat a fire the ventilation to a compartment should be secured to __________.
Answer_1: allow the exhaust fans to remove the smoke
Answer_2: lower the carbon monoxide smothering capabilities
Answer_3: reduce the amount of available oxygen to the fire
Answer_4: protect the fire fighters from smoke

Question_Title: An insulating flange should be used in a cargo hose connection instead of a bonding wire __________.
Answer_2: when static electricity may be generated
Answer_3: when the terminal is equipped with a cathodic protection system

Question_Title: The state of charge of a stored pressure type dry chemical  fire extinguisher can be readily determined by __________.
Answer_1: visual inspection of the pressure gage
Answer_3: removing the lid and checking the level of dry chemical

Question_Title: When fueling, it is important to ground the ship with regard to static electricity.  Therefore, you must connect the __________.
Answer_1: fuel hose before the bonding cable
Answer_2: bonding cable only if sparks are seen
Answer_3: bonding cable before the fuel hose has been connected
Answer_4: bonding cable through a ground fault circuit breaker

Question_Title: One advantage of a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher, over that of a stored pressure dry chemical extinguisher is the former __________.
Answer_1: can be easily recharged aboard ship
Answer_3: can be discharged further from the fire

Question_Title: How can the build up of static electricity be prevented so  that a static spark does not ignite flammable vapors?
Answer_1: Each machine and hose involved in the operation should be grounded.
Answer_2: All electrical circuits near and around the fueling operations should be opened.
Answer_3: A dehumidifier used in spaces containing flammable liquids  will significantly reduce the possibility of static charges being generated.
Answer_4: Static neutralizers can be used to reduce ionization in the air.

Question_Title: The advantage of using a dry chemical fire extinguishing agent is __________.
Answer_1: permanent extinguishment regardless of the reignition sources

Question_Title: Bonding cables are used to reduce the possibility of accidental spark discharge when __________.
Answer_1: transferring flammable liquids to or from a vessel
Answer_2: transferring dry mud to or from a vessel
Answer_3: transferring fuel oil from storage to day tanks

Question_Title: To minimize the possibility of an explosion caused by the discharge of static electricity, the vessel should  __________.
Answer_1: be electrically grounded to shore piping
Answer_2: have its electrical equipment insulated from its structure
Answer_3: have crew members use flashlights rather than AC lamps in vapor filled areas
Answer_4: have crew members use flame safety lamps during entry to areas that may contain explosive fumes

Question_Title: The correct method for connecting a grounding or bonding cable is to __________.
Answer_1: open switch, connect ground cable, close switch, and connect cargo hose
Answer_2: connect ground cable, open switch, and connect cargo hose
Answer_3: close switch, connect cargo hose, open switch, and connect  ground cable
Answer_4: connect ground cable, connect cargo hose, open switch, and  then close switch

Question_Title: Where would you expect to find a "charged mist" on a tanker?
Answer_1: In a common vent header during tank ballasting.
Answer_3: In a cargo tank during inerting operations.
Answer_4: In the overflow line while topping off.

Question_Title: An electrically "charged mist" will be found in a __________.
Any liquid with a flash point above 80F is a __________.
Any liquid which gives off flammable vapors at or below 80F, as determined by flash point from an open cup tester, describes a __________.
A grade "A" petroleum product is __________.
Bunker "C" is classified as a grade __________.
Bunker "C", a grade "E" combustible liquid, will __________.
Answer_2: have a Reid vapor pressure of 14 psi (96.5 kPa) or more
Answer_4: have a flash point of 150F (65.5C) or more

Question_Title: A grade "E" combustible liquid is one having a flash point  of 150F or above.  An example of a grade "E" product is __________.
Which of the following statements describes the advantage of using a Halon fire extinguisher versus a CO2 fire extinguisher?
Answer_1: Halon cools rather than smothers a fire.
Answer_2: Halon is more effective than CO2.
Answer_3: Halon can extinguish combustible metal fires.
Answer_4: Halon is not toxic and safe to breathe under all conditions.

Question_Title: You may improve a vessel's stability by __________.
Answer_1: keeping the fuel tanks topped off
Answer_3: keeping the fuel tanks at least half full
Answer_4: keeping at least one fuel tank empty for slops

Question_Title: In order to find out which lifeboat you are assigned, you should look at the __________.
Any combustible liquid having a flash point of 150F or above is grade __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning Halon  1301?
Answer_1: The agent is extremely toxic in any concentration.
Answer_3: The agent extinguishes a fire by smothering.

Question_Title: What is the usual effect of moving weight from the main deck to a position lower in the vessel?
Answer_1: The stability of the vessel is increased.
Answer_2: The trim of the vessel is changed substantially.
Answer_3: The stability of the vessel is significantly decreased.
Answer_4: The vessel will list in proportion to the volume of the cargo shifted.

Question_Title: The inclining experiment conducted on a merchant ship is the method for determining the exact location of the __________.
Answer_2: position of the ship's center of gravity
Answer_3: position of the ship's center of buoyancy

Question_Title: Which statement is true concerning Halon 1301 fire extinguishing equipment?
Answer_1: The agent is highly toxic under all conditions.
Answer_2: The agent is less effective than CO2.
Answer_3: Halon extinguishes the fire by smothering.
Answer_4: The agent is a colorless odorless gas.

Question_Title: You can generally improve the vessel's stability in a hazardous situation by __________.
Answer_1: pumping double bottoms to the forepeak

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning Halon  1301 fire extinguishing equipment?
Answer_1: The agent is considered nontoxic at room temperature in low concentrations.
Answer_2: The agent is less effective than carbon dioxide.
Answer_3: Halon primarily extinguishes the fire by cooling.
Answer_4: The agent cannot be used on electrical fires because it leaves a residue.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions will occur to the ship's center of gravity if 200 tons of steel is transferred to the ships cargo hold from shore side?
Answer_2: The center of gravity will remain in the same position.
Answer_3: The center of gravity will be lowered.
Answer_4: The reserve buoyancy will remain the same.

Question_Title: Which of the listed effects will occur when an operating diesel engine ingests Halon 1301?
Answer_1: The high engine combustion temperatures liquefy the Halon.
Answer_2: The engine absorbs the Halon into its cooling system.
Answer_3: The engine decomposes the ingested Halon.
Answer_4: The engine will stall regardless of how little Halon has been taken in through the air intake.

Question_Title: If a vessel rolls to the starboard side, and there are no movable or moving weights onboard, the center of gravity will __________.
If weight is added at the keel, the ship's center of gravity will __________.
Answer_4: pass through the center of flotation

Question_Title: A vessel's stability normally increases when tanks are ballasted because the vessel's __________.
In the event of a collision, watertight integrity may be lost if __________.
Answer_1: the sounding tube cap from a damaged tank is missing
Answer_2: the dogs on a manhole cover are secure
Answer_3: you have recently replaced a gasket in a watertight door
Answer_4: you operate the dewatering system from a flooded compartment

Question_Title: A vessel's center of gravity is lowered when the __________.
Where in the Code of Federal Regulations will you find information about the compatibility of cargoes?
The stability of a vessel is normally the greatest when all fuel and water tanks are full because the __________.
If you have to abandon ship, the EPIRB can be used to __________.
Answer_1: hold the lifeboat's head up into the seas
Answer_4: send radio homing signals to searching aircraft

Question_Title: When checking the liquid level in a tank on the weather deck of a vessel, you should position yourself __________.
Answer_1: on the windward side of the opening
Answer_2: on the leeward side of the opening
Answer_3: at a right angle to the wind direction
Answer_4: so that the obstruction of your body will protect you from  the fumes

Question_Title: Many uninspected motor vessels require load lines.  For the purpose of the Load Line Regulations, the term 'surveyor' means __________.
Answer_1: an officer of the Coast Guard designated by the Commandant  to command all Coast Guard activities within his district
Answer_2: any person designated by the American Bureau of Shipping who actually examines the vessel
Answer_3: any person from the Coast Guard who is in charge of a marine inspection zone
Answer_4: any person from the Coast Guard who performs duties with respect to the inspection, enforcement, and administration  of Title 52 of the revised statute

Question_Title: Which fire extinguisher is most prone to freezing when stowed in low temperatures?
If deck cargo is carried, it should be stowed so that it __________.
Answer_1: is now higher than 12 inches above the deck
Answer_2: does not block access to the fire station hydrant
Answer_3: will cover no more than 25 percent of deck space
Answer_4: will be easily visible from the bridge

Question_Title: What is a major advantage of using a positive pressure type self-contained breathing apparatus?
Answer_1: The equipment is lightweight and the wearer can work without difficulty in confined spaces.
Answer_2: The average operating time is over an hour.
Answer_3: The speed with which it can be put into operation is around 45 seconds.
Answer_4: Facial hair will not affect the mask performance.

Question_Title: To operate a CO2 fire extinguisher equipped with a squeeze  grip handle, you are to remove the locking pin and __________.
Answer_4: rotate the cutter disc valve wheel

Question_Title: The bypass valve on a self-contained,  breathing apparatus bypasses __________.
Answer_2: a breathing bag containing excessive pressure

Question_Title: To use a portable CO2 fire extinguisher, you must FIRST __________.
Answer_3: open the valve on the side of the tank

Question_Title: Prior to entering a compartment containing an atmosphere potentially dangerous to life or health, you should don an  approved self-contained breathing apparatus.  Which one of  the listed devices is a self-contained breathing apparatus?
A safety 'ring pin' is usually inserted in the handle of a  CO2 fire extinguisher to prevent __________.
Answer_1: the cylinder valve from coming loose
Answer_2: the handle from contacting the cylinder

Question_Title: Annual servicing of a hand portable CO2 fire extinguisher includes __________.
Answer_1: inspecting the pressure gauge to ensure the needle is within operating range
Answer_2: weighing the cylinder and recharging if weight loss exceeds 10% of the weight of the charge

Question_Title: While donning the positive-pressure self-contained breathing apparatus, you discover that the air cylinder pressure gage and the regulator pressure gage differ from each other by 500 psi.  Which of the listed action should you consider as appropriate?
Answer_1: Replace the defective gages with a new pair from the spare parts inventory.
Answer_3: Assume that the lower gage reading is correct.
Answer_4: Take the average of the two gages as the correct pressure.

Question_Title: Which of the components listed are interchangeable between  different backpack self-contained breathing apparatus produced by various manufacturers?
Which of the listed fire extinguishers cannot be easily recharged aboard ship?

The pressure gages on the air cylinder and the regulator should be checked before putting on a positive pressure type self-contained breathing apparatus.  Which of the following is the maximum acceptable differential readings permitted to exist between the two gages?
The knife edges and gaskets of watertight doors should be  __________.
A carbon dioxide fire extinguisher has been partially discharged, and should be immediately __________.
Answer_1: tagged and restowed properly in its rack
Answer_2: weighed and the charge loss recorded

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the correct procedure for closing a watertight door?

Answer_2: Loosely set up two dogs adjacent to the hinges, snugly set up one dog on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.
Answer_3: Snugly set up two dogs on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.
Answer_4: Loosely set up one dog on the hinge side, snugly set up two dogs on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.

Question_Title: The best emergency repair to a crack forming in the vessel's hull is to __________.
Answer_2: drill the ends of the crack and apply a concrete patch
Answer_3: weld a doubler plate over the crack
Answer_4: weld a metal box over the crack and applying air pressure

Question_Title: The component in an inert gas system used for cleaning the  gas of solid and sulphur combustion products, while simultaneously cooling the inert gas, is called the __________.
According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the shore facility must have an emergency means to stop the flow of oil to a vessel in __________.
Answer_1: 15 seconds on any facility which starts operations after April 1, 1985
Answer_2: 30 seconds on any facility which starts operations after November 1, 1980
Answer_3: 90 seconds on any facility which starts operations after December 1, 1976
Answer_4: 120 seconds on any facility which starts operations after July 1, 1973

Question_Title: An acceptable method of temporarily sealing a crack formed  in the hull of a vessel is to __________.
Answer_1: apply a patch of sheet packing backed by a shole and shoring
Answer_3: shore up the crack with welded braces
Answer_4: tack weld a doubler plate over the crack

Question_Title: The fire extinguishing action of CO2 comes mostly from __________.
Answer_1: breaking the fire chemical chain reaction
Answer_4: isolating the heat from the fuel

Question_Title: The emergency shutdown requirements of Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) apply to __________.
Which of the following represents an emergency procedure used to stop the oil flow aboard tank vessels, of 250 tons  or greater, as required by Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR)?
Where will you find the procedures for the reporting of oil discharge into the water?
Answer_4: The vessel's International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate

Question_Title: Which of the listed functions is the purpose of a gas scrubber in an inert gas generation system?
Answer_2: Maintains the oxygen content at 5% by volume.
Answer_3: Drains off static electricity in the inert gas.
Answer_4: Maintains the water seal on the gas main.

Question_Title: The lengthening of a crack formed in the shell plating of a ship may be prevented by __________.
Answer_1: welding brackets across both ends of the crack
Answer_2: chipping out and slot welding the entire crack
Answer_3: drilling a hole at each end of the crack
Answer_4: cutting a square notch at each end of the crack

Question_Title: The empty weight of a B-II CO2 fire extinguisher is 34 pounds, therefore, the full charged weight is __________.
A high concentration of hydrogen sulfide gas is most likely to be found in which of the locations listed?
Answer_1: Fireroom bilges where hydrazine has accumulated.
Answer_2: Sewage compartment bilges where leaked sewage has accumulated.
Answer_3: Engine room bilges where chemical cleaners and solvents have accumulated.
Answer_4: Emergency battery storage compartment where discharge gases have accumulated.

Question_Title: Portable carbon dioxide fire extinguishers should be sent ashore to be recharged __________.
Answer_1: when the remaining charge volume is less than 90 percent of the required VOLUME
Answer_4: when the weight loss exceeds 10% of weight of charge

Question_Title: Inert gas systems fitted on tank vessels must be fitted with an alarm to give an audible and visual warning when the oxygen content of the inert gas exceeds __________.
Prior to entering a shipboard compartment containing spilled sewage, you should test the atmosphere in the compartment for __________.
The empty weight of a '100 pound' cylinder in a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system is 130 pounds.  What is the minimum acceptable weight of the cylinder before recharging would be required?
The blowers of an inert gas generation system aboard a tanker, will be automatically secured if __________.
Answer_1: normal water supply at the water seal is lost
Answer_2: the temperature of the inert gas being delivered to the cargo tanks is more than 150F
Answer_3: the cooling water supply to the scrubbers is lost

Question_Title: When pumping sour crude, which gas should be tested for prior to entering the cargo pumproom to repair a leaking pump?
On a tanker vessel, what is the required combined capacity of the inert gas generating system as compared to the total capacity of all the cargo pumps which can be operated simultaneously?
Waste oil from the lube oil sumps of machinery may NOT be __________.
Which of the following methods is used to supply inert gas  from a flue gas system to the cargo tanks?
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) prohibit draining __________.
Answer_1: waste oil into the slop tank
Answer_2: lube oil purifiers into the bilge
Answer_4: lube oil strainers into drip pans

Question_Title: After allowing for pressure losses, the pressure-volume capacity of an inert gas blower must be able to maintain a  pressure, in any cargo tank, with a minimum of __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) prohibits draining __________.
Answer_3: fuel oil strainers into the ship's bilges
Answer_4: lube oil strainers into fixed drip pans

Question_Title: The purpose of the deck seal in an inert gas system is to prevent __________.
Answer_1: flammable vapors from entering machinery space

Question_Title: The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that a  ship's oily bilge slops may be pumped in port only if the __________.
Answer_2: local port authority has completed the required pollution inspection
Answer_3: discharge is led to a slop barge or shoreside tank
Answer_4: engineer on watch has signed the declaration of inspection

Question_Title: Open tank hatches and ullage holes from tanks which are not gas free, and unattended, must be protected by __________.
Bilges may be pumped __________.
Answer_3: overboard through an oily water separator
Answer_4: anytime in an emergency, i.e. main engine lube oil failure

Question_Title: Flame screens used on ullage openings prevent flames from entering a tank by __________.
Answer_1: reducing the cross-sectional area of the opening
Answer_2: restricting the flow of gases through the opening
Answer_3: creating turbulence in the exiting gas stream
Answer_4: dissipating heat from the flame into the surrounding metal

Question_Title: Following a grounding, you can best determine that a SLACK  fuel oil tank has been holed by __________.
Answer_2: waiting for the vessel to list

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations, any discharge of oil, or oily mixture into the sea from any oil tanker, or from any ship of 400 gross tons and above, other than an oil tanker, is prohibited while in a "special" area. These "special areas" are designated in __________.
Your vessel has run aground and upon taking fuel oil tank soundings, you find that a fuel tank level has increased. You therefore should suspect __________.
Answer_2: a crack in the hull portion of the fuel tank
Answer_4: contamination from the saltwater flushing system

Question_Title: According to 46 CFR, a single layer of tank vent flame screen must be composed of corrosion resistant wire and  at least a mesh of __________.
According to Federal Regulations, new  tank vessels enroute beyond the 50 mile limit may not discharge an oily mixture into the sea from a cargo tank or cargo pump room unless __________.
Answer_1: the quantity of oil discharged into the sea does not exceed 1/30,000 of the total quantity of cargo carried on board
Answer_3: discharging oil at a rate not exceeding 200 liters per nautical mile
Answer_4: the quantity of oil discharged into the surrounding waters  does not exceed 1/600,000 of the total quantity of cargo carried onboard

Question_Title: The device used for preventing the passage of flames into enclosed spaces is called a __________.
How many approved B-II fire extinguishers must be carried in the machinery space of a 3000 HP vessel?
When cargo oil tanks are cleaned by crude oil washing while in port, __________.
Answer_1: provision should be made for a shoreside holding tank or an onboard slop tank
Answer_2: water should be allowed to settle before discharge overboard
Answer_3: filters should be installed in bilge strainers to absorb oil before discharge overboard
Answer_4: the dock supervisor need not be notified before discharging oily mixtures overboard

Question_Title: At the earliest indication of fire aboard your vessel, you  must FIRST __________.
Answer_2: determine which type of fire is burning

Question_Title: A new ocean going ship of 2000 gross tons having an inoperative oily water separator may dispose of its bilge slops by __________.
Answer_1: holding its slops onboard until they can be pumped into the city sewer system
Answer_2: circulating them through the lube oil purifier to remove water and debris
Answer_3: holding its slops onboard until they can be discharged to a shoreside reception facility
Answer_4: pumping them into a settling tank for separation before pumping the oily water residue overboard

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the correct action to take when three crew members discover a fire?
Answer_1: One man report the fire, and the other two men fight the fire.
Answer_2: One man report the fire, one man fight the fire, and one man evacuate and secure the area.
Answer_3: One man report the fire, one man fight the fire, and one man act as a safety observer.
Answer_4: All three men fight the fire and report it immediately after it is extinguished.

Question_Title: A low velocity fog applicator is held in an all-purpose nozzle by a bayonet joint.  The applicator is prevented from rotating in the joint by __________.
In port, after chemically cleaning a fuel oil tank, you should dispose of the waste oil by __________.
Answer_1: pumping it into the sewer connection
Answer_3: circulating it through an oil and water separator
Answer_4: discharging it into a slop barge or holding tank

Question_Title: Where would you look to find the number of hand portable fire extinguishers required on an uninspected towing or fishing industry vessel?
Answer_2: Subchapter C, Rules and Regulations for Uninspected Vessels

Question_Title: While in drydock in a U.S. port, you discover that the spool piece for the fire pump sea suction is wasted away.  You should __________.
Answer_1: place a cement box patch on the spool piece
Answer_3: silver braze a patch over the leak
Answer_4: patch the leak with epoxy sealer

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), you are required to test cargo discharge piping every __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no person may use a connection for oil transfer operations  unless it is a bolted or full threaded connection, or __________.
Answer_1: an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle is used to fuel the vessel
Answer_2: a clamped or compression fitted connection
Answer_3: a quick connection coupling approved by the American Petroleum Institute
Answer_4: a connection not over six inches in diameter

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning oil transfer,  related equipment, tests and inspections is true?
Answer_1: Each pressure gauge in the system must indicate a reading that is within 5% of the actual system pressure.
Answer_2: Each nonmetallic oil transfer hose, larger than a 3" inside diameter must be inspected, and tested annually.
Answer_3: A 6" inside diameter nonmetallic oil transfer hose having a small slash penetrating the hose reinforcement may remain in service if there is no visible internal deterioration.

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), a vessel built in 1977 with a gross registered tonnage of 219 tons, must __________.
Answer_1: use one gallon portable containers under tank vents when fueling
Answer_2: use an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle when fueling
Answer_3: use a fixed container or enclosed deck area under or around each lube oil tank vent when fueling
Answer_4: fill fuel tanks forward of the collision bulkhead first

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require a 1500 gross ton vessel (constructed before July 1, 1974) equipped with a fill fitting for which discharge containment is impractical to __________.
Answer_1: have the fill fitting altered on or before December 31, 1986
Answer_2: use a drip collar on the fill fitting
Answer_3: have a designated crew member stand watch over the fill fitting
Answer_4: use an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle

Question_Title: An ocean going ship of 4000 gross tons must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection for the discharge of oily wastes to a reception facility.  The dimensions for the connection are specified in the Pollution Prevention Regulations under Part __________.

An ocean going ship of 6000 gross tons or above must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection with dimensions outlined in Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) or be substituted with a __________.
Answer_1: portable connection using a four bolt pattern
Answer_3: portable adapter that meets the same specification outlined in 33 CFR, Subchapter "O"
Answer_4: clip-on flange suitable for service pressure of 4 kg/cm2

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the minimum number of bolts permitted in an ANSI standard flange on an oil hose is __________.

Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 155) state that no person may transfer oil or fuel to a vessel of 300 gross tons or more, constructed after June 30,1974, unless each fuel tank vent, overflow, and fill pipe is equipped with a/an __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) requires that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless __________.
Answer_1: all necessary components of the transfer system are lined up before the transfer begins
Answer_2: all unnecessary parts of the transfer system are open and drained
Answer_3: the transfer system is connected to a flexible overflow fuel hose
Answer_4: the transfer system is connected to an automatic back pressure shutoff nozzle

Question_Title: How many emergency outfits are required to be carried onboard all tankships over 1,000 gross tons?
The minimum number of bolts necessary for a standard ANSI oil transfer hose temporary flange coupling (eight bolt hole flange) is __________.
Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 156), state that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: oil residue has been drained from all hoses
Answer_2: an oil containment boom is available for immediate use
Answer_3: all parts of the transfer system have been properly lined up
Answer_4: a representative sample has been taken from the oil being received

Question_Title: As part of the emergency outfit required to be carried onboard all tank vessels over 1000 gross tons, flashlights  must be __________.
Answer_1: of a minimum number of two explosion proof type
Answer_2: listed by NEMA and bearing its label
Answer_3: of the Type II or Type III

Question_Title: The tanks used for oily waste on a new ocean going cargo ship of 6000 gross tons must meet certain requirements for  isolation between oil and bilge systems.  These requirements are set forth in __________.
A fireman's outfit carried onboard cargo vessels, must have a __________.

An oceangoing ship of 400 gross tons and above must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection.  What is the size of the bolt circle diameter of the shore connection required to transfer oily ballast to a shoreside reception  facility?
Answer_4: It depends on outside pipe diameter.

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no  person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: each hose is supported in a manner that prevents strain on  its coupling
Answer_2: each part of the transfer system necessary to allow the flow of oil is lined up for transfer
Answer_3: each oil transfer hose has no loose covers, kinks, bulges,  or soft spots, and no gouges, cuts or slashes that penetrate the hose reinforcement

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning oil transfer connections?
Answer_1: Any permanently connected flange coupling must have a bolt  in each hole.
Answer_2: Approved quick-connect couplings may be used.
Answer_3: When a temporary connection utilizes an American National Standard Institute (ANSI) standard flange, a bolt in every  other hole is acceptable if at least four bolts are used.

Question_Title: Oil Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), require that the person-in-charge of transfer operations is to insure that the __________.
Answer_1: drains and scuppers are closed by the mechanical means
Answer_2: transferrer and transferee know the identity of the product to be transferred
Answer_3: hose is supported to prevent kinking or damage

Question_Title: The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require that  no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless __________.
Answer_1: bonding cables are installed on all tanks
Answer_4: an oil containment boom is ready for immediate use

Question_Title: While on watch in the engine room, you hear a continuous sounding of the general alarm.  Which of the following actions should you take FIRST?
Answer_1: Secure the burners then proceed to your assigned boat station.
Answer_2: Start the fire pump and establish flow to the fire main.
Answer_3: Open the guardian valve and standby to maneuver.
Answer_4: Open the master control valves on the fixed CO2 system.

Question_Title: In an oil pumping operation where pumping connections are made up of flanged hoses the weakest link is the __________.
While on watch in the engine room, you hear a continuous sounding of the general alarm.  Which of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Make an entry in the official logbook.
Answer_2: Open the master control valves on the fixed CO2 system.
Answer_3: Start the fire pump and check discharge pressure.

Question_Title: As soon as you hear the fire and emergency signal, you should ensure that the __________.
Answer_4: life preservers have been issued to everyone

Question_Title: Which of the following actions should be taken by the engine room watch when the general alarm is sounded continuously?
Answer_1: The fire pump should be started.
Answer_2: The boiler fires should be secured.
Answer_3: The fixed CO2 system should be initiated into action.
Answer_4: The engine room ventilation should be secured.

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: hoses are supported to prevent kinking and strain on its coupling
Answer_2: a sample has been taken from the oil being received
Answer_3: adequate deck lighting is turned on one hour before sunset
Answer_4: each part of the transfer system is blown through with air

Question_Title: When the general alarm is sounded continuously, the engine  room personnel should __________.
Answer_1: proceed to their man overboard stations
Answer_3: put on lifejackets and go to their abandon ship stations
Answer_4: secure the propulsion diesel engines and evacuate the engine room

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no  person may connect or engage in any other critical oil transfer operation unless __________.
Answer_2: that person holds a tankerman endorsement
Answer_3: that person holds a license as master, mate, or engineer
Answer_4: that person holds a valid port security card

Question_Title: Which of the actions listed should be taken by the engineer on watch when the general alarm is sounded continuously for 10 seconds?
Answer_1: Engine room ventilation should be started.
Answer_3: The fire pump should be started.
Answer_4: The fixed CO2 system should be activated.

Question_Title: Which of the listed operations must be personally supervised by the person-in-charge while taking on fuel?
Answer_1: Posting of the Declaration of Inspection in a conspicuous place under glass.
Answer_2: Topping off of any tanks being loaded.
Answer_3: Disposing overboard all waste oil or slops from drip pans.
Answer_4: Periodic sampling during the loading to ensure uniformity.

Question_Title: During topping off of bunker tanks, the loading rate must be personally supervised by the __________.
According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), when may a person serve as the person-in-charge of both a vessel and a facility during oil transfer operations?
Answer_1: When authorized by the Captain of the Port.
Answer_2: When licensed as a certified refueling officer.
Answer_3: Whenever the vessel is short of manpower.

Question_Title: As soon as you hear the fire and emergency signal, you should ensure that __________.
Answer_1: the ring buoys are thrown overboard
Answer_4: everyone is suited in an approved life vest

Question_Title: When fuel tanks are being topped off, the person-in-charge  of bunkering is directly responsible for the __________.
Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) specify that the  person-in-charge of bunkering is responsible for the __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless each  person in charge has signed the __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that a  person may not transfer oil or hazardous materials to or from a vessel unless each person-in-charge has signed the __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), who makes the final decision of when oil transfer may begin?
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the declaration of inspection is the __________.
Answer_1: paper issued by the Coast Guard marine inspector which allows you to conduct a transfer operation
Answer_2: application you must complete and submit to the Coast Guard to have an inspector visit your vessel
Answer_3: document signed by vessel and shore facility persons-in-charge declaring that all transfer requirements  have been met
Answer_4: annual report submitted by vessel personnel to the Coast Guard declaring that all transfer equipment has been inspected

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), which of the following conditions would disqualify a nonmetallic hose as being suitable for use in transferring  oil?
Answer_1: A cut in the cover which makes the reinforcement visible.
Answer_2: A blown gasket when hydrostatic test pressure is applied.
Answer_3: Evidence of internal or external deterioration.

Question_Title: Oil "transfer hose" defects are specified in the Pollution  Prevention Regulations under 33 CFR Part __________.
According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), how much hose should you use in transferring oil in bulk?
Answer_1: Twice the distance between ship and dock.
Answer_2: One and one half times the distance between ship and dock.
Answer_3: Not over 300 feet (91.4 m) of hose.
Answer_4: Sufficient for maximum vessel movement without straining the hoses.

Question_Title: No person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless the person in charge __________.
Answer_1: has in his or her possession a copy of the vessel's Oil Record Book
Answer_2: has notified the captain of the port at least 24 hours before beginning each oil transfer operation
Answer_3: has in his or her possession a valid Certificate of Inspection or Tank Vessel Examination Letter
Answer_4: is in the immediate vicinity and immediately available to the oil transfer personnel

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require that on the completion of oil transfer operations all __________.
Answer_1: hoses shall be blown down with air
Answer_2: soundings shall be entered in the oil record book
Answer_3: valves used during transfer shall be closed
Answer_4: persons on duty during oil transfer shall be accounted for

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the person-in-charge of transfer operations, both ashore and on the vessel, must agree on __________.
Answer_1: the identity of the product to be transferred
Answer_2: the size of the slop tank required under 155.330
Answer_3: the status of the oily water separator
Answer_4: whether or not the transferring ship is a "Public Vessel of the United States"

Question_Title: Which of the listed fire extinguishers would be considered  hand portable/semiportable and capable of combating a class "B" fire?
When bunkering operations are completed, the hoses should be __________.
Answer_1: drained into drip pans or tanks
Answer_2: blown down with nitrogen or inert gas
Answer_3: steam cleaned and flushed with hot water
Answer_4: stowed with their ends open for venting

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), who is to make the final decision of when oil transfer may  begin?
Answer_4: Designated persons-in-charge of vessel and facility

Question_Title: If your vessel's Certificate of Inspection requires six B-II, two A-II and one B-V fire extinguisher, which of the listed combinations will provide the amount and type required?
Answer_1: Six 2 1/2 gallon soda acid, two 2 1/2 gallon foam, and one  40 gallon foam
Answer_2: Six 2 1/2 gallon foam, two 15 pound CO2, and one 30 pound dry chemical
Answer_3: Six 15 pound CO2, two 2 1/2 gallon foam, and one 50 pound CO2
Answer_4: Eight 2 1/2 gallon foam and one 100 pound CO2

Question_Title: On an uninspected vessel, all portable fire extinguishers are required by law to be approved by the __________.
Answer_4: American Society for the Testing of Materials (ASTM)

Question_Title: The term "oil", as used in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), means __________.
The term "oil" as defined in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) means: __________.
Answer_3: noxious liquid substances designated under Annex II of MARPOL 73/78

Question_Title: Each inert gas system must be designed to supply the cargo  tanks with a gas, or mixture of gases, that has an oxygen  content by volume of __________.
The term "oily mixture", as defined in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) includes __________.
Which of the following represents the maximum percent of oxygen, by volume, required to be achieved by a ship's inert gas system, prior to the commencement of crude oil tank washing?
The Federal Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) that  apply to ships are enforced by the __________.
Where are remote readouts for oxygen concentration, pressure, and temperature of an inert gas system required to be located?
Answer_3: Main deck and engine control consoles
Answer_4: Cargo control and engine control consoles

Question_Title: An oxygen indicator will detect __________.
Answer_2: an oxygen deficiency in a space
Answer_3: the presence of harmful amounts of carbon monoxide

Question_Title: Each inert gas system must be equipped with the following instruments:  oxygen concentration indicator and recorder,  pressure indicator and recorder, and temperature indicator. The point of measurement for these instruments must be located __________.
Answer_4: upstream of the liquid filled breaker

Question_Title: To determine that a compartment contains sufficient oxygen  to sustain life, you should use a/an __________.
Each inert gas system gas main must have an automatic shut down valve at the outlet of the gas production plant.  This valve must close automatically upon __________.
Which of the following statements is true regarding oxygen  indicators?
Answer_1: The instrument is capable of providing an immediate accurate reading of any space with no delay.
Answer_2: Prolonged exposure to gases such as CO2 may affect the accuracy of the indicator.
Answer_3: A cotton filter placed in the end of the sampling tube prevents damaging the instrument when exposed to strongly acidic gases.

Question_Title: During loading and discharging operations, in addition to when the cargo tanks have been properly filled, each inert  gas system must be capable of maintaining a minimum gas pressure of __________.
An International Oil Pollution Prevention (IOPP) Certificate ceases to be valid on a U.S. Ship when __________.
Answer_1: the ship changes its port of documentation to San Francisco
Answer_2: the certificate exceeds 2 years from the date of issue
Answer_3: an intermediate survey as required by 33 CFR 151.17 is not  carried out
Answer_4: the vessel owners cease to belong to IMO (International Maritime Organization)

Question_Title: Each ship having an inert gas system must have a portable instruments to measure concentrations of hydrocarbon vapor  in inert atmospheres and also to measure __________.
The upper limit of sulphur dioxide permitted to be  maintained in the inert gas should not exceed __________.

An inert gas system incorporating a separately fired inert  gas generator shall be provided with visual and audible alarms to indicate failure of the power supply to the generator, the automatic control system, and __________.
According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the "Discharge of Oil Prohibited" placard is required on all __________.
Answer_1: foreign vessels not in U.S. navigable waters
Answer_2: U.S. Vessels 26 feet or more in length
Answer_3: Foreign vessels when engaged in noncommercial service
Answer_4: U.S. vessels less than 26 feet in length

Question_Title: A "Discharge of Oil Prohibited" placard must be fixed in a  conspicuous place in each machinery space, or at the bilge  and ballast pump control station as required by __________.
Which of the following liquids can ordinarily be discharged overboard without being processed through an oily water separator?
Exemption or partial exemption from compliance with any requirement in the Oil or Harardous Material Pollution Prevention Regulations prescribed in (33 CFR 155) may be granted by the __________.
Answer_1: OCMI in the vessel's home port

Question_Title: Some Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), only apply  to "new ships."  Under these regulations, a new ship is a ship __________.
Answer_1: having undergone a major conversion and has been completed  before December 31, 1979
Answer_2: for which the building contract has been placed after December 31, 1975
Answer_3: having undergone a major conversion for which the contract  was placed between June 30, 1974 and December 31, 1975
Answer_4: the delivery of which is on or after June 10, 1975

Question_Title: Used engine oil may be properly disposed of by __________.
Answer_2: discharging it to a dockside oil waste station
Answer_3: pumping or throwing it over the side in port
Answer_4: dumping it in a gasoline fuel tank

Question_Title: According to title 33 CFR's, an International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate (IOPP) for a "new" vessel ceases to be valid if __________.
Answer_1: it exceeds 3 years from date of issue
Answer_2: an alteration approved by the Captain of the Port is made
Answer_3: an intermediate survey has not be conducted within 12 months from the date that the IOPP was issued
Answer_4: the vessel is transferred to the flag of another country

Question_Title: If 1/4 liter of oil is spilled during fueling and causes a  sheen upon the water, it __________.
Answer_1: must be reported to the fire department
Answer_2: must be reported to the Coast Guard
Answer_3: must be reported to the harbomaster
Answer_4: need not be reported since the spill was less then 1 barrel

Question_Title: If fuel tank levels are found to have increased after a grounding, you should suspect __________.
Answer_2: a puncture, crack, or hole in the skin of the vessel
Answer_3: improper record keeping of fuel transfer activities
Answer_4: contamination of the contaminated steam supply system

Question_Title: Where are "prohibited oil spaces" specified in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR)?
A self-propelled ship of 400 gross tons, constructed in January 1974, may carry fuel oil in tanks forward of the collision bulkhead, if such tanks were __________.
Answer_1: designated for fuel oil carriage after Jan 31, 1975
Answer_2: installed for fuel oil carriage on August 1, 1974
Answer_3: designated, installed, or constructed for fuel oil carriage before July 1, 1974
Answer_4: designed for cargo oil using specifications from 1976 Pollution Prevention Regulations

Question_Title: People should be protected from the rotating parts of machinery by __________.
The word "discharge" as used in Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 151) applies to oil __________.
Answer_3: pumped into navigable waters through a fixed piping system

Question_Title: What safety precautions should be observed by the crew while working around machinery in an engine room?
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), which of the following qualifies as a discharge of oil?
Answer_1: Leakage of oil to the water by an improperly blanked transfer hose.
Answer_2: Spilling oil on the main deck and having it flow over the side.
Answer_3: Pumping oil overboard through a fixed piping system.

Question_Title: The explosive range of a mixture of flammable vapors is specified as a percentage of __________.
Answer_1: flammable vapor by volume in air
Answer_3: the temperature of the flash point
Answer_4: the lower limit of explosibility of the mixture

Question_Title: What operational limitation should the user of a self-contained breathing apparatus be concerned with when using the device?
Answer_1: The weight of the unit changes the user's center of gravity.
Answer_2: The lens of the facepiece reduces the user's peripheral vision.
Answer_3: The attached lifeline limits the user's mobility.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Why is it important for fuel oil tanks not to be topped off when loading cold oil?
Answer_1: Increased viscosity of the product needs higher loading pressure, which increases the chance of a spill.
Answer_2: Air pockets may cause the fuel to bubble out of the ullage  hole.
Answer_3: The change in its specific volume when heated may cause an  overflow.

Question_Title: Portable Halon extinguishers used on a class "B" fire should be directed __________.

Answer_4: toward the upwind side of the fire

Question_Title: The existence of liquids in partially full tanks or compartments of a MODU causes a virtual rise in the height  of the __________.

Answer_1: discharge of ballast or cleaning water from fuel tanks
Answer_2: sounding levels of all fuel tanks on a daily basis
Answer_3: grade and specific gravity of all fuel oil carried
Answer_4: fuel consumption rates on a weekly basis

Question_Title: When applying chest compressions on an adult victim during  CPR, the sternum should be depressed about __________.

Answer_1: Signaling that all personnel are clear before lifting or lowering material.

Answer_3: Closing, tagging, or securing valves that permit entrance of steam, water, or air into a fitting or other equipment.
Answer_4: Throwing materials from high places to the deck.

Question_Title: Horizontal transverse motion of a vessel is known as __________.

Answer_1: close the deck filling valve to reduce the pumping rate
Answer_2: close all tank vents to prevent overflow
Answer_3: fill the tank to the bottom of the expansion trunk
Answer_4: notify the shore pumping station to reduce the pumping rate as tanks near full capacity

Question_Title: When taking soundings on a floating MODU, the tape should be lowered and brought back quickly to __________.
Answer_1: reduce the time the sounding tube is open
Answer_3: lessen the effect of roll or pitch on the reading
Answer_4: lessen the effect of heave on the reading

Question_Title: The regulations regarding Oil Record Books do not apply to  MODUs that __________.
Answer_2: are on a voyage of more than 24 hours
Answer_3: have a valid International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate
Answer_4: have a valid National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permit

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions represents the appropriate time for setting off distress flares and rockets?
Answer_1: Only when there is a chance of them being seen by rescue vessels.

Question_Title: Halon extinguishers used on a class "C" fire should be directed at the __________.

Answer_2: show the depth of any water in an oil tank

Question_Title: The signal to man emergency stations on MODUs is __________.
Answer_1: a 30 second on - 30 second off alternating signal
Answer_2: the continuous ringing of the general alarm signal
Answer_3: an intermittent ringing of the general alarm for not less than ten seconds

Question_Title: When administering chest compression during CPR, at what part of the victim's body should the pressure be applied?
A straight stream of water should be used to extinguish __________.
Answer_4: a fire in the paint locker

Question_Title: Rolling is the angular motion of the vessel about what axis?
When completing the ballasting operation of a contaminated  tank, which of the following problems must be guarded against?
Answer_3: Excessive tank pressure due to closed vents
Answer_4: Motor overload due to high discharge head

Question_Title: The requirement to carry an Oil Record Book does not apply  to a MODU that __________.
Answer_1: is not equipped to discharge overboard any oil or oily mixture
Answer_2: is on an international voyage to a country that is party to MARPOL
Answer_3: has an International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate
Answer_4: has an oily water separator of sufficient capacity for the  oil wastes generated

Question_Title: A virtual rise in the center of gravity of a MODU may be caused by __________.
Answer_2: using fuel from a pressed fuel tank
Answer_4: transferring pipe from the setback area to the pipe rack

Question_Title: To release the davit cable of a davit launched liferaft, you must __________.
Dry chemical fire extinguishers may be effectively used on which of the listed classes of fires?

Answer_2: the tank may be partially flooded

Question_Title: The Muster List ("Station Bill") of a MODU must be signed by the __________.
Changing rescuers while carrying out artificial respiration should be done __________.
Answer_1: without losing the rhythm of respiration
Answer_2: only with the help of two other people
Answer_3: by not stopping the respiration for more than 5 minutes

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of fires should be extinguished with a straight stream of water?
Pitching is angular motion of the vessel about which axis?
A segregated ballast system is a system where __________.
Answer_1: all ballast is processed through the oily water separator
Answer_2: ballast is taken on and discharged through a separate main  deck riser
Answer_3: ballast and cargo tanks are separated by cofferdams
Answer_4: all ballast lines, tanks, and pumps are independent of those used for oil

Question_Title: When the height of the metacenter has the same value as the height of the center of gravity, the metacentric height is  equal to __________.
Answer_2: height of the center of gravity
Answer_3: same as half the height of the metacenter

Question_Title: If a liferaft should capsize, __________.
Answer_3: right the raft using the righting straps

Question_Title: When is it required for a dry chemical fire extinguisher to be recharged?

What information must be entered on the MODU Muster List ("Station Bill")?
Answer_2: Use and application of special equipment.
Answer_4: Duties and station of each person during emergencies.

Question_Title: The most essential element in the administration of CPR is  __________.
Answer_1: to have the proper equipment for the process

Question_Title: A solid stream of water might be useful in fighting a burning oil fire on deck when it is used __________.
Answer_1: to wash burning oil over the side
Answer_2: to provide cooling for the fire fighters

Question_Title: Yawing is the angular motion of the vessel about what axis?

Answer_1: tank that is completely separated from the cargo oil and fuel oil systems
Answer_2: fuel settling tank for segregation from lighter fluids
Answer_4: isolated tank for analysis because of its noxious properties

Question_Title: For a floating MODU, the center of buoyancy and the metacenter are in the line of action of the buoyant force __________.

Answer_2: only when there is negative stability
Answer_3: only when there is neutral stability

Question_Title: You should deploy the sea anchor from a liferaft to __________.
In addition to weighing the cartridge, what other routine maintenance is required for a cartridge-operated dry chemical extinguisher?
Answer_1: Weigh the powder in the canister.
Answer_2: Discharge small amount to see that it works.
Answer_3: Check the hose and nozzle for clogs.

Question_Title: If you observe any situation which presents a safety or pollution hazard during fuel transfer operations on a MODU, which of the listed actions should be taken first?
Answer_1: Wait for the person-in-charge to act.

Question_Title: The signal for fire alarm on a MODU must be indicated __________.
Before CPR is started on the victim, you should __________.

Answer_1: a straight stream into the center of the space
Answer_2: the high velocity fog into the center of the space
Answer_3: the high velocity fog at the overhead to absorb heat
Answer_4: the high velocity fog at the deck to cool it for entry

Question_Title: Angular motion about the longitudinal axis of a vessel is known as __________.

Answer_1: storing all items in an assigned place
Answer_2: storing all items in a common storage container except those ready-for-sea
Answer_3: tagging all items according to their age and then storing them together

Question_Title: Immediately after abandoning a vessel, lookouts should be posted aboard liferafts to look for __________.

Answer_1: authorized fire equipment servicing personnel only
Answer_2: replacing the propellant cartridge and refilling it with powder
Answer_3: puncturing the cartridge seal after installation
Answer_4: recharging the cartridge and refilling it with powder

Question_Title: The free surface effects of a partially full tank in a floating MODU decrease with the __________.
Answer_4: height of the tank above the keel

Question_Title: A load line for a MODU is assigned by the __________.
Answer_4: a recognized classification society approved by the Coast Guard

Question_Title: When administering artificial respiration, it is of the utmost importance to __________.
When entering a compartment which is on fire, __________.
Answer_2: the flames should be beaten back from the door with water fog
Answer_3: a straight stream of water should be used to cool the door
Answer_4: a straight stream of water should be used to cool the fire fighters

Question_Title: Heave is the motion of a vessel along the __________.

Answer_1: mechanically mixing and agitating foam chemical, water, and air
Answer_2: a chemical reaction of foam components and air
Answer_3: gas bubbles liberated when the foam chemical contacts fire
Answer_4: chemical reaction of foam components and water

Question_Title: There are two disadvantages to CO2 when used as a total flooding firefighting agent.  One of these is the limited quantity available and the other is __________.
Answer_1: the lack of cooling effect on heated materials
Answer_2: it cannot be used in a dead ship situation without  electrical power available to the CO2 pump
Answer_3: it breaks down under extreme heat to form poisonous gases
Answer_4: there is no effect on a class "A" fire even in an enclosed  space

Question_Title: The maximum draft to which a MODU can legally be submerged  is indicated by the __________.

Answer_2: Raise the victim's head higher than his feet.
Answer_3: Press on the victim's lungs so that air pressure will blow  out any obstruction.
Answer_4: Re-tip the head and try again.

Question_Title: Why should passageway fires be fought from one end only?
Answer_1: This action will cause the passageway to become slippery and difficult for fire fighters to stand.
Answer_2: So that one hose team does not push the flames heat and smoke directly at the other hose team.
Answer_3: It is impossible for the fire main to handle two fully pressurized hoses.
Answer_4: So that the extinguishing water can be trapped at the end of the passageway.

Question_Title: Horizontal fore or aft motion of a vessel while underway is known as __________.
