Answer_3: the hose leak is securely wrapped
Answer_4: a drip pan is placed under the leak

Question_Title: After abandoning a vessel, water consumed within the first  24 hours __________.
Answer_1: will pass through the body with very little being absorbed  by the system
Answer_3: will quench thirst for only two hours

Question_Title: A fire extinguishing product produced by first mixing a foam concentrate with water to produce a foam solution, then mixing the foam solution with air is termed __________.

Answer_2: the control box glass is broken
Answer_3: pressure from the control cylinders is initially detected
Answer_4: the control cylinders have been completely discharged

Question_Title: Progressive flooding on a MODU is controlled by securing watertight boundaries and __________.

Answer_1: two hose teams should attack the fire from opposite directions
Answer_2: the fire should be attacked from above if possible
Answer_3: the fire should be attacked from one direction only
Answer_4: water must not be used if the passageway is above the metacentric height

Question_Title: Angular motion about the vertical axis of a vessel is known as __________.

Answer_1: notify the Coast Guard of a potential oil spill
Answer_2: reduce pumping pressure to reduce the leakage rate
Answer_3: spread absorbent material on deck beneath the leak
Answer_4: notify the terminal operator, then shutdown and repair the  leak

Question_Title: In the first 24 hours after abandoning a vessel, water should be given only to personnel who are __________.
Mechanical foam used for firefighting is produced by mechanically mixing and agitating __________.
Answer_3: foam chemical with air and water
Answer_4: bicarbonate soda with air and water

Question_Title: Spaces protected by a fixed CO2 system must be equipped with an alarm which is to sound __________.
Answer_1: for the first 20 seconds CO2 is being released into the space
Answer_2: for at least 20 seconds prior to release of CO2
Answer_3: during the entire period that CO2 is being released
Answer_4: if all doors and ventilation are not secured

Question_Title: What must be accurately determined to assess the potential  for progressive flooding after a MODU has been damaged?
Answer_1: The integrity of the watertight boundaries.

Question_Title: After you have put water on a burning mattress, and the fire appears to have been extinguished, you should then  __________.

Answer_2: make sure the fire is out with CO2
Answer_3: pull the mattress apart to ensure no fire remains
Answer_4: secure the mattress in a well ventilated area

Question_Title: When a vessel is floating upright, the distance from the keel to the metacenter is called the __________.

Answer_2: stop the fueling operation and correct the leak

Answer_4: notify the local port authority of a potential oil spill

Answer_1: passed around so all can drink

Answer_3: saved to be used at a later time

Question_Title: A safety outlet is provided on the CO2 discharge piping to  prevent __________.
Answer_1: overpressurization of the space being flooded

Question_Title: Which type of hull damage on a floating MODU should be repaired first?
Answer_3: Damage to or in the machinery rooms.

Question_Title: Which of the listed devices is required to be located on the discharge side of the pump in a fire main system?

Low velocity fog extinguishes a fire by __________.
In small angle stability, when external forces exist, the buoyant force is assumed to act vertically upwards through  the center of buoyancy and through the __________.
An oceangoing ship of 350 gross tons, contructed in January 1976, and not equipped with an oily water separator, may retain all bilge slops __________.

Answer_1: be safe if mixed with fresh water

Question_Title: Carbon dioxide cylinders must be recharged when the cylinder charge weight is less than what percent of the stamped full weight charge?

Answer_1: walked around until he is back to normal

Question_Title: A low velocity fog applicator is used in firefighting to __________.

Question_Title: 'GM' cannot be used as an indicator of stability at all angles of inclination because __________.

Answer_2: there is no "M" at large angles
Answer_3: "G" is not fixed at large angles
Answer_4: there is no "G" at large angles

Question_Title: The most frequent incidents of tanker pollution occurring during tanker operations is __________.

Answer_3: remove their lifejackets to prepare for the transfer
Answer_4: take in the sea anchor to prevent fouling of the rescue sling

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed must be used in conjunction with the portable in-line foam proportioner to produce foam?

Question_Title: The passive safety device installed on each Halon fire extinguishing cylinder, to prevent its overpressurization is called a __________.

Answer_1: It returns the MODU to an even keel.
Answer_3: It lowers the center of gravity.
Answer_4: It raises the center of gravity.

Question_Title: Each fire pump on a MODU must have a pressure gage located  __________.

Answer_1: ignore it and continue mouth-to-mouth ventilation
Answer_2: pause for a moment until the patient appears quiet again, then resume mouth-to-mouth ventilation
Answer_4: turn the patient's body to the side, sweep out the mouth and resume CPR

Question_Title: The horizontal distance between the vertical lines of action of gravity and the buoyant forces is called the __________.

Question_Title: Oil Pollution Regulations (33 CFR) require any transfer or  discharge of oil or oily mixtures to be recorded in the __________.

Answer_2: at the vessel whose attention you want to attract
Answer_4: at about 60 degrees above the horizon

Question_Title: Oil Pollution Regulations (33 CFR), require any transfer, or discharge of oil, or oily mixtures be recorded in the __________.

Answer_1: control flooding, control fire, repair structural damage

Answer_3: control fire, restore vital services, control flooding
Answer_4: control fire, control flooding, repair structural damage

Question_Title: Where multiple fire pumps are installed, they may be used for other purposes, provided that one pump is __________.
Answer_1: on line and in operation at all times to the fire main

Answer_3: capable of being quickly connected to the fire main with a  suitable pipe spool

Question_Title: In order to initiate CPR on a drowning victim, __________.
Answer_1: start chest compressions before the victim is removed from the water
Answer_2: drain water from the lungs before ventilating
Answer_4: do not tilt the head back since it may cause vomiting

Question_Title: Which of the listed firefighting agents and associated applications provide the largest shielding effect for the fire fighter?

Answer_1: Securing equipment against slipping or drifting.
Answer_2: Operating machinery at its recommended speed.
Answer_3: Repairing loose handles on tools before using.
Answer_4: Using tools for purposes for which they are not designed.

Question_Title: AMVER is a system which provides __________.
Inspection of a Halon fire extinguisher involves checking the hose, handle, nozzle, and __________.
Answer_4: the last date it was charged

Question_Title: Control of flooding on a MODU should be addressed __________.
On a MODU, a fire pump may be used for other purposes if __________.
Answer_1: the other services are run off a reducing station with pressure gage
Answer_2: a separate fire pump is available for use on the fire main
Answer_3: all other services are operated by a manifold near the pump
Answer_4: all of the above conditions are met

Question_Title: Which of the following is a correct statement with respect  to inserting an airway tube?
Answer_1: Only a trained person should attempt to insert an airway tube.
Answer_2: A size #2 airway tube is the correct size for an adult.
Answer_3: The airway tube will not damage the victim's throat.
Answer_4: Inserting the airway tube will prevent vomiting.

Question_Title: One of the uses for low velocity fog is to __________.
Answer_4: act as a heat shield to protect the fire fighter

Question_Title: The value of the maximum righting arm is dependent upon the position of the center of buoyancy and the __________.
Answer_4: vertical location of the center of gravity

Question_Title: Fire hydrant valves on a crude oil tanker shall be isolated from the crude oil washing system by __________.
If accidents are considered as an 'unexpected contact', you will be able to perform a better job by observing which of  the following practices?
The AMVER system for vessel in the Gulf of Mexico is administered by the __________.

Answer_1: put back in service if more than 50% of the charge remains

Question_Title: Which of the following must be eliminated to prevent accidents?

Answer_1: after control of fire, flooding, and structural repairs
Answer_2: immediately before emergency is under control
Answer_3: after control of fire, but before control of flooding

Question_Title: Antiseptics are used principally to __________.
Low velocity water fog is very effective in __________.
Answer_1: removing toxic fumes from the air
Answer_2: controlling the movement of burning oil
Answer_3: removing combustible vapors from the air
Answer_4: shielding fire fighters from the fire

Question_Title: A floating vessel will behave as if all of its weight is acting downward through the __________.
Fire extinguishers designated by the Roman numerals I and II are __________.
Combustible gas indicators measure the presence of  combustible gases as a percentage of the __________.
Which type of firefighting foam listed is supplied in both  3% and 6% concentrations?
What information can be obtained from a marine chemist's certificate issued to a fishing vessel?
Answer_1: The number of fire extinguishers required onboard.
Answer_2: The quality of fuel in the vessel's tanks
Answer_3: The tanks which are safe to enter when the certificate was issued

Question_Title: To turn over a liferaft that is floating upside down, you should pull on the __________.
Which of the following conditions can contribute to accidents?
A tourniquet should be used to control bleeding only __________.
Answer_2: when all other means have failed
Answer_4: to prevent bleeding from minor wounds

Question_Title: Low velocity water fog is used in firefighting as a __________.
The water in which a vessel floats provides vertical upward support.  The point through which this support is assumed to act is known as the center of __________.
Sufficient portable drive heads for a crude oil washing system must be provided in order to avoid one head being used during the tank washing procedure more than __________.
"Category 1"  EPIRB's transmit on frequencies that are monitored by __________.
Which of the following procedures is the generally accepted method of determining whether the atmosphere within a cargo tank is over rich, explosive, or too lean to support combustion?
Answer_1: Use the open flame test on a small sample that has been taken from the tank.
Answer_2: Send a gas sample ashore for laboratory analysis.
Answer_3: Enter the tank with a teledyne oxygen analyzer.

Question_Title: Which of the firefighting foams listed would require the mechanical mixing of air and foam concentrate?
If a ship is supported on the crest of a wave amidships, the vessel is subjected to __________.
If you have to abandon ship, and enter a liferaft, your main course of action should be to __________.
Answer_1: remain in the vicinity of the sinking vessel

Question_Title: A seaman has sustained a small, gaping laceration of the arm requiring sutures to close if medical facilities were available.  Which of the following remedies can be done to temporarily close the wound?
Answer_1: Wrap a tight bandage around the wound.
Answer_2: Gently close the wound and while holding it closed apply a  compression bandage.
Answer_3: Use temporary stitches of sail twine.
Answer_4: Apply butterfly strips and cover with a sterile dressing.

Question_Title: The master or person in charge of a MODU must record the date of each test of emergency lighting systems, power systems, the condition of each and the performance of the equipment __________.

Answer_4: geometric center of the displaced volume

Question_Title: To avoid excessive electrostatic effect in the crude oil washing process, due to the presence of water in the crude  oil washing fluid, the contents of any tank to be used as a source of crude oil for washing must first reduce a portion of the tank contents by a vertical height equal to  __________.
A fuel/air mixture below the lower explosive limit is too __________.
No outlet on a fire hydrant may point above the horizontal, in order to __________.
Aqueous film forming firefighting foam is also known as __________.
A vessel which is subjected to 'hogging' __________.
Answer_1: has its main deck under compressive stress
Answer_2: has its main deck plating under tensile stress
Answer_3: has its bottom plate under tensile stress
Answer_4: has its bottom plating under ductile stress

Question_Title: The sea painter of an inflatable liferaft should be __________.
Answer_2: faked out next to the case
Answer_3: secured to a permanent object on deck via a weak link

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions can be considered as the single greatest cause of accidents?
A continual change in the list, or trim of any floating MODU indicates __________.
When water fog is used as an extinguishing agent, the fire  is extinguished principally by the __________.
A person reports to you with a fishhook in their thumb.  The accepted procedure for removing it should be to __________.
Answer_2: cut the skin from around the hook
Answer_3: push the barb through, cut it off, and then remove the hook

Question_Title: Water ballast placed in a tank that has been crude oil washed, but not water rinsed, shall be regarded as __________.
At all angles of inclination the metacenter is located __________.
Answer_1: vertically above the center of buoyancy
Answer_2: vertically above the center of gravity
Answer_3: at the intersection of the upright vertical centerline and  the line of action of the buoyant force
Answer_4: geometric center of the underwater volume

Question_Title: The fire hydrant outlet may be positioned from the horizontal to any position pointing __________.
To prevent oily rags from  spontaneously igniting they should be __________.
A vessel is subjected to 'hogging' when it __________.
Answer_1: has its main deck under compressive stress
Answer_2: has its bottom plating under tensile stress
Answer_3: is supported on a wave whose crests are at the bow and stern
Answer_4: is supported on a wave whose crest is amidships

Question_Title: Which of the actions listed and instituted on your part will have the greatest lasting effect on the crew with respect to safety?
Answer_2: Showing video tapes of actual accidents
Answer_3: Incorporating safety practices in daily routine

Question_Title: A person has suffered a laceration of the arm.  Severe bleeding has been controlled by using a sterile dressing and direct pressure.  Which of the following actions should be  taken next?
Answer_1: Apply a tourniquet to prevent the bleeding from restarting.
Answer_2: Apply a pressure bandage over the dressing.
Answer_3: Remove any small foreign matter and apply antiseptic.
Answer_4: Administer fluids to assist the body in replacing the lost  blood.

Question_Title: Water fog is an effective fire extinguishing agent because  it __________.
Answer_2: will completely remove toxic fumes from the air
Answer_3: will completely remove combustible vapors from the air
Answer_4: does not leave a harmful residue on electrical machinery

Question_Title: With regards to the metacentric height, which of the following statements is true?
Answer_1: It is used to indicate the quality of initial stability.
Answer_2: It is located below the center of buoyancy.
Answer_3: It is measured vertically above the center of buoyancy.
Answer_4: Its determination is the objective of the inclining experiment.

Question_Title: At which of the listed tank locations should you obtain oxygen content readings prior to tank washing?
Answer_1: At the hatch coaming and tank bottom.
Answer_2: At the hatch coaming and middle of the tank.
Answer_3: At the middle and bottom of the tank.
Answer_4: At the center of the ullage and one meter below deck.

Question_Title: When a floating MODU inclines to an angle slightly greater  than the angle of loll, it will __________.

Question_Title: Paints and solvents used aboard a vessel should be  __________.
Answer_1: stowed safely at the work site until work is completed
Answer_2: returned to the paint locker after each use
Answer_3: covered with a fine mesh screen to protect from ignition sources
Answer_4: continuously kept in closed containers at all times

Question_Title: What information can be obtained from a marine chemist's certificate issued to a fishing vessel?
Answer_1: The number of fire extinguishers required onboard.
Answer_2: The quality of fuel in the vessel's tanks
Answer_3: The tanks which were safe to enter when the certificate was issued

Question_Title: The primary function of an automatic sprinkler system is to __________.
Answer_1: instantaneously extinguish the fire which triggered it
Answer_2: limit the spread of the fire and control the amount of heat produced
Answer_3: protect people in the areas which have had sprinkler heads  installed
Answer_4: alert the crew to the fire

Question_Title: The best information on the nature and extent of damage on a MODU is obtained from __________.

Question_Title: In all but the most severe cases, bleeding from a wound should be controlled by __________.
Answer_2: submerging the wound in lukewarm water

Question_Title: Which of the following fire extinguishing agents has the greatest capacity for heat absorption?

Answer_2: when loaded with minimum deck load

Question_Title: The term "arrival ballast" refers to __________.
Answer_4: any form of sea water ballast

Question_Title: The volume of a floating MODU above the waterline that can  be made watertight is its __________.
Damage stability of a MODU is the stability __________.
Answer_1: which exists when the wind speed is less than 50 knots

Question_Title: Good housekeeping on a vessel prevents fires by __________.
Answer_1: allowing better access in an emergency

Question_Title: Overhauling a fire in the living quarters on a vessel must  include __________.
Answer_1: opening dead spaces to check for fire or lingering  sources of heat

Question_Title: Which of the following must be carried out in order to launch and inflate an inflatable liferaft?

Answer_2: Push on the hydrostatic release, pull on the sea painter.
Answer_3: Push on the hydrostatic release, push on the sea painter.
Answer_4: Pull on the hydrostatic release, push on the sea painter.

Question_Title: According to 46 CFR Part 108, when fire pumps are used for purposes other than firefighting service, each pipe connection to the other service (except for branch lines used for deck washing) must have a __________.
Answer_1: check valve installed in the line
Answer_2: shut off valve at a manifold near the pump
Answer_3: quick disconnect union within ten feet of the pump

Question_Title: Bleeding from a vein may ordinarily be controlled by __________.

Answer_3: pouring ice water directly onto the wound

Answer_1: alternate expansion and contraction as water in liquid state becomes vapor
Answer_2: absorb smoke and gases as water is converted from liquid to vapor
Answer_3: rapidly contract as water is converted from a liquid to a  vapor
Answer_4: vaporize and rapidly expand as water absorbs heat

Question_Title: Which of the listed initials is used to represent the indicator of initial stability?

The stability existing after the unintentional flooding of a compartment on a MODU is called __________.

Answer_1: use all CO2 available to cool the surrounding area

Answer_3: thoroughly ventilate the space of CO2

Question_Title: Which of the following must be carried out in order to manually launch an inflatable liferaft not designed for float-free operation?
Answer_1: It will be easily launched by simply breaking the weak link.
Answer_3: It is easily launched by cutting the container securing straps.
Answer_4: It is only necessary to attach the weak link to the vessel.

Question_Title: A fire main system must have enough fire hydrants for each  accessible space to be reached with __________.
Answer_2: a water spray or solid stream
Answer_3: at least two spray patterns of water

Question_Title: The preferred method of controlling external bleeding is by __________.
Answer_1: applying direct pressure on the wound
Answer_3: applying pressure on a pressure point
Answer_4: applying a tourniquet above the wound

Question_Title: When compared to other fire extinguishing agents, water fog __________.
Answer_1: has the greatest ability to produce foam
Answer_3: will completely remove toxic fumes from the air
Answer_4: will completely remove combustible vapors from the air

Question_Title: The quality of initial stability is indicated by __________.

Forces within a mobile offshore drilling unit have caused a difference between the starboard and port drafts.  This difference is __________.

Answer_1: Shut off the power or remove the wire from the person.
Answer_4: Leave the accident scene and summon medical assistance.

Question_Title: An initial attempt to extinguish a galley grease fire may be made by using __________.

Answer_1: Connect the stainless steel link (float free link) to the vessel.
Answer_2: Pull the line (painter) from the container and make it fast to the cleat provided.
Answer_4: Remove the raft from the container to permit complete inflation.

Question_Title: The size of the fire hydrant hose connections must be either 1 1/2 inches or __________.

Answer_1: have the patient lie down and cover the wound when the bleeding stops
Answer_2: stop the bleeding, clean, medicate, and cover the wound
Answer_3: apply an ice pack to the wound and cover it when the bleeding stops
Answer_4: apply a hot towel to purge the wound, then medicate and cover it

Question_Title: Water applied as a 'fog' can be more effective than water applied as a 'solid stream', because __________.

Answer_3: it does not have to hit the seat of fire to be effective

Question_Title: The stability term for the distance between the center of gravity (G) to the Metacenter (M), when small angle stability applies is known as the __________.

Question_Title: Each fire hydrant serving the machinery spaces of a MODU containing oil fired boilers, internal combustion machinery, or fuel oil units, must be equipped with a __________.

Answer_1: leave the door and vents open, but release the CO2 flooding system

Answer_3: enter and use a portable extinguisher
Answer_4: secure the door and vents, then manually release the CO2

Question_Title: Each fire hose coupling on a MODU must have threads to meet the specifications of the __________.

Bleeding from a vein can be characterized as __________.
On a MODU, size I and II fire extinguishers are considered  ____________,
The upward force of displaced water is known as __________.
On a MODU, a fire extinguisher charged with 15 pounds of CO2 or 10 pounds of dry chemical is a size __________.
Although 'KG' for a MODU in a lightweight condition is relatively high, the vessel is stiff because __________.

Answer_2: cause an increase in the righting arm
Answer_3: bring the unit to an upright equilibrium position
Answer_4: cause the unit to flop to a greater angle

Question_Title: Fire extinguishers of the sizes  designated by III, IV, and V are considered __________.
After extinguishing a paint locker fire using the fixed CO2 system, the next immediate action is for the space to be __________.
Answer_2: left closed with vents off until all boundaries are cool
Answer_3: checked for the proper oxygen level
Answer_4: opened and doused with water to prevent reflash

Question_Title: Control valves for a CO2 fire extinguishing system may be located within the protected space when __________.
Answer_1: it is impractical to locate them outside
Answer_2: there is also a control valve outside
Answer_3: the CO2 cylinders are also in the space
Answer_4: an automatic heat sensing trip is installed

Question_Title: The primary danger in helicopter fires occurring on a MODU  is __________.
Answer_1: burning jet fuel running into the quarters or other areas

Question_Title: Blood flowing from a cut artery would appear __________.
Answer_1: dark red with a steady flow
Answer_2: bright red with a steady flow

Question_Title: One of the main concerns when fighting a galley fire is __________.
Answer_2: spreading of fire through the engineering space
Answer_4: the igniting of a grease fire in the range hood ventilation  system

Question_Title: The important initial stability parameter 'GM' is the __________.
Answer_2: height of the metacenter above the keel
Answer_3: height of the center of buoyancy above the keel
Answer_4: height of the center of gravity above the keel

Question_Title: On a MODU, a fire drill shall be conducted once every __________.

Answer_2: righting moment equals the wind heeling moment

Question_Title: If the cause of severe list, or trim is due to off-center ballast, counterflooding into empty tanks will __________.
As a firefighting medium, CO2 can be dangerous under certain conditions as it can cause __________.

Answer_1: Each fire pump is to be started.

Answer_4: An inspection and inventory of fire hoses is to be made.

Question_Title: As a last resort, a tourniquet can be used to __________.
Answer_1: hold a victim in a stretcher
Answer_3: hold a large bandage in place

Question_Title: The important stability parameter 'KG' is defined as the __________.
Answer_2: height of the metacenter above the keel
Answer_3: height of the center of buoyancy above the keel
Answer_4: height of the center of gravity above the keel

Question_Title: On a MODU, watertight doors should be operated __________.
Answer_4: when the rig is being moved

Question_Title: A quick and rapid motion of a MODU in a seaway is an indication of __________.

Question_Title: If the alarm provided in the fixed CO2 system sounds in the engine room, you should __________.
Answer_3: make certain that the CO2 starts flowing into the space

Answer_1: put back in service if some CO2 remains

Question_Title: You are preparing to administer closed chest cardiac massage on a victim of electric shock.  Which of the following actions is NOT a recommended procedure?

Question_Title: A person suffering from possible broken bones and internal  injuries should __________.
Answer_2: be examined then walked to a bunk

Answer_4: not be allowed to lie down where injured but moved to a chair or bunk

Question_Title: The object of plugging holes below the waterline on a MODU  should be to __________.

Question_Title: Which abbreviation represents the height of the center of buoyancy?

Answer_1: determine the cause before taking countermeasures

Answer_3: counterflood on the side opposite the list or trim
Answer_4: assume the cause is environmental forces

Question_Title: What is the function of the small gas accumulator cylinder  attached to the discharge piping of the engine room fixed CO2 system?

Answer_4: It controls the rate of discharge of carbon dioxide into the engine room.

Question_Title: When patching holes in the hull of a MODU, pillows, bedding, and other soft materials can be used as __________.

Answer_3: discharging a small amount of CO2

Question_Title: A fire pump used on a MODU requires 175 psi discharge pressure to maintain the required 50 psi pitot tube pressure at the two highest hydrants.  The maximum pressure setting  for this installation relief valve is __________.
What is the primary purpose for applying a splint in first aid?

Answer_2: a mechanism which filters and purifies crude oil

Answer_4: a cleanup for pump room bilges

Question_Title: The abbreviation 'GM' is used to represent the __________.

Answer_1: visually checking to see that CO2 is discharging through the piping

Answer_3: listening for the sound of the warning siren

Question_Title: Repair of structures on a MODU in the vicinity of liquid mud handling areas presents which of the possible listed hazards?
Answer_3: Liquid muds may flood adjoining spaces.

Question_Title: A CO2 fire extinguisher provided aboard a MODU has lost 10% of its charge.  It now must be __________.

Answer_4: alternately apply hot and cold compresses

Question_Title: When shoring a damaged bulkhead on a MODU, any effort should be taken to spread the pressure over the __________.

Answer_2: secure all mechanical ventilation in the protected space
Answer_3: sound the general alarm signal for a fire
Answer_4: sound an alarm in the ballast control room

Answer_2: CO2 releasing valve and actuate the alarm
Answer_3: control valve, then open the CO2 releasing valve
Answer_4: control valve, then shut off the engine room ventilation

Answer_2: reducing the level of drill water from the storage tanks

Answer_3: which is accompanied by internal bleeding
Answer_4: which causes external bleeding at the site of the fracture

Answer_4: in all of the above locations

Answer_4: A reduced KG caused by water filling the compartment

Question_Title: In the event of a fire, automatic activation of a fixed CO2 extinguishing system can result in which of the following areas?

Answer_2: It is recommended for use on fires in main propulsion electric motors.
Answer_3: It is formed as a result of the rapid mixing of foam liquid, water, and air.
Answer_4: It is useful in fighting only chemical fires.

Answer_1: cooling the outside bulkheads with water

Answer_4: foam directed against the side of the vessel

Answer_2: instructions for lowering the survival capsule

Answer_3: sweeping the fire before you with the foam

Question_Title: On a MODU, size "III", 'IV', and "V" fire extinguishers are considered __________.

Question_Title: Semi-portable fire extinguishers used on MODUs are of the  sizes __________.

Question_Title: A 'class B' fire is extinguished using foam by __________.

Question_Title: Flooding of any compartment in a ship, resulting in a serious loss of reserve buoyancy, will always __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following treatments is used for traumatic shock?

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is a symptom of a person  in shock?

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is NOT a symptom of traumatic shock?
Extinguishing an oil fire when using foam is a result of __________.
The lowest temperature at which the vapor formed from a liquid ignites in the presence of an ignition source and continues to burn steadily is called the ________.
Fire and lifeboat stations are required to be listed on the __________.
If the result of loading a MODU is an increase in the height of the center of gravity, there will always be an increase in the __________.
Onboard mobile offshore drilling units, the key to the most rapid and effective response to a man overboard situation is __________.
If a vessel loses its reserve buoyancy, it will __________.
Answer_1: float upright with the main deck awash
Answer_2: capsize and float on its side
Answer_3: remain unaffected if the hull remains intact

Question_Title: Which type of respiratory protection is preferable for the  repair/investigation personnel in a hydrogen sulfide (H2S) environment?
Which of the following procedures is always recommended in  the rescue of an unconscious person from a compartment containing an unsafe atmosphere?
Answer_1: Have the rescuers wear an approved self-contained breathing apparatus.
Answer_2: Have the rescuers carry in a stokes basket for the victim.
Answer_3: Have the rescuer carry an emergency first aid kit for the victim.
Answer_4: Have the rescuers carry a combustible gas analyzer.

Question_Title: When treating a person for shock, you should wrap the victim in warm coverings to __________.
Answer_3: avoid self-inflicted wounds caused by spastic movement
Answer_4: protect the person from injury during transportation

Question_Title: When using mechanical foam to fight a bilge fire, the stream of foam is most effective when directed __________.
Reducing the free surface of a liquid within a tank has the effect of lowering the __________.
Answer_2: virtual height of the center of gravity

Question_Title: Since accumulations of hydrogen sulfide gas on a MODU can be dangerous to personnel, it is important to know that this gas is __________.
Answer_3: a yellow gas that is easily recognized

Question_Title: The purpose of the inclining experiment on a MODU is to determine __________.
Answer_1: lightweight and lightweight center of gravity location
Answer_2: the position of the center of buoyancy

Question_Title: A person who observes an individual fall overboard from a MODU should __________.
Answer_1: immediately jump into the water to assist the individual
Answer_2: call for help and keep the individual in sight
Answer_3: run to the radio room to send an emergency message
Answer_4: go to the control room for the distress flares

Question_Title: The reserve buoyancy of a vessel varies directly with changes in the vessel's __________.
The sense of smell cannot be depended upon to detect hydrogen sulfide because __________.
Answer_1: it has a smell similar to petroleum products
Answer_2: the gas is odorless in any concentration
Answer_3: of paralysis to the olfactory nerves
Answer_4: it is better to rely on eye irritation as a detector

Question_Title: Which of the following is NOT a mandatory requirement part  of the shipboard oil pollution emergency plan?
The fundamental treatment for preventing traumatic shock following an accident is to __________.
Answer_1: have the victim exercise to increase circulation
Answer_3: keep the victim warm and dry while lying down
Answer_4: apply ice packs and avoid excitement

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF) is correct?
Answer_1: AFFF can be used effectively on live electrical equipment.
Answer_2: AFFF can be used to extinguish combustible metal fires.
Answer_3: AFFF may be used in a joint attack with dry chemical.
Answer_4: AFFF is an effective chain breaking agent similar to Halon.

Question_Title: Increasing the free surface of a confined liquid has the effect of raising the __________.
Answer_2: virtual height of the center of gravity

Question_Title: High concentrations of hydrogen sulfide gas are most dangerous to personnel because they can __________.
The effects of free surface on initial stability depend upon the surface area dimensions of the free liquids and the __________.
Answer_1: volume of liquid in the tank
Answer_2: volume of displacement of the MODU
Answer_3: location of the tank in the MODU
Answer_4: height of the center of gravity of the MODU

Question_Title: When the wave period and the apparent rolling period of the MODU are the same, __________.

The fire alarm signal onboard United States flag merchant vessels is a continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less than 10 seconds, supplemented by the continuous ringing of the general alarm bells for not less than 10 seconds.  Where can this information be readily found aboard ship?
The reserve buoyancy of a ship consists of __________.
Answer_1: the void portion of the ship below the waterline which is enclosed and watertight
Answer_2: all cofferdams, double bottoms, and wing tanks that are slack
Answer_3: the part of the enclosed and watertight portion of a vessel above the waterline
Answer_4: the percentage of the volume of a compartment which can be  occupied by water if flooded

Question_Title: The worst atmospheric condition for dispersion of hydrogen  sulfide is __________.
Answer_3: nearly calm, clear nights or early morning

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the actions of a properly organized rescue party for removing an unconscious victim from a tank containing toxic vapors?
Answer_1: The victim should not be moved until the extent of his injuries is determined.
Answer_2: The victim should be fitted with a canister type OBA as soon as possible.
Answer_3: The rescue party should provide the victim with oxygen or fresh air immediately.
Answer_4: The tank vapors should be tested with an explosimeter before personnel enter.

Question_Title: After an accident, the victim may go into shock and die. Which of the following actions should be taken to help prevent shock?
Answer_1: Slightly elevate the head and feet.
Answer_3: Keep the person lying down and at a comfortable temperature.
Answer_4: Give the person a stimulant to increase blood flow.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF)?
Answer_1: The agent cannot be used in conjunction with dry chemicals.
Answer_2: AFFF can only be produced from fresh water.
Answer_3: Because AFFF works through surface tension, it cannot be broken up if it is agitated.
Answer_4: AFFF controls the vaporization of flammable liquids by means of a water film.

Question_Title: Reducing the free surfaces within a vessel, reduces the __________.
Answer_4: uncorrected height of the center of gravity

Question_Title: The airborne concentrations of substances (such as  hydrogen sulfide) under which nearly all workers may be repeatedly exposed without adverse effects are called __________.
The free surface effects of a partially filled liquid tank  decrease with increased __________.
Answer_2: placement of the tank above the keel
Answer_4: size of the surface area in the tank

Question_Title: Why is an upper limit switch used when raising the lifeboat?
Answer_1: To prevent the davits from pulling up against the stops.
Answer_2: To assist in cranking in the lifeboat.
Answer_3: To keep the tricing lines from releasing or getting tangled.
Answer_4: To stop the lifeboat from being lowered.

Question_Title: The empty weight of a '100 pound' (45.4 kg) cylinder in a fixed CO2 system is 130 pounds (58.9 kg).  What is the minimum acceptable total weight of the cylinder before recharging is required?
Locations on a MODU, where flammable hydrocarbon gas or vapors may accumulate due to drilling operations, are defined as __________.
The minimum concentration of hydrogen sulfide that can result in death if a person is exposed for even an instant  is __________.
While you are fighting a fire in a smoke-filled compartment one of your shipmates falls sustaining a severe laceration  and ceases breathing.  Your FIRST response should be to __________.
If there is no head injury, extreme physical discomfort or  difficulty in breathing, a patient in shock should be placed in which of the positions listed?
Answer_3: Flat on back with head and feet at the same level

Question_Title: Which of the listed firefighting agents produces a buoyant  blanket to separate the burning vapors from air?
A stiff wind has caused a difference to occur between the port and starboard drafts.  This condition is known as __________.
The maximum concentration of hydrogen sulfide to which workers may be regularly exposed without adverse effects is __________.
The free surface corrections depend upon the surface area of the free liquids and the __________.
Answer_1: volume of liquid in the tank
Answer_3: location of the tank in the MODU
Answer_4: height of the center of gravity of the MODU

Question_Title: To determine the number of portable fire extinguishers required on a mobile offshore drilling unit, you should check the __________.
Answer_3: Safety of Life at Sea Certificate

Question_Title: When the engine room fixed CO2 system is activated, which of the following actions should be taken FIRST if the automatic fuel oil and ventilation shutoffs have failed to operate?
Answer_1: Manually operate the remote shutdown controls.
Answer_2: Activate an additional CO2 bottle to increase pressure on the pressure switch plunger.
Answer_3: Send someone down to manually secure the fuel oil pumps and ventilation fans.
Answer_4: Discharge extra carbon dioxide into the engine room.

Question_Title: Which of the following is a mandatory section of the shipboard oil pollution emergency plan?
Answer_4: list of individuals required to respond

Question_Title: The lethal concentration of hydrogen sulfide that will result in death with short-term exposure is a minimum of __________.
The recommended equipment for a pumproom rescue aboard a tank vessel is a lifeline, harness, and breathing apparatus. The lifeline should be __________.
Answer_2: a minimum of two inch line
Answer_3: longer than twice the depth of the pumproom
Answer_4: led through a two sheave block

Question_Title: The major cause of shock in burn victims is __________.
Answer_3: increase in body temperature and pulse rate
Answer_4: massive loss of fluid through the burned area

Question_Title: Firefighting foam is only effective when the foam __________.
Answer_1: penetrates to the bottom of the fire
Answer_2: is kept saturated with low velocity water fog
Answer_3: mixes with the burning fuel oil
Answer_4: completely covers the top of the burning liquid

Question_Title: The difference between the initial trim of a vessel and the trim after a change in load has occurred is known as __________.

If hydrogen sulfide exposure is anticipated, fixed  monitoring devices aboard a MODU should have a low level concentration alarm to alert personnel when concentrations  of this gas first reach a maximum of __________.
The free surface effects of a partially filled tank in a floating MODU, increase with the __________.
Answer_1: surface area of the fluid in the tank
Answer_4: height of the tank above the keel

Question_Title: Which of the following is NOT required to be provided as part of the appendixes of the Shipboard Oil Pollution Emergency Plan?
Answer_1: a list of agencies or officials of Coastal State administrations responsible for receiving and processing incident reports
Answer_2: a list of agencies or officials in regularly visited ports.
Answer_3: a list which specifies who will be responsible for informing the parties listed and the priority in which they must be notified.
Answer_4: a list of personnel duty assignments

Question_Title: Which of the listed fixed fire extinguishing systems is most effective for use in the cargo holds?
If a fixed foam firefighting system on a MODU is not of the premix type, a sample of the foam liquid must be tested by  __________.
Answer_2: the safety man aboard the unit
Answer_3: the designated person-in-charge of the unit
Answer_4: the manufacturer, or his authorized representative

Question_Title: When hydrogen sulfide has been encountered on a MODU, or is anticipated, monitoring devices must sound an alarm (differing from the lower concentration alarm) or otherwise warn employees when the concentration of the gas reaches or exceeds how many parts per million?
All fire hoses on a mobile offshore drilling units must be  tested to a pressure of at least __________.
A crew member has suffered a burn on the arm.  There is extensive damage to the skin with charring present.  This is an example of what kind of burn?
When fighting a fire on deck with foam, you should __________.
Answer_1: play the foam stream directly on the burning oil
Answer_2: play the foam stream off nearby vertical vessel structures
Answer_3: only use the foam on flowing liquids
Answer_4: play the foam stream on the base of the fire with whirling  motion

Question_Title: The difference between the starboard and port drafts due to wind or seas is called __________.
When hydrogen sulfide is burned (flared) on a MODU, which of the following conditions can be expected to occur?
Answer_1: All of the hydrogen sulfide will be converted to sulfur dioxide.
Answer_2: All of the hydrogen sulfide will be converted to hydrogen and free sulphur.
Answer_3: Only 80% of the hydrogen sulfide will be converted to sulfur dioxide or free sulphur.
Answer_4: The hydrogen sulfide not converted will not be dangerous.

Question_Title: When the floating MODU inclines to an angle slightly less than the angle of loll, it will __________.
Answer_4: return to the angle of loll

Question_Title: A weathertight door on a MODU must not allow water to penetrate into the unit __________.
Any firefighting equipment carried in addition to the minimum requirements on a MODU must __________.
Answer_3: be stowed in a separate area

Question_Title: On a MODU, the possibility of a blowout makes which type of diesel engine shutdown desirable?
Individuals who have consumed alcohol within 24 hours of exposure to H2S can tolerate __________.
Answer_2: smaller than normal concentrations of H2S
Answer_3: moderate concentrations of H2S without the usual reactions

Question_Title: The instructions for launching lifeboats and liferafts on a MODU must be approved by the __________.
A man has suffered a burn on his arm characterized by reddening of the skin, blistering, and swelling.  This is an example of what kind of burn?
When a fire occurs in a ruptured oil cargo tank, caused by  an explosion or collision, the best firefighting agent to use is __________.
The distance between the bottom of the hull and the waterline is called __________.
Which of the following machinery space operations is required to be logged in the Oil Record Book?
Answer_1: Ballasting or cleaning of fuel oil tanks.
Answer_2: Shifting suction of main fuel pump to reserve fuel oil tank.
Answer_3: Changing out sprayer plates to adjust for steam demand.
Answer_4: Daily inspection of engine room bilges.

Question_Title: In firefighting, the term 'protecting exposures' means __________.
Answer_1: protecting fire fighters from direct exposure to the heat of the fire
Answer_2: keeping flames from burning at the tank vents
Answer_3: protecting exposed areas of the superstructure from flames
Answer_4: taking measures to prevent the spread of fire from the involved compartment to an adjacent compartment

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed below is designed to prevent flames from entering through fuel tank vents?
Requirements for hydrogen sulfide preparation and equipment usage aboard MODUs in U.S. offshore waters are administered by the __________.
Where are self-closing doors required on a MODU?
Part of the required equipment for a lifeboat includes __________.
What is the percentage of oxygen in a typical sample of uncontaminated air?
A man has suffered a burn on the arm.  There is a reddening of the skin but no other apparent damage.  This is an example of what kind of burn?
Chemical foam is most suitable for use on a fire involving  __________.
For an upright vessel, draft is the vertical distance between the keel and the __________.
If a mixture containing air and a concentration of flammable vapor, is capable of ignition when exposed to a spark or other source of ignition,  it is said to be  __________.
Fuel oil tank vents must be fitted with corrosion resistant screens to prevent __________.
Clean air standards, referred to as 'Grade D', apply to compressed air for use in __________.
Each ventilation system for an enclosed classified location on a MODU must provide a complete change of air every __________.
Which of the following statements is true regarding the operational testing and inspecting of a cargo vessel's lifesaving equipment by the ship's force?
Answer_1: On all vessels, regardless of voyage duration, the entire steering gear, whistle, and bridge-engine room communication systems must be tested within 12 hours of departure.
Answer_2: All emergency lighting and power systems, regardless of source, must be operated and tested at least once each week under load for at least 2 hours.
Answer_3: Where motor-propelled lifeboats are carried, regardless of length or person capacity, each lifeboat motor must be operated ahead and astern at least 3 minutes once a week.

Question_Title: First, second, and third degree burns are classified according to __________.
Answer_2: source of heat causing the burn

Question_Title: Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF), commonly known as 'light water', is especially suitable for fighting  __________.
Answer_1: oil fires in the engine room bilges
Answer_2: class B fires in paint lockers

Question_Title: After transferring a weight forward on a vessel, the draft  at the center of flotation will __________.
Answer_1: change, depending on the location of the LCG

Question_Title: The Oil Record Book must be maintained onboard the vessel for __________.
Answer_1: not less than 3 years and be readily available for  inspection
Answer_2: 6 months and then submitted to the nearest Marine Safety Office for review
Answer_4: the duration of the ship's active employment

Question_Title: The Upper Explosive Limit (UEL) of a mixture of flammable vapors and air, is defined as __________.
Answer_1: the concentration above which just enough flammable vapor exists to produce an explosion
Answer_2: the concentration above which the mixture is too rich to burn
Answer_3: the percentage of flammable vapor by volume in the air sufficient to create an explosion
Answer_4: the percentage of oxygen present in the air sufficient to support combustion

Question_Title: Fuel oil tank vents are fitted with corrosion resistant screens to prevent __________.
Answer_1: flames entering through the tank vent

Question_Title: On a MODU, if there is a probability of encountering hydrogen sulfide during the drilling of a well, air movers  (bug blowers) should be installed to dilute the concentration of gas at the __________.
The approval period for a shipboard oil pollution emergency plan expires after __________.

For hydrogen sulfide detection, sensitized tapes indicate the presence of this gas by means of discoloration of an exposed spot on the tape.  The shade of the color on the spot depends upon the concentration of the gas and  __________.
When treating a person for third degree burns, you should __________.
Answer_1: submerge the burn area in cold water
Answer_2: make the person stand up and walk to increase circulation
Answer_3: cover the burns with thick sterile dressing
Answer_4: break blisters and remove dead tissue

Question_Title: The average of the observed drafts is known as __________.
Answer_4: draft at the center of flotation

Question_Title: U.S. flag ships may obtain an Oil Record Book from the __________.
A fire is considered 'under control' when __________.
Answer_1: all hands are at their fire stations
Answer_2: all firefighting equipment is at the scene
Answer_4: the fire is contained and no longer spreading

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is designed to prevent flames from entering through fuel tank vents?
The hand brake of a lifeboat winch is __________.
Answer_1: manually disengaged when hoisting a boat
Answer_2: applied by dropping the counterweighted lever
Answer_3: controlled by the centrifugal brake mechanism
Answer_4: automatically engaged if lowering speed is excessive

Question_Title: Each hose in the fuel transfer system for helicopter refueling must meet the standards of the __________.
Each hose in the fuel transfer system for helicopter refueling must have a __________.
The centrifugal brake mechanism incorporated in a lifeboat  handling winch is intended to __________.
Answer_1: automatically stop the boat if electric power fails
Answer_2: mechanically stop the boat when the hand brake fails
Answer_3: hold the load suspended during lowering operations
Answer_4: automatically control the speed of lowering by gravity

Question_Title: For small first degree burns the quickest method to relieve pain is to __________.
Answer_1: immerse the burn in cold water
Answer_4: apply a bandage to exclude air

Question_Title: A cutoff valve in the fire main system of a MODU may be closed to protect a portion of the system on an exposed deck from __________.
Answer_3: accidental diversion of flow to wrong location

Question_Title: When flooding occurs in a damaged vessel, reserve buoyancy __________.
Which of the following gases is the most dangerous to personnel safety in confined atmospheres, as it is absorbed by the blood 300 times more quickly than oxygen?
The vertical distance between "G" and "M" of a MODU is used as a measure of __________.
Answer_1: stability at all angles of inclination
Answer_3: stability at angles less than the limit of positive stability
Answer_4: stability at angle less than the downflooding angle

Question_Title: A device for preventing sparks or flames from entering a tank, while permitting the free passage of gases is called a  __________.
A shipboard oil pollution emergency plan is required of __________.
Answer_1: all vessels, regardless of size and commercial application
Answer_2: any barge or other ship which is constructed or operated in such a manner that no oil in any form can be carried aboard
Answer_3: an oil tanker of 150 gross tons or above, or other ship of  400 gross tons or above
Answer_4: an oil tanker of 400 gross tons and above, or other ships of 150 gross tons and above

Question_Title: For a MODU not on an international voyage, an approved substitute for an impulse projected rocket type line throwing appliance is a __________.
Each liferaft container without an indicated maximum stowage height must be stowed at a height not more than __________.
Answer_3: indicated on the vessels certificate of inspection
Answer_4: required by the vessels Muster List ("Station Bill")

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft should be lifted back aboard the ship by using __________.
Answer_1: the single hook at the top of the raft
Answer_2: two lines passed under the raft

Question_Title: A victim has suffered a second degree burn to a small area  of the lower arm.  Which of the following statements represents the proper treatment for this injury?
Answer_1: Immerse the arm in cold water for 1 to 2 hours, apply burn  ointment, and bandage.
Answer_2: Open any blisters with a sterile needle, apply burn ointment, and bandage.
Answer_3: Apply burn ointment, remove any foreign material, and insure that nothing is in contact with the burn.
Answer_4: Immerse the arm in cold water for 1 to 2 hours, open any blister, and apply burn ointment.

Question_Title: Of the required ring life buoys for a MODU, how many must be equipped with a waterlight?
Reserve buoyancy is the __________.
Answer_2: volume of intact space above the waterline
Answer_3: excess of the buoyant force over gravitational force
Answer_4: difference between buoyancy in salt and fresh waters

Question_Title: When making entries in the Oil Record Book, the date, operational code, and item number shall be inserted in the  appropriate columns.  Futhermore, the required particulars  shall be __________.
Answer_1: recorded only for accidental oil discharges
Answer_2: recorded only for operations involving discharge of oily waste
Answer_3: signed by the oiler who enters them in the Oil Record Book
Answer_4: recorded chronologically in the blank space

Question_Title: Adding the transverse free surface correction to the uncorrected height of the center of gravity of a MODU yields __________.
A fine mesh wire screen is fitted to tank vent pipes to prevent __________.
Answer_1: passage of flames into the tank
Answer_2: entry of rodents into the tank
Answer_3: debris stopping up the vent pipe
Answer_4: embers from a fire entering the tank

Question_Title: Which of the toxic gases listed is a product of incomplete  combustion, and is often present when a fire burns in a closed compartment?
On a MODU, how many ring buoys are required to have a buoyant line attached?
Answer_2: One ring life buoy on each side of the MODU.
Answer_4: Two ring life buoys on each side of the MODU.

Question_Title: What is the minimum required number of ring life buoys on a MODU?
Spontaneous combustion is most likely to occur in __________.
Surface burns should first be treated by __________.
Answer_1: washing the area with a warm soap and water solution
Answer_2: flooding, bathing, or immersing the area in cold water
Answer_3: covering the area with talcum power and bandaging tightly
Answer_4: leaving them exposed to the atmosphere

Question_Title: The difference between the average of the forward and aft drafts is __________.
Each fireman's outfit and its spare equipment on a MODU must be stowed __________.
Answer_1: in a locked cabinet in the machinery space
Answer_2: in an unlocked cabinet in the machinery space
Answer_3: in a separate and accessible location

Question_Title: Adding the longitudinal free surface correction to the uncorrected height of the center of gravity of a MODU yields __________.
Why are flame screens an important safety device?
Answer_1: They provide a 'dead air space' within a fuel tank.
Answer_2: They accelerate the dispersal of fuel vapors.
Answer_3: They prevent the passage of flames from or into closed spaces.
Answer_4: They smother flames once a fire has been started.

Question_Title: The spread of fire can be prevented by __________.
Answer_1: cooling surfaces adjacent to the fire
Answer_2: removing combustibles from the endangered area

Question_Title: A branch line valve of a fixed fire extinguishing system on a MODU must be marked with the __________.
Answer_1: maximum pressure allowed at that branch
Answer_2: name of the space or spaces which it serves
Answer_3: date of the last maintenance inspection
Answer_4: pressure needed to maintain an effective stream at that point

Question_Title: Most fire and explosions occur in a fuel tank __________.
Answer_1: during fueling when the fuel first strikes the tank bottom
Answer_2: during fueling when fuel strikes fuel already in the tank
Answer_3: when underway as the fuel is moved by wave action
Answer_4: shortly after fueling when fuel vapors are released and accumulated

Question_Title: Spontaneous combustion is a result of __________.
Answer_1: an outside heat source heating a substance until it ignites
Answer_2: conduction of heat through a wall of material to the substance

Question_Title: If a crewman suffers a second degree burn on the arm, you should __________.
Answer_3: scrub the arm thoroughly to prevent infection
Answer_4: immerse the arm in cold water

Question_Title: On a MODU, a cabinet or space containing the controls or valves for the fixed firefighting system must be __________.
Answer_1: posted with instructions on the operation of the system
Answer_2: ventilated and equipped with explosion-proof switches
Answer_3: painted with red and black diagonal stripes
Answer_4: equipped with a battery powered source of emergency lighting

Question_Title: In the absence of external forces, adding weight to one side of a floating vessel, will cause the vessel to __________.
Answer_1: heel until the angle of loll is reached
Answer_2: list until the center of buoyancy is aligned vertically with the center of gravity
Answer_3: trim to the side opposite TCG until all moments are equal
Answer_4: decrease draft at the center of flotation

Question_Title: Each completed page of the Oil Record Book must be signed by the __________.
Subtracting the height of the center of gravity corrected for transverse free surface effects from the height of the  transverse metacenter of a MODU yields __________.
Flame screens must be maintained in good condition and fitted in the opening they protect in order to __________.
Answer_1: prevent flammable vapors from entering the tank
Answer_2: allow the escape of flammable vapors
Answer_3: contain flammable vapors within the tank
Answer_4: allow dissipation of heat from any flame

Question_Title: To prevent the spread of fire by conduction, you should __________.
Answer_1: cool the bulkheads around the fire
Answer_3: close all openings to the area

Question_Title: On a MODU, the locker or space containing the self-contained breathing apparatus must be __________.
Answer_1: located in close proximity to the main control station
Answer_2: equipped with battery powered emergency lighting

Question_Title: Each hand portable fire extinguisher carried on a MODU must be marked with __________.
Answer_1: the name of the unit on which it is located
Answer_2: the date that it was installed on the unit
Answer_3: the names of the individuals qualified to use it
Answer_4: an identification number different from other extinguishers on the unit

Question_Title: Each emergency light on a MODU must be marked with __________.
Answer_2: an arrow pointing to the nearest exit

Question_Title: In treating a person for extensive first or second degree thermal burns it is important to prevent or reduce  __________.
According to regulations, the capacity of a liferaft is required to be marked __________.
Answer_2: on a sign next to the liferaft

Question_Title: The difference between the starboard and port drafts caused by a transverse shift in weight is __________.
In the Oil Record Book, a comprehensive list of operational items are grouped into operational sections.  Each section  is codified by a/an __________.
Subtracting the height of the center of gravity corrected for longitudinal free surface effects from the height of the longitudinal metacenter of a MODU yields __________.
On a MODU, when may a work vest be substituted for a required life preserver?
Answer_1: To replace a damaged life preserver.

Question_Title: A MODU must have a self-contained breathing apparatus to be used as protection from gas leaking from a refrigeration unit.  To meet this requirement, you may use __________.
Answer_1: a gas mask certified by the Mine Safety and Health  Administration
Answer_2: the same self-contained breathing apparatus required with the fireman's outfit
Answer_3: an oxygen breathing apparatus, provided that the device has been inspected within three years
Answer_4: a portable ventilation system that will provide a complete  change of air every three minutes

Question_Title: The litter on a MODU must be capable of __________.
Answer_1: carrying at least two injured persons
Answer_2: floating for at least two hours
Answer_3: being used on the types of helicopters serving the unit

Question_Title: Each buoyant work vest on a MODU must be __________.
Answer_2: marked with the name of the unit

Question_Title: For use as protection from gas leaking from a refrigeration unit, each MODU must be equipped with a __________.
A minor heat burn of the eye should be treated by __________.
Answer_2: warming the eye with moist warm packs
Answer_3: laying the person flat on his back
Answer_4: mineral oil drops directly on the eye

Question_Title: The immersion suit requirements for MODUs apply to units operating in the Atlantic Ocean __________.
Answer_1: above 20 degrees North and below 20 degrees South
Answer_2: above 25 degrees North and below 25 degrees South
Answer_3: above 30 degrees North and below 30 degrees South
Answer_4: above 32 degrees North and below 32 degrees South

Question_Title: With no environmental forces acting on the vessel, the center of gravity of an inclined vessel is vertically aligned with the __________.
A MODU is inclined at an angle of loll.  In the absence of  external forces, the righting arm (GZ) is __________.
For each passenger vessel, the minimum number of immersion suits to be carried for each lifeboat is at least __________.
The light on a personal flotation device on a MODU must be  replaced __________.
Answer_1: when the power source is replaced
Answer_4: when it is no longer serviceable

Question_Title: Each hand portable, semi-portable, and fixed fire extinguishing unit on a MODU must be tested and inspected at least once every __________.

In the event of a fire, the doors to a stairtower must be closed to prevent the spread of fire by __________.
Severe airway burns will cause __________.
Which of the listed substances is susceptible to spontaneous combustion?
How are line shaft bearings usually lubricated?
Burning diesel oil should be treated as which class of fire?
The required periodic inspection of MODU lifeboat winch control apparatus must include __________.
Answer_2: removal of drain plugs from electrical enclosures

Question_Title: Which of the listed characteristics applies to a semi-portable CO2 system?
Answer_1: Each cylinder must weigh less than 50 pounds.
Answer_3: It has a portable hose and nozzle.
Answer_4: It has distribution piping installed permanently.

Question_Title: If your vessel has a starboard list after taking on fuel, you would transfer fuel __________.
During the required periodic boat drill aboard a MODU, each person not assigned duties as per the Muster List ("Station Bill") is __________.
Answer_1: instructed in the use of portable fire extinguishers
Answer_2: shown a video demonstrating lifeboat launching

Question_Title: When treating a chemical burn, you should flood the burned  area for at least __________.

Question_Title: How many people onboard a MODU must be trained in the use of the fireman's outfit?

Answer_2: cover the area with absorbent material

Answer_4: the transfer of heat across an unobstructed space

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is a symptom of heat stroke __________.

Answer_3: hot and moist skin, high body temperature

Answer_3: cover the area with absorbent material

Answer_3: the flow of CO2 under pressure

Question_Title: When the survival craft is supplied with bottles of compressed air, they are used for __________.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions is a symptom of sun stroke?

Answer_3: only when activated by the controls at the lowering station

Question_Title: When inspecting a survival craft, you should check to make  sure that the __________.

Question_Title: The backup system on an electric start survival craft is a  __________.

Question_Title: Small oil spills on deck may be prevented from entering the water by __________.

Question_Title: If the survival craft is not loaded to full capacity, the personnel should be __________.

Question_Title: Fire hoses located at protected fire stations, must always  be __________.

Question_Title: Using a sea anchor with the survival craft will __________.
Answer_2: keep the survival craft from turning over

Question_Title: To effectively treat a person suffering from heat exhaustion, you should __________.

Question_Title: The survival craft engine is fueled with __________.

Question_Title: The sprinkler system of a survival craft is used to __________.

Question_Title: During the towing of a survival craft, a lookout should be  on station to __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following methods should be used to prevent a class "A" fire in a topside compartment, with steel bulkheads, from spreading to the adjacent compartments?

Question_Title: A class "C" fire would most likely occur in the __________.

Answer_3: increase the rate of heat loss from the body

Question_Title: When fighting a fire with a portable dry chemical extinguisher you should always __________.

Answer_1: Fire hose couplings are strong and not easily damaged.

Answer_3: Fire hose couplings can be easily damaged by dropping.
Answer_4: Fire hose couplings should be painted red.

Question_Title: If water is rising in the bilge of a survival craft, you should first __________.
Answer_2: check for cracks in the hull
Answer_3: shift all personnel to the stern

Question_Title: The air cylinder bottles in the survival craft should be refilled with __________.

Answer_1: immerse the feet in warm water
Answer_2: warm the feet with a heat lamp
Answer_3: warm the feet at room temperature
Answer_4: rub the feet to restore circulation

Question_Title: The best way to effectively use a dry chemical type fire extinguisher in fighting a fire, is to __________.
Answer_1: discharge a stream horizontally and allow it to flow down evenly on all burning surfaces
Answer_2: discharge a stream at the base of the fire, starting at the near edge, and use side-to-side sweeping motions
Answer_3: play the stream off adjacent vertical surfaces until the area is blanketed
Answer_4: use concentrated amounts in small locations and put the fire out in sections

Question_Title: With the sprinkler system and air system on, and all hatches shut, the survival craft will be protected from __________.
Answer_4: a drop greater than ten feet

Question_Title: A class "C" fire is burning __________.

Answer_1: after the hose has been completely drained
Answer_2: with the nozzle in the solid stream position
Answer_3: so the hose can be connected quickly if a fire occurs
Answer_4: so the nozzle is protected by the hose

Question_Title: When transferring survivors from a survival craft to a rescue vessel, personnel onboard the craft should __________.
Answer_1: remove their lifejackets to make it easier to climb onboard the rescue vessel
Answer_2: climb on top of the survival craft while waiting for their  turn to transfer to the rescue vessel
Answer_3: remain seated inside the survival craft and make the transfer one person at a time
Answer_4: enter the water and swim over to the rescue vessel

Question_Title: Except in rare cases, it is impossible to extinguish a shipboard fire by __________.
Treatment of frostbite is to __________.

Answer_1: attack the fire from the leeward side
Answer_2: direct the chemical discharge into the center of the burning fuel surface
Answer_3: sweep the chemical discharge back and forth across the burning fuel surface
Answer_4: invert the dry chemical extinguisher before starting to fight the fire

Question_Title: Which of the listed sources of ignition may cause fuel vapors to ignite?
Which of the listed materials would be considered as a burning class "C" fire?

Answer_1: A fusible link will automatically open after a fire is extinguished and reset the damper.
Answer_2: Fusible links must be replaced at every inspection for certification.
Answer_3: Fusible links are tested by applying a source of heat to them.
Answer_4: Fusible links must be replaced if a damper is closed.

Question_Title: If a fire hose is left unattended and under pressure with the nozzle shut off, the fire hose will __________.

The most likely location for a liquid cargo fire to occur on a tanker would be __________.
A crew member has suffered frostbite to the toes of his right foot.  Which of the following is NOT an acceptable first aid measure?
Answer_3: Warm the frost bitten toes rapidly.
Answer_4: Give aspirin or other medication for pain if necessary.

Question_Title: For the best extinguishing effect, the discharge from a dry chemical type fire extinguisher should be directed at the __________.
Answer_2: top and sides of a fire

Answer_1: stowed near open flame or where smoking is permitted

Question_Title: A health hazard, listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), that can cause cancer in exposed individuals is called a __________.

Fusible link fire dampers are operated by __________.
Answer_1: a mechanical arm outside the vent duct
Answer_3: the heat of a fire melting the link

Question_Title: A tank or compartment is "gas free" when there is an absence of dangerous concentrations of __________.
Which of the listed methods, is the most effective to fight a fire on the open deck of a vessel if using a dry chemical type fire extinguisher?
Answer_1: Approach the fire from the windward side.
Answer_2: Direct the extinguisher discharge at the base of the fire.
Answer_3: Move the discharge stream back and forth in a rapid sweeping motion.

Question_Title: Fire dampers prevent the fire spreading through the process of __________.
When compared to low-expansion foam, a high-expansion foam  will __________.
A burning AC motor would be considered what class of fire?

The explosive range of benzene is 1.4% to 8% by volume in air.  If you sample an empty tank that had contained benzene and obtained a reading of 50% L.E.L. on a combustible gas indicator, then the __________.
Answer_1: vapor/air mixture is too lean to burn
Answer_2: vapor concentration at the sample point is 0.7%

Question_Title: A fire hose is subject to damage if the swivel on the female coupling is lubricated with __________.

Answer_4: all of the above as necessary

Question_Title: The most effective warming treatment for a crew member suffering from hypothermia is __________.
Answer_1: running or jumping to create heat

Question_Title: When using a dry chemical type fire extinguisher in a windy location, you should direct the stream from __________.
A fire may be spread by which of the following means?
Answer_1: Conduction of heat to adjacent surfaces

Question_Title: When compared to a high-expansion foam, a low-expansion foam will __________.
A fire in an electrical generator is considered to be __________.

Answer_2: checking fireman's outfits and other personel rescue equipment

Question_Title: The designation "Not safe for men - Not safe for fire" means __________.
Answer_1: the gas or oxygen concentrations within a compartment is not within permissible limits
Answer_3: the compartment was not tested due to the presence of ballast slops or bunkers

Question_Title: A crew member suffering from generalized hypothermia should be given __________.
Which of the following statements is NOT true concerning life-jackets?
Answer_1: They come in two sizes, child and adult.
Answer_2: They are required to be of a highly visible color.
Answer_3: The life jackect will always support an unconscious wearer in an upright position.
Answer_4: They must be able to support the wearer in an upright position.

Question_Title: Besides heat, fuel, and oxygen, which of the following is necessary for a fire to exist?
When compared to a high-expansion foam, a low-expansion foam will __________.
Which of the listed classes of fire is considered as one involving electrical equipment?

The flammable limits of kerosene are 0.7% to 6.0% by volume in air.  The combustible gas indicator reading is 50% of the lower explosive level.  The flammable vapor concentration at the sample point is __________.
Which of the conditions listed make it difficult to indefinitely maintain fire hoses?
Answer_1: Gasoline and oils act to dissolve the rubber or cement which holds the inner jacket and lining together.
Answer_2: Heat causes the rubber lining to harden and crack.
Answer_3: Moisture will cause mildew to form on the jacket which destroys the cotton fiber.

Question_Title: In order to retrieve an inflatable liferaft and place it on deck, you should heave on the __________.

Answer_2: They may be kept open if the ventilation or air conditioning system is shut down.
Answer_3: They may be kept open if they can be automatically closed from the bridge.

Question_Title: The symptoms of heat exhaustion are __________.

Answer_1: Buoyant vests may be substituted for lifejackets.
Answer_2: Lifejackets are designed to turn an unconscious person's face clear of the water.
Answer_3: Lifejackets must always be worn with the same side facing outwards to float properly.
Answer_4: Lightly stained or faded lifejackets will fail in the water and should not be used.

Question_Title: Fires are grouped into which of the listed categories?
Answer_1: Class A, B, C, and D

Question_Title: When compared to low-expansion foam, a high-expansion foam  will __________.
Which of the listed classes of fire would apply to a main switchboard fire?

The vapor explosive range of gasoline by volume is 1.0% to  6.0% in air.  If a gasoline tank is sampled with an explosimeter, and the reading obtained is 30% L.E.L., the vapor concentration at the sample point is __________.
Which type of wrench listed is used to disconnect fire hose couplings?

Answer_1: Watertight doors which are in the drill area shall be operated.

Answer_3: Fire pumps shall be started and all exterior outlets opened.

Question_Title: If, in a compartment or space, the gas or oxygen content is not within permissible concentration, and dangerous gases are either present, or may be produced by residues, what would be the safety designation listed on a marine chemist's certificate?
Answer_1: Safe for Men - Safe for Fire
Answer_2: Safe for Men - Not Safe for Fire
Answer_3: Not Safe for Men - Safe for Fire
Answer_4: Not Safe for Men - Not Safe for Fire

Question_Title: Heat exhaustion is caused by excessive __________.
Answer_2: loss of water and salt from the body
Answer_4: intake of water when working or exercising

Question_Title: Lifejackets should be stowed in __________.

Answer_3: at a temperature not less than 80F

Question_Title: If the liferaft you are in should capsize, all personnel should leave the raft and __________.
Answer_3: right the raft using the righting straps

Question_Title: When using the combustible gas indicator to test a cargo tank, and the hydrocarbon content of the atmosphere exceeds the upper explosive limit (UEL), __________.

Answer_2: the needle will move to the maximum reading and stay there
Answer_3: the needle will move to the maximum reading and return to zero immediately
Answer_4: an audible beeping will be heard

Question_Title: Hose spanner wrenches should be used to connect __________.

Question_Title: If you have to jump in the water when abandoning ship, your legs should be __________.

Answer_2: held as tightly against your chest as possible
Answer_4: extended straight down and crossed at the ankles

Question_Title: If a crew member faints, you should __________.

Answer_3: lay him down with his head lower than his feet
Answer_4: attempt to stand him upright to restore consciousness

Question_Title: An oil fire would be classified as a __________.

Answer_1: To cut off power when the davits hit the track safety stops.
Answer_2: To stop the davits from going too fast.
Answer_3: To cut off power when the davits are about 12 inches from the track safety stops.

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft has inflated on top of you in an upside down position.  What should you do next?
Answer_1: Wait for others to lift the raft off of you.

Question_Title: Which of the tools listed is designed for connecting and disconnecting fire hose couplings?

Answer_4: Some food and water should be consumed immediately and then not until 48 hours later

Question_Title: A reproductive health hazard, listed on a Material Safety Date Sheet (MSDS), that can cause genetic changes in sperm  or egg cells is called a __________.

If the residues are not capable of producing toxic materials or flammable concentrations, what would be the designation listed on the marine chemist's certificate?
Answer_1: Safe for men - Safe for Fire
Answer_2: Safe for men - Not Safe for Fire
Answer_3: Not safe for men - Safe for Fire
Answer_4: Not safe for men - Not Safe for Fire

Question_Title: Which of the following should NOT be done for a person who  has fainted?
Answer_1: Get the person in the open air.
Answer_3: Lay the person with the head higher than the feet.
Answer_4: Splash cold water in the face.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is TRUE concerning lifejackets?
Answer_1: Buoyant vests may be substituted for lifejackets.

Answer_3: Lifejackets must always be worn with the same side facing outwards.
Answer_4: Lifejackets are not designed to turn a person's face clear  of the water when unconscious.

Question_Title: A galley grease fire would be classified as __________.

Answer_2: knees bent and held close to the body with both arms around the legs

Answer_4: both hands holding the lifejacket below the chin with knees bent and legs crossed

Question_Title: After the lifeboat has reached the top of the davit heads,  the davit arms begin moving up the tracks until the movement is stopped by the __________.
