Answer_1: Fresh water may be obtained from fish.
Answer_2: Lifeboat covers or canopies should be washed with rain before drinking water is collected.
Answer_3: Fresh water may be collected from condensation inside the liferaft.
Answer_4: Freshwater can be evaporated from standing seawater.

Question_Title: The explosive range of petroleum vapors when mixed with air is __________.

Answer_1: The residues in the compartment must not be capable of producing any toxic gas under existing atmospheric  conditions.
Answer_2: The concentration of combustible gases in the compartment's atmosphere must be less than 10 percent of the lower flammable limit.
Answer_3: The toxic gases in the compartment's atmosphere must be within permissible concentrations.

Question_Title: The proper stimulant for an unconscious person is a/an __________.

Answer_2: Enter the water feet first and legs together.
Answer_3: Swim in the same direction as the wind is blowing.
Answer_4: Cover your eyes with one hand when entering the water.

Answer_3: 2 barrel capacity which may be bolted in place below the loading manifold valves

Question_Title: Foam is effective in combating which of the listed classes  of fire?

Answer_1: The meter will deflect to the 70% explosive position.

Answer_2: standing on the CO2 bottle, holding the bottom straps, and  throwing your weight backwards

Answer_2: only condensation on the bottom of the canopy should be collected
Answer_3: it should be strained through a finely woven cloth
Answer_4: chlorine tablets should be used to make it drinkable

Question_Title: The function of the lifeboat davit limit switch is to __________.

Answer_4: cut off power to the winch when the lifeboat reaches the davit bumpers

Answer_3: cover your eyes with one hand while pinching your nose shut and covering your mouth with the other
Answer_4: enter the water at the bow or stern, on the windward side of the vessel

Question_Title: Which of the listed classes of fire would most likely occur in the engine room of a vessel?

Answer_1: fixed container with a capacity of 5 U.S. gallons  (19 l)

Answer_3: fixed container with a capacity of one-half barrel (.08 m3)
Answer_4: overflow manifold that empties into the day tank

Question_Title: A reproductive health hazard, listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), that can damage the fetus during development is called a __________.

Answer_1: filling the stabilizers on one side with water

Answer_4: standing on the inflating cylinder and pulling on the straps on the underside of the raft

Question_Title: Provided every effort is used to produce, as well as preserve body moisture content by avoiding perspiration, how long is it normally possible to survive without stored quantities of water?

Answer_2: The gas free status applies for the duration of the work inside the compartment.
Answer_3: The gas free status applies for the 24 hour period following the inspection.
Answer_4: The gas free status applies as long as the air temperature  inside the compartment remains at or below 25 degrees Celsius.

Answer_4: has financial reserves to meet reasonable expected crew costs of an intended voyage

Answer_1: protect your lifejacket by holding it above your head

Answer_3: keep both hands in front of your face to break the water surface when diving head first

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), which of the following statements is correct regarding the  fuel oil containment under the oil filling connection section?
Answer_1: The containment may be fixed or portable depending upon the age of the vessel.
Answer_2: The containment drains must have quick-closing valves to be closed in the event of leakage or failure of any part of the transfer connection.
Answer_3: All containment drains must lead to a common, fixed drain tank.
Answer_4: Containment drains are prohibited from leading to a common  tank.

Question_Title: A class "D" fire would be considered as burning __________.

Answer_1: placed in a position with the head lower than the body

Question_Title: Inflatable liferafts are provided with __________.

Question_Title: Fires involving combustible metals are classified as __________.

Answer_1: the needle will rise slowly to and remain at the maximum reading
Answer_2: the needle will move rapidly to and remain at the maximum reading

Answer_3: on a cord hanging from the canopy

Answer_3: upper explosive limit of a flammable gas concentration

Question_Title: What danger to personnel exists when a carbon dioxide fire  extinguisher is discharged in a small enclosed space?
Inflatable liferafts are provided with a __________.

For a ship of 10,000 gross tons, constructed after 30 June  1974, a fixed container, or enclosed deck area, must exist  under or around each fuel oil tank vent.  The container must have a capacity of at least __________.
How is the external flotation bladder of an immersion suit  inflated?
Answer_1: It is inflated by a small CO2 bottle that is automatically  tripped when the front zipper is at the top of zipper track.
Answer_2: It is inflated by a small CO2 bottle that is manually tripped.
Answer_3: It is inflated by blowing through an inflation tube.
Answer_4: It inflates by sea water bleeding into the flotation bladder and reacting with a chemical.

Question_Title: When testing the atmosphere of a compartment with a combustible gas indicator, the operator must remember that  __________.
Answer_1: most petroleum vapors are lighter than air and accumulate around deck longitudinals
Answer_2: the indicator guarantees a safe atmosphere for a maximum of two hours
Answer_3: the meter scale indicates only the upper explosive range
Answer_4: the indicator tests only the atmosphere at the end of the suction tube

Question_Title: Lower level fire main stations in the engine room should undergo regular routine maintenance, including __________.
Answer_1: operating the self-cleaning strainers once a day
Answer_2: flushing out the hydrants with full fire main pressure
Answer_3: repacking valve stems at three month intervals
Answer_4: a weekly replacement of fire hose fittings

Question_Title: To keep injured survivors warm in the water, after  abandoning ship, they should __________.
Answer_1: be placed in the middle of a small circle formed by the other survivors in the water
Answer_2: float on their backs with their arms extended for maximum exposure to the air
Answer_3: remove their lifejackets and hold on to the uninjured survivors
Answer_4: sip water at fifteen minute intervals

Question_Title: According to 33 CFR Part 151, shipboard oil pollution emergency plans must be reviewed __________.
Answer_1: annually by the owner and a letter submitted six months prior to expiration
Answer_2: only once every five years and a letter submitted six months prior to expiration
Answer_3: and the entire plan resubmitted for approval once every five years, six months prior to expiration
Answer_4: annually by the owner and submit a letter to the Coast Guard within one month of the anniversary date of the plan approval

Question_Title: Limit switches on gravity davits should be tested by __________.
Answer_1: the engineers, from a panel in the engine room
Answer_2: shutting off the current to the winch
Answer_3: pushing the switch lever arm while the winch is running

Question_Title: If a person gets battery acid in their eye while filling a battery, they should FIRST wash the eye with __________.
When any fire has been extinguished with carbon dioxide, there is always the danger of the __________.
Answer_1: fire being reignited by residual heat
Answer_3: dry ice crystals clogging the machinery
Answer_4: atmosphere containing a dangerous charge of static  electricity

Question_Title: A safety feature provided on all inflatable liferafts is __________.
Answer_4: the use of water stabilizing pockets

Question_Title: A 1500 gross ton freight vessel, with a keel laid in 1969,  must have a fuel oil discharge containment for the fuel tank vents.  This containment must consist of __________.
Answer_2: portable containers of at least 5 U.S. gallon capacity
Answer_4: a container with a capacity of 3 barrels if it serves one or more vents; each with an inside diameter of 3 inches or more

Question_Title: A burning mattress is considered as which of the following  classes of fire?
The external flotation bladder of an immersion suit should  be inflated __________.
Answer_1: only after two hours in the water
Answer_2: only after four hours in the water

Question_Title: There is always a lower water pressure at the fire hose outlet than is found at the discharge of the pump.  Which of the following reasons is the common cause of this loss in pressure?
Answer_3: Friction in the piping and valves

Question_Title: The use of sinking and dispersing agents for the removal of surface oil is __________.
Answer_1: the most common method used in the United States

Question_Title: When operating gravity davits, __________.
Answer_1: the gripes should be released after the boat is moving
Answer_2: the davits should always be hand cranked the last 12 inches into the final stowed position
Answer_3: the boats are generally lowered by surging the falls around cruciform bits
Answer_4: the tricing pendant should be tripped prior to releasing the gripes

Question_Title: Which of the following can result in an oxygen deficiency in a closed space?
If a person gets something in his eye and you observe that  it is not embedded, you can __________.
Answer_1: get him to rub his eye until the object is gone
Answer_2: remove it with a match or toothpick
Answer_3: remove it with a piece of dry sterilized cotton rag
Answer_4: remove it with a moist cotton-tipped applicator

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft is floating in its container, attached to the ship by its painter, as the ship is sinking rapidly.  Which of the actions listed should be taken with  respect to the liferaft container?
Answer_1: Cut the painter line so it will not pull the liferaft container down.
Answer_2: Swim away from the container so you will not be in danger as it goes down.
Answer_3: Take no action as the pull on the painter will cause the liferaft to inflate and open the container.
Answer_4: Manually open the container and inflate the liferaft with the hand pump.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning an immersion suit and its use?
Answer_1: Only a light layer of clothing may be worn underneath.
Answer_2: They provide sufficient flotation to do away with the necessity of wearing a lifejacket.
Answer_4: A puncture in the suit will not appreciably reduce its value.

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators are used to detect flammable gases or vapors in the atmosphere.  As a safety feature, they are equipped with __________.
Which of the following conditions would be true if a serious leak developed in the main line of a horizontal, looped, fire main system?
Answer_1: It would not be possible to provide water beyond the point  where the break occurred.
Answer_2: The ruptured section could be isolated allowing water to be delivered to all other parts of the system.
Answer_3: The capability of the system would be greatly reduced due to the drop in line pressure but still remain operational through the use of the alternate loop.
Answer_4: Full fire main pressure could be maintained but only on one side of the vessel through the use of either the fore or aft isolation valve.

Question_Title: Records of garbage disposal are required to be maintained __________.
Answer_1: until each quadrennial Coast Guard inspection
Answer_2: until the end of each voyage
Answer_3: for a minimum of one year
Answer_4: for a minimum of two years

Question_Title: When using the hand crank to retrieve and stow a lifeboat on gravity davits, which of the listed precaution should always be observed?
Answer_1: Make certain the hand brake is disengaged.
Answer_2: Put the emergency disconnect switch in the 'off' position.
Answer_3: Make certain the crank is in the locked position.

Question_Title: A tank which has been sealed for a long period of time can  be dangerous because __________.
Answer_1: steel surfaces consume oxygen by rusting
Answer_2: sealed tanks usually form a vacuum
Answer_3: moisture condenses in the tank, displacing the oxygen
Answer_4: most tank coatings give off poisonous vapors in the presence of moisture

Question_Title: For a victim who is coughing and gagging, as a result of a  partial obstruction of the airway by a foreign body, a potential rescuer should __________.
Answer_2: wait for the victim to become unconscious then give four back blows followed by four abdominal thrusts
Answer_3: encourge the victim to continue coughing.  If the victim is unable to expel the object, arrange for prompt transport to an appropriate medical facilty
Answer_4: bend the victim over and give back blows

Question_Title: If you continue to wear extra clothing when entering the water after abandoning your vessel, it will __________.
Answer_4: make it more difficult to breathe

Question_Title: The operating cord on an inflatable liferaft also serves as a __________.
Fires occurring in combustible metals, such as sodium or magnesium, are classified as a __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Immersion suits should be worn during routine work on deck  to provide maximum protection.
Answer_2: After purchasing, the suit should be removed from its storage bag and hung on a hanger where it will be readily accessible.
Answer_3: During the annual maintenance, the front zipper should be lubricated only with manufacturers recommended lubricant
Answer_4: Small leaks or tears may be repaired using the repair kit packed with the suit.

Question_Title: The purpose of the wire stretched between the lifeboat davit heads is to __________.
Answer_1: keep the movement of the davits at the same speed
Answer_2: keep the davits from slipping when they are in the stowed position
Answer_3: prevent vibration during lowering of the boat

Question_Title: A tank has been sealed and unventilated for a long period of time.  Which of the following conditions does this indicate?
Answer_1: The tank is safe to enter.
Answer_2: The tank is especially dangerous to enter.
Answer_4: Water vapor present when the tank was sealed has oxidized.

Question_Title: You are in the mess room when a shipmate suddenly begins to choke, is unable to speak and starts to turn blue.  Which of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Administer abdominal thrust in an effort to clear the airway.
Answer_2: Make the victim lie down with the feet elevated to get blood to the brain.
Answer_4: Do nothing until the victim becomes unconscious.

Question_Title: In which of the circumstances listed would a carbon dioxide fire extinguishing agent be most effective?
The operating cord of the inflatable liferaft has a length  of __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion  suits is correct?
Answer_1: Immersion suits should be worn while performing routine work on deck.
Answer_2: After purchacing, the suit should be stowed in the storage bag in which it was received.
Answer_3: During the annual maintenance, the front zipper should be lubricated using light machine oil or mineral oil.
Answer_4: Any tear or leak will render the suit unserviceable and it  must be replaced.

Question_Title: The most common type of containment device for spilled oil  on the water is the use of __________.
Which of the following signals is used to report for boat stations or boat drill?
Answer_1: More than six short blasts followed by one long blast of the whistle.
Answer_2: A continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less  than 10 seconds.
Answer_3: One long blast followed by three short blasts of the whistle.
Answer_4: Three short blasts of the whistle.

Question_Title: If someone suffers a heart attack and has ceased breathing, you should __________.
Answer_1: immediately give a stimulant, by force if necessary
Answer_2: make the victim comfortable in a bunk

Question_Title: Which of the following health hazards found on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) is a reproductive hazard?
After a liferaft is launched, the operating cord __________.
Answer_3: is used to rig the boarding ladder
Answer_4: is cut immediately as it is of no further use

Question_Title: When using a handheld smoke signal in a liferaft, you should __________.
Answer_1: activate the signal on the downwind side
Answer_2: activate the signal on the upwind side
Answer_3: activate the signal inside the boat
Answer_4: activate the signal at the stern

Question_Title: An example of class "A" fire is a/an __________.
Answer_1: electrical fire in the engine room
Answer_2: oil fire in the engine room bilges
Answer_3: oil fire involving a grade "A" petroleum product

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators detect flammable gases, or vapors present in the atmosphere by an intricate system which includes __________.
How may a cargo tank atmosphere be tested for explosive gases?
Answer_1: Use the open flame test on a small sample that has been taken from the tank.
Answer_2: Send a gas sample ashore for laboratory analysis.
Answer_3: Enter the tank with a teledyne oxygen analyzer.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Suits are not required to automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to the wearer while swimming through burning oil.
Answer_4: The suits provide for limited body movement such as walking, climbing a ladder, and picking up small objects like a pencil.

Question_Title: Pressure within a firemain system will vary from point to point due to __________.
Answer_3: friction in the piping and valves

Question_Title: While at your lifeboat station, you hear a signal consisting of one short blast of the whistle.  This indicates __________.
A person suffering from a heart attack may show which of the following symptoms?
Before you initiate the engine room fixed CO2 system to extinguish a serious fire, you would __________.
After having thrown the liferaft and stowage container into the water, the liferaft is inflated by __________.
Answer_2: forcing open the container which operates the CO2

Question_Title: The temperature at which a liquid, as listed on a Material  Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), will change to a gas is called its __________.
The lowest temperature at which a liquid, listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), gives off enough vapor to ingnite in the presence of an ignition source is called its __________.
Combustible gas indicators are used to detect flammable gases, or vapors present in a tank.  This is accomplished by an intricate instrument incorporating a/an __________.
While fighting a fire, in order to utilize two hoses from a single 'wye' gate attached to a hydrant outlet, you need only turn the valve handle __________.
Answer_1: at the base of the "Y" in either direction
Answer_2: at the base of the "Y" counterclockwise 180

Question_Title: A vessel having a concentration of weight toward the top of the vessel is said to be __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Not all models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit will still be serviceable after a brief (2 seconds) exposure to flame and burning.
Answer_4: The wearer of the suit is no way restricted in body movement and the suit may be donned well in advance of abandoning ship.

Question_Title: Persons who have swallowed a non-petroleum based poison are given large quantities of warm, soapy water or warm salt water to __________.
Answer_2: absorb the poison from the blood
Answer_3: neutralize the poison in the blood
Answer_4: increase the digestive process and eliminate the poison

Question_Title: Why is it necessary to warn engine room personnel before activating the fixed CO2 system?
Answer_1: To make them aware there is a fire.
Answer_2: To let them know they should leave the engine room.
Answer_3: To prevent possible injury from frostbite.
Answer_4: To make them aware that ventilation will automatically stop.

Question_Title: Hydrogen sulfide gives crude oil the sour odor of rotten eggs.  A hazard to personnel regarding hydrogen sulfide  is __________.
An inflatable liferaft can be launched by __________.
Answer_3: throwing the entire container overboard, then pulling on the operating cord to inflate the raft

Question_Title: The signal given to commence lowering the lifeboats is __________.
Answer_1: 3 short blasts of the ship's whistle
Answer_2: 1 short blast of the ship's whistle
Answer_3: 3 long blasts of the ship's whistle
Answer_4: 1 long blast of the ship's whistle

Question_Title: Combustible gas indicators incorporate the use of a/an __________.
In cleaning up an oil spill, the use of chemical agents would __________.
Answer_1: absorb the oil for easy removal
Answer_2: remove the oil from the water
Answer_3: disperse or dissolve the oil in the water

Question_Title: If fuel is burned from only the starboard tanks, the ship will __________.
Puncture leaks in the lower tubes, or bottom of an  inflatable liferaft should first be stopped by using __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: Not all models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit reduces the rate of body cooling and greatly increases the survival time in cold water.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to a wearer  swimming in burning oil.
Answer_4: The suit provides a full range of body movement and is suitable for routine wear on deck.

Question_Title: To reduce mild fever the MOST useful drug is __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning carbon dioxide when used as a fire extinguishing agent?
Answer_1: Carbon dioxide is corrosive when exposed to fire.
Answer_2: Carbon dioxide should be applied slowly to a large engine room fire.
Answer_3: Its total cooling effect is far greater than water.
Answer_4: Its smothering effect is excellent for class B fires.

Question_Title: Hydrogen sulfide is the constituent giving sour crude oil the characteristic odor of rotten eggs.  One of the hazards associated with hydrogen sulfide is __________.
Answer_3: its high toxicity resulting in death
Answer_4: dependency addiction to the highly toxic fumes

Question_Title: A raft should be manually released from its cradle by __________.
Answer_1: cutting the straps that enclose the container
Answer_2: removing the rubber sealing strip from the container
Answer_3: loosening the turnbuckle on the securing strap
Answer_4: pushing the button on the hydrostatic release

Question_Title: A fire in a pile of canvas would be classified as a __________.
When taking samples of a tank atmosphere with an explosimeter, you should __________.
Answer_1: only sample around the deck longitudinals as gases are lighter than air
Answer_2: sample only near the ullage openings as all vapors  accumulate there
Answer_3: avoid sampling in the vicinity of deep webs to prevent false readings
Answer_4: sample as much of the tank as possible, especially at the bottom

Question_Title: When whistle signals are used as commands for launching the lifeboats, one short blast means __________.
Answer_4: drill is over, secure all boats

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is correct?
Answer_1: All models will automatically turn an unconscious person face-up in the water.
Answer_2: The immersion suit seals in all body heat and provides protection against hypothermia for weeks.
Answer_3: The suit is flameproof and provides protection to the wearer while swimming through burning oil.
Answer_4: The wearer of the suit is not severely restricted in body movement and permits the wearer to perform any form of strenuous work.

Question_Title: The atmosphere of an empty fuel tank is tested and  designated "gas free".  Which of the following statements is correct concerning this tank?
Answer_1: The concentration of flammable gas in the compartment is less than 10% of the lower flammable limit.
Answer_2: The tank should be frequently retested.
Answer_3: The gas free status is good as long as the initial  conditions remain unchanged.

Question_Title: Which of the following best defines First Aid?
Answer_2: Setting of broken bones and transport of victim
Answer_3: Emergency treatment of the injury at the scene.
Answer_4: Dosage of medications and application of bandages

Question_Title: Which of the following terms is the minimum temperature at  which a liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), gives off sufficient vapor concentration to ignite  in the presence of an ignition source?
In cleaning up an oil spill, the use of straw or reclaimed  paper fibers would be an example of which type of oil removal?
The most important thing to remember when launching an inflatable liferaft by hand is to __________.
Answer_3: ensure that the operating cord is secured to the vessel
Answer_4: inflate the raft on the vessel, then lower it over the side

Question_Title: A fire in a pile of dunnage would be classified as a __________.
To detect the presence of explosive gases in any space, tank, or compartment, you should use a __________.
While at your lifeboat station, a signal consisting of two  short blasts of the ship's whistle is sounded.  This indicates  __________.
Which of the following statements concerning immersion suits is FALSE?
Answer_1: They should be worn while working on deck if the possibility exists of being washed overboard.
Answer_2: The suit is received from the manufacturer in a bag intended to be used for storage of the suit onboard ship.
Answer_3: During the annual inspection and maintenance, the zipper should be lubricated according to manufacturers recommendations.
Answer_4: A small leak of water into the suit will destroy the protective qualities against hypothermia.

Question_Title: What information can be obtained from a marine chemist's certificate on a tank barge?
Answer_1: The number of fire extinguishers required onboard.
Answer_2: The quality of the barge's cargo.
Answer_3: The tanks which are safe to enter when the certificate was  issued.

Question_Title: Symptoms of sugar diabetes include __________.
The fire extinguishing action of CO2 is derived mostly from __________.
Answer_1: a blanket of bubbles formed on the surface of the fire
Answer_4: isolating the heat from the fuel

Question_Title: Which type of fire extinguisher is most prone to the freezing when exposed to low temperatures?
To launch a liferaft by hand, you should __________.
Answer_1: cut the casing bands, throw the liferaft over the side and  it will then inflate
Answer_2: detach the operating cord, throw the raft over the side and it will then inflate
Answer_3: cut the casing bands, throw the raft over the side and pull the operating cord
Answer_4: throw the liferaft over the side and pull the operating cord

Question_Title: A fire involving trash and paper waste would be classified  as a __________.
Hydrocarbon vapors are usually detected by the use of the __________.
While reading the Muster List ("Station Bill"), you find 'three (3) short blasts on the whistle and three (3) short rings on the general alarm bells,' this signal is for __________.
Answer_2: dismissal from fire and emergency stations

Question_Title: What statement about immersion suits is FALSE?
Answer_1: The suit should be worn only when abandoning ship.
Answer_2: The suit is received from the manufacturer in an outer storage bag that should be used aboard ship for storing the suit.
Answer_3: The front zipper should be lubricated according to  manufacturer's specifications.
Answer_4: Immersion suits provide protection against hypothermia even if there is a small leak or tear.

Question_Title: A category of health hazard, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) which includes teratogens and mutagens, is called a __________.
A liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), having a flash point below 100F (37.78C) is called a/an __________.
If a diabetic suffers an insulin reaction and is conscious, he should be given __________.
Answer_2: orange juice or a candy bar

Question_Title: A liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS)  having a flash point at or above 100F is called a/an __________.
If an emergency pump control is used as the emergency shutdown on a tank vessel, it must stop the flow of oil through __________.
Answer_4: a means that is not dependant on electrical power

Question_Title: An ullage reading is the distance from a given point at the __________.
Answer_1: sounding tube to either side of the tank
Answer_2: top of the tank down to the bottom of the tank
Answer_3: top of the liquid down to the tank bottom
Answer_4: top of the sounding tube down to the surface of the liquid

Question_Title: An inflatable liferaft is hand-launched by __________.
An instrument used to detect explosive gas/air mixtures, usually measures the concentration in terms of the lower explosive limit, and is known as a __________.
A person manning a fire hose under pressure with an all-purpose nozzle attached, should be aware that the nozzle is most difficult to control when the handle position is changed from __________.
Answer_3: low velocity to high velocity fog

Question_Title: When should distress flares and rockets be used?
Answer_1: Only when there is a chance of them being sighted by rescue vessels.
Answer_2: They should be set off at half-hour intervals.
Answer_3: They should be set off at one-hour intervals.

Question_Title: Physical data on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) which  describes chemicals that produce health effects requiring medical attention where damage may be permanent but is neither life-threatening nor seriously disabling, is called __________.
Emergency signals for use on a river passenger vessel are to be conspicuously posted and listed on the __________.
If a person with diabetes has been injured, the symptoms of the onset of a diabetic coma would include __________.
Answer_4: slurred speech and loss of coordination

Question_Title: The most effective method in the use of a CO2 fire  extinguisher is for the discharge to be directed at the __________.
Answer_2: top and sides of a fire
Answer_3: base or nearest edge of a fire

Question_Title: Which of the following items is NOT required to be contained in the vessel's oil transfer procedures?
Answer_1: A line diagram of the vessel's oil transfer piping.
Answer_2: The number of persons on duty during oil transfer operations.
Answer_3: Any special procedures for topping off tanks.
Answer_4: The location and capacity of all fuel and cargo tanks on the vessel.

Question_Title: If a raft is to be released manually, where should the operating cord be attached before throwing the raft overboard?
Answer_1: Do not attach the cord to anything but throw it overboard with the raft container.
Answer_2: To some fixed object on the ship.
Answer_3: Stand on it with your foot.
Answer_4: To the special pad eye on the 'raft davit launcher'.

Question_Title: Burning wood is considered to be which of the listed classes of fire?

A specific document which identifies a chemical, listing its physical properties, health hazards, required controls, firefighting procedures, clean up methods, waste disposal,  and the safe handling and storage requirements,  is commonly called a __________.
A chemical material, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) that can undergo a sudden and violent release  of pressure and heat is called __________.
When firing a pyrotechnic distress signal, it should be aimed __________.
Answer_3: at the vessel whose attention you want to attract

Question_Title: Most lifeboats are equipped with __________.

Epilepsy is a chronic nervous disorder characterized by __________.
Answer_2: muscular convulsions with partial or complete loss of consciousness
Answer_3: sudden thirst and craving for candy
Answer_4: severe agitation and desire to get out of close spaces

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the correct method to use when applying CO2 from a portable fire extinguisher?
Answer_1: Bounce the CO2 off the bulkhead.
Answer_2: Apply CO2 to the base of the flames in a sweeping motion.
Answer_3: Apply the CO2 to the center of the flames with a beating motion.
Answer_4: Direct the CO2 in as near a vertical upward direction as possible.

Question_Title: The oil transfer procedures aboard a tanker transferring oil are NOT required to contain __________.
Answer_1: the name of the person designated as the person in charge of transfer
Answer_2: a line diagram of the vessel's oil transfer piping
Answer_3: special procedures for topping off tanks

Question_Title: Which of the following operations should be carried out when launching an inflatable liferaft by hand?
Answer_2: Turn the valve on the CO2 cylinder to start inflation
Answer_3: Make sure the operating cord is secured to the vessel before throwing it over the side
Answer_4: After inflation, detach operating cord from liferaft

Question_Title: The "flammable limits" of an atmosphere are the __________.
Answer_1: two temperatures between which an atmosphere will self- ignite
Answer_2: upper and lower percentage of vapor concentrations in an atmosphere which will burn if an ignition source is present
Answer_3: upper and lower pressures between which an atmosphere will  not burn
Answer_4: two temperatures between which an atmosphere will burn if an ignition source is present

Question_Title: A high velocity fog nozzle will produce the most effective  spray pattern when the water pressure is not less than __________.
When using a handheld smoke signal in a lifeboat, you should __________.
Answer_1: activate the signal on the downwind side
Answer_2: activate the signal on the upwind side
Answer_3: activate the signal inside the boat
Answer_4: activate the signal at the stern

Question_Title: A chemical material, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) that supplies oxygen required to start or support fire is called a/an __________.
Material listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) that violently self-reacts under commonly occurring conditions is called  __________.
The most beneficial assistance for a person having an epileptic convulsion is to __________.
Answer_3: give the victim one 30mg tablet of phenobarbitol

Question_Title: For which of the listed classes of fire combinations would  carbon dioxide be most suitable as the extinguishing agent?
The transfer procedures for oil products are required to be posted __________.
Answer_4: where they can be easily seen or readily available

Question_Title: As a vessel sinks to a depth of 15 feet, the hydrostatic trip releases the liferaft container from its cradle by __________.

Answer_1: It will explode if exposed to a flame.
Answer_2: Phosgene gas may be formed if it comes in contact with hot  metal.
Answer_3: It will burn rapidly once ignited.
Answer_4: You cannot use water to fight the fire because it will react with the carbon tetrachloride.

Question_Title: What is the purpose of an explosimeter?
Answer_3: To indicate the absence of oxygen.

Question_Title: The bayonet catch on an all purpose nozzle is used to latch in place the __________.
Which of the items in the lifeboat equipment listed would be the most suitable for night signaling to a ship on the horizon?

A chemical material, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS), that can spontaneously burst into flames when exposed to air at temperatures below 130F (55.5C) with no ignition source needed, is called __________.
Prior to lowering the lifeboat, the most important item to  check is the __________.

Answer_2: get professional medical advice for further medical care
Answer_3: keep the patient awake and make him walk if necessary to keep him awake
Answer_4: remove any soiled clothing and put the patient in a clean bed

Question_Title: What term is listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS)  to describe a chemical that can produce life-threatening or seriously disabling health hazard ?
Your vessel is taking on bunkers from a shore side facility. If oil begins flowing from one tank vent, which of the following actions should be taken FIRST?
Answer_1: Open the intake valve to an adjacent tank.
Answer_2: Set out drip pans and sawdust and begin to mop up the spill.
Answer_3: Signal the shore control point to shutdown.
Answer_4: Close the valve on the tank vent line.

Question_Title: If the hydrostatic release mechanism for an inflatable liferaft is not periodically serviced and becomes inoperable, it will fail to __________.
Answer_1: set the water lights on immersion
Answer_2: release the dyemarker from the liferaft
Answer_3: free the liferaft from the vessel
Answer_4: break the seal on the carbon dioxide cylinder

Question_Title: A fire in a pile of linen is considered to be a class __________.
A combustible gas indicator is used to determine __________.
Answer_1: if there is sufficient oxygen to support life
Answer_2: the toxicity of flammable gases or vapors
Answer_3: the amount of CO2 present in flue gas
Answer_4: the presence of flammable gases or vapors in the air

Question_Title: Which of the following visual distress signals is acceptable for daylight use only?
Answer_2: Self-contained rocket propelled parachute red flare

Question_Title: What term is listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS)  to describe a chemical that produces only minor health effects that usually heal with or without medical attention when exposure stops?

Question_Title: In each inflatable raft, what piece of equipment is provided to make quick, emergency, temporary repairs to a cut, or rip in a raft?

Question_Title: The process that occurs when heat is generated by a chemical reaction within a substance and continues to a point of ignition is known as __________.

Answer_2: Open the bypass valve on the regulator and immediately evacuate the contaminated area.

Question_Title: To serve as the person in charge of oil cargo transfer operations onboard a self-propelled tank vessel, an individual must __________.

Question_Title: For a fixed CO2 fire fighting system, if the maximum quantity of carbon dioxide required to be maintained aboard the  vessel is 2450 pounds,  the minimum nominal pipe size of the fixed system branch lines to the various spaces must be __________.

Answer_3: The pilot cylinder discharge valve is leaking.
Answer_4: An excessive amount of insulation has been installed on the tank and piping.

Question_Title: What would be a major consequence of allowing the refrigeration system of a low pressure fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system to remain inoperable?
Answer_1: The entire charge may eventually be lost due to CO2 boil-off venting through the relief valve.
Answer_2: Liquid CO2 would overflow from the tank through the drain line as the temperature increased.
Answer_3: Excessive condensation inside the tank would freeze causing a restriction in the discharge piping.
Answer_4: The warmed charge of CO2 would not be effective in extinguishing a fire.

Question_Title: When a ship's low-pressure CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system is activated from a remote location, what determines the quantity of CO2 that will be released into the selected compartment?
Answer_1: A timer mechanism controls the discharge valve and is preset for the space being activated.
Answer_2: The discharge of CO2 will continue until the temperature of the space returns to ambient conditions.
Answer_3: The CO2 tank is divided into separate sections designated for each protected space.
Answer_4: The number of discharge nozzles in the space will determine the quantity released.

Question_Title: A continuous blast of the whistle for a period of not less  than 10 seconds, supplemented by the continuous ringing of  the general alarm bells for not less than 10 seconds, would indicate a __________.
A ship's low-pressure CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system is normally designed for a storage tank pressure and temperature of approximately __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
The carbon dioxide cylinders of a fixed fire extinguishing system may be located inside the protected space if the quantity of CO2 required to protect that space is not more than __________.
Which of the following statements is FALSE concerning the regulations pertaining to the carbon dioxide cylinder room for a CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system?
Answer_1: The compartment must be properly ventilated.
Answer_2: The ambient temperature of the room should never be allowed to exceed 130 degrees farhenheit.
Answer_3: The door must be kept unlocked.
Answer_4: The compartment shall be clearly identified and marked.

Question_Title: Normally manned machinery spaces protected by a fixed carbon dioxide system are required to be fitted with audible alarms so arranged that the alarm will be sounded prior to the discharge of CO2 by at least _________.

Normally manned machinery spaces protected by a fixed carbon dioxide system are required to be fitted with audible alarms so arranged that the alarm will be sounded prior to the discharge of CO2 by at least __________.
In a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system, where provision is made for the release of CO2 by the operation of a remote control, provision is also to be made for releasing the CO2 from __________.

When pilot cylinder pressure is used to initialize the release of CO2 from a fixed fire extinguishing system containing four storage cylinders, what would be the minimum number of pilot cylinders required in this installation?
Fixed carbon dioxide extinguishing systems for machinery spaces are actuated by one control operating the stop valve leading to the space and __________.
Answer_1: the same control releasing the CO2
Answer_2: a separate control releasing the CO2
Answer_3: two separate controls to release the CO2
Answer_4: three separate controls to release the CO2

Question_Title: A fixed carbon dioxide extinguishing system for a machinery space, designed with a stop valve installed in the line leading to the protected space, is actuated with __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning the control station activation handles for a space protected with a CO2 fixed fire extinguishing system?
Answer_1: Only one control activation handle is required for discharge piping systems designed without a separate stop valve.
Answer_2: Two separate control handles are required when a stop valve is installed in the CO2 discharge line leading to the protected space.
Answer_3: An alarm must sound for at least 20 seconds before CO2 is released into a space that is likely to be occupied.

Question_Title: Mobile offshore drilling units not required to have an official logbook shall __________.
Answer_1: maintain a logbook on Form CG-706
Answer_2: not be required to maintain a logbook
Answer_4: report only major events to the OCMI

Question_Title: Before making any welded repairs to the internals of a vessel's fuel tank in a U.S. port, the tank must be examined by __________.
A vessel's stability is greatly reduced by liquid free surface.  Which of the listed conditions would develop the  greatest adverse effect?
Answer_2: Tanks which have been pressed up to full capacity.
Answer_3: Tanks which have been completely emptied.

Question_Title: What first aid is appropriate for skin contact with tank residue from a cargo of leaded gasoline?
Answer_1: Cover the affected area with petroleum jelly.
Answer_2: Immerse the area in a solution of boric acid.
Answer_3: Wash the area with soap and water immediately.
Answer_4: Administer a strong stimulant and treat for shock.

Question_Title: A class "D" fire would involve the burning of __________.

Answer_1: It is solely the chief engineer's responsibility to ensure  all safety precautions are observed, and all entries are to be made in the engine room log.
Answer_2: The repair work cannot be done at this time due to the lack of the chemist's certificate.
Answer_3: Prior to any hot work, an inspection must be made by the senior officer present, and an entry made in the official logbook.
Answer_4: Repairs should proceed as scheduled since a chemist's certificate is not required for that type of work.

Question_Title: The principal effect of liquid free surface is dependent upon the volume of displacement of the vessel and the __________.
Answer_1: height of liquid in the tank
Answer_2: amount of liquid in the tank
Answer_4: weight of liquid in the tank

Question_Title: A fuel tank is considered to be gas free when the tank is __________.
Answer_1: inerted with carbon dioxide for 24 hours
Answer_2: free of most flammable gas concentrations
Answer_3: thoroughly ventilated for at least 24 hours
Answer_4: free of dangerous concentrations of flammable or toxic gases

Question_Title: Any single ship's compartment sustaining partial flooding with free communication to the sea will __________.
A tank or compartment is considered gas free when it is free of dangerous concentrations of __________.
Excessive free surface occurring in tanks carrying liquid cargo should be avoided in order to __________.
Where grades A, B, C, and D liquid cargoes are involved, power-driven or manually-operated spark producing devices shall not be used in the cargo pump room unless __________.
Answer_1: the compartment itself is gas free
Answer_4: all cargo tanks have been inerted

Question_Title: Servicing of a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher aboard ship would include ensuring that the __________.
Answer_1: pressure gage is within the operating range

Answer_3: cartridge weight is not less than 1/4 ounce of weight stamped on cartridge
Answer_4: recharge of weight loss exceeds 10% of the weight of charge

Question_Title: Vessel stability is greatly affected when water or fuel tanks are partially filled as a result of the __________.
Which of the following precautions are necessary when using any electrical equipment in a hazardous location, such as a cargo pumproom?
Answer_1: The pumproom is to be gas free.
Answer_2: The adjacent compartments are to be gas free.
Answer_3: Each compartment where flammable gas is expected to accumulate is to be closed and secured.

Question_Title: The powder in a dry chemical fire extinguisher __________.
Answer_1: is always ready for use and requires no attention
Answer_2: may cake up and fail to discharge properly if not occasionally agitated
Answer_3: deteriorates to an unusable condition within three years
Answer_4: puts out the fire with its cooling action

Question_Title: When any tank or compartment is partially filled with a liquid free to move as the ship rolls, the free surface effect is present.  This condition will usually __________.

Answer_1: smoke density has been decreased sufficiently to see the bulkhead opposite the compartment's entrance
Answer_2: a lifeline and explosion proof flash light are used
Answer_3: all smoke and toxic fumes are removed and an adequate oxygen supply is present
Answer_4: overhaul has been completed to remove any possible source of reignition

Question_Title: Ships are less stable when water or fuel tanks are  partially filled because of the __________.

To prevent an explosion when the pumproom has not been certified gas free and repairs are to be carried out, the only type of portable electric equipment allowed in the pumproom would be an approved __________.
Answer_1: explosion proof self-contained battery powered lamp
Answer_3: marine drop lamp and extension cords

Question_Title: Which of the following procedures should be used to examine a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher?
Answer_1: Make certain that the pressure cartridge has not been punctured.
Answer_2: Check to see that hose and nozzle are clear.
Answer_3: Ensure that dry chemical is not become caked.

Question_Title: Adverse effects due to free surface will result when __________.
Answer_1: the vessel is trimmed by the stern
Answer_2: the vessel's draft is decreased exposing more surface area  to the wind and current
Answer_3: the vessel's draft is increased, thus increasing the vessel's wetted surface area
Answer_4: a portion of liquid is removed from a full tank

Question_Title: Before a shipboard fire can be declared completely out, which of the following steps is/are essential?
Answer_1: The cause of the fire is to be known.
Answer_2: The fire area is safe for men to enter without a breathing  apparatus.
Answer_3: The fire area is sufficiently cooled so that accidental skin burns will not occur.

Question_Title: Proper maintenance of a dry chemical fire extinguisher will include __________.
Answer_4: shaking the extinguisher to loosen the caked-up portions of the powder

Question_Title: A vessel whose fuel tanks are half full is subject to __________.
If there has been a fire in a closed unventilated compartment it may be unsafe to enter because of __________.
On a newly constructed oceangoing vessel of 10,000 gross tons, equipped with an approved 100 ppm oily water  separator, and bilge monitor, the bilge monitor continuous  record must be __________.
Answer_1: kept readily available for 1 year only
Answer_2: detached monthly for enclosure in the Oil Record Book
Answer_3: maintained onboard for not less than 3 years
Answer_4: initialled after each engineering watch by the watch engineer

Question_Title: Vessel stability can be adversely affected by __________.
When reentering an engine room that has been flooded with CO2, the investigating team should initially __________.
Answer_1: leave the access door partially open
Answer_2: enter from the lowest possible level
Answer_3: enter from the highest level with breathing apparatus

Question_Title: Liquid petroleum products will become electrically charged  as a result of the __________.
Answer_1: splashing or spraying of oil into a tank
Answer_2: movement of water droplets in an oil filled tank
Answer_3: oil moving through the pipe lines
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: On U.S. inspected ships, oily water separating equipment, bilge alarms, and bilge monitors must be approved under __________.

Answer_1: replace the pressure cartridge and weigh the chemical charge
Answer_2: replace the entire charge of chemical agent
Answer_4: weigh the pressure cartridge to determine if it must be replaced

Question_Title: Free surface effect occurring in tanks should be avoided to __________.

Answer_1: are required to be at your liferaft
Answer_3: should point to the man overboard

Question_Title: Following an engine room bilge fire which is believed to be extinguished after using a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system, the investigating team should reenter the closed space __________.

Answer_4: via the highest access door and equipped with SCBAs

Question_Title: Fuel tanks should never be filled by cascading liquid through an open hatch or manhole because __________.

Answer_3: spillage of fuel could occur with an open hatch
Answer_4: water contamination of the fuel could occur

Question_Title: When petroleum products are handled, static electricity can be generated by __________.
Answer_1: splashing or agitation of the fluids

Question_Title: When handling petroleum products, static electricity is generated by moving machinery and __________.
Which of the following methods will reduce the possibility  of producing an electrical spark?
Answer_1: Using a cargo hose with a built in electrical bonding wire.
Answer_2: Connecting a bonding wire between the shoreside piping and  the vessel.
Answer_3: Placing an insulating flange or a section of nonconducting  hose in the hose setup.

Question_Title: To initially combat a fire the ventilation to a compartment should be secured to __________.
Answer_1: allow the exhaust fans to remove the smoke
Answer_2: lower the carbon monoxide smothering capabilities
Answer_3: reduce the amount of available oxygen to the fire
Answer_4: protect the fire fighters from smoke

Question_Title: An insulating flange should be used in a cargo hose connection instead of a bonding wire __________.
Answer_2: when static electricity may be generated
Answer_3: when the terminal is equipped with a cathodic protection system

Question_Title: The state of charge of a stored pressure type dry chemical  fire extinguisher can be readily determined by __________.
Answer_1: visual inspection of the pressure gage
Answer_3: removing the lid and checking the level of dry chemical

Question_Title: When fueling, it is important to ground the ship with regard to static electricity.  Therefore, you must connect the __________.
Answer_1: fuel hose before the bonding cable
Answer_2: bonding cable only if sparks are seen
Answer_3: bonding cable before the fuel hose has been connected
Answer_4: bonding cable through a ground fault circuit breaker

Question_Title: One advantage of a cartridge-operated dry chemical fire extinguisher, over that of a stored pressure dry chemical extinguisher is the former __________.
Answer_1: can be easily recharged aboard ship
Answer_3: can be discharged further from the fire

Question_Title: How can the build up of static electricity be prevented so  that a static spark does not ignite flammable vapors?
Answer_1: Each machine and hose involved in the operation should be grounded.
Answer_2: All electrical circuits near and around the fueling operations should be opened.
Answer_3: A dehumidifier used in spaces containing flammable liquids  will significantly reduce the possibility of static charges being generated.
Answer_4: Static neutralizers can be used to reduce ionization in the air.

Question_Title: The advantage of using a dry chemical fire extinguishing agent is __________.
Answer_1: permanent extinguishment regardless of the reignition sources

Question_Title: Bonding cables are used to reduce the possibility of accidental spark discharge when __________.
Answer_1: transferring flammable liquids to or from a vessel
Answer_2: transferring dry mud to or from a vessel
Answer_3: transferring fuel oil from storage to day tanks

Question_Title: To minimize the possibility of an explosion caused by the discharge of static electricity, the vessel should  __________.

Answer_2: have its electrical equipment insulated from its structure
Answer_3: have crew members use flashlights rather than AC lamps in vapor filled areas
Answer_4: have crew members use flame safety lamps during entry to areas that may contain explosive fumes

Question_Title: The correct method for connecting a grounding or bonding cable is to __________.
Answer_1: open switch, connect ground cable, close switch, and connect cargo hose
Answer_2: connect ground cable, open switch, and connect cargo hose
Answer_3: close switch, connect cargo hose, open switch, and connect  ground cable
Answer_4: connect ground cable, connect cargo hose, open switch, and  then close switch

Question_Title: Where would you expect to find a "charged mist" on a tanker?
Answer_1: In a common vent header during tank ballasting.
Answer_3: In a cargo tank during inerting operations.
Answer_4: In the overflow line while topping off.

Question_Title: An electrically "charged mist" will be found in a __________.

Answer_2: have a Reid vapor pressure of 14 psi (96.5 kPa) or more
Answer_4: have a flash point of 150F (65.5C) or more

Question_Title: A grade "E" combustible liquid is one having a flash point  of 150F or above.  An example of a grade "E" product is __________.

Answer_1: Halon cools rather than smothers a fire.

Answer_3: Halon can extinguish combustible metal fires.

Question_Title: You may improve a vessel's stability by __________.
Answer_1: keeping the fuel tanks topped off
Answer_3: keeping the fuel tanks at least half full
Answer_4: keeping at least one fuel tank empty for slops

Question_Title: In order to find out which lifeboat you are assigned, you should look at the __________.

Answer_1: The agent is extremely toxic in any concentration.
Answer_3: The agent extinguishes a fire by smothering.

Question_Title: What is the usual effect of moving weight from the main deck to a position lower in the vessel?

Answer_3: The stability of the vessel is significantly decreased.

Answer_2: position of the ship's center of gravity
Answer_3: position of the ship's center of buoyancy

Question_Title: Which statement is true concerning Halon 1301 fire extinguishing equipment?
Answer_1: The agent is highly toxic under all conditions.

Answer_3: Halon extinguishes the fire by smothering.

Answer_1: pumping double bottoms to the forepeak

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning Halon  1301 fire extinguishing equipment?
Answer_1: The agent is considered nontoxic at room temperature in low concentrations.
Answer_2: The agent is less effective than carbon dioxide.
Answer_3: Halon primarily extinguishes the fire by cooling.
Answer_4: The agent cannot be used on electrical fires because it leaves a residue.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions will occur to the ship's center of gravity if 200 tons of steel is transferred to the ships cargo hold from shore side?
Answer_2: The center of gravity will remain in the same position.
Answer_3: The center of gravity will be lowered.
Answer_4: The reserve buoyancy will remain the same.

Question_Title: Which of the listed effects will occur when an operating diesel engine ingests Halon 1301?
Answer_1: The high engine combustion temperatures liquefy the Halon.
Answer_2: The engine absorbs the Halon into its cooling system.
Answer_3: The engine decomposes the ingested Halon.

Question_Title: If a vessel rolls to the starboard side, and there are no movable or moving weights onboard, the center of gravity will __________.
If weight is added at the keel, the ship's center of gravity will __________.
Answer_4: pass through the center of flotation

Question_Title: A vessel's stability normally increases when tanks are ballasted because the vessel's __________.

Answer_1: the sounding tube cap from a damaged tank is missing

Answer_3: you have recently replaced a gasket in a watertight door
Answer_4: you operate the dewatering system from a flooded compartment

Question_Title: A vessel's center of gravity is lowered when the __________.

Answer_1: hold the lifeboat's head up into the seas

Question_Title: When checking the liquid level in a tank on the weather deck of a vessel, you should position yourself __________.

Answer_3: at a right angle to the wind direction
Answer_4: so that the obstruction of your body will protect you from  the fumes

Question_Title: Many uninspected motor vessels require load lines.  For the purpose of the Load Line Regulations, the term 'surveyor' means __________.

Answer_4: any person from the Coast Guard who performs duties with respect to the inspection, enforcement, and administration  of Title 52 of the revised statute

Question_Title: Which fire extinguisher is most prone to freezing when stowed in low temperatures?

Answer_1: is now higher than 12 inches above the deck

Answer_3: will cover no more than 25 percent of deck space
Answer_4: will be easily visible from the bridge

Question_Title: What is a major advantage of using a positive pressure type self-contained breathing apparatus?
Answer_1: The equipment is lightweight and the wearer can work without difficulty in confined spaces.

Answer_3: The speed with which it can be put into operation is around 45 seconds.
Answer_4: Facial hair will not affect the mask performance.

Question_Title: To operate a CO2 fire extinguisher equipped with a squeeze  grip handle, you are to remove the locking pin and __________.
Answer_4: rotate the cutter disc valve wheel

Answer_2: a breathing bag containing excessive pressure

Question_Title: To use a portable CO2 fire extinguisher, you must FIRST __________.
Answer_3: open the valve on the side of the tank

Question_Title: Prior to entering a compartment containing an atmosphere potentially dangerous to life or health, you should don an  approved self-contained breathing apparatus.  Which one of  the listed devices is a self-contained breathing apparatus?

Answer_1: the cylinder valve from coming loose
Answer_2: the handle from contacting the cylinder

Answer_1: inspecting the pressure gauge to ensure the needle is within operating range

Question_Title: While donning the positive-pressure self-contained breathing apparatus, you discover that the air cylinder pressure gage and the regulator pressure gage differ from each other by 500 psi.  Which of the listed action should you consider as appropriate?
Answer_1: Replace the defective gages with a new pair from the spare parts inventory.
Answer_3: Assume that the lower gage reading is correct.

Question_Title: Which of the components listed are interchangeable between  different backpack self-contained breathing apparatus produced by various manufacturers?
Which of the listed fire extinguishers cannot be easily recharged aboard ship?

Answer_1: tagged and restowed properly in its rack

Answer_3: given to the chief engineer for recharging
Answer_4: tagged 'empty' and stowed separately from charged extinguishers

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the correct procedure for closing a watertight door?
Answer_1: Loosely set up one dog on the opposite side from the hinges, snugly set up two dogs on the hinge side, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.
Answer_2: Loosely set up two dogs adjacent to the hinges, snugly set up one dog on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.
Answer_3: Snugly set up two dogs on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.
Answer_4: Loosely set up one dog on the hinge side, snugly set up two dogs on the opposite side from the hinges, then evenly set up all the remaining dogs.

Question_Title: If the empty weight of a B-II, portable, CO2, fire  extinguisher bottle is 34 pounds (15.4 kg), the cylinder must be recharged if the gross weight decreases to  __________.

Answer_1: An adjacent store room containing spare engine parts.
Answer_2: A store room directly above the laundry room containing combustibles.
Answer_3: An adjacent store room containing spare bed mattresses.
Answer_4: An adjacent store room containing laundry detergent.

Question_Title: You notice smoke coming from an open laundry room doorway.  After activating the fire alarm, which of the following would you do FIRST?

Question_Title: You notice smoke coming from an open laundry room doorway.  After activating the fire alarm, which of the following would you do FIRST?
Answer_1: Attempt to determine what is burning.
Answer_2: Locate and acquire the nearest emergency breathing apparatus.
Answer_4: Wait for the fire team to arrive and assist them as instructed.

Question_Title: You notice smoke coming from an open laundry room doorway, which smells like electrical insulation.  After activating the fire alarm, which of the following would be the lowest action priority?
Answer_1: Close the door to the room.
Answer_2: Locate the nearest CO2 or dry chemical extinguisher.
Answer_3: Secure power to the washers and dryers.
Answer_4: Break out the nearest fire hose.

Question_Title: You notice smoke coming from an open laundry room doorway, accompanied by the odor of cotton fabric.   After activating the fire alarm, you might do any of the following next, EXCEPT __________.
Answer_1: begin breaking out the nearest fire hose

Answer_4: locate and don an available SCBA

Question_Title: As a general rule of thumb, with no adverse wind conditions, approximately how far could a straight stream of water reach from a fire hose having a nozzle pressure of 100 psi?

Answer_4: The fire hose should be partially charged before deploying the hose from the hydrant.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is FALSE concerning the proper procedure in handling a fire hose?
Answer_1: A 2-1/2 inch hose should be deployed with a minimum of a nozzleman and two hosemen.
Answer_2: Backup hoseman should be placed wherever the hose makes a significant turn.
Answer_3: A spanner wrench must always be used when attaching nozzles or additional lengths of hoses.
Answer_4: There is less hose nozzle thrust when using high velocity fog when compared to straight stream.

Question_Title: When fighting a large fire on your vessel and attacking it from ABOVE the space on fire, it is important to __________.
Answer_1: rotate personnel due to heat stress
Answer_2: station personnel on the hot deck immediately above the fire
Answer_3: stay low by kneeling or crouching on the deck

Question_Title: When fighting a large fire on your vessel and attacking it from ABOVE the space on fire, it is important to __________.
Answer_2: stand erect and not stay low or crouch on the deck

Question_Title: When fighting a large fire on your vessel and attacking it from ABOVE the space on fire, it is important to __________.

Answer_2: station personnel on the hot deck, immediately above the fire
Answer_3: cool the deck directly above the space of the fire

What is the minimum period of time that the air supply for a self-contained breathing apparatus is required to last?
What is the minimum period of time that the air supply for a self-contained breathing apparatus is required to last?
A fully charged standard SCBA can be expected to supply air under nonstressful conditions for approximately _______.
A fully evolved fire has occurred in the HFO centrifuge room.  The MOST serious effect of not cooling the adjacent bulkheads and deck will __________.
Answer_1: blister the painted surfaces in the adjourning spaces
