Answer_3: contribute to noxious gases collecting in the adjacent spaces
Answer_4: allow a backdraft condition to occur when the door to the room is opened to extinguish the fire

Question_Title: A vessel has eight B-II CO2 fire extinguishers.  How many spare charges must the vessel carry?
Which of the fire extinguishers listed is to be weighed annually and sent ashore for recharging if the weight loss  exceeds 10% of the weight of a full charge?
The safe and efficient use of the facepiece of a self-contained breathing apparatus is directly  influenced by __________.
Before the seas get rough, it is a good safety practice to __________.
A vessel has eight B-II CO2 fire extinguishers.  How many spare units must the vessel carry?
A vessel has eight B-II CO2 fire extinguishers.  How many spare extinguishers must the vessel carry?
If a vessel has four hand portable fire extinguishers that can be recharged by personnel onboard, how many spare charges must be carried?
When the scuppers are plugged and an oil spill occurs on deck, you should __________.
Answer_1: use absorbent materail, such as sawdust, to clean up the spill
Answer_2: remove the plugs from the scuppers to allow the spill to run overboard and wipe the area dry with rags
Answer_3: remove scuppers and wash the fuel overboard with a solvent

Question_Title: Which of the following vessels is NOT exempt from mandatory requirements on ballast water management for control of non-indigenous species in waters of the United States?
Answer_2: A vessel engaged in the foreign export of Alaskan North Slop Crude Oil.
Answer_3: A passenger vessel equipped with a functioning system designed to kill aquatic organisms in ballast water.
Answer_4: A crude oil tanker engaged in the coastwise trade.

Question_Title: Many uninspected vessels require load lines to indicate the maximum __________.
Answer_2: amidship's draft to which a vessel can be lawfully  submerged
Answer_3: angle of reduced freeboard for subdivision calculations
Answer_4: freeboard for the light ship displacement

Question_Title: While wearing a self-contained breathing apparatus the alarm bell begins ringing.  Which of the following conditions does this indicate?
Answer_1: There is a 4-5 minute supply of air remaining in the air cylinder.
Answer_2: There is approximately 500 psi (3.5 MPa) of pressure left in the air cylinder.
Answer_3: The wearer should immediately leave the contaminated area.

Question_Title: You are replacing a section of heavy piping on deck and using a chain fall to lift the pipe.  Which of the following precautions should be taken to prevent personal injury?
Answer_1: Position several men under the pipe so they can catch it if it falls.
Answer_2: Attach lines to the ends of the pipe and have your helpers  steady the load.
Answer_3: Place an old mattress under the hoist to prevent the load from hitting the deck.
Answer_4: Have a first aid kit at the job site.

Question_Title: Plastic garbage bags containing comminuted paper and rags may be discharged __________.
Comminuted or ground garbage which will be discharged into the sea, must be able to pass through a screen with a mesh size no larger than __________.
International Oil Pollution Prevention (IOPP) Certificates are required for each U.S. oil tanker at or above  __________.
The Exclusive Economic Zone extends from the baseline of territorial sea of the United States seaward ___________ .
According to MARPOL, the definition of graywater includes drainage from __________.
According to MARPOL, the defination of medical waste does NOT include __________.
Portable carbon dioxide fire extinguishers must be recharged __________.
Answer_1: when the remaining charge volume is less than 90% of the required volume
Answer_4: when the remaining charge weight is 10% less than the required weight

Question_Title: With regards to the load line marks, the reason for the placement of mark 'WNA' is __________.
Answer_1: more severe weather is expected in the North Atlantic in winter
Answer_2: more freeboard is required in the North Atlantic in winter
Answer_3: less draft is allowed in the North Atlantic in winter

Question_Title: When the alarm bell on a self-contained breathing apparatus sounds, how much air supply remains?
Answer_4: Less than 1 minute supply of air.

Question_Title: Which of the following is NOT a MARPOL, Annex V, Special Area?
According to MARPOL, the definition of oil does NOT include __________.
Passenger vessels shall maintain an Oil Record Book, if the vessel is __________.
The No. 2 lifeboat on a vessel would be found __________.
Answer_1: aft of No. 1 lifeboat port side
Answer_2: aft of No. 1 lifeboat starboard side

Question_Title: An ocean going ship of 400 gross tons or above must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection with dimensions outlined in Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) or be substituted with a suitable __________.
Answer_1: portable flange adapter using a four bolt pattern and a bolt circle diameter of 83 mm
Answer_2: portable flange adapter using a five bolt pattern and a bolt circle diameter of 183 mm
Answer_3: portable flange adapter using a six bolt pattern and a bolt circle diameter of 183 mm
Answer_4: portable flange adapter using a eight bolt pattern and a bolt circle diameter of 83 mm

Question_Title: To determine if all requirements of the Declaration of Inspection are met for oil transfer operations just prior to bunkering from a shoreside facility, __________.
Answer_1: vessel and bunker facility are jointly inspected by their respective designated person-in-charge
Answer_2: bunker facility is inspected by the designated person-in-charge of the vessel and vice versa for the vessel
Answer_3: vessel and bunker facility are independently inspected by the designated persons-in-charge
Answer_4: vessel and bunker facility must be inspected by a  representative of the Coast Guard Captain of the Port

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions represents a particular advantage of using a pressure demand type self-contained breathing apparatus in an atmosphere that is immediately dangerous to life or health?
Answer_1: The positive pressure in the facepiece prevents contaminated air from entering the facepiece.
Answer_2: The average operating time for most air cylinders is over an hour.
Answer_3: The equipment used is lightweight and easy to wear by reducing physical strain on the wearer.
Answer_4: The equipment is compact and the wearer can work in confined spaces without difficulty.

Question_Title: When is it required for carbon dioxide fire extinguishers to be recharged?
Answer_3: When the charged weight decreases by 10%.
Answer_4: When the trigger seal has been broken.

Question_Title: A flat block placed under the end of a shore for the purpose of distributing pressure is referred to as a __________.
To order new fire hose with the correct coupling thread, you should specify __________.
Static water pressure on the hull of a ship is greatest at the __________.
After measuring the length to which a section of shoring should be cut, you should cut the shoring __________.
Answer_1: approximately 1/2 inch longer than measured length to allow for trimming
Answer_2: approximately 1/2 inch shorter than measured length to allow for the use of wedges
Answer_3: to the same length as the measured length
Answer_4: approximately 1/2 inch shorter per foot of shoring to allow wet expansion

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning fire hose stations used in the engine room of a tank or cargo vessel?
Answer_1: It must be marked in red letters two inches high
Answer_2: National Standard fire hose coupling threads shall be used  having 9 threads per inch for 2 1/2 inch hose and 7 1/2 threads per inch for 1 1/2 inch hose.
Answer_3: In heavy weather, the hose may be removed temporarily from  the hydrant.

Question_Title: Wooden shoring is used in shipboard damage control to __________.
Answer_1: force a warped bulkhead back into its normal position
Answer_3: force a sprung bulkhead back into place
Answer_4: support a damaged bulkhead in position

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning fire hoses used within the machinery spaces of cargo vessels?
Answer_1: The fire hoses must be in 75 foot lengths.
Answer_2: The fire hoses must be 1 1/2 inches in diameter or less.
Answer_3: The fire hoses must be of the lined type.
Answer_4: The fire hoses must all be fitted with approved 5/8 inch nozzles.

Question_Title: Special transportation hazards of bulk LPG include __________.
If a fixed fire extinguishing system is installed on any vessel, it must be of a type approved by the __________.
To prevent overpressurization when loading liquid petroleum products, cargo tanks should be fitted with a/an __________.
Pressure-vacuum relief valves on tank vessel cargo tanks should be kept in good working order to prevent __________.
Fire main outlet valves or hydrants located on exposed decks shall be __________.
Answer_1: behind glass or a suitably marked enclosure
Answer_2: protected against freezing or be fitted with cutout valves  and drain valves
Answer_3: opened up and internally examined at each Coast Guard biannual inspection for certification

Question_Title: Which of the following pressures represents the normal pressure setting of a pressure-vacuum relief valve?
Fire doors are released by a/an __________.
Answer_1: hydraulic directional valve that automatically releases the door in the event of a disruption to the control power system
Answer_2: spring-loaded catch that automatically lifts to release the door in the event of the presence of a fire
Answer_3: method that automaticly releases the door in the event of a disruption of control system power

Question_Title: Which of the precautions listed should be observed when taking on diesel fuel?
Answer_1: Secure all lighting to the main deck.
Answer_2: Provide a portable fan to blow away fumes.
Answer_4: Display a black triangle during daylight hours.

Question_Title: After ballasting a fuel tank, which of the listed valves should you close FIRST?
When you have completed bunkering operations, the hoses should be __________.
Answer_2: drained into drip pans or tanks
Answer_3: stowed with their ends open for venting
Answer_4: steam cleaned and flushed with hot water

Question_Title: When should you expect to find an insulating flange in a fueling hose?
Answer_2: When a bonding cable is employed.
Answer_3: When static electricity is not expected to be a problem.
Answer_4: When the terminal is equipped with a cathodic protection system.

Question_Title: To avoid excessive pressures in the fuel oil filling system during bunkering, you should __________.
Answer_1: close the tank filling valves quickly
Answer_2: top off all tanks at the same time
Answer_3: fill one tank at a time
Answer_4: reduce the loading rate when topping off

Question_Title: For all loading operations, the terminal must supply the vessel with a means in which the vessel's designated person-in-charge may stop the flow of oil to the vessel, insuring immediate shutdown in the event of a hose rupture, tank overflow, etc.  This means of control may be activated __________.
Answer_3: via a communications device used for no other purpose

Question_Title: During fueling operations oil is detected in the water adjacent to your vessel.  If however, it is determined to be from some source other than your vessel, you should __________.
Answer_1: secure operations until the exact type of oil is determined
Answer_2: make an entry in the oil record book to that effect

Question_Title: The term "load on top" is used on many crude oil carriers, is to provide a method for  __________.
Answer_1: calculating the ullage in the cargo tanks
Answer_3: the loading of new cargo into a decanted slop tank as a procedure to minimize pollution
Answer_4: calculating the ratio of cargo expansion in a cargo tank

Question_Title: Which of the following operations must be personally supervised by the person-in-charge when taking on fuel?
Answer_1: Posting of the Declaration of Inspection in a conspicuous place under glass.
Answer_2: Topping off any tanks being loaded.
Answer_3: Overboard disposal of all waste oil or slops from drip pans.
Answer_4: Sampling performed periodically during loading to ensure uniformity.

Question_Title: While loading bulk liquid cargo, a tank valve jams open. You should FIRST __________.
Answer_2: run out the vessel's fire hose
Answer_3: order the shore facility to shut down

Question_Title: Prior to loading or discharging bulk cargo, all sea valves  should be __________.
"Line Displacement" is a procedure that is followed at an oil terminal facility, when there is a change of __________.
Answer_1: cargo lines at the terminal before loading
Answer_2: product before the start of loading
Answer_3: product during the final phase of loading

Question_Title: If a leak in an oil hose coupling cannot be stopped by tightening the coupling bolts, you should __________.
Answer_1: notify the Coast Guard of a potential pollution incident
Answer_2: reduce the pumping pressure to reduce the leakage rate
Answer_3: spread absorbent material on deck beneath the leak
Answer_4: stop transfer operations and renew the gasket

Question_Title: If you are loading a petroleum cargo at below average room temperatures, you must insure that __________.
One consideration for determining the safest maximum rate at which bunker fuel may be received is by the __________.
Answer_2: size of the fuel storage tanks ashore
Answer_3: distance to the fuel storage tanks ashore
Answer_4: number of tanks to be filled

Question_Title: A fire station located in the engine room, is required by regulations to have __________.
Answer_1: a spanner wrench suitable for the size of hose at that station
Answer_2: lined or unlined hose, depending upon its location
Answer_3: a 6 foot or 10 foot low velocity fog applicator

Question_Title: The safe rate of bunkering heavy fuel oil is directly related to the __________.
Answer_1: type of fuel transfer pump aboard
Answer_2: temperature of the fuel oil being received
Answer_3: size of the fuel storage tanks ashore
Answer_4: distance from the fuel oil storage tanks ashore

Question_Title: One precaution to take prior to working in a freshly painted compartment where there are an excessive amount of paint fumes, is to __________.
Answer_3: wear a breathing apparatus while working
Answer_4: keep a charged fire hose handy

Question_Title: Fire main outlet valves, or hydrants shall be installed __________.
Answer_1: in screened enclosures in all passageways
Answer_2: where they are protected from the weather
Answer_3: in a protected location to prevent cargo damage
Answer_4: pointing downward or horizontal to prevent kinking of the fire hose

Question_Title: Your ship has run aground and it is necessary to determine whether or not a compartment has flooded. Therefore, you should __________.
Answer_1: open the watertight door and take a quick look
Answer_2: open the hatch dogs on the side away from the hinges
Answer_3: tap the bulkhead with a hammer to check for a water level
Answer_4: feel the bulkhead to see if it is hot

Question_Title: After an emergency shoring installation has been completed, the __________.
Answer_1: repair is completed and no further action is needed
Answer_2: timbers are nailed in place to prevent looseness
Answer_3: shoring should be frequently inspected for looseness
Answer_4: damaged plating should be straightened by heating

Question_Title: In a compartment that has been completely flooded, the greatest pressure will be exerted __________.
Answer_1: along the bottom of any bulkhead
Answer_2: at the center of all bulkheads
Answer_3: along the top of any bulkhead
Answer_4: on the overhead of the compartment

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning fire pumps used aboard cargo vessels of 1,500 gross tons and over, contracted for on, or after May 26, 1965?
Answer_1: The fire pumps may be used for other purposes provided at least one of the pumps is kept available for use on the fire main system at all times.
Answer_2: Fire pumps shall have a minimum capacity of at least one-third of that required for an independent bilge pump.
Answer_3: Each pump shall be capable of delivering water simultaneously from the two highest outlets at a pilot tube pressure of approximately 25 psi.
Answer_4: The total area of the pipes leading from a pump shall be less than the discharge area of the pump.

Question_Title: When water washing epoxy-coated cargo tanks, the temperature and pressure of the wash water should generally not exceed  __________.
When using portable tank cleaning machines, the hoses may be disconnected when __________.
Answer_1: the machine is inside the tank
Answer_2: the machine is not inside the tank
Answer_3: a sailor is standing by the machine
Answer_4: the hose has been partially drained

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning fire main system details used aboard 2500 gross ton cargo vessels on international voyages?
Answer_1: The vessel must be equipped with a minimum of two independently driven fire pumps.
Answer_2: Fifty foot length hoses of 1 1/2 inch diameter may be used in  exterior locations on the vessel.
Answer_3: The total area of the pipes leading from a fire pump must be more than the discharge area of the pump to avoid an excessive back pressure buildup (discharge head).

Question_Title: A gurgling noise is heard from within a cargo tank when discharging cargo, this would indicate that the __________.
Answer_4: tank foot valve is partially clogged

Question_Title: Which of the listed pumping arrangements will be hazardous  when two similar centrifugal pumps are used to discharge a  cargo of flammable liquid?
Answer_1: Both pumps operating at the same speed and discharging into a common line.
Answer_2: Both pumps operating at the same speed and taking suction from a common line.
Answer_3: Each pump operating at a different speed and taking suction from a common line.
Answer_4: Each pump operating at a different pressure and discharging into a common line.

Question_Title: If flammable liquids are being pumped with a centrifugal pump, you should __________.
Answer_1: stop the pump immediately if it becomes vapor bound
Answer_2: throttle the discharge valve to assure positive pumping
Answer_3: vent the pump casing continuously to expel vapors
Answer_4: gag relief valves to prevent recirculating and heating of the liquid

Question_Title: If a fixed foam system is activated aboard a tank vessel, constructed in 1968, you can expect the foam supply to last for a minimum of __________.
When preparing to pump flammable liquids with a centrifugal pump, you should __________.
Answer_1: lift the relief valve by hand to check its operation
Answer_2: draw a small quantity of liquid to prime the pump
Answer_3: have a standby pump running with the discharge valve closed
Answer_4: check for gland leakage and any fire hazard

Question_Title: After taking on fuel oil, the hoses should be disconnected  and __________.
Answer_1: draped over the fantail to dry out
Answer_2: drained over the side and washed out
Answer_3: drained into the bilges and washed out
Answer_4: drained into buckets or fuel tanks

Question_Title: After transferring fuel to another vessel, hoses should be  drained __________.
Which of the listed cargo hoses presents the greatest resistance to collapsing when operated under vacuum?
If your vessel is to carry ten portable foam fire extinguishers, you must maintain a supply of at least __________.
A portable foam fire extinguisher carried aboard a tank vessel must be recharged every __________.
At what interval must a foam fire extinguisher be recharged if the vessel's Certificate of Inspection is issued for a period of two years?
Tankers carrying cryogenic cargoes, such as LNG, are fitted with gas detector systems alarmed at 30% of the lower explosive limit.  If the gas detector alarms sounds, this means __________.
Answer_1: the detector sensor is sampling a space where the cargo vapor concentration is 30 percent by volume
Answer_2: an explosion is about to take place
Answer_3: the detector is sampling a space in which 30 percent of the atmosphere is explosive
Answer_4: a flammable vapor concentration exists at the sample point, but it is too lean to burn

Question_Title: An LNG carrier has an approved type of gas detecting system to detect methane leaks in the __________.
Span gas is used aboard liquefied natural gas carriers to __________.
To prevent the overflow of cargo tanks due to expansion, you should top off __________.
Answer_1: to the bottom of the expansion trunk
Answer_2: to within 1% to 3% of its capacity
Answer_3: to within 1 to 3 inches of its capacity
Answer_4: 1 to 3 inches from top of the vent pipe

Question_Title: In order to release CO2 to the machinery spaces from a fixed fire extinguishing system, you must __________.
Answer_1: actuate an alarm and open the engine room control valve
Answer_2: actuate an alarm and open the engine room CO2 releasing valve
Answer_3: open the engine room control valve and shut off engine room ventilation fans
Answer_4: open the engine room control valve and then the CO2 releasing valve

Question_Title: Why is it important for fuel oil tanks not to be topped off at the inner bottom level when loading on a cold day?
Answer_1: Increased viscosity of the product needs higher loading pressure, which increases the chances of a spill.
Answer_2: Air pockets may cause the fuel to bubble out of the ullage  hole.
Answer_3: The temperature rise of the fuel will cause an overflow.
Answer_4: Fueling valve may become stuck closed and cause the fuel oil to spill before the valve can be opened.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes how the main bank of CO2 bottles is released into an engine room from most fixed CO2 fire extinguishing systems?
Answer_1: Manually releasing the bottles in groups of four.
Answer_2: CO2 pressure from the pilot cylinders.
Answer_3: Steel wire trigger lines provided to all bottles in the main bank.
Answer_4: Remote pull cables provided to each group of four bottles in the main bank.

Question_Title: During fueling operations, which of the listed precautions  should be taken when topping off fuel tanks?
Answer_1: Reduce the pumping rate by closing the deck filling valve.
Answer_3: Place 5 gallon containers under all flange connections in the fuel line.
Answer_4: Reduce the pumping rate and sound tanks frequently as the level rises.

Question_Title: The most critical part of the bunkering operations, which can result in an oil spill, is when the __________.
After fuel tanks have been topped off, which of the listed  procedures should be followed next?
Answer_1: The pressure-vacuum relief valve should be reset.
Answer_2: The tanks should be made seaworthy to prevent contamination.
Answer_3: The tanks should be sounded to verify levels.
Answer_4: The tanks should be marked with a bull stamp on the manifold filling valve.

Question_Title: If the overflow tank high-level alarm sounds while the fuel oil tanks are being topped off, the engineer should __________.
Answer_1: close the static leg filling valve
Answer_2: close the overflow tank filling valve
Answer_3: reduce the fuel oil pumping rate
Answer_4: stop the fuel oil pumping operation

Question_Title: To avoid shock pressures in the fuel oil filling hoses while you are topping off tanks, the __________.
Answer_2: oiler should sound all tanks continuously
Answer_4: tank vent valves should be clear

Question_Title: When a fuel oil tank is being topped off during bunkering operations, the tank valve should be closed __________.
Answer_2: to prevent gas from escaping through the pressure-vacuum relief valves
Answer_3: after the shore pumps are stopped

Question_Title: The amount of expansion space to be left in a fuel tank when fuel oil is being received, is determined by the __________.
Answer_1: quantity of fuel to be received
Answer_2: flash point of the fuel as it is received
Answer_3: fuel temperature as it is received
Answer_4: viscosity of the fuel being received

Question_Title: A cylinder used for storing CO2 in a fixed firefighting system, must be hydrostatically retested and restamped every __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) requires an emergency means of stopping the flow of oil during oil transfer operations.  The emergency means must be operable  from the __________.
Answer_1: usual operating station of the person-in-charge
Answer_4: emergency operating station of the person-in-charge

Question_Title: A cargo pump driven by an internal combustion engine on the weather deck must have __________.
Answer_2: two remote manual shutdown stations located fore and aft
Answer_3: three remote manual shutdown stations located fore, aft, and at the midpoint
Answer_4: four remote manual shutdown stations located fore, aft, port side midpoint, and starboard side midpoint

Question_Title: A hole in the hull above the waterline may be temporarily patched with __________.
Which of the following statements is correct concerning fixed carbon dioxide fire extinguishing systems?
Answer_1: A separate supply of carbon dioxide must be provided for each space protected.
Answer_2: The piping shall be used for no other purpose except that it may be incorporated with the fire-detecting system.
Answer_3: Distribution piping within the space shall be proportioned  from the supply line to give the proper throttling to the outlets.

Question_Title: When a tank vessel with a capacity of 250 barrels is transferring oil to a facility, the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), require an emergency means to stopping the flow of oil which must be operable from __________.
Answer_1: two or more locations on the tank vessel
Answer_2: a remote location of equal distance from the tank vessel and facility
Answer_3: the usual operating station of the person in charge of the  oil transfer
Answer_4: the engine room, cargo control room and bridge sequentially

Question_Title: In an emergency, a hole in the hull below the waterline, not over three inches in diameter, can be temporarily sealed by __________.
Answer_2: stuffing a mattress in the hole

Question_Title: When a cylinder is used to store CO2 in a fixed firefighting system and is retested in accordance with regulations, all  flexible connections between cylinders and distribution piping must be renewed or tested at __________.

Answer_1: shuts off the main propulsion plant
Answer_2: shuts off the firefighting foam systems
Answer_3: stops the flow of oil to shore facility or other vessel
Answer_4: secures electrical power to all motors

Question_Title: Fuel containers used for refueling portable gasoline driven pumps and exceding a capacity of five gallons, should be stowed __________.
Answer_4: on or above the weather deck in locations designated by the master

Question_Title: It is generally not advisable to drive a wedge into a crack occurring in the hull because wedges __________.
Which of the signals listed is required to be displayed during the day while loading fuel?
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) requires an emergency means of stopping the flow of oil during oil transfer operations.  That emergency means may be a/an __________.
Answer_3: emergency pump control on the cargo deck

Question_Title: The best emergency repair to a crack forming in the vessel's hull is to __________.
Answer_2: drill the ends of the crack and apply a concrete patch
Answer_3: weld a doubler plate over the crack
Answer_4: weld a metal box over the crack and applying air pressure

Question_Title: The component in an inert gas system used for cleaning the  gas of solid and sulphur combustion products, while simultaneously cooling the inert gas, is called the __________.

Answer_1: 15 seconds on any facility which starts operations after April 1, 1985

Answer_3: 90 seconds on any facility which starts operations after December 1, 1976
Answer_4: 120 seconds on any facility which starts operations after July 1, 1973

Question_Title: An acceptable method of temporarily sealing a crack formed  in the hull of a vessel is to __________.
Answer_1: apply a patch of sheet packing backed by a shole and shoring
Answer_3: shore up the crack with welded braces
Answer_4: tack weld a doubler plate over the crack

Question_Title: The fire extinguishing action of CO2 comes mostly from __________.
Answer_1: breaking the fire chemical chain reaction
Answer_4: isolating the heat from the fuel

Question_Title: The emergency shutdown requirements of Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) apply to __________.

Where will you find the procedures for the reporting of oil discharge into the water?
Answer_4: The vessel's International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate

Question_Title: Which of the listed functions is the purpose of a gas scrubber in an inert gas generation system?
Answer_2: Maintains the oxygen content at 5% by volume.
Answer_3: Drains off static electricity in the inert gas.
Answer_4: Maintains the water seal on the gas main.

Question_Title: The lengthening of a crack formed in the shell plating of a ship may be prevented by __________.
Answer_1: welding brackets across both ends of the crack
Answer_2: chipping out and slot welding the entire crack
Answer_3: drilling a hole at each end of the crack
Answer_4: cutting a square notch at each end of the crack

Question_Title: The empty weight of a B-II CO2 fire extinguisher is 34 pounds, therefore, the full charged weight is __________.
A high concentration of hydrogen sulfide gas is most likely to be found in which of the locations listed?
Answer_1: Fireroom bilges where hydrazine has accumulated.
Answer_2: Sewage compartment bilges where leaked sewage has accumulated.
Answer_3: Engine room bilges where chemical cleaners and solvents have accumulated.
Answer_4: Emergency battery storage compartment where discharge gases have accumulated.

Question_Title: Portable carbon dioxide fire extinguishers should be sent ashore to be recharged __________.
Answer_1: when the remaining charge volume is less than 90 percent of the required VOLUME
Answer_4: when the weight loss exceeds 10% of weight of charge

Question_Title: Inert gas systems fitted on tank vessels must be fitted with an alarm to give an audible and visual warning when the oxygen content of the inert gas exceeds __________.
Prior to entering a shipboard compartment containing spilled sewage, you should test the atmosphere in the compartment for __________.
The empty weight of a '100 pound' cylinder in a fixed CO2 fire extinguishing system is 130 pounds.  What is the minimum acceptable weight of the cylinder before recharging would be required?

Answer_1: normal water supply at the water seal is lost
Answer_2: the temperature of the inert gas being delivered to the cargo tanks is more than 150F
Answer_3: the cooling water supply to the scrubbers is lost

Question_Title: When pumping sour crude, which gas should be tested for prior to entering the cargo pumproom to repair a leaking pump?
On a tanker vessel, what is the required combined capacity of the inert gas generating system as compared to the total capacity of all the cargo pumps which can be operated simultaneously?
Waste oil from the lube oil sumps of machinery may NOT be __________.
Which of the following methods is used to supply inert gas  from a flue gas system to the cargo tanks?
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) prohibit draining __________.
Answer_1: waste oil into the slop tank
Answer_2: lube oil purifiers into the bilge
Answer_4: lube oil strainers into drip pans

Question_Title: After allowing for pressure losses, the pressure-volume capacity of an inert gas blower must be able to maintain a  pressure, in any cargo tank, with a minimum of __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) prohibits draining __________.
Answer_3: fuel oil strainers into the ship's bilges
Answer_4: lube oil strainers into fixed drip pans

Question_Title: The purpose of the deck seal in an inert gas system is to prevent __________.
Answer_1: flammable vapors from entering machinery space

Question_Title: The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that a  ship's oily bilge slops may be pumped in port only if the __________.
Answer_2: local port authority has completed the required pollution inspection
Answer_3: discharge is led to a slop barge or shoreside tank
Answer_4: engineer on watch has signed the declaration of inspection

Question_Title: Open tank hatches and ullage holes from tanks which are not gas free, and unattended, must be protected by __________.
Bilges may be pumped __________.
Answer_3: overboard through an oily water separator
Answer_4: anytime in an emergency, i.e. main engine lube oil failure

Question_Title: Flame screens used on ullage openings prevent flames from entering a tank by __________.
Answer_1: reducing the cross-sectional area of the opening
Answer_2: restricting the flow of gases through the opening
Answer_3: creating turbulence in the exiting gas stream
Answer_4: dissipating heat from the flame into the surrounding metal

Question_Title: Following a grounding, you can best determine that a SLACK  fuel oil tank has been holed by __________.
Answer_2: waiting for the vessel to list

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations, any discharge of oil, or oily mixture into the sea from any oil tanker, or from any ship of 400 gross tons and above, other than an oil tanker, is prohibited while in a "special" area. These "special areas" are designated in __________.
Your vessel has run aground and upon taking fuel oil tank soundings, you find that a fuel tank level has increased. You therefore should suspect __________.
Answer_2: a crack in the hull portion of the fuel tank
Answer_4: contamination from the saltwater flushing system

Question_Title: According to 46 CFR, a single layer of tank vent flame screen must be composed of corrosion resistant wire and  at least a mesh of __________.
According to Federal Regulations, new  tank vessels enroute beyond the 50 mile limit may not discharge an oily mixture into the sea from a cargo tank or cargo pump room unless __________.
Answer_1: the quantity of oil discharged into the sea does not exceed 1/30,000 of the total quantity of cargo carried on board
Answer_3: discharging oil at a rate not exceeding 200 liters per nautical mile
Answer_4: the quantity of oil discharged into the surrounding waters  does not exceed 1/600,000 of the total quantity of cargo carried onboard

Question_Title: The device used for preventing the passage of flames into enclosed spaces is called a __________.
How many approved B-II fire extinguishers must be carried in the machinery space of a 3000 HP vessel?
When cargo oil tanks are cleaned by crude oil washing while in port, __________.
Answer_1: provision should be made for a shoreside holding tank or an onboard slop tank
Answer_2: water should be allowed to settle before discharge overboard
Answer_3: filters should be installed in bilge strainers to absorb oil before discharge overboard
Answer_4: the dock supervisor need not be notified before discharging oily mixtures overboard

Question_Title: At the earliest indication of fire aboard your vessel, you  must FIRST __________.
Answer_2: determine which type of fire is burning

Question_Title: A new ocean going ship of 2000 gross tons having an inoperative oily water separator may dispose of its bilge slops by __________.
Answer_1: holding its slops onboard until they can be pumped into the city sewer system
Answer_2: circulating them through the lube oil purifier to remove water and debris
Answer_3: holding its slops onboard until they can be discharged to a shoreside reception facility
Answer_4: pumping them into a settling tank for separation before pumping the oily water residue overboard

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the correct action to take when three crew members discover a fire?
Answer_1: One man report the fire, and the other two men fight the fire.
Answer_2: One man report the fire, one man fight the fire, and one man evacuate and secure the area.
Answer_3: One man report the fire, one man fight the fire, and one man act as a safety observer.
Answer_4: All three men fight the fire and report it immediately after it is extinguished.

Question_Title: A low velocity fog applicator is held in an all-purpose nozzle by a bayonet joint.  The applicator is prevented from rotating in the joint by __________.
In port, after chemically cleaning a fuel oil tank, you should dispose of the waste oil by __________.
Answer_1: pumping it into the sewer connection
Answer_3: circulating it through an oil and water separator
Answer_4: discharging it into a slop barge or holding tank

Question_Title: Where would you look to find the number of hand portable fire extinguishers required on an uninspected towing or fishing industry vessel?
Answer_2: Subchapter C, Rules and Regulations for Uninspected Vessels

Question_Title: While in drydock in a U.S. port, you discover that the spool piece for the fire pump sea suction is wasted away.  You should __________.
Answer_1: place a cement box patch on the spool piece
Answer_3: silver braze a patch over the leak
Answer_4: patch the leak with epoxy sealer

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), you are required to test cargo discharge piping every __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no person may use a connection for oil transfer operations  unless it is a bolted or full threaded connection, or __________.
Answer_1: an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle is used to fuel the vessel
Answer_2: a clamped or compression fitted connection
Answer_3: a quick connection coupling approved by the American Petroleum Institute
Answer_4: a connection not over six inches in diameter

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning oil transfer,  related equipment, tests and inspections is true?
Answer_1: Each pressure gauge in the system must indicate a reading that is within 5% of the actual system pressure.
Answer_2: Each nonmetallic oil transfer hose, larger than a 3" inside diameter must be inspected, and tested annually.
Answer_3: A 6" inside diameter nonmetallic oil transfer hose having a small slash penetrating the hose reinforcement may remain in service if there is no visible internal deterioration.

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), a vessel built in 1977 with a gross registered tonnage of 219 tons, must __________.
Answer_1: use one gallon portable containers under tank vents when fueling
Answer_2: use an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle when fueling
Answer_3: use a fixed container or enclosed deck area under or around each lube oil tank vent when fueling
Answer_4: fill fuel tanks forward of the collision bulkhead first

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require a 1500 gross ton vessel (constructed before July 1, 1974) equipped with a fill fitting for which discharge containment is impractical to __________.
Answer_1: have the fill fitting altered on or before December 31, 1986
Answer_2: use a drip collar on the fill fitting
Answer_3: have a designated crew member stand watch over the fill fitting
Answer_4: use an automatic back pressure shut off nozzle

Question_Title: An ocean going ship of 4000 gross tons must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection for the discharge of oily wastes to a reception facility.  The dimensions for the connection are specified in the Pollution Prevention Regulations under Part __________.

An ocean going ship of 6000 gross tons or above must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection with dimensions outlined in Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) or be substituted with a __________.
Answer_1: portable connection using a four bolt pattern
Answer_3: portable adapter that meets the same specification outlined in 33 CFR, Subchapter "O"
Answer_4: clip-on flange suitable for service pressure of 4 kg/cm2

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the minimum number of bolts permitted in an ANSI standard flange on an oil hose is __________.

Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 155) state that no person may transfer oil or fuel to a vessel of 300 gross tons or more, constructed after June 30,1974, unless each fuel tank vent, overflow, and fill pipe is equipped with a/an __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) requires that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless __________.
Answer_1: all necessary components of the transfer system are lined up before the transfer begins
Answer_2: all unnecessary parts of the transfer system are open and drained
Answer_3: the transfer system is connected to a flexible overflow fuel hose
Answer_4: the transfer system is connected to an automatic back pressure shutoff nozzle

Question_Title: How many emergency outfits are required to be carried onboard all tankships over 1,000 gross tons?
The minimum number of bolts necessary for a standard ANSI oil transfer hose temporary flange coupling (eight bolt hole flange) is __________.
Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 156), state that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: oil residue has been drained from all hoses
Answer_2: an oil containment boom is available for immediate use
Answer_3: all parts of the transfer system have been properly lined up
Answer_4: a representative sample has been taken from the oil being received

Question_Title: As part of the emergency outfit required to be carried onboard all tank vessels over 1000 gross tons, flashlights  must be __________.
Answer_1: of a minimum number of two explosion proof type
Answer_2: listed by NEMA and bearing its label
Answer_3: of the Type II or Type III

Question_Title: The tanks used for oily waste on a new ocean going cargo ship of 6000 gross tons must meet certain requirements for  isolation between oil and bilge systems.  These requirements are set forth in __________.
A fireman's outfit carried onboard cargo vessels, must have a __________.

An oceangoing ship of 400 gross tons and above must be fitted with a standard discharge shore connection.  What is the size of the bolt circle diameter of the shore connection required to transfer oily ballast to a shoreside reception  facility?
Answer_4: It depends on outside pipe diameter.

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no  person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: each hose is supported in a manner that prevents strain on  its coupling
Answer_2: each part of the transfer system necessary to allow the flow of oil is lined up for transfer
Answer_3: each oil transfer hose has no loose covers, kinks, bulges,  or soft spots, and no gouges, cuts or slashes that penetrate the hose reinforcement

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning oil transfer connections?
Answer_1: Any permanently connected flange coupling must have a bolt  in each hole.
Answer_2: Approved quick-connect couplings may be used.
Answer_3: When a temporary connection utilizes an American National Standard Institute (ANSI) standard flange, a bolt in every  other hole is acceptable if at least four bolts are used.

Question_Title: Oil Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), require that the person-in-charge of transfer operations is to insure that the __________.
Answer_1: drains and scuppers are closed by the mechanical means
Answer_2: transferrer and transferee know the identity of the product to be transferred
Answer_3: hose is supported to prevent kinking or damage

Question_Title: The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require that  no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless __________.
Answer_1: bonding cables are installed on all tanks
Answer_4: an oil containment boom is ready for immediate use

Question_Title: While on watch in the engine room, you hear a continuous sounding of the general alarm.  Which of the following actions should you take FIRST?
Answer_1: Secure the burners then proceed to your assigned boat station.
Answer_2: Start the fire pump and establish flow to the fire main.
Answer_3: Open the guardian valve and standby to maneuver.
Answer_4: Open the master control valves on the fixed CO2 system.

Question_Title: In an oil pumping operation where pumping connections are made up of flanged hoses the weakest link is the __________.
While on watch in the engine room, you hear a continuous sounding of the general alarm.  Which of the following actions should you take?
Answer_1: Make an entry in the official logbook.
Answer_2: Open the master control valves on the fixed CO2 system.
Answer_3: Start the fire pump and check discharge pressure.

Question_Title: As soon as you hear the fire and emergency signal, you should ensure that the __________.
Answer_4: life preservers have been issued to everyone

Question_Title: Which of the following actions should be taken by the engine room watch when the general alarm is sounded continuously?
Answer_1: The fire pump should be started.
Answer_2: The boiler fires should be secured.
Answer_3: The fixed CO2 system should be initiated into action.
Answer_4: The engine room ventilation should be secured.

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless  __________.
Answer_1: hoses are supported to prevent kinking and strain on its coupling
Answer_2: a sample has been taken from the oil being received
Answer_3: adequate deck lighting is turned on one hour before sunset
Answer_4: each part of the transfer system is blown through with air

Question_Title: When the general alarm is sounded continuously, the engine  room personnel should __________.
Answer_1: proceed to their man overboard stations
Answer_3: put on lifejackets and go to their abandon ship stations
Answer_4: secure the propulsion diesel engines and evacuate the engine room

Question_Title: According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no  person may connect or engage in any other critical oil transfer operation unless __________.
Answer_2: that person holds a tankerman endorsement
Answer_3: that person holds a license as master, mate, or engineer
Answer_4: that person holds a valid port security card

Question_Title: Which of the actions listed should be taken by the engineer on watch when the general alarm is sounded continuously for 10 seconds?
Answer_1: Engine room ventilation should be started.
Answer_3: The fire pump should be started.
Answer_4: The fixed CO2 system should be activated.

Question_Title: Which of the listed operations must be personally supervised by the person-in-charge while taking on fuel?
Answer_1: Posting of the Declaration of Inspection in a conspicuous place under glass.
Answer_2: Topping off of any tanks being loaded.
Answer_3: Disposing overboard all waste oil or slops from drip pans.
Answer_4: Periodic sampling during the loading to ensure uniformity.

Question_Title: During topping off of bunker tanks, the loading rate must be personally supervised by the __________.

Answer_1: When authorized by the Captain of the Port.
Answer_2: When licensed as a certified refueling officer.
Answer_3: Whenever the vessel is short of manpower.

Question_Title: As soon as you hear the fire and emergency signal, you should ensure that __________.
Answer_1: the ring buoys are thrown overboard
Answer_4: everyone is suited in an approved life vest

Question_Title: When fuel tanks are being topped off, the person-in-charge  of bunkering is directly responsible for the __________.
Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) specify that the  person-in-charge of bunkering is responsible for the __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless each  person in charge has signed the __________.
The Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that a  person may not transfer oil or hazardous materials to or from a vessel unless each person-in-charge has signed the __________.
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), who makes the final decision of when oil transfer may begin?
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the declaration of inspection is the __________.
Answer_1: paper issued by the Coast Guard marine inspector which allows you to conduct a transfer operation
Answer_2: application you must complete and submit to the Coast Guard to have an inspector visit your vessel
Answer_3: document signed by vessel and shore facility persons-in-charge declaring that all transfer requirements  have been met
Answer_4: annual report submitted by vessel personnel to the Coast Guard declaring that all transfer equipment has been inspected

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), which of the following conditions would disqualify a nonmetallic hose as being suitable for use in transferring  oil?
Answer_1: A cut in the cover which makes the reinforcement visible.
Answer_2: A blown gasket when hydrostatic test pressure is applied.
Answer_3: Evidence of internal or external deterioration.

Question_Title: Oil "transfer hose" defects are specified in the Pollution  Prevention Regulations under 33 CFR Part __________.
According to Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), how much hose should you use in transferring oil in bulk?
Answer_1: Twice the distance between ship and dock.
Answer_2: One and one half times the distance between ship and dock.
Answer_3: Not over 300 feet (91.4 m) of hose.
Answer_4: Sufficient for maximum vessel movement without straining the hoses.

Question_Title: No person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless the person in charge __________.
Answer_1: has in his or her possession a copy of the vessel's Oil Record Book

Answer_3: has in his or her possession a valid Certificate of Inspection or Tank Vessel Examination Letter
Answer_4: is in the immediate vicinity and immediately available to the oil transfer personnel

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) require that on the completion of oil transfer operations all __________.
Answer_1: hoses shall be blown down with air
Answer_2: soundings shall be entered in the oil record book
Answer_3: valves used during transfer shall be closed
Answer_4: persons on duty during oil transfer shall be accounted for

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), the person-in-charge of transfer operations, both ashore and on the vessel, must agree on __________.
Answer_1: the identity of the product to be transferred
Answer_2: the size of the slop tank required under 155.330
Answer_3: the status of the oily water separator
Answer_4: whether or not the transferring ship is a "Public Vessel of the United States"

Question_Title: Which of the listed fire extinguishers would be considered  hand portable/semiportable and capable of combating a class "B" fire?

Answer_1: drained into drip pans or tanks
Answer_2: blown down with nitrogen or inert gas
Answer_3: steam cleaned and flushed with hot water
Answer_4: stowed with their ends open for venting

Question_Title: According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), who is to make the final decision of when oil transfer may  begin?
Answer_4: Designated persons-in-charge of vessel and facility

Question_Title: If your vessel's Certificate of Inspection requires six B-II, two A-II and one B-V fire extinguisher, which of the listed combinations will provide the amount and type required?
Answer_1: Six 2 1/2 gallon soda acid, two 2 1/2 gallon foam, and one  40 gallon foam
Answer_2: Six 2 1/2 gallon foam, two 15 pound CO2, and one 30 pound dry chemical
Answer_3: Six 15 pound CO2, two 2 1/2 gallon foam, and one 50 pound CO2
Answer_4: Eight 2 1/2 gallon foam and one 100 pound CO2

Question_Title: On an uninspected vessel, all portable fire extinguishers are required by law to be approved by the __________.
Answer_4: American Society for the Testing of Materials (ASTM)

Question_Title: The term "oil", as used in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), means __________.
The term "oil" as defined in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) means: __________.
Answer_3: noxious liquid substances designated under Annex II of MARPOL 73/78

Question_Title: Each inert gas system must be designed to supply the cargo  tanks with a gas, or mixture of gases, that has an oxygen  content by volume of __________.
The term "oily mixture", as defined in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) includes __________.
Which of the following represents the maximum percent of oxygen, by volume, required to be achieved by a ship's inert gas system, prior to the commencement of crude oil tank washing?

Where are remote readouts for oxygen concentration, pressure, and temperature of an inert gas system required to be located?
Answer_3: Main deck and engine control consoles
Answer_4: Cargo control and engine control consoles

Question_Title: An oxygen indicator will detect __________.
Answer_2: an oxygen deficiency in a space
Answer_3: the presence of harmful amounts of carbon monoxide

Question_Title: Each inert gas system must be equipped with the following instruments:  oxygen concentration indicator and recorder,  pressure indicator and recorder, and temperature indicator. The point of measurement for these instruments must be located __________.
Answer_4: upstream of the liquid filled breaker

Question_Title: To determine that a compartment contains sufficient oxygen  to sustain life, you should use a/an __________.

Which of the following statements is true regarding oxygen  indicators?
Answer_1: The instrument is capable of providing an immediate accurate reading of any space with no delay.
Answer_2: Prolonged exposure to gases such as CO2 may affect the accuracy of the indicator.
Answer_3: A cotton filter placed in the end of the sampling tube prevents damaging the instrument when exposed to strongly acidic gases.

Question_Title: During loading and discharging operations, in addition to when the cargo tanks have been properly filled, each inert  gas system must be capable of maintaining a minimum gas pressure of __________.
An International Oil Pollution Prevention (IOPP) Certificate ceases to be valid on a U.S. Ship when __________.
Answer_1: the ship changes its port of documentation to San Francisco
Answer_2: the certificate exceeds 2 years from the date of issue
Answer_3: an intermediate survey as required by 33 CFR 151.17 is not  carried out
Answer_4: the vessel owners cease to belong to IMO (International Maritime Organization)

Question_Title: Each ship having an inert gas system must have a portable instruments to measure concentrations of hydrocarbon vapor  in inert atmospheres and also to measure __________.
The upper limit of sulphur dioxide permitted to be  maintained in the inert gas should not exceed __________.

An inert gas system incorporating a separately fired inert  gas generator shall be provided with visual and audible alarms to indicate failure of the power supply to the generator, the automatic control system, and __________.

Answer_1: foreign vessels not in U.S. navigable waters
Answer_2: U.S. Vessels 26 feet or more in length
Answer_3: Foreign vessels when engaged in noncommercial service
Answer_4: U.S. vessels less than 26 feet in length

Question_Title: A "Discharge of Oil Prohibited" placard must be fixed in a  conspicuous place in each machinery space, or at the bilge  and ballast pump control station as required by __________.
Which of the following liquids can ordinarily be discharged overboard without being processed through an oily water separator?
Exemption or partial exemption from compliance with any requirement in the Oil or Harardous Material Pollution Prevention Regulations prescribed in (33 CFR 155) may be granted by the __________.
Answer_1: OCMI in the vessel's home port

Question_Title: Some Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), only apply  to "new ships."  Under these regulations, a new ship is a ship __________.
Answer_1: having undergone a major conversion and has been completed  before December 31, 1979
Answer_2: for which the building contract has been placed after December 31, 1975
Answer_3: having undergone a major conversion for which the contract  was placed between June 30, 1974 and December 31, 1975
Answer_4: the delivery of which is on or after June 10, 1975

Question_Title: Used engine oil may be properly disposed of by __________.
Answer_2: discharging it to a dockside oil waste station
Answer_3: pumping or throwing it over the side in port
Answer_4: dumping it in a gasoline fuel tank

Question_Title: According to title 33 CFR's, an International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate (IOPP) for a "new" vessel ceases to be valid if __________.
Answer_1: it exceeds 3 years from date of issue
Answer_2: an alteration approved by the Captain of the Port is made
Answer_3: an intermediate survey has not be conducted within 12 months from the date that the IOPP was issued
Answer_4: the vessel is transferred to the flag of another country

Question_Title: If 1/4 liter of oil is spilled during fueling and causes a  sheen upon the water, it __________.
Answer_1: must be reported to the fire department
Answer_2: must be reported to the Coast Guard
Answer_3: must be reported to the harbomaster
Answer_4: need not be reported since the spill was less then 1 barrel

Question_Title: If fuel tank levels are found to have increased after a grounding, you should suspect __________.
Answer_2: a puncture, crack, or hole in the skin of the vessel
Answer_3: improper record keeping of fuel transfer activities
Answer_4: contamination of the contaminated steam supply system

Question_Title: Where are "prohibited oil spaces" specified in the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR)?
A self-propelled ship of 400 gross tons, constructed in January 1974, may carry fuel oil in tanks forward of the collision bulkhead, if such tanks were __________.
Answer_1: designated for fuel oil carriage after Jan 31, 1975
Answer_2: installed for fuel oil carriage on August 1, 1974
Answer_3: designated, installed, or constructed for fuel oil carriage before July 1, 1974
Answer_4: designed for cargo oil using specifications from 1976 Pollution Prevention Regulations

Question_Title: People should be protected from the rotating parts of machinery by __________.
The word "discharge" as used in Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 151) applies to oil __________.
Answer_3: pumped into navigable waters through a fixed piping system

Question_Title: What safety precautions should be observed by the crew while working around machinery in an engine room?
According to the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR), which of the following qualifies as a discharge of oil?
Answer_1: Leakage of oil to the water by an improperly blanked transfer hose.
Answer_2: Spilling oil on the main deck and having it flow over the side.
Answer_3: Pumping oil overboard through a fixed piping system.

Question_Title: The explosive range of a mixture of flammable vapors is specified as a percentage of __________.
Answer_1: flammable vapor by volume in air
Answer_3: the temperature of the flash point
Answer_4: the lower limit of explosibility of the mixture

Question_Title: What operational limitation should the user of a self-contained breathing apparatus be concerned with when using the device?
Answer_1: The weight of the unit changes the user's center of gravity.
Answer_2: The lens of the facepiece reduces the user's peripheral vision.
Answer_3: The attached lifeline limits the user's mobility.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Why is it important for fuel oil tanks not to be topped off when loading cold oil?
Answer_1: Increased viscosity of the product needs higher loading pressure, which increases the chance of a spill.
Answer_2: Air pockets may cause the fuel to bubble out of the ullage  hole.
Answer_3: The change in its specific volume when heated may cause an  overflow.
Answer_4: The fueling valve may become stuck closed and cause the fuel oil to spill before the valve can be opened.

Question_Title: Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR) state that no person may transfer oil to or from a vessel unless the __________.
Answer_1: spectacle flanges are installed in cargo pump overboard discharges
Answer_2: packing glands of the transfer pump must not leak at all
Answer_3: vessel is surrounded by an oil containment boom
Answer_4: fuel hose is supported to prevent strain on its couplings

Question_Title: The trim of a vessel is the __________.
Answer_4: difference in fore and aft drafts

Question_Title: Vessel stability can be adversely affected by __________.
Which of the following represents the maximum percent of oxygen, by volume, required to be achieved by a ship's inert gas system, prior to the commencement of crude oil tank washing?
